670300547.name: Fun and hip place
670300547.author: a TripAdvisor user
670300547.reviewBody: What a fun place to see.    The markets, shops and streets have such energy.   Reminded us for the hip feeling of being at NYC Village area without the city buildings.    Beautiful streets, great music and fun hip culture.    Highly recommend visiting

659720322.name: Great way to spend a day
659720322.author: a TripAdvisor user
659720322.reviewBody: Spend the day strolling the shops, markets and of coarse watching the surfers!  Numerous restaurants/bars all along the clean beach along with the local peddlers with their wares.

659028384.name: Good eats
659028384.author: a TripAdvisor user
659028384.reviewBody: I wish we hadn\'t eaten before we went to market, there were so many delicious vendors.   I thought the prices were a little high..   Nice local vendors with lots of organic and natural products.   good entertainment too.

658154846.name: Best ever
658154846.author: a TripAdvisor user
658154846.reviewBody: My obsession are garments markets! This one was my absolute favorite ever!!!!! Most real and delicious food ever! Nice people! Not cheap! You need at least two hours there and go with an empty stomach!!!! I had the best Fish tacos outside!!!!!

652669771.name: Go go go
652669771.author: a TripAdvisor user
652669771.reviewBody: Got there too late to fully enjoy it and instantly regretted not arriving earlier. Go for lunch, try out the food stands and stay to check out all the different vendors and artists. Don\u2019t forget to bring some pesos, you will not leave empty handed.

651200891.name: Friday market!
651200891.author: a TripAdvisor user
651200891.reviewBody: We visited Sayulita from Bucer\u00edas for the day and this time we came on a Friday to see the market.   Nice little market selling a variety of Mexican items, homemade soaps, cheeses, breads, dips and fresh coffee.   Quite a small market but nice to have a look around before walking into Sayulita as the markets is located at the start of the village near the bus station.  \nIf you\u2019re looking for an authentic homemade Mexican gift to take home then I\u2019m sure you\u2019d find it here.

651067561.name: Farmers market
651067561.author: a TripAdvisor user
651067561.reviewBody: My wife and I are staying in Sayulita, and took the opportunity to shop at this great little market. It is open every Friday, between 9 a.m. and 2 p.m., and offers a variety of vendors selling arts, crafts, and local produce. We purchased various items, including organic salad, organic lettuce, feta cheese, tomatoes, raspberries, spinach and leek quiche, and for dessert brownies and muffins. Great place to browse, lots of interesting products. Worth a visit!

650548410.name: Friday Market outing
650548410.author: a TripAdvisor user
650548410.reviewBody: Small market in a small town. Some craft vendors, some food vendors, some organic fruit and skin products. Some fresh cheese products, organic coffee and coffee alternatives. It was a nice little outing but nothing spectacular.

648239575.name: Great Vendors
648239575.author: a TripAdvisor user
648239575.reviewBody: Great Vendors, Fun Music, Nice People!!!\nOur stay in Sayulita will be a total of 12 Days which meant that we have been able to visit this Market twice, Lucky Us ;-)\nWe purchased roasted nuts & seeds, green coffee beans, mocha coffee, bananas, sauerkraut, humus, sprout cup & sprout tacos and a fresh turmeric & ginger shot.

647402304.name: Delicious local farmers market!
647402304.author: a TripAdvisor user
647402304.reviewBody: This market has all you need in a farmers market: fresh tropical produce, coffee, hot food good for breakfast or lunch, smoothies, and local arts and crafts!

646669862.name: Friendly market with lots of good shopping
646669862.author: a TripAdvisor user
646669862.reviewBody: My family and I like the market for its selection of fresh produce grown by local farmers. There is also a coffee merchant, a cheese vendor and plenty of other locally grown and made products. \nWorth the visit.

646198495.name: Nice Market
646198495.author: a TripAdvisor user
646198495.reviewBody: My family and I enjoyed a nice morning at the Friday market in Sayulita. We parked at the baseball field, which is adjacent to the market. There\u2019s a lot of lovely hand crafted jewelry and home goods at the market. We purchased souvenirs, t-shirts, linens, jewelry, and enjoyed some refreshing agua frescas. I was too busy to remember to take many photos, but the market is picturesque and has some lovely shaded areas.

617455775.name: Local Produce
617455775.author: a TripAdvisor user
617455775.reviewBody: Guaranteed to find everything you need at a low cost. Produce is fresh and inexpensive. Support the last call.

599690693.name: Sayulita Farmer\'s Market
599690693.author: a TripAdvisor user
599690693.reviewBody: Great market for everyone!! Everything from food, sauces, handmade clothing, handmade jewelry, local coffee, juices, chips, vegetables, rugs, wall hangings and much much more. The Market is closed now for the season but will reopen in November. Be sure to check it out from November to April.

598616743.name: Friday fresh good shopping .
598616743.author: a TripAdvisor user
598616743.reviewBody: Great place for fresh produce, food, flowrers, crafts. Meet friends, listen to music and have lunch.

582891308.name: Mercado del Pueblo, Sayulita, Nayarit
582891308.author: a TripAdvisor user
582891308.reviewBody: I\u2019ve been to Sayulita many times and going to Mercado del Pueblo it\u2019s one of the activities I\u2019m looking forward to go every Friday.  The ambiance is simple but colorful, the products and produce are fantastic, original clothing, healing natural products, amazing local artisans displaying their art, the food that we can enjoy there, the live music,  but most of all, the people!  And ideal blend of locals and residents from all over the world, in perfect harmony.  Tourists that don\u2019t know the market sometimes complain about the prices  but we have to understand that the products are first class, 100%  organic, home prepared, using the freshest fruits and vegetables, local grain fed meats, etc. This is a very special place! Please don\u2019t expect to find cheap fast food or frozen or refrigerated produce. Also, we have great respect for the hours of labor and love that the artisans put in every article they create. Don\u2019t miss it!

572906979.name: a small fun twist to sayulita
572906979.author: a TripAdvisor user
572906979.reviewBody: I really liked coming here when it opens, although most of  the stands are rather pricey. the variety of food sets up a delicous vibe, unless you\'re not planing to try any.\nif you do, look for the sushi place inside on your left.

572276844.name: Open Air Markets - FUN FUN FUN
572276844.author: a TripAdvisor user
572276844.reviewBody: My husband and I traveled to Sayulita during a visit to Mexico in February. We traveled using local transportation, an adventure in itself! The market is small but the goods are of very high quality. Food is amazing - pastries, fresh fish, fresh veggies and fruits. Artisans crafts are a little expensive but the prices gave me a point of reference for other markets that we planned to visit. We had a great time and definitely worth the visit.

569757893.name: Pricey artisanal items
569757893.author: a TripAdvisor user
569757893.reviewBody:
Go to Sayulita for the Friday market, 10am to 2pm.  Small market.  Goods are not cheap (small packet of candied pecans cost 100 pesos) but they are reasonable quality. Lots of jewellery.  Live folk music.  

A best thing about Sayulita is the town itself (see photos).  A great excursion from PV.  Grab a bus at the Glorias stop, for 42 pesos each, and expect a 1.5 hour ride each way.  Lots of locals on the bus and you may be “entertained” on route for a small tip.  Busses leaving and returning every 10-20 minutes.  

This quaint, photographic town has a colourful, laid-back, hippy vibe.  Walking around is fun and easy.  The beach is busy and full of surfers.  Golf carts are the transport of choice and these can be rented in town.  

Had a tastey lunch at the Italian restaurant on the main pedestrian street to the beach.  Mouthwatering pizza at a great price, and yummy icecream two doors down on the corner.  

Fun day away from PV.

567555632.name: Small , but fun
567555632.author: a TripAdvisor user
567555632.reviewBody: It\'s a small market, but very fun. Some great French pastry when you enter on the left. Several unusual venders in the market. Try the sausage maker and the cheese guy. Worth the time to go!

562482963.name: Fabulous Sunday Market
562482963.author: a TripAdvisor user
562482963.reviewBody: This market is the best we have been to in Mexico.  People come from far afield to walk the \'aisles\' of this city market by the sea.  It is a great backdrop for great offerings.\n\nAlthough we purchased clothing (a beautifully hand-painted blouse and a baby alpaca hand painted wrap), our friends got the most gorgeous lilies I\'ve ever seen.  They were huge, and lasted almost 10 days.  Could not have been happier.

562399235.name: Fun place on a Friday when it is open
562399235.author: a TripAdvisor user
562399235.reviewBody: I went there today Friday which the farmers market is open from ten until about two pm.  They have jewelery, cloths that are made by a artist, produce, music. I have been there before and enjoy this very much.\nIn another area there is a place called the hippo market where there are artists who make jewelry. Prices are not bad.just enjoy the town of surfboard, great crevasse and fish tacos. Yummmmm\n

559438962.name: Market day!!
559438962.author: a TripAdvisor user
559438962.reviewBody: Highly recommend this array of crafts, food, music and experiences. Friday\u2019s! You can find it tucked in Calle revolution about 100 yards past north end of the bridge on the right.

559213422.name: Disappointed 2
559213422.author: a TripAdvisor user
559213422.reviewBody: I am in the minority group who did not find the Friday "Organic Market" or Gringo market that impressive.  It is quite small and seems to be mostly ex-pats selling their wares.  There is a bit of organic produce, baking, fresh pasta and fruit, plus some gluten free items.  There are some crafts and clothing, coffee and some tasty ready-made foods you can eat at a small eating area.  Maybe I was disappointed because I was expecting a big,  traditional fresh fruit and vegetable plus souvenir market?

558346977.name: Fun at the mercado
558346977.author: a TripAdvisor user
558346977.reviewBody: This is a great event full of shopping, socializing, and getting to know the artisans. One of my highlights for the week so if you have the chance, spend Friday mornings in Sayulita getting some great arts, handicrafts and organic food and produce. A must do Friday event.

554863439.name: Fun place to shop
554863439.author: a TripAdvisor user
554863439.reviewBody: Very small market but worth a visit . It\u2019s Only open Friday morning and starts at 9, not the crack of dawn. Closes at 2. A few fresh vegetable stands, one really nice stand with raspberries, strawberries , blackberries, and blueberries abdcrgey were cheap! . Nice clothes ( not as cheap as the fruits and vegetables). Some local stuff like Mexican blankets, pottery (bargain with the sellers!). Great local foods - corn tortilla with Lima beans or cheese and they cover them with saut\u00e9d cactus and queso. So good. Really delicious empanadas. A stand with French looking pastries ( croissants etc). Vanilla ( I hope real)) and those cool decorated match boxes . Nice art work (cool local photos on wood) .Prices were reasonable . A smaller market as compared to other ones I\u2019ve experienced , but worth a visit .

552556833.name: interesting treats, but mostly gringos
552556833.author: a TripAdvisor user
552556833.reviewBody: lots of organic products, some food, some clothes. worth the visit, but doesn\'t take very long. prices and organic theme attract almost exclusively tourists. quirky and worth the quick visit. we got croissants, strawberries and a souvenir.

550724765.name: Flavours and colours
550724765.author: a TripAdvisor user
550724765.reviewBody: Nice and simple artcrafts in the great local colours, plus the always present \u201cdia de Los muertos\u201d themed objects, can be found next to tacos stalls, in this small market occupying a couple of blocks south of the bridge. A \u201cmust see\u201d in Sayulita

493089317.name: Day Trip at Sayulita
493089317.author: a TripAdvisor user
493089317.reviewBody: A couple of days in on our vacation we were recommended by a few people to visit the little town of Sayulita.  What a gem of a small town, who would of though on how beautiful this little town ended up being.  We walked the street markets and the people were full of smiles and are welcoming.  We walked the beach, lots of surfers enjoying the waves.  Lots of shops to choose from, the art is amazing!!!!  If you get the chance to go, please go ahead and visit.  You can go all day, we went for 2 hours. The taxi took a group of us from the resort for 16$ USD for two people there and back.  You can always take your own taxi and enjoy a full day and night in the small town.

487815848.name: Perfect Day in Sayulita
487815848.author: a TripAdvisor user
487815848.reviewBody: Spent hours browsing the shops and enjoying the beach from a little beach bar in this town north of Puerta Villarta.  A charming community....

480743477.name: Trip highlight!
480743477.author: a TripAdvisor user
480743477.reviewBody: Visiting Sayulita was the absolute highlight of our trip. We have visited the area before but had not made the side trip to Sayulita. We spent the day in the market, beach and wondering the postcard perfect streets. Food and restaurants were everywhere and we bought wonderful local handicraft souvenirs for everyone on our list. There were locals and tourists mingling everywhere. It was just the most wonderful day and I can\'t wait to go back someday. Sooo happy we drove a bit off the beaten path to discover this gem! Must go.

474615147.name: Best organic market!
474615147.author: a TripAdvisor user
474615147.reviewBody: If you happen to be in Sayulita on a Friday afternoon definitely worth a visit! Take lots of shopping bags for great organic vegetables and cheese, juice etc...also handmade skin care, jewelry not to mention a great place to have lunch! So many stands if great and healthy food it\'s hard to choose! On the Northside off the main road before the bridge!

473048055.name: Friday market
473048055.author: a TripAdvisor user
473048055.reviewBody: A great market! Glad we were able to go, lots of variety and cheaper too! Probably a highlight of the week.

471380939.name: Enjoy culture!
471380939.author: a TripAdvisor user
471380939.reviewBody: Farmers markets are a great way to experience the culture of the area you are in.  Mexican markets have everything from fresh breads, fruits to local crafts and native flowers for unbelievable prices.  This market is on Fridays, and a must attend event in town.

470305485.name: Great market
470305485.author: a TripAdvisor user
470305485.reviewBody: On a day when we drove from Puerto Vallarta to Punta Mita for a lunch at Litibu Grill, we were recommended to visit Sayulita. When we arrive there, we noticed this market full of artisans and farmers. We couldn\'t hold ourselves, but shopped and walked around to buy unique things. This is a nice market to be. Recommended !

466309776.name: Love the friday market
466309776.author: a TripAdvisor user
466309776.reviewBody: We live here in the winters and I rely on the market for my fresh vegetables, the table with Thai ingredients is amazing, love the food served and always fun to catch up with friends.  Looking for a gift (clothing, jewelry, home good) a great place to shop.

454935181.name: Mangos, Coffee and Handmade Treasures in the middle of Sayulita
454935181.author: a TripAdvisor user
454935181.reviewBody: Having come back for the second year this market is developing a great following as in one space you can get the best dried mangos I have ever eaten to coffee, to hammocks and traditional crafts.

448105025.name: Local crafts and foods
448105025.author: a TripAdvisor user
448105025.reviewBody: Went on a Friday ( think this is market day), it is small with local crafts and jewelry. Some foods ( sausage and pork sandwiches, alcohol), hand rolled cigars ( not great but better than the knockoffs sold in town as cubans), fruits and vegetables. Worth an hour.

447642321.name: HappycOuple20
447642321.author: a TripAdvisor user
447642321.reviewBody: I wish we had planned more time here. I enjoyed a variety of items to shop. My husband purchased a local instrument. We bout teas and incense, clothing, foods, etc. all were different sorts of things than in the local commercial shops. I would do my grocery shopping to stock your condo here!!!

444062088.name: beads,beads and more
444062088.author: a TripAdvisor user
444062088.reviewBody: Small little town with a large block of vendors selling mostly all things made with beads. The stores have expensive pricng that dont deal like the market vendors., lots of packed restaurants.

443277904.name: A fun destination during my shopping day in Sayulita
443277904.author: a TripAdvisor user
443277904.reviewBody: I spent my birthday roaming the streets, taking in all the color and life in Sayulita. The shops are full of artistic crafts, there are galleries, lots of street vendors, many different food options and overall fun town to hang in. The farmers market was especially nice as I met up with Roxana Morgante, a local jewelry designer, and treated myself to a pair of her handmade silver earrings. Thank you Roxana for making my day so special.

436636174.name: Yum at the Farmers Market!!
436636174.author: a TripAdvisor user
436636174.reviewBody: I loved visiting the farmers market which is not just a market but a great place to snack and eat lunch. I loved the sprout lady\'s sandwiches - if you\'re a vegetarian and/or are interested in that type of cuisine she is a must stop. I also picked up a lovely bag made of sheep\'s wool. The vendor told me that his family and made the bags from start to finish and showed me photos of four generations shearing wool on his family\'s farm in another part of\nMexico. Items were reasonably priced.  So many delicious treats to try!

391835331.name: Shopping in sayulita
391835331.author: a TripAdvisor user
391835331.reviewBody: Many shops lots of crafts, hippies, and surf shops.  Cheaper prices than bucerias and Puerto Vallarta. Many will make it custom while you shop or wait.

361062265.name: Sayulita Town
361062265.author: a TripAdvisor user
361062265.reviewBody: We spent a half day visiting Sayulita Town. We drove type-boogies car for a 4 hours drive all the way to town. Small town with a very nice Farm Local Market. We found and excellent Taco Place inside the aisles.

358467191.name: Great Farmer\'s Market!
358467191.author: a TripAdvisor user
358467191.reviewBody: If you are in Sayulita be sure to check out this Farmer\'s Market.  In addition to a wide array of fresh vegetables and fruits, you can also find salsas, spreads and coffees to sample.  There are also artisans who sell everything from handmade clothing, sandals, jewelry, hammocks, oils, and candles to name a few of the products.  it is best to go before 11:00 for the best selection of produce.

355720475.name: Great experience!
355720475.author: a TripAdvisor user
355720475.reviewBody: The market was GREAT!  Most looked very fresh, some looked a little iffy.  Worth checking out.  It is not very big.

353712904.name: A Unique and Special Market
353712904.author: a TripAdvisor user
353712904.reviewBody: Small and perfect.  Instead of 29 booths selling the same thing this a very small but focussed market.  Everything was unique and top notch.  We are already talking about planning our next trip to ensure we can utilize the many unique and amazing local food items.  If your objective is to wander mindlessly for hours through mediocrity this won\'t work for you but we\'ll do short and sweet every time.

350396629.name: Fun Spot
350396629.author: a TripAdvisor user
350396629.reviewBody: I understand the comments that it is not strictly a "local farmers" market. There are a lot of ex-pats but they are producing good local home-made stuff. Great coffee and the food was good. Local crafts were reasonably priced. Very kid friendly and some music.

349124335.name: Dissapointed
349124335.author: a TripAdvisor user
349124335.reviewBody: This market was more about expats selling their wears than local people selling fresh fruits, vegetables, meats, cheese etc. Not what I was hoping for.

347380471.name: Don\'t miss on Friday!
347380471.author: a TripAdvisor user
347380471.reviewBody: Really fun market.  Always good local entertainment.  The sausage sandwiches are a highlight.  We also took sausages home.  There is nothing like them elsewhere in Sayulita.  Tons of really outstanding food as well as local crafts and specialty items.  We were there a month and never missed the Friday market.

344869238.name: Small, Quiet Friday Market
344869238.author: a TripAdvisor user
344869238.reviewBody: The Sayulita "gringo market" is on Fridays in a delightful shady area behind the buildings on the street.  There was a band playing the day we were there and many of the gringos who inhabit Sayulita in the winter were out in full force.  It reminded me of farmers\' markets in rural BC communities.  There was lovely fresh produce that you don\'t always see in the shops in town:  organic greens which were so great to get.  People were selling their own salsa, baking, jewelry, etc.  There were some Mexican vendors but there wasn\'t the usual hawker mentality you see in some markets.  It was quiet and respectful and there was lots of opportunity to browse and make up your mind without being pushed.

339039209.name: What to do in Sayulita on a Friday
339039209.author: a TripAdvisor user
339039209.reviewBody: This is a great market, and is getting better every year. Go to browse, enjoy the music, eat some great food, get some organic produce - which is tricky to find otherwise - and browse some beautiful handmade crafts. We always take our visitors to Sayulita. \nInteresting to note that there are a lot of good causes to support here too, from Sayulita Animals to Casa Clu children\'s center and the local green school Costa Verde. Nice to shop when the money also goes to a great cause! \nWhat\'s not to love?

334710161.name: Best Tacos Al Pastor
334710161.author: a TripAdvisor user
334710161.reviewBody:
At Carneceria Trancos they set up their tables and outside eatery in the afternoon for guest. This is a grocery store/Meat market. 
They have the best Tacos Al Pastor and Chicken tacos in PV! 
Not too many places to sit and eat but no need to worry you already be standing in line for seconds or thirds.

328250932.name: Overpriced market.
328250932.author: a TripAdvisor user
328250932.reviewBody:
I am all for Farmers Markets and supporting local farms. This was more an overpriced craft fair with some food options and music going while all the Gringos got together to catch up with each other. 

I've found that most farmers markets are a bit overpriced but I also understand that the people selling their items need to make a living. I'm just more into finding good deals than I am buying items I can get elsewhere for cheaper.

A plus to it was that there was a woman right up front selling homemade Kombucha. That was great to be able to have my Kombucha fix while on vacation. There was also some fresh fruit at a table that they put in a cup and put choc syrup on. I think it was only $30 Pesos which isn't so bad.  

If you love Farmers Markets and mingling and talking to the people at the tables, listening to live music etc... Then go for it.  It wouldn't be something I would plan my vacation around but if you happen to be passing by it doesn't hurt to stop in and take a quick walk around.

327013382.name: Spectacular Sunday
327013382.author: a TripAdvisor user
327013382.reviewBody: Got to the market early Sunday morning and found a good parking space.  All of the vendors were set up and ready for business.  A very nice setting on the edge of the marina. An extensive array of items to purchase; fruit, vegetables, pastries, prepared meals to take home, clothing, jewelry, etc. We purchased a couple of fresh squeezed juice concoctions that were very good.  There was a really good selection of items for lunch. Too many good choices.  We all had something different, fish tacos, Argentinian sausage sandwich, and a pollo chicken quesadilla. I\'m serious, all were very very good.

282922379.name: Like a tumbled down the Rabbit\'s Hole!
282922379.author: a TripAdvisor user
282922379.reviewBody: Surrounded by vibrant color, animated and friendly people with hearts of gold!  Hearing the multitudes speaking in their native tongue was like listening to a medley of music. And the smells!!!!!  Fresh, organic coffee beans, seafood not an hour out of the sea!  Baked goods and salty air!  Total awesomeness!

271564037.name: Quaint little market
271564037.author: a TripAdvisor user
271564037.reviewBody: It\'s a pretty little market, where you can find plenty of things to eat and rub... nice people to talk to and original stuff for sale, lots of organic products, not really Mexican but interesting to walk around.

263643169.name: Great fun. Great people watching.
263643169.author: a TripAdvisor user
263643169.reviewBody: Fun to see lots of people who appear to have found a new home in Mexico. Not a Mexican experience. It could be California.\n\nBut my guess is that Mexicans don\'t need a Farmers\' Market. They grow their own fresh fruits and vegetables.

261984603.name: A Must Visit City!!!
261984603.author: a TripAdvisor user
261984603.reviewBody: Wow! What a great town filled with great friendly people! Catch a wave, relax in the sun, cheap dinning, and of course SHOPPING! This small city has it all! If you have a chance, be sure to visit Playa de los muertos & pick up some YUMMY fish tacos at "The Real Fish Taco"

253526249.name: Wonderful Market with Vegan Options
253526249.author: a TripAdvisor user
253526249.reviewBody: We love the farmers market and stock up on organic vegan goodies whenever we can. The food at esperanza\'s table is great. organic select is always there with hummus, peanut and almond butter, flax tostadas, nuts, seends, grawnola, etc. We appreciate being able to buy salad greens at the market as well. Good live music and great happy vibes.

249651314.name: Good farmers market
249651314.author: a TripAdvisor user
249651314.reviewBody: My friends & I went today to the Farmers Market. It was nice. Fresh produce, tasty looking prepared food, nice arts & crafts. The produce there is little more expensive than the local stores since grown organically. The local stores also have great produce- as recommended by one of the local expats. I liked the coffee stand at the Farmers Market, organic coffees at a good price. The owner was really helpful.

210339143.name: Great little town
210339143.author: a TripAdvisor user
210339143.reviewBody: Surfers village town about 20 minutes from Punta Mita.  Worth checking out for the day.  Don Pedros has great food and drinks and its right on the beach!

201128833.name: Authentic Mexican experience
201128833.author: a TripAdvisor user
201128833.reviewBody:
We took a day trip to Sayulita while staying in Puerto Vallarta.  It took us approximately 1 hour to get there as we rented a car.  The drive from PV is easy as there's a lot to see.  

When you enter the town it's like stepping into "old world" Mexico.  There are a lot of small bars, shops, and restaurants.  The beach is beautiful... a bit crowded for our taste.  So, you want to get there early if laying out is your thing.  

We stopped at a small mom/pop restaurant that's known for its fish tacos (Marlin).  My husband said that they were the best he'd ever had.  I had shrimp tacos which were great.  The price and service were great.  

Sorry I don't have the name of the restaurant (directly in front of the beach).  The town is small and the locals can point you in the right direction.  I paid in pesos (no credit cards).

Enjoy!

196959170.name: A nice surprise
196959170.author: a TripAdvisor user
196959170.reviewBody: This market was adorable with many food options and goods to purchase. There are a lot of CAN/US hippies that clearly moved down there and were selling things at the market which was a bit unexpected for mexico, but all in all a great place.

192774371.name: Small town, fiendly people, great surfing waves
192774371.author: a TripAdvisor user
192774371.reviewBody: Loved the beach restaurants, walking forever, history.  Lots of old architecture, not the cleanest town but most memorable.

191658606.name: A variety of things to see...
191658606.author: a TripAdvisor user
191658606.reviewBody: I was eager to visit Sayulita\'s Farmers Market to see how it differed with other markets. Besides the many Mexican arts/crafts, and food from the locals, there were many Canadians selling their own arts/crafts, and home cooking. Their jewelry were especially high quality, and some reasonably priced. It was interesting to see both cultures working together.\n

191258434.name: Surfers paradise
191258434.author: a TripAdvisor user
191258434.reviewBody: Sayulita is a great spot to visit took the local bus from bucerias for 14 peso and spent the day walking the market and drinking on the beach. More laid back than PV try the surf or paddle board

190005124.name: All Local! Organic produce, music, crafts, and worthy causes
190005124.author: a TripAdvisor user
190005124.reviewBody: The market at the casa de Cultura is wonderful for visitors and locals alike. You can get some things here that are very hard to find in town otherwise, and all in a great atmosphere. The organisers put in such hard work to keep the market a thriving and bustling place, and we are all very appreciative. A friday only must see Sayulita event for sure!

188575019.name: Fun little market
188575019.author: a TripAdvisor user
188575019.reviewBody: Cute items for sale, some typical food, lots of activity on a Sunday with music and people - a very nice outing!!!

188014361.name: Loved Sayulita
188014361.author: a TripAdvisor user
188014361.reviewBody: We were happily surprised with Sayulita.  Such a picturesque little town, a breath of fresh air after Bucerias and PV.  Merchants and vendors are much more laid back. If it had been a little closer we would have gone there every morning instead...but then it wouldn\'t be the same place if it wasn\'t so far away.

166812421.name: fun sea village
166812421.author: a TripAdvisor user
166812421.reviewBody: we drove here for a day trip to learn to surf.  The surfing was fun with gentle waves and patient instructors. The village was so much fun!  It felt very authentic and laid back.  We ate at a restaurant on the beach and then had a frozen chocolate banana at CHOCO BANANA. It was amazing! I would do this again!

164627937.name: Fun local color
164627937.author: a TripAdvisor user
164627937.reviewBody: We enjoyed the little town of Sayulita, including the shopping and the food!  Great restaurants and many hotels to choose from, too.\n

159288493.name: Diversity and quality in abundance!
159288493.author: a TripAdvisor user
159288493.reviewBody: Amazing to find an organic market displaying such diversity and quality in this small Mexican town! An impressive variety of produce is available, along with both fresh and fermented local dairy products, handcrafted chocolates, coffee beans grown on nearby plantations, nuts, bee pollen and honey, even potted herbs to take home and harvest for yourself as needed. An incredible array of prepared foods, from \'turmeric tea\' to kombucha, kimchee, green coconut and mango keifir, gluten free pastries, healthy and creative soup blends, vegetarian sushi, tacos, quiches, smoked fish, and grilled meats, with a variety of ethnic cuisines represented, including Mexican, Asian, French, Italian, and Indian. it\'s not possible to list it all here, nor will you have room to sample everything you\'d like to at the market (but you CAN take delish lunches to last all week home to your fridge)! There are also herbal skincare products, soaps, tinctures and the like, as well as jewelry, clothing, and artwork. Last, but not least - great entertainment! The market takes place on Fridays at Sayulita\'s Cultural Center, which includes an open air stage with tiered concrete seating, some in sun and some in shade. Not only is the Mercado del Pueblo a great place to buy tasty, healthy food - it\'s a place to sit down to an al fresco meal with old friends, to make new friends, and to listen to good music in a lovely, relaxed outdoor setting.

158490583.name: The Best Salsa Is Found Here
158490583.author: a TripAdvisor user
158490583.reviewBody:
The market is a great Friday morning tradition while in Sayulita. I do wish there were more fruits and vegetables and less lotions and hand creams but it is still worth a visit. 

But I will say that the best and freshest salsa can be found at the market. Be sure to come early because many of the variety he offers sell out quickly. Take the time to try them all. 

It is worth stopping by the market just for the salsa!

157938200.name: Great Market
157938200.author: a TripAdvisor user
157938200.reviewBody: A really great market. Lovely fresh vegetables and fruit. Lots of food to eat - I especially liked the potato omlette. But the best thing of all was the home made chocolate lady. Her chocolate ginger surpassed anything I have ever tasted and  am a chocoholic. She love chocolate and enjoys talking about it.

157028335.name: Sayulita  Always a joy to visit
157028335.author: a TripAdvisor user
157028335.reviewBody: Sayulita Farmers market is a treat for the senses.  From the people to the food and all that is offered.   The culture is abound where ever you look.  Colorful people and offerings. Fresh produce and pastries.\nWell worth your time.

156145427.name: Fresh, local goods & colorful ambience
156145427.author: a TripAdvisor user
156145427.reviewBody: Fabulous cherry tomatoes!  Great pickles, tortilla pie, pastries & fresh soups.  Mostly frequented by American & Canadian visitors...actually could have been in northern California.  Not frequented by local Mexicans.  Good prices

155662705.name: Too crafty, not enough produce
155662705.author: a TripAdvisor user
155662705.reviewBody: Not much of a farmers market.  More of a mercado with contemporary art.  Most of the sellers of arts and crafts were regulars every night on the street anyhow, so just having them all at one location was that much of a bonus.  The producers were not ready to offer taste tests of their produce.  So I declined to buy any!  Don\'t go here thinking it is a Farmers Market, as that is underrepresented.

155519411.name: Wonderful
155519411.author: a TripAdvisor user
155519411.reviewBody: We are so happy to see this in Sayulita. Great food and produce to add to our cuisine. Fantastic atmosphere to hang around in, live music, great food. Don\'t miss it.

153947438.name: Sayulita, Mexico
153947438.author: a TripAdvisor user
153947438.reviewBody:
One thing that you have to do for sure, is go to Sayulita for the day...It's an amazing little surfer village, with a wonderful market that has something for everyone...we went with the intentions of "just" going to the markets, and got much, much more...
There is a wonderful bar there with all open windows and the sea air flows in as you sit and enjoy your drinks and eats....
As we sat for a drink we spotted a guy with some horses, so we asked him if he rented the horses out and of course they do....We payed 30.00 american $ for almost 2 hours of the most fun we had ever had riding horses...Our guide, Jose, took us through town, through many, many trails in the jungle then onto a private beach to ride in the surf, AMAZING....who does that??? so fun. then back through the jungle on a diff. trail then back through town and back on the beach for more riding in the surf.....CRAZY AWESOME.......
The Business is called "Rancho Manuel Horseback tours, fishing and Ecotourism" Tjis people is a MUST, it was so fun, and very cheap, but the experience was priceless, 
Infact we were ready to do it all over again....My husband who has always been afraid of horses is NO longer afraid, he LOVED it....and talks about it all the time.....so please check it out, you will not be disappointed!!!!!! 
although I have no photo's of the market, we did enjoy that as well...

153782552.name: Well Worth a Visit!
153782552.author: a TripAdvisor user
153782552.reviewBody: As locals, we love having a place to get fresh mixed greens, hummus, delicious pickled vegetables, and to sample and splurge on a variety of other items like salsas, breads, desserts, specialty jams, and more. Note that the market is now back at the Casa de Cultura downtown - so be sure to stroll down there as parking may be tight!  Also, try to get there early because much the yummy fare like the pork sandwiches and Indian food can sell out as the days wears on!

153533072.name: Great market
153533072.author: a TripAdvisor user
153533072.reviewBody: I love the Friday farmers market...lots of foods and local jewelry. They moved the market into town though, and about half the vendors are gone, not sure why. Its too bad...but I think there is not enough space at the new location. Still, a nice market and worth visiting, Fridays 10 - 1.

152829253.name: A Friday must! lots of tasty treats and nice shopping!
152829253.author: a TripAdvisor user
152829253.reviewBody: There are a lot of food stalls with homemade treats,  We liked the Tamales which were fantastic. Organic/GF/Vegan items are plentiful.The arts items were varied from typical tourist itmes to some interesting local artist. It is a nice diversion for an hour or so on a Friday,

151245693.name: Sweet town
151245693.author: a TripAdvisor user
151245693.reviewBody: Had a great half-day trip shopping along the streets of this sweet town. Lovely beach but you have to pay to use the lounge chairs. Bring your owl towels!

151095476.name: Great place to visit
151095476.author: a TripAdvisor user
151095476.reviewBody: Sayulita is a beautiful beach community with a very pretty beach. It has an eclectic mix of shops and an excellent farmers market. it is well worth a visit.

150505225.name: Amazing food!
150505225.author: a TripAdvisor user
150505225.reviewBody:
I have watched this Mercado evolve and blossom over the years.  So much thought and love goes into creating the beautiful food and merchandise that is available at this organic market.  Where do I begin....amazing mustards and relishes, organic naturally dried-coffee grown from local farms, soups that have flavors that dance in your mouth, to die for Indian food, fresh sushi, tamales with exotic ingredients, incredible Argentinian sausage sandwiches, egg rolls made with lovely sauces, a variety of salsas and guacamole...the list goes on.

There are also lovely flowers grown locally, recycled glass gifts, and merchandise sold from the local  "Green" school, Costa Verde....... just to mention a few.

The icing on the cake is the lovely music played by local musicians as your stroll through the market and talk to friends, eat amazing food and shop your heart out.

A must for your Friday afternoon activity!

150493062.name: Great market - lots of organics and gourmet prepared foods
150493062.author: a TripAdvisor user
150493062.reviewBody: What a sweet little taste of Sayulita - every Friday.  So many great food options and more. Smoked fish, deli pickles, local fair trade coffee, organic produce and fruit, delicious read to eat tamales, baked goods and more !

149668415.name: Something for everyone!
149668415.author: a TripAdvisor user
149668415.reviewBody: Great place for a family with different tastes. A great place to try different food. Pickles, Pies, chocolates, Indian food, flowers and local growers make this market a Fun place!!

149653041.name: Sayulita Farmers Market- A Friday Destination
149653041.author: a TripAdvisor user
149653041.reviewBody: A great intimate market for a small town. An ecclectic combination of organic produce, cooking ingredients, and natural body products. It\'s fun to pick up one of the international light lunch items and browse around, while listening to live music.

651750846.name: Una vista bonita!!!
651750846.author: a TripAdvisor user
651750846.reviewBody:
As we are more adventurous vacationers who prefer to do our own independent sightseeing, we chose to do this hike on our own.  We did encounter a couple of people along the way, Europeans, who had a guide along with them.  Definitely not necessary to do with a guide, but just be sure to read my tip at the bottom of this review.

We took a taxi ($500pesos incl tip) from Nuevo Vallarta to Higuera Blanca, a small pueblo at the foot of the mountain.  

Our taxi driver had to stop several times in the pueblo to ask for directions.  This was a blessing, however, as we stopped at a tienda, where we purchased another 1L bottle of water. This came in very handy, as the heat of the day required more hydration.  We had packed water, but we went through all of it by the end of our day.

It is a short walk (3 1/2 hrs total) easy for anyone in fairly good health.  We are mid fifties and in good shape, hiking and cycling at home.  The climb is not too steep, only a 400m increase in elevation.  There was a bit of scrambling over rocks at the end, nothing really difficult, if you are wearing proper hiking shoes.

Also, some people mentioned a lack of signage.  This was no problem at all, as we found the trail well marked, with signs along the way.

The views are spectacular, with the opportunity to see whales breaching out at sea...360% view of the Bahía de Banderas.

IMPORTANT NOTE:  There are no taxis back to Nuevo Vallarta or Bucerías or anywhere for that matter.  Knowing some Spanish is a real asset, as I asked a couple of locals, who told us to flag down a bus.  This cost $31pesos each, taking us all the way back to Nuevo Vallarta.  We got off the bus at the Chedraui on the highway to pick up a few things, then took an Uber back to our condo.  The trip on the bus took over an hour, on the old winding highway.  

Nice diversion from sitting on a beach all day.  For those seeking an alternative view of Puerto Vallarta.

Adventurous souls from Calgary, AB.
🇨🇦

651125998.name: Worth the effort
651125998.author: a TripAdvisor user
651125998.reviewBody:
This is a totally unmarked trail and the only hints for getting there are some signs others have been there before.  Unfortunately the smaller summit is well traveled and although easier it is about half the height.  This is about a 1000 foot climb and there are lots of tricky spots for those not use to trail walking.  I'd say advanced intermediate for skill and fitness levels. 
If you make it to the top of the wrong mountain top there's a small trail leading off to the right at the top which will take you to the very farthest point.  Not terribly difficult but not for the faint of heart. We did this the one day and then the correct trail a few days later.  You can easily do both the same day if you make a mistake and you are very healthy.  That didn't included anyone in my group.  We were all around 60 years old. 

Traveling there we took a taxi from el centro for 100 pesos.  There's no cell service most of the time there and definitely none near Jaqueline Hacienda.  We ended up walking most of the way back until a taxi happened along.  This is about a three hour hike from the Hacienda and back with no errors in trail decisions.  Book a taxi for your return about 4 hours later and walk to the beach if you have extra time and back to the hacienda for your scheduled time.  

Like the other reviews you will be crossing over gates etc.  The taxis may take you to the farthest point they can which will save you some time but it isn't a bad walk. I'm guessing it won't be for 100 pesos like we paid.  Tip:  when you get to the first place it seems like it will take you up to the mountain stay left don't be tempted.  It looks like a washed out riverbed and it is wide. The trail to the left looks less used but when you come to a tree across the trail you will know you are on the right track.  After this point it is only well used where you are supposed to travel.

572712736.name: Beautiful View!
572712736.author: a TripAdvisor user
572712736.reviewBody: The hike was a bit tiring... but worth it.\nit\'s one of those views that take an hour and a half to reach, but once you reach the top the panoramic heaven speaks for itself.\nhighly recommend it

562817453.name: Most well-known hike in Sayulita
562817453.author: a TripAdvisor user
562817453.reviewBody:
Overall: 

- Highly recommend booking this hike with MexiTreks. The trails for Monkey Mountain back into private farmland and the MexiTreks guides have a relationship with the farmers. I doubt most visitors are comfortable enough to walk about 1-2 miles out of town and convince a local farmer that he/she wants to hike on their property. (MexiTreks also gives back to the community by helping to clear and maintain hiking trails and are upfront about where your tour fee goes.)

- Most of the terrain is dusty and rocky. Wear shoes with good traction and apply sunscreen and insect repellent. 

- Be prepared for steep uphill climbs and downhill semi-crawls. Any healthy traveler should get a moderate workout from this hike.

- Bring more water than you think you need even if your hike starts early in the morning.

560101709.name: Don\'t Use Versa Premium
560101709.author: a TripAdvisor user
560101709.reviewBody: I did this hike with Versa because they lied about knowing where Mexi Treks was.  The hike is challenging with some risky parts.  The ropes are slippery and the knots are too small.  Our guide was only 17 years old and completely inexperienced.  The worst part:  We told the driver, named Jonathan, that we wanted to have pizza at Rustico.   He showed up there, and sat at our table and ordered himself a pizza.  We never invited him or offered to pay for his food.  He are his pizza and stuck us with the bill.  So unprofessional.   Neve use Versa Premium for this hike!  January 2018.

558312407.name: Doable on your own 3hr with taxi
558312407.author: a TripAdvisor user
558312407.reviewBody: All the guides and a bunch of other people said we had to have a guide to do this hike. But if your up for adventure you can totally do it on your own. It helps if you speak spanish but that\'s not necessary. Ask the taxi drivers if they know how to get to Cerro Del Mono ( monkey mountain ) they should say it cost between 150-250pesos. \n\nThe start of the trail is close to Hacienda Jacqueline\'s. The taxi can take a left there and then drive down another 10 minutes until you arrive at a closed gate, jump the fence and walk up hill for about 1 hr. There are a couple of paths that lead away but generally just keep heading straight and up on the most well defined path available. The summit coordinates are (20.8219440,-105.4652350)

539787858.name: tough but awesome!
539787858.author: a TripAdvisor user
539787858.reviewBody: we took a guided hike with Wild Mex see my review there as well. the hike was steep and rough. Fine for my husband and I but my dad was dying for days after. The view at the top is totally worth it. the picture they have on here doesn\'t sum it up at all

474714125.name: Beautiful Hike, need a guide
474714125.author: a TripAdvisor user
474714125.reviewBody: This was an amazing hike, and I went with a guide from Mexitreks. It was beautiful, with an amazing view! I would not do this hike alone or without a guide. To get to the trail head you really need to take transportation, otherwise you are walking along the street (with no sidewalks) for about an hour out of Sayulita, and it did not look safe. Once you get to the turn off in the road you have to hike through private property, opening and closing their gates. This could be very awkward if you don\'t speak Spanish well and get confronted by a local farmer. There are also multiple trails to get up and down the mountain and there are no maps. The mountain is privately owned, and I would not have felt comfortable going without a map and on someones land. If you do this hike I would not do it alone and would 100% use a guide. I used Mexitreks and loved them! Not only are the guides knowledgeable about everything - from the flora and fauna to everything about Mexico. Not to mention that Mexitreks works with the farmers and gets their permission to hike on their land, and gives back a portion of the fee back to locals and non-profits working in Sayulita. When you do this hike make sure you wear tennis or hiking shoes, enough water to last about 3-4 hours, and be prepared that this is not an easy hike if you are not an avid hiker. Overall, a beautiful hike with a very rewarding view!

362636023.name: Monkey Mountain makes an amazing hike with a rewarding view.
362636023.author: a TripAdvisor user
362636023.reviewBody:
While visiting Sayulita we were told about Monkey Mountain, and some guided hikes, but my husband and I decided to go by ourselves.
There is not really any signs of how to get there, but we just asked local people around as we walked towards the mountain. 
We even went through some private property to get there. We followed my husband's instinct and made it up there after having climbed the wrong mountain before. Monkey Mountain is the highest mountain in the area and has a 360º view, letting you see the whole bay. Very stunning. 
There are lots of vultures up there as you can tell by the smell of their poo. My husband made it before me and got to see one from close. 
The hike tours apparently leave before sunrise, so you get to see the sun set from above, which we didn't, but still very beautiful.
It requires to be fit to climb to the top, since it's about 1 hour and a half up hill. Going down is probably 1 hour, but still tricky since it's very slippery (I fell down like 5 times).
Only bad thing is we came back to notice we were covered in ticks. Not only our dog, but us humans too. Still it was worth it, great outdoors experience.

675342285.name: Amazing Beach - Don\'t Pass it Up!
675342285.author: a TripAdvisor user
675342285.reviewBody: My wife and I hiked here (technically, I think were were at Playa Malpasos - at least that\'s what it\'s called on Google Maps). The hike through the jungle was delightful, but the beach was breathtaking. When we arrived around noon on a Saturday we were the only people on the entire stretch for most of our time there. Someone had made a lean-to with palm fronds in the sand so we set up there and felt like we were castaways. The only caution is the surf. I saw other people mention it in their posts. There was a wicked undertow, so we never got more than knee deep, and even then there were times we had to fight to keep our footing. So, while it would have been nice to be able to dive in and cool off, just plan to be extra cautious as there is really no help immediately available if you get into trouble. If you have the physical means to do so, I highly recommend putting this on your agenda when visiting Sayulita!

664838242.name: Sketchy Walk, Worth the Solitude
664838242.author: a TripAdvisor user
664838242.reviewBody: Went here for a day. The walk there was easy if you follow online blog instructions but you are walking through a forest for about 15-20 minutes. The beach itself is amazing and very secluded. Was us and a few other people. No one selling items.

540907921.name: Beautiful View of Ocean and Jungle
540907921.author: a TripAdvisor user
540907921.reviewBody: This beach is North of the main beach in Sayulita and worth the hike because there were only a handful of people there when we arrived. The water was very clear and the sand was soft and white, but the waves were quite large with a strong undertow so we did not swim.

381628284.name: Great Hike and Beach!
381628284.author: a TripAdvisor user
381628284.reviewBody: Directions from the previous review are spot on. Go north out of town on Avenue del Palmar. Be careful. There is no one back there to rescue you!!

372628407.name: Remote Hidden Solitude!
372628407.author: a TripAdvisor user
372628407.reviewBody: Plan your hike about a half hour before low tide. The start of the easy trail is at the end of the beach road by Casa El Palacio. Just cross over the chain at the end of the street. follow silver arrows on trees and rocks til you cross a cobblestone road that leads to a beach house. keep heading north perhaps a quarter mile in all and you will see an abandoned cement structure on the left. Follow that trail to the beach. On the north end of the beach there are 2 caves, the bigger one during low tide, passes thru to Malpayso Beach. If the tide is too high just walk around on the trail that continues above. Easy hike and we\'ve never seen  soul there. Dangerous riptides though. Take water, it gets hot.

432923668.name: Unique handmade jewelry, beautiful silver, gold, gems and pearls.
432923668.author: a TripAdvisor user
432923668.reviewBody: One of a kind pieces from a true artist. Humble and pure in presentation and description. Definitely want to support this shop.

157081203.name: For artisano items
157081203.author: a TripAdvisor user
157081203.reviewBody: I bought a hammered silver bracelet here for 550 pesos. That was an unbelievable price, real silver, real craftmanship, and the jeweller was there when I bought it...he and his wife operate this store and have a lovely selection of beautiful handcrafted and local items. It is nice to find such a place-authentic!

675342739.name: Favorite Beach of the Trip
675342739.author: a TripAdvisor user
675342739.reviewBody: Of our 5 beach days, we spent 2 at Playa los Muertos. It was a delightful 10 minute walk from our villa. The venders there are not as plentiful as on the main beach in Sayulita. We ordered the shrimp ceviche, guacamole, and fresh fruit while there and all were amazing...and we didn\'t get sick at all from it. Save yourself a few pesos and bring your own blanket and umbrella, or pay a small fee (I don\'t know how much because we did the former) to use what\'s there. Side Note: I tried snorkeling in the main roped off swim area. It was a bust. I think the surf was kicking up too much sand to allow any visibility. I didn\'t venture away from there, so maybe it gets better over near the rocks. Just be careful...

672147951.name: Nice quiet beach
672147951.author: a TripAdvisor user
672147951.reviewBody: Just a short ride by golf cart (available for rent in Sayulita), this beach is very beautiful, but much less crowded than Sayulita\'s main beach. You can buy drinks and a few snacks from beach vendors, and the water is good for swimming. Also has a lovely graveyard, for those who appreciate morbid beauty :)

665311770.name: Best for swimming...
665311770.author: a TripAdvisor user
665311770.reviewBody: ...and the only beach that seems to be safe right now in Sayulita. Not sure what\'s going on with the sewage project at the main beach.

663515401.name: Away from the crowded and smelly beaches in town
663515401.author: a TripAdvisor user
663515401.reviewBody: You have to bring your own umbrellas & chairs, beverages & coolers! But the tranquility and lack of smelly sewage seeping into the ocean is worth the inconvenience of not being near the cafes.

661233061.name: Beautiful quiet beach
661233061.author: a TripAdvisor user
661233061.reviewBody: We came here every morning with our 7 year old to check out tide pools, throw the football, and build sand castles. It was a great quiet beach with beautiful views. I\u2019d highly recommend getting off the beaten path if you\u2019re in sayulita.

660407953.name: PRIVATE and worth the walk!
660407953.author: a TripAdvisor user
660407953.reviewBody: I\'ve never had to pass by a cemetery to enter a gorgeous private beach, but there is a first for everything.  It really was beautiful if I\'m being honest, because every tomb stone was colorful and it wasn\'t a sad feeling passing by, it was beautiful in a sense to see how the Mexican culture celebrates life.  The cove itself is STUNNING!  the sand glittered in the light with gold and there were hardly any people on this beach.  There were hundreds of people on the main beach and very few people here.  Who knows how long that will last, but go while you can before Instagram makes it even more famous and everyone starts to go there!!!

657921617.name: Secluded and Relaxed
657921617.author: a TripAdvisor user
657921617.reviewBody: Just a short walk from the center of Sayulita, this beach is a bit more laid back and secluded. Great rocks to explore in the shallows and still some basic amenities if you plan to spend the day.

656869903.name: Good for swimming
656869903.author: a TripAdvisor user
656869903.reviewBody: Good beach for swimming, far fewer people than at the awfully crowded main sayulita beach.\n\nVery pretty water. Did get 1 jellyfish bite on my second day though.

656606220.name: Quiet beach
656606220.author: a TripAdvisor user
656606220.reviewBody: My family visited this quiet and relaxing little beach in Sayulita recently. Interesting location, just adjacent to a graveyard, hence the name of the beach. It is outside the main part of town, along a paved road. Follow avenue Palmar and you can\'t miss it. Various vendors, but not a lot of people around. Water is calm, and great for swimming or just wading in. You can rent chairs and umbrellas at a reasonable price. Worth the visit!

656594408.name: Worth the hike to this Beach
656594408.author: a TripAdvisor user
656594408.reviewBody: Hike up past Villa Amor and you\'ll reach this beach a bit more off the beaten path than the main beach.  No lounge chairs but there are vendors selling drinks and shrimp on the stick.

656412149.name: Nice beach! Even better hike to get there
656412149.author: a TripAdvisor user
656412149.reviewBody:
Very nice light sandy beach in a small cove. The rocky outcrop on the right was beautiful, where whereas the left side had houses perched on the mountain that reminded me of Italy.

The hike up and down through the graveyard to get there was spectacular. Many things to see.

I'll be back

656115208.name: Hidden gem of a beach!
656115208.author: a TripAdvisor user
656115208.reviewBody: Of all the beaches we visited in Sayulita, this was by far my favorite! It is a bit confusing to find, so grab a map of the town and look closely at the streets.  We took our golf cart and drove right on down.  The best part of all is that you enter the beach by going through a graveyard, which is filled with culture, memories, lots of color, and spectacular headstones!  You must go through this to reach the beach area, so don\'t turn around.  Once you are through the graveyard, you will immediately be at the beach entrance and you will see a little food and drink stand nearby.  Food is cheap beach food, but the drinks kept on flowing throughout the entire day, as they walked down to the beach the whole day to see if we wanted margaritas.  The beach itself is beautiful and clean, but the best part about it was that it was empty! We were some of the first to arrive for the day as we were prepared to stay the whole day (which we did), and we expected many others to arrive shortly after us.  That never happened.  There might have been a total of 30 people around the entire time.  We rented a cheap plastic table and chairs and had a great time playing frisbee, enjoying the waves, and eating and drinking cheap eats!  There is a bathroom, but bring a couple dollars because they like you to pay to use the facilities.  Seriously a must visit while in Sayulita!

653922251.name: Great beach
653922251.author: a TripAdvisor user
653922251.reviewBody: If you are staying for any extended time in Sayulita, you need to spend one day here. Very cool little beach with a walk through the cemetery. On the way back we stopped at a bar for happy hour. They just finished the road to los arcos which made it a \nNice walk.

651900870.name: Family place with nice beach
651900870.author: a TripAdvisor user
651900870.reviewBody: A nicer beach away from tourists and bars but you can still buy a cold beer from the vendors.  They rent chairs and umbrellas. Walking here is past Amor hotel and the stretch of beach road under construction. Omar and his son Michael oversee the drinks and chairs. Beer is 30 pesos. Plus tip.

651720476.name: Great Beach!
651720476.author: a TripAdvisor user
651720476.reviewBody: This beach is great and is a wonderful walk through the colourful cemetery to get there.  This beach is much less busy than the main beach but still has vendors that will bring you food, drink or whatever you need.  The water was clear and the beach was sandy.  Be warned that the bathrooms may not be open though!

651276149.name: Friendly, peaceful and beautiful.
651276149.author: a TripAdvisor user
651276149.reviewBody: Great beach.  Less busy and noisey than main beach.  Beautiful scenery and some places to grab a bite to eat, never been ill from eating here.  Lots of trees for shade and large ares for sun tanning.  Great place to read that book or listen to music.

651275014.name: Small quiet beach
651275014.author: a TripAdvisor user
651275014.reviewBody: Love this beach for how small and quiet it is.  There can be limited space at times because of the tide.  Would recommend coming to this beach to get away from the tourist action in main beaches of Sayulita where you constantly have vendors stopping by with things to sell you.  There is still a little of that happening at this beach but nothing in comparison to the others. It\'s also very fun to walk to, as you walk through the colorful cemetery to get to the actual beach.

650246464.name: Better than the main beach by far
650246464.author: a TripAdvisor user
650246464.reviewBody: If you\'re in Sayulita and you;re trying to avoid the crowds and potential sickness you might get at the main beach, this is by far the better option. Take not, it\'s only for swimming, no surfing or boogie boarding.

649594754.name: Glad we went!
649594754.author: a TripAdvisor user
649594754.reviewBody: Nice easy walk to get there from town, then interesting through the cemetery.  The waves where a lot smaller than at the North Beach so it was great to finally get in the water.  Not too busy.

649570581.name: Gem
649570581.author: a TripAdvisor user
649570581.reviewBody: It was a great trip to a quiet beach....but no banos, they needed to be emptied. Omar was our guy,  quite accommodating but!!!, he took out ID for the rental of a board and when we were done, we had to wait for it to come from town...WTF!?!?!??. Not acceptable!!!

649327673.name: Unless you\'re surfing - skip the big beach and go here!
649327673.author: a TripAdvisor user
649327673.reviewBody: Where you put your towel is a little more like gravel than sand, but its soft and doesn\'t get all over the place. You can actually swim at this beach and if you get in up to your waste the gravel changes to super soft silica sand. Not good for snorkeling because of said silica, but great for a beach day.

649051441.name: Great beach
649051441.author: a TripAdvisor user
649051441.reviewBody:
This is a great beach and just a short walk from anywhere in Sayulita.  This isn't a taxi ride unless you are handicap. 

The surf is heavy most of the time in Sayulita so be careful of the waves and undertow.  This isn't a large beach so go early if you want a nice spot.
The main beach in Sayulita has issues with sewage and although they seem to be working on it it is far from being resolved.  The north beach is just great for swimming and privacy

648158526.name: very small beach
648158526.author: a TripAdvisor user
648158526.reviewBody: Over-crowded, not clean, and still not amenable to swimming.\nI do not recommend taking the path to the beach as it is under construction.

646869861.name: Best beach day ever
646869861.author: a TripAdvisor user
646869861.reviewBody: Had a beautiful day at this secluded beach.  Definitely take a taxi from downtown Sayulita, don\u2019t try to walk there.  It\u2019s worth the 100 pesos ($5).  Omar took great care of us when arrived, setting up chairs and an umbrella and bringing us drinks and snacks.  We hardly had to move.  Way quieter than the main beach.  It\u2019s also interesting to explore the nearby cemetery.  Note that the bathroom requires 10 pesos to use.

646783019.name: An beach cemetery
646783019.author: a TripAdvisor user
646783019.reviewBody: Not particularly interesting but it\'s something to do.  The monuments are varied and in quite a difference in how well they are maintained.

646370305.name: Secluded beach in Sayulita (10 min walk from the main beach)
646370305.author: a TripAdvisor user
646370305.reviewBody: If you like swimming in the sea, or want to take your kids to a beach where they can run around and you won\'t lose sight of them, Playa los Muertos is perfect. It\'s a pretty beach, clean, and has a cafe nearby for lunch. Is also a lot quieter than the main beach in Sayulita and you won\'t risk getting in the way of surfers whilst swimming here as there\'s no swell/surf.

646072969.name: Quiet and scenic
646072969.author: a TripAdvisor user
646072969.reviewBody: This beach is just off the road that goes through a picturesque cemetery. It\u2019s small,cozy and scenic. There\u2019s a small food/drink stand and a couple vendors around. Our preference over the main beach in Sayulita.

645866484.name: Beautiful beach near the local cemetery
645866484.author: a TripAdvisor user
645866484.reviewBody: We walked through this beach several times on our way to town. Cute local beach where families would gather.

645657520.name: Perfect, for a quieter beach experience
645657520.author: a TripAdvisor user
645657520.reviewBody: 10 minute walk from town, this beach is perfect to escape the crowded Sayulita beach. The water also has a quicker drop off, so you can swim faster, and the waves are less intense.

645068340.name: Over crowded Sayulita
645068340.author: a TripAdvisor user
645068340.reviewBody: We were so disappointed with our trip to Sayulita and Playa los Muertos Beach.Playa los Muertos was over crowded which prevented swimming other than back and forth between two bouys. The main Sayulita Beach was worse. There were hundreds of people standing in the water and beginners trying to surf. I was hit and run over by a beginner surfer within a few minutes in the water. My whole family got sick after swimming with likely E. Coli. We flew home early to recover. New Years week was so loud at our airbnb downtown that no one could sleep. What a disappointment. We had to cancel all our excursions.This town may have been cool 20 years ago.

644169649.name: Not as crowded
644169649.author: a TripAdvisor user
644169649.reviewBody: The main beach is packed and crowded. This one has less people and the waves are smaller. There are still vendors coming by to sell you stuff. Short walk to get there.

643150139.name: Nice stretch of beach to relax on
643150139.author: a TripAdvisor user
643150139.reviewBody: All the internet searches will point you to this beach if you are looking for a quieter more secluded area. While this is kind of true, it\u2019s not really secluded and will have a decent amount of people there depending on the time/day. With that said, it is infinitely less crowded than the main beach in Sayulita, and is equally as beautiful and a great place to catch some sun rays and relax. Added bonus: very easy to get to, short walk from town. Even shorter walk from villa amor, if you happen to stay there. There are lifeguards on duty who will point you in the right direction if you happen to meander into sea urchin territory. The cemetery on the way there is kind of neat, but not as interested or amazing as some articles I saw online made it out to be. The beach itself, though, is great. definitely worth the time to check out. Watch for a variety of beautiful birds in the area :)

642441892.name: Great Beach check out the Cemetery
642441892.author: a TripAdvisor user
642441892.reviewBody: This beach is tuck away in a cove. Seems like you can rent umbrellas, chairs and have restaurant service (I may be cautious on the food) the walk is nice be sure to check out the cemetery.  There is even a life guard on duty!

640564010.name: Great beach for swimming and relaxing.
640564010.author: a TripAdvisor user
640564010.reviewBody: Just a few minutes walk south of the main beach, Playa los Muertos is a delight.  Clean, with a little palapa bar providing waiter service, the waves are just enough to feel the thrill of playing in them, but not enough to overwhelm.  I loved the walk there as well.

637712357.name: If in Sayulita you must find this beach
637712357.author: a TripAdvisor user
637712357.reviewBody: We have just a few days here and it has been lovely but this beach has been hands down our favorite thing. Quiet, away from town - there are folks to help you with chairs, umbrellas food and more if you want - or simply say - no gracias and enjoy this quiet beach. We have two days left and plan to be there every day. There is a lifeguard on duty and some version of policies in an atv....little restaurante and a few vendors

636112233.name: great little beach
636112233.author: a TripAdvisor user
636112233.reviewBody: walk through the cemetery to get to Playa los Muertos. not a lot of vendors for beer/food though so byob.

635674683.name: Quite Beach
635674683.author: a TripAdvisor user
635674683.reviewBody: This beach is more secluded and peaceful then the main Sayulita beach. Not a far walk at all to get there. There are some vendors too. Definitely worth checking out.

631658165.name: A more private beach
631658165.author: a TripAdvisor user
631658165.reviewBody: Just a short 10 minute walk from main beach to the south.  Nice small beach with a small outdoor bar with food.  Nice if you want to get away from the crowds.

630134016.name: Nice Beach - Pleasant Stroll
630134016.author: a TripAdvisor user
630134016.reviewBody: Took a looped hike from downtown Sayulita along the ocean shoreline to the cemetery and onto Playa los Muertos. Took another road back that dropped up back downtown. It was a pleasant stroll. We didn\'t swim at the beach although it seemed nice enough. A few vendors selling bracelets and sunglasses. Sandy bottom and generally protected so waves less intense. Most people on the beach were lying in the sun or splashing in the waves. The surfboard folk were further North. I guess this beach is better for swimming than surfing. Worth a visit.

629942663.name: worth the ride
629942663.author: a TripAdvisor user
629942663.reviewBody: this beach is where to go if you want to dodge the crowds.  Remote and lovely, but it takes a car ride to get there\n

626987498.name: Small, secluded beach, easy walk from downtown area!
626987498.author: a TripAdvisor user
626987498.reviewBody: I have a fascination with cemeteries and enjoy exploring beaches so this adventure was high on my list when vacationing in Sayulita. From the downtown beach, head south along the shore then up onto the road past Villa Amor. Go under the green- blue arch and you enter the cemetery. The cemetery is on the hill, separated by a road. It\u2019s hard to explore as there are no real paths. But I managed to respectfully and quietly walk around without stepping on any graves, most of which are above ground. There were a few families visiting graveside. The colors and randomness of the cemetery are quite unique. The beach has parking so not quite as remote as I expected. Also a few concession stands and a bar on the approach road. Just like downtown locals will rent chairs and umbrellas and shrimp on a stick and trinkets will be offered. Amazingly there was a manned lifeguard tower! And a buoy line restricting swimmers. That was a good thing because the waves were big and the undertow strong. A swimmer could potentially get in big trouble fast. Not too many people. Most come for a quick look. A few of us were there for the day with a book. Well worth the walk!

622952447.name: Worth the drive
622952447.author: a TripAdvisor user
622952447.reviewBody: This beach isn\u2019t the easiest to find unless you get told, but it\u2019s a quick drive and very few people! Well worth it

620110245.name: What\u2019s all the fuss about?
620110245.author: a TripAdvisor user
620110245.reviewBody: Really not sure why this beach gets talked up so much. If you desperately want privacy and to avoid people, then maybe it\u2019s worth the 10 minute walk from Sayulita\u2019s main beach. Otherwise, not sure what the draw is. It\u2019s... a beach.

610042323.name: Cute little beach just a 5-7 minute walk from the main Sayulita beach.
610042323.author: a TripAdvisor user
610042323.reviewBody: Cute little beach just a 5-7 minute walk from the main Sayulita beach. Much quieter- great for swimming- but not for surfing.  We came here as we had heard about the water quality issues on the main beach (especially now during the rainy season when the rains wash the towns sewage from the river into the middle of the main beach) and didn\'t want to jeopardize our time with Montezuma\'s revenge. There is  little restaurant nearby with sellers bringing cold beer, prawns, chips and zero calorie donuts (:)).

609693408.name: A Hidden gem
609693408.author: a TripAdvisor user
609693408.reviewBody: A nice quiet and small beach away from the crowded Sayulita Beach. I thought the water quality here was better.

609229699.name: Fun time
609229699.author: a TripAdvisor user
609229699.reviewBody: We visited playa de los muertos on a Saturday morning, it was not so crowded and the water was very calm, so we could go in easily for a swim.  It\u2019s kind of funny getting there, since to reach it you have to go through the street that crosses the cementery.  It\u2019s worth the walk, and you can get all kinds of drinks, food, umbrellas and chairs to have a good time.

607096800.name: Charming little beach... a must if you are in Sayulita area.
607096800.author: a TripAdvisor user
607096800.reviewBody:
We went here daily during our stay in Sayulita.  We rented a golf cart during our stay (from Riviera Golf Carts - the Best) so it was easy to transport the four of us and our stuff and umbrella.  

They will rent you umbrellas and there is a nice shady area under the palm trees.  There is an enterprising system running a little restaurant and oyster bar.  You can get shrimp on a stick and oysters very cheap.  Also the restaurant makes any virgin or alcoholic drink and they are delicious.  Fresh coconuts as well.  

On Sunday it was very crowed with locals and tourists on Monday and Tuesday it was a much quietier vibe.  We had to pay 50 pesos for parking in Sunday, but not on the weekdays.

Everyone one was friendly.  I was fearful of the water/sewer situation in Sayulita and verified from several locals that unless they really have to surf they don't go to the main beach, they come here because the water is cleaner.  I swam all the way across the bay and didn't run into evidence of sewage/waste which I did see at the north end of the main Sayulita beach.  I used a mask and snorkel the second day and visability was poor but I could see some angel, parrot fish and schools of smaller fish by the rocks.

I ended up lending my mask, snorkel and goggles I brought to some mexican kids next to me and later their mom gave me some yummy ceviche she had brought.  We had a fun spanglish conversation.  

I fell in love with this beach and am already trying to figure out how to get back.

604135141.name: Cliff Jumping!
604135141.author: a TripAdvisor user
604135141.reviewBody: The beach itself is pretty memorable because of the cemetery that\'s just feet away. However, the cliff jumping is what made this a special beach for us. Bring your courage and jump on in, the water is great!

602265335.name: Beautiful private beach with a historic cemetery near by.
602265335.author: a TripAdvisor user
602265335.reviewBody: Amazing! Go!  Not crowded. Cool rocks. Feels like a private beach. Accessible from a path down from Don Pedro\'s and around the Amor hotels.

601268203.name: Hidden Gem Of A Beach!
601268203.author: a TripAdvisor user
601268203.reviewBody: We went to Sayulita and the locals told us we needed to walk over to Playa los Muertos. You can tell that not alot people know about it because it was clean, small and so beautiful! The beach is a good 10 minute walk from Sayulita beach and you walk by the Cemetary. Water is warm and you can rent a zarape and order drinks from your spot on the beach. You must go this beach!

597526584.name: Short walk from town, much quieter and nicer walk
597526584.author: a TripAdvisor user
597526584.reviewBody: This beach is just about a 15 minute walk from the main Sayulita beach. It is worth the walk! It is secluded, quiet, you aren\'t hit with vendors as much, and beautiful. You walk past a very ornate cemetery on the way. There are not restaurants and vendors, so come prepared. I would come back here again- way nicer than the main beach.

594434044.name: Culturally distinct small beach
594434044.author: a TripAdvisor user
594434044.reviewBody: Wonderful beach.  Please be respectful of the character of the beach.    Try to fish and the shrimp on the stick here!  Truly white sandy and small beach with a hidden beach within a 5 min walk or swim.

590079261.name: Best beach in Sayulita
590079261.author: a TripAdvisor user
590079261.reviewBody: Very cool spot a short walk away from the town center. The sand is much nicer than Sayulita beach it self and has that pirate\u2019s cove feel...

590060634.name: Everything you need to know
590060634.author: a TripAdvisor user
590060634.reviewBody:
We drove from Nuevo Vallarta. It will take about 45 min.  Very easy to find on well paved asphalt road.

Follow the 200 PV/Tepic signs.  Stay in tge left lane when the road splits at the Punta Mita turn off.  Still following the 200 with Tepic you will begin heading up the hill then down, past fruit stands and some businesses.  Turn left onto Av Revolucion.  You can't miss it....at the Pemex station with a Subway sandwiches on the left.

Head down hill and follow the road down to the right hand side (toward Centro).  This road takes you into downtown Sayulita.  

We found a parking lot for 150 pesos for the day.  There is little street parking in this town.  Look for a lot, there are several.    The large "E" 

Get down to the beach and follow the walkway to your left. You are heading south.  Go until you run out of walkway then follow the dirt frontage road along the water.

You will come to what looks like a private drive, a single lane well landscaped area with a yellow arch for the entrance to the Villa Amor Hotel.  Go past (they have a nice place to eat right there overlooking the water and Sayulita beach called "O's" where we ate a late lunch. The restaurant has reviews and takes Visa.
