Pass the restaurant and go through a teal green arch. You will see the cemetery.  Stay on the road to the left.  At the bottom of the hill, past the cemetery you will find the beach.

There is an outdoor grill and folks asking if you want chairs and umbrellas.  2 chairs/1 umbrella for $10 US.  They will serve you food and drinks from your seats.  They are the shire plastic chairs. Not lounge chairs.

The sand is nice. Some small pebbles at the waters edge but then sand.  Easy to swim and don't need water shoes.

It is a protected bay. Some rocks on the south side where you can snorkel.  There was a lifeguard there on the Sat we went.  

There is some shade to the right under a few palm trees if you just want to sit on the ground.

Vendors come through but not too many.  They just asked and kept moving.

The water was clear anx no seaweed.

You could also drove here but there isn't much parking. Follow same path as described, park on hill (street) opposite cemetery.

589852866.name: Hard to compare.  After being in Cozumel.
589852866.author: a TripAdvisor user
589852866.reviewBody: I went for a swim here.  The water is brown as is the sand.  Visibility was not too good.  The temperature was good and the locals were friendly.  The beach was also clean.  Way to go mexico.

588181063.name: Secluded beach
588181063.author: a TripAdvisor user
588181063.reviewBody: It\'s a bit of a hike from the south but so worth the sweat. We had the almost mile long beach entirely to ourselves.

586824255.name: decent beach sometimes have to pay for parking
586824255.author: a TripAdvisor user
586824255.reviewBody: I recently went there twice, the 1st time I didn\'t have to pay to park. the 2nd time someone asked for 50 pesos ($2.50 US). Its a much quieter and smaller beach then sayulita.

582230664.name: Clean, quiet, Beautiful.
582230664.author: a TripAdvisor user
582230664.reviewBody: Worth the short walk! This beach is clean, quiet, and there is a lady sometimes who can rent you an umbrella. There are rocks and the water is cleaner over here than the regular beach.

582009145.name: Sunsets
582009145.author: a TripAdvisor user
582009145.reviewBody: We walked the beach almost every day! We sat at a table by Captain Pablo/Patricia Surf lessons! We had a great view of the surfers, and our server made sure we had that view! Another day we sat on the benches near Don Pedro\'s! Just watching no service nor were we asked to move! \nThe beach was always clean, marina on south end with smaller boats on the sand, but neatly parked! There were several locals picking up trash through out the days and evenings that we were there! \nEvery evening we would sit at the Sunset Bar, part of Compuetos Los Tortugas. We sat with Eric, the bartender & owner, who we chatted and watched the sunsets every night! It is a local thing to do, and always beautiful!

580395570.name: Fun and mellow adventure
580395570.author: a TripAdvisor user
580395570.reviewBody: Take a walk south from Sayulita\u2019s main beach, past the Villa Amor Hotel, through the graveyard of above ground, beautifully decorated memorials to Sayulita\u2019s \u201cother\u201d beach. We went early and rented 2 chairs and an umbrella for about 200 pesos (~$10) from Luis for the whole day and got a great spot. The water is very calm and clear, plenty of families and couples. Lots of vendors walking by all day selling stuff but it didn\u2019t ruin our time at all. Tina and her husband will bring you drinks and food if you want them. We got a fruit tray with mango, watermelon, jicama and cucumber with a salty/chile sprinkled on it all for super cheap and it was great. If you spend the whole day, reapply that sunscreen after the water. We got some color on our skin after this but it was worth it!

578152339.name: Quieter than Sayulita- Snorkeling
578152339.author: a TripAdvisor user
578152339.reviewBody: Great small beach, few minute walk from Sayulita. We were looking to snorkel and took gear and this beach was great. The north end is rockier but there was better visibility and fish on the south side. Unfortunately there is nowhere to rent snorkeling gear easily, we had to from a tour guide who was nice enough to let us rent his stuff. Better beach for kids and further from the polluted waters in sayulita.

578150675.name: Best Beach in Sayulita!
578150675.author: a TripAdvisor user
578150675.reviewBody: Very clean beach, with its own bay, perfect for the family. We spened a full day here and would most likely be back

575201416.name: a must do
575201416.author: a TripAdvisor user
575201416.reviewBody: walk the beach to the rocks, and then get up on the dirt gravel road and walk thru the cemetery to a quite beach area.  There\'s a little snack hut and a street vendor for snacks.

575119773.name: Quick stop
575119773.author: a TripAdvisor user
575119773.reviewBody: We went on a boat trip and stopped at this place to do some water sports  .  There was toilets there plus place to have a drink. Lots of sun loungers. Clear water

573848547.name: So cool
573848547.author: a TripAdvisor user
573848547.reviewBody: Visited this cemetery at night, and during the day.  Great hike, great views!  There is a quiet little beach around the corner too!

573321898.name: We went everyday!
573321898.author: a TripAdvisor user
573321898.reviewBody: We preferred to spend our beach time here, rather than at Sayulita.\nLos Muertos is a lot quieter. You can buy drinks and ceviche from the restaurant there. It\u2019s sunny the water was refreshing but still swimmable in April.\nOnly reason I didn\u2019t give a 5/5 is there\u2019s s lot of beach vendors.. still less than that of the main beach in Sayulita though!

572701551.name: great beach, better than Sayulitas main beach
572701551.author: a TripAdvisor user
572701551.reviewBody:
every freaking tourist can go to sayulita, try the most reviewed restaurants, ride the same atvs, stay at the most known hotels, do the things that everybody recommended online and you would still end up falling into something called a "tourist monotony"
 where you realize everyone that went to sayulita did the same exact thing.
I personally liked the peace I felt when I arived at Los Muertos (a beach next to sayulitas main one), definitely a climatic change despite the short distance.
The atmosphere was cleaner and inviting, whereas sayulitas main beach was diverse and much more active.
If you are looking for a safe and peacful part of Sayu to escape the fast world in a minute, then Los Muertos is all I can say, you'd have to see for yourself.

571364803.name: much better than the Sayulita main beach
571364803.author: a TripAdvisor user
571364803.reviewBody: This beach is maybe 7 minutes walking distance away from the main beach in Sayulita. You can get a more private beach with cool waves, I will definitely come back again, just remember to bring your cooler and beach umbrella. \nThe beach gets its name from a nearby cemetery, I would recommend driving all the way here if you want to avoid the walk, they only charge $50 pesos. Or just just the walk as exercise!

571364692.name: A fine spot but over-rated
571364692.author: a TripAdvisor user
571364692.reviewBody: A nice swimming beach but smaller and much more crowded than I had been led to expect. We enjoyed walking through Villa Amor and the cemetery to get to it.

571106062.name: A great small beach not far from Sayulita
571106062.author: a TripAdvisor user
571106062.reviewBody: If you want to get away from the crowds in Sayulita this is a great place to go and relax. The beach is small but pretty.

570774156.name: Worth the walk
570774156.author: a TripAdvisor user
570774156.reviewBody: We were here on Easter week so it was incredibly crowded everywhere! That being said, the los Muertos beach was much less crazy and most of all much cleaner than the Sayulita main beach. It is a bit of a walk (perhaps half a mile) so beware. Less services but people will still bring you cerveza for 30 pesos. Ask for Omar as you arrive and he will get you chairs and an umbrella (250 pesos for the day) and cooks up a mean rice and shrimp dish.... fresh, as well as Margs! Walk here, its worth it.

570611808.name: Great Beach with smaller waves.
570611808.author: a TripAdvisor user
570611808.reviewBody: This beach is so unique as you walk through a beautiful cemetery to get there. The waves are smaller so it is a better swimming beach.

569493518.name: nice beach
569493518.author: a TripAdvisor user
569493518.reviewBody: We went to Los Muertos beach while staying in Sayulita. We rented 2 chairs and an umbrella for a few pesos and had beach side service all day with food and drinks. The water is very clear and the waves are not nearly as large as at the main beach making it a lot easier to swim.

569328547.name: Worth the walk
569328547.author: a TripAdvisor user
569328547.reviewBody: A short walk south of Sayulita beach brings you to Playa Los Muertos.  Quaint walk through a beautifully kept cemetery and all of a sudden you pop out at this beach.  A quieter and more relaxed feel here and some great Spanish tunes coming from the patrons beside us added to the atmosphere of the beach.  Thoroughly enjoyed our afternoon.

568998283.name: Peaceful Change of Pace!
568998283.author: a TripAdvisor user
568998283.reviewBody: A 10-minute walk south of Sayulita\u2019s main beach, this picturesque beach is accessed through the community cemetery, hence the name. It is smaller and quieter than the main beach and with smaller waves the day we went, well-suited for families with young children. There are some vendors and chairs and umbrellas for rent, but also ample natural shade. Well worth checking out at least once during any trip to Sayulita!

568185300.name: Beautiful beach!
568185300.author: a TripAdvisor user
568185300.reviewBody: Beautiful beach, waves are strong and it gets deep very quickly. Don\u2019t wander too far out if you\u2019re not a strong swimmer.

568000577.name: Beautiful beach
568000577.author: a TripAdvisor user
568000577.reviewBody: A beautiful place to relax and have a few drinks. Water is calm enough to swim all the time. Love this beach.

567782118.name: Mucho Muertos
567782118.author: a TripAdvisor user
567782118.reviewBody: Absolutely beautiful, private beach with beautiful ocean mountain views. Snorkelling to Sayulita pier was amazing...stingrays, eels, blow fish, and many other fish.\nCliff jumping for the daring too, ask a local.

567771274.name: What the locals don\'t want you to know!
567771274.author: a TripAdvisor user
567771274.reviewBody: Playa Los Muertos is located behind a cementary a short walk south of the main beach. The walk through the cementary is an experience by itself, the beach is quiet and calmer so it\'s perfect to relax specially if you are traveling with kids. \n\nThere are clean bathrooms, you pay 10 pesos and they give you toilet paper. Limited options for food/drinks but you may bring your own. We rented a table, chairs and hamock for our entire group for 300 pesos all day, not a bad deal!

567361422.name: Quiet beach, low key, good swimming
567361422.author: a TripAdvisor user
567361422.reviewBody: If you are looking for a quieter place to enjoy the sun, sand and surf, you will find it here. There is a stand offering fruit and beverages, but that is it. There is a bathroom, 10 pesos per visit, if you really need it. Lovely spot to swim and relax.

566905406.name: Beach of the Dead
566905406.author: a TripAdvisor user
566905406.reviewBody: If you are visiting Sayulita, take 10 minutes to walk to the Playa los Muertos. From town you walk along the road that goes south out of town or along the beach and cross through the cemetery.  The beach is smaller and there are less people than the main beach. There are umbrellas for rent, but not many vendor. Stay for the day, for a swim or to snorkel near the rocks or just go to see the beach and the cemetery.

566360699.name: Hidden treasure
566360699.author: a TripAdvisor user
566360699.reviewBody: Just a short hike from the main beach down the dusty road thru the cemetery is a true gem ... generally way less busy than main beach but still has all the needed services ... beach is smaller but ocean is less wavy making it easier for swimming...

566188547.name: Quiet and relaxing place
566188547.author: a TripAdvisor user
566188547.reviewBody:
If you don't enjoy crowded places you might prefer coming to Playa de los Muertos instead of Sayulita's main beach.

Less crowded, a lot of palms so no need for you to rent an umbrella and a nice view.

There are food and beverages offered at the entrance (but vendors won't be disturbing you as in the main beach)

Visit Playa los Muertos but don't share the secret or this beach will also be crowded (kidding, kind of)

565866469.name: Beautiful, relaxing little beach.
565866469.author: a TripAdvisor user
565866469.reviewBody: My teenage daughters and I really enjoyed this beach since we like to swim, not surf.  We\'re also fair-skinned and greatly appreciated the ample shade.  Our hotel was on the opposite side of Sayulita but this beach was still a short, enjoyable walk.

565521483.name: See the Sunset
565521483.author: a TripAdvisor user
565521483.reviewBody: Hike to los Muertos to see the sunset while you\'re in Sayulita. So peaceful and lovely; great break from the regular bustle.

565187909.name: Great little beach
565187909.author: a TripAdvisor user
565187909.reviewBody: Cocktails are delivered to you at the beach. Parking costs a few Pesos. Make sure you bring pesos not order to use the restroom.

564941122.name: Nice beach
564941122.author: a TripAdvisor user
564941122.reviewBody: A much less crowded beach only 15 minute walk from the main one. There is one steep but short hill. The cemetery you pass is  quite interesting. Take a lunch and refreshment with you.

564579844.name: Fabulous Beach!
564579844.author: a TripAdvisor user
564579844.reviewBody:
Go!  This is a great beach!  Not as crowded as the main beach in town and it is wonderful.  You will have to Drive through the cemetery (see pictures) to get there but that is part of the beauty of this area.   It is wonderful how the deceased are celebrated with the creative and colorful tombstones and monuments.   

Once you get there there is a parking area that a little lady will collect 50+/- pesos and this will also give you access to the bathrooms for the day.  Then just walk a short way to the beach.  

Enjoy,

563996350.name: No Banos
563996350.author: a TripAdvisor user
563996350.reviewBody: Nice beach but there were no bathrooms available which made our stay a little short considering that we had paid 300$peso for all day rental of chairs and umbrella before we found out the bathrooms were closed.\n

563003108.name: Quiet less busy beach
563003108.author: a TripAdvisor user
563003108.reviewBody: If you want to get away from the bustle of the main beach then Playa los Muertos is a great alternative. No services but vendors walk over from the main beach. There is a coconut stand for a refreshing drink. Bring your own chairs. Most Casitas and villas have ones for you to borrow or rent. Saw folks who were carrying their chairs on their backs like a backpack - a great Costco find. If you visit regularly the landlords let you store stuff from visit to visit.

562816653.name: Smaller and quieter slice of Sayulita
562816653.author: a TripAdvisor user
562816653.reviewBody:
If you're staying in Sayulita and have experienced the hustle and bustle of Sayulita Beach, then Playa de los Muertos is the perfect beach to read and nap for hours. 

The walk will take about 10-15 minutes.

 From Sayulia Beach, walk toward and then past the fishing and whale watching boats. 

There's a public road that will take you past some of the oceanside resorts and rentals before you reach a hill. 

Walk about 30 feet to the top of the hill and you'll see the graveyard. Continue straight and past the graveyard until you see a fork in the road. Turn right and you're headed to Playa de los Muertos. 

Pros: 

- Quieter beach 
- Fewer tourists and families here. They typically don't stay for the entire day as they would on Sayulita Beach, especially on the weekends and holidays.
- Fewer vendors come here to sell their goods, but there's a snack and soft drinks stand at the entrance to the beach.
-Bathrooms for use steps beyond the beach (10 pesos per visit).

Cons: 

- Playa de los Muertos' shoreline is a fraction of Sayulita Beach's shoreline. It's bookended by rocks with a resort to the south.

560320105.name: Worth the walk if you\'re nearby
560320105.author: a TripAdvisor user
560320105.reviewBody: This is a small beach to enjoy one day if you\'re nearby, nothing more. The walk is easy. You can either go over the rocks or walk along the beach heading south, pass the cemetery and turn right to get there. There are vendors with food and drink. Sometimes people play music with boomboxes which can be loud and annoying. If you\'re staying in Sayulita, it\'s definitely worth checking out at  least once.

560098641.name: Beach is beautiful but limited
560098641.author: a TripAdvisor user
560098641.reviewBody: Beach is beautiful and maybe 20 minute walk from Sayulita in a dirt and gravel road. Large cemetery is right there and the only bathroom is \u201cmanaged\u201d by a family charging $10 pesos to park or use the banyos. Same family offers you rental chairs and umbrellas and they appear to keep the public beach raked and maintained. It\u2019s a public beach. You can understand the puzzling feeling. Beach and view is stunning.\n

559107269.name: Interesting beach by cemetery
559107269.author: a TripAdvisor user
559107269.reviewBody: Quiet beach without riptides, tucked next to an interesting cemetery.  From here, you can walk another 15 minutes to Playa Carracitos for an even quieter beach.

558672405.name: Love this Spot
558672405.author: a TripAdvisor user
558672405.reviewBody: If you are up for the hike, Playa Los Muertos is great on a hot day. And come hungry: vendors offer fish tacos, grilled chicken, tamales, the best doughnuts ever eaten on a beach, cold beer, margaritas, coconut water and many other items for a reasonable price considering you are sitting on a beach doing nothing but wait for food and drinks to appear as if from the jungle...:) Great waves, maybe not so great for little ones except at shore\'s edge if fully supervised (hands on), umbrellas for rent as desired.

557592992.name: A little piece of heaven at the Dead Beach
557592992.author: a TripAdvisor user
557592992.reviewBody:
We weren’t sure about making the trek to the beach, but it is really a short walk (10 minutes) from the main beach at Sayulita. 
We were glad we went, it is a clean beach and maintained throughout the day. The beach area is smaller and the waves are more gentle than in Sayulita. A peaceful place to relax. 
There is a shack at the entrance where you can buy drinks or they will bring drinks to you on the beach. You can rent umbrellas and chairs and a banos is available for 10 pesos (free if you are just changing clothes). 
A bonus for making the trek is you pass thru an amazing colourful cemetery on the way. The shrines and plots are very ornate and beautifully decorated. A wonderful resting place.

556301433.name: Nice quiet beach, away from the main Sayulita beach.
556301433.author: a TripAdvisor user
556301433.reviewBody: Nice place. Nice people working there. Our beach for our trip. We found this place to be more to our tastes.

555922823.name: Hidden gem
555922823.author: a TripAdvisor user
555922823.reviewBody: This small beach is peaceful and cleaner than the regular one.  Vendors are in abundance though not pushy.  Want it to remain quiet.

554826321.name: Worth a visit!
554826321.author: a TripAdvisor user
554826321.reviewBody: Playa Los Muertos is a beautiful beach and worth the walk from downtown Sayulita. The beach is really sandy and great for lounging. The waves were huge! But I still enjoyed swimming there. You can also take a walk through the cemetery next to the beach.

553574796.name: Great for kids
553574796.author: a TripAdvisor user
553574796.reviewBody: This places is great for kids as the tides aren\u2019t as strong as the beaches nearby.  It\u2019s like 10 minutes from Sayulita main plaza  if you drive. It doesn\u2019t get overly crowded and it\u2019s very clean. If you don\u2019t have any beach gear you can rent chairs for 50 pesos and you can also rent umbrellas.

552953986.name: Best beach in Sayulita
552953986.author: a TripAdvisor user
552953986.reviewBody: It\'s a short stroll thru colorful cemetery in Sayulita - but you reach a very clean nice beach with less vendors than the Sayulita beach. There are no surfers here - so ideal place to take the kids. It\'s not a big beach so get there early to find a spot with shade or bring your own umbrella.

551637157.name: Crowded
551637157.author: a TripAdvisor user
551637157.reviewBody: Really crowded beach, loud music, not very large beach, rather dirty.any people go to this beach because it is easy to reach by car or on foot

551274494.name: Great quiet beach worth the hike.
551274494.author: a TripAdvisor user
551274494.reviewBody: The hike through a grave yard is well worth it. The beach seems to get more crowded every year but still is less crowded than Sayulitas other main beach. Not for surfers but for swimming only.

551198786.name: This is so interesting!
551198786.author: a TripAdvisor user
551198786.reviewBody: Come check out the graves sites and mausoleums on the ocean beach. They are real, current, and decorated/well maintained. I respectfully walked the graveyard and was fascinated by the art and culture.

551032475.name: The better choice in Sayulita
551032475.author: a TripAdvisor user
551032475.reviewBody: This beach is a quick walk from town (ten minutes). The walk was interesting as you go through a cemetery. If you have a golf cart it\'s even easier. We walked. There are no restrooms but I think the water is cleaner versus the main beach with its sewage issues and crowding. For a few dollars we got an umbrella and two chairs as well as a very nice man who would periodically ask if we needed anything. He brought us beer and water as needed. It was mostly Mexican families chilling at the beach and playing so the vibe was very nice.

550949632.name: First photo is wrong
550949632.author: a TripAdvisor user
550949632.reviewBody: The first photo of this is the wrong beach! Playa Los Muertos is definitely not a city beach! It is located right next to the cemetery and a beautiful spot to go relax, especially if you have kids :)

550094327.name: nice beach - chill time
550094327.author: a TripAdvisor user
550094327.reviewBody: I think it is much cleaner than the main Sayulita Beach. Decent for body surfing but be careful!!!!!!!!!

549392197.name: So good, so good
549392197.author: a TripAdvisor user
549392197.reviewBody: This beach is fantastic but can get a little busy, get there super early, rent a chair and umbrella and settle in.

549356795.name: Sharing the place with the deads
549356795.author: a TripAdvisor user
549356795.reviewBody: A long unpaved road leads to this beach, approximately 3km from sayulita. While the turn from the main road (pta sayulita and Playa Los muertos) is visible, a couple of unmarked choices have to be made as you proceed downhill, typically keeping right and descending will take you to the cemetery near the quiet beach (or at least it was in the early morning) I did not find it particularly more attractive than the beaches in Sayulita

548490212.name: Been there
548490212.author: a TripAdvisor user
548490212.reviewBody: Have visited several real times and really enjoy it.  A bit out of the way south of Sayulita.  I have never had anyone from the cemetery bother me.  I think they surf or anything.  Make sure you clean up after yourself and keep the area nice.

545145361.name: A have to walk and visit!
545145361.author: a TripAdvisor user
545145361.reviewBody: A must see is the very decorated cemetery you walk through to get to the locals Playa Los Muertos beach. The locals hang out here more than the crowded beach front of the downtown area. It\'s nice to get away from the crowds! But it\'s small, and they have a roped off area they prefer you swim in for safety. We stay up the road in North beach side we have more to choose from. If your\'e in town, I\'d go here rather than the main beach for sure!

544446084.name: Cool beach
544446084.author: a TripAdvisor user
544446084.reviewBody: Nice off the beaten path beach without the sewage. Better than the main town beach, but you have to know how to get here.

544085023.name: a fun walk
544085023.author: a TripAdvisor user
544085023.reviewBody: def take a walk to this beach... we didn\'t stay long at the beach because we really just wanted a fun walk and I wanted to see the grave yard. i have to say the grave yard it so worth it. grab a michelada and go for a stroll through this place. its so colorful and interesting. when you get to the beach its more secluded. there are no vendors or anything so bring a picnic and chill if that\'s what you are into. it\'s really pretty, and a nice break from the larger more crowded beach

544037535.name: Tranquil beach and surf, not as many people selling trinkets,
544037535.author: a TripAdvisor user
544037535.reviewBody: Not a long walk from town square. Beach is nice and clean. No loud people, music. The surf was calmer too, you could go way out and still touch bottom and not get wiped out by the waves. There were fewer vendors. We were able to get food and drinks while on the beach.

543084697.name: Good spot
543084697.author: a TripAdvisor user
543084697.reviewBody: Worth the walk over!!!! Wish we hadn\'t bothered with the main beach after coming here. Spent a few hours here and had a handful of vendors approach us (unlike getting hassled every few minutes). There are a few people selling food and drinks on the way there, but I would suggest bringing food and drinks with you since there may or may not be someone on the beach (no restaurants). Also felt relatively safe leaving our stuff on the beach while we went in the water (would not on Sayulita beach). The walk through the cemetery is also unique and cool.

541039415.name: The cemetery was the only highlight
541039415.author: a TripAdvisor user
541039415.reviewBody: We decided to check out the hidden gem only to find a smallish, somewhat dirty beach with no facilities. The only reason for two stars was the short drive through the cemetery that is the reason for the name of beach.

540909326.name: Quiet, Calm, Small Beach
540909326.author: a TripAdvisor user
540909326.reviewBody: This beach is nice if you want to get away from the hustle & bustle of Sayulita Beach. Very quiet with not many waves and cool clear water. Bugs can be bad later in the afternoon though so bring bug spray. Also a nice walk South, you will pass the Sayulita Cemetery, which is cool if you have not seen one in Mexico before.

535817347.name: Quiet beach in small cove
535817347.author: a TripAdvisor user
535817347.reviewBody: This is a cleaner alternative to the main Sayulita beach. It\'s somewhat scenic but there are few amenities.

533454464.name: Beautiful beach
533454464.author: a TripAdvisor user
533454464.reviewBody: Finally we arrived at a beach in Sayulita that isn\u2019t rocky, filled with vendors or glass. The beach was clean and lovely to lounge, Once in the water you don\u2019t have to walk all over rocks & it\u2019s not too crowded. Just a 15 min walk from the main beach. Plenty of people willing to rent you an umbrella or sell you a cold drink/snack. Worth visiting.

530377281.name: Beautiful little beach
530377281.author: a TripAdvisor user
530377281.reviewBody: This is the spot to see the sunset just chillin with friends and family in a space with great view and calm water.

525237291.name: Death be Proud
525237291.author: a TripAdvisor user
525237291.reviewBody: Getting to the beach is a trip, as they say. You will be going through mud and jungle and one-car only paths - hang on, it\'s a bumpy ride. Once at the beach be prepared to pay a small gratuity to park and use the restrooms. The cemetery bordering the beach, hence the name \'beach of the dead\', is a treasure of folk art and beliefs. Very cool. The beach itself is rather small but due to its seclusion, not very crowded. Bring a towel and some food & beverage and be sure to clean up after yourself. Enjoy.

524771788.name: Private and fun
524771788.author: a TripAdvisor user
524771788.reviewBody: We wondered if we were headed the right way as you really do walk up and then down a little hill through the cemetery. Had the beach almost to ourselves. So quiet and nice sand. Such a fun swim.

522694225.name: Nice beach!
522694225.author: a TripAdvisor user
522694225.reviewBody: Nice beach! Way better than the main one in sayulita. You have to walk through a cementery to get there, but everyone goes! Really hood to chill and get a sunbathe!

520289245.name: Unexpected trip
520289245.author: a TripAdvisor user
520289245.reviewBody: Again due to the rain, these usual amazing spots were ok. Had a little of a challenge to get here because of the roads , arrived kids loved the water always nice and warm.... and when it began to rain left thinking the roads would worsen, but it\'s a total local recommendation , and worth visiting.... pretty virgin small beach.

516338920.name: A great little beach away from the main crowds
516338920.author: a TripAdvisor user
516338920.reviewBody: Definitely check this beach out. A great spot to take a walk too (there are lots of little tracks up around through this area we used to go for morning runs before it gets too hot)\nA great spot for a dip :)

515722643.name: Great little beach
515722643.author: a TripAdvisor user
515722643.reviewBody: Playa los Muertos is about 15 minutes beyond the main beach in Sayulita and well worth the walk. It\'s smaller, but less frequented, so there\'s more space to swim and sunbathe.

511925628.name: Cool spot
511925628.author: a TripAdvisor user
511925628.reviewBody: We walked over from the main beach, nice reprieve from the overly busy beach. Nice shady spots along the perimeter of the beach.

504224737.name: Hidden beach, away from Sayulita
504224737.author: a TripAdvisor user
504224737.reviewBody: Make sure to spend an afternoon there, away from the crowd in Sayulita. It\'s a 15 minutes walk from the village but you can rent a golf cart to get there. Really peaceful, and cleaner than the beach in Sayulita. BYOB.

504022885.name: Wonderful beach!
504022885.author: a TripAdvisor user
504022885.reviewBody: The water and sand is glittery! It\'s amazing! The tide wasn\'t too crazy so the kids were able to play in the water just fine.

503872648.name: watch out for the campers  & vendors
503872648.author: a TripAdvisor user
503872648.reviewBody: some moderate waves.  not too crowded.  watch out for the campers &vendors both were hitting us up for money.

503732951.name: Hidden and Authentic
503732951.author: a TripAdvisor user
503732951.reviewBody: A must go for a day or afternoon! From the shade trees lining the beach to the naturally shallow waters it is a great spot to visit. The ride in on the golf cart was fun to drive, even with our kids and a stroller in tow. The cemetery and jungle on the way were pretty neat too. Lots of locals and Mexican visitors. Some food and drink options at the "entrance" nothing fancy. Make sure to park where told...or the spirits come out (aka the lady cooking the kabobs will\nmake you pay her)

500525880.name: Relaxing with the familly
500525880.author: a TripAdvisor user
500525880.reviewBody: My family and I spent one week just relaxing in this beach, It is has been one of the most wonderful places we have visited. Beach is clean, not too crowded, you can take your own food there or if you prefer you can buy food and beer from the local restaurants at very reasonable prices. I\'ll definitely come back.

500456456.name: Great beach with a lot to do
500456456.author: a TripAdvisor user
500456456.reviewBody: This is your typical tourist beach. There are always people trying to sell you things as your try to relax and enjoy your margarita or bucket of beers, but other than that, it\'s a great place for everyone, including families. They are daily activities on or near the beach you can do as well as shopping.

497003939.name: Hidden Gem!
497003939.author: a TripAdvisor user
497003939.reviewBody: Don\'t expect anything fancy, but it is a beautiful beach found in a hidden cove. Though it is so close to the main beach it seems like it is far away.  Definitely a place to see!  On land there two ways to get there. The long way which is an adventure through the jungle is a must and then there is a shorter route through the cementary. Both routes are much interesting and fun to try. Make sure to try the crazy pineapple and micheladas from the young man and young lady right at the entrance of the beach!

496527631.name: Heaven on Earth!
496527631.author: a TripAdvisor user
496527631.reviewBody: We stayed at Siete Lunas, up the hill, and Playa de los Muertos was our home beach. We couldn\'t spend enough time there. It is so unique and incredible. It\'s a special place. Right outside the beach, there is a gorgeous cemetery filled with mausoleums. It is interesting to walk around and look at the dates. The families have decorated the cemetery with flowers and candles and photos. It is an experience to have and enjoy. The beach is small and secluded. To the right side, there is another small bay at low tide. It is easy to scramble over those few rocks and enjoy the view and privacy. To the left, is a whole lot of rocks and boulders. My husband and I, being the explorers we are, climbed over them all the way to the end. He fished and I read my book, basking topless in the gorgeous sun. It is somewhat of a physical challenge and can be slippery.  It\'s also very fun to swim out and clamber over the rocks which jut out. My husband had a great time fishing off there. It is so clear and stunning. Another day, we took the stand-up paddleboards from our hotel and paddled out and around, snorkeled and then went across to Sayulita beach, had a couple beers, and paddle boarded back. It isn\'t far and it is so much fun! It was one of the highlights of the trip for me. The beach itself is not too busy. There is a couple of local stands selling beer and fruits. It is simple and relaxed. A perfect way to spend the day!

495492662.name: Great for Just Beach Time
495492662.author: a TripAdvisor user
495492662.reviewBody: We made the trek through the cemetery to get to this beach.  The walk was not long and the cemetery is interesting.  We were pleased there were a couple independent vendors there with drinks and snacks, as we did not plan ahead, but I\'m not sure they are regularly there, so I\'d say it\'s a good pack-up-a-picnic beach spot.  There were more people than I expected from what I read about it. I\'m not one to just sit on the beach for an extended period of time, so I\'m not sure it was worth it for me, but if you like to just park yourself on a beach off the beaten path, it would be worth the visit.

494381923.name: Isolated beach south of town
494381923.author: a TripAdvisor user
494381923.reviewBody: This beach is isolated just south of Sayulata, there are no services be sure to bring your own beach mat, umbrella and food.  The beach and surrounding area are part of an ecological preserve and part of a turtle nesting area.

493419178.name: Chill, swim, enjoy some shade
493419178.author: a TripAdvisor user
493419178.reviewBody: For a peaceful day at the beach with young children Los Muertos offers a safe surf, some trees, and occasional vendors to buy snacks. \nYou can also explore a bit around the rocks.

491246291.name: Nice getaway
491246291.author: a TripAdvisor user
491246291.reviewBody: When things get too crowded on the main beach, head to Playa los Muertos. Its a great spot for families or those that just want a quieter atmosphere. I have often seen local families here that come for a picnic on the beach. \nJust nearby is the town cemetery. If you have not been to a Mexican cemetery it is well worth the few minutes walk from town.

490179362.name: Tourist and Local Haven
490179362.author: a TripAdvisor user
490179362.reviewBody: This beach is always busy and fun - fresh oysters and sometimes fish can be bought for a dime (not literally).  Locals swim in the river mouth which runs into the water.  Lots of beachside restaurants with seating under cover or on the sand under umbrellas.

489436363.name: Lovely beach with a beautiful cemetary
489436363.author: a TripAdvisor user
489436363.reviewBody: Worth the short walk from town to visit this lovely beach and cemetary. This is also a turtle nesting beach.

488295846.name: Fun on the Beach
488295846.author: a TripAdvisor user
488295846.reviewBody: Water was very clean but did not see any public restrooms.\nSand was great and shade trees were available.\nPlenty of families and safe feel to the area.

487055363.name: Best beach ever!!!
487055363.author: a TripAdvisor user
487055363.reviewBody: My favorite in Sayulita! There are fewer people here and it\'s easier to swim and lounge. There can be quite a rip current at times, so be cautious if you are not an experienced swimmer.

486714041.name: 50 pesos to park!?!
486714041.author: a TripAdvisor user
486714041.reviewBody: Small beach, calmer, not too busy...last year you did not have to pay to park. We were met by a very unfriendly woman wearing a fanny pack that demanded 50 pesos to park our cart this year. I have no idea if that is legit or not, she wasn\'t wearing anything official and was not even remotely nice or friendly so we left. Wont\' be back unless on foot - there\'s no way I\'m giving some random person money that I never had to pay before ot park in a dusty unmaintained lot...especially in Mexico, scam if you ask me.

486652814.name: Nice Beach just down from main beach at Sayulita
486652814.author: a TripAdvisor user
486652814.reviewBody: Nice getaway from main beach at Sayilata. Further away from sewer river that flows at main beach. Worth the walk. Less venders pedaling their bracelets and macaroons.

485618855.name: Dusty drive but worth it
485618855.author: a TripAdvisor user
485618855.reviewBody:
We spent the day exploring Sayulita and this beach was our last stop. 

There is an actual cemetery there, hence the name that you can pay a few pesos to tour. Out of respect I didn't photograph any gravesites.

485568743.name: Worth the time
485568743.author: a TripAdvisor user
485568743.reviewBody: It is worth your time to go to the beach here.  Shade and quite make this the place to be.  Weekends will be a little busier but still nothing like the surf beach

484497793.name: Clean quiet beach
484497793.author: a TripAdvisor user
484497793.reviewBody: After visiting Sayulita several times we just discovered playa los Muertos. When you follow Sayulita Beach South you discover the cemetery (Which is pretty interesting) and beyond is the beach.  It is clean and quiet and family oriented.

482458255.name: a little adventure
482458255.author: a TripAdvisor user
482458255.reviewBody: Beach less traveled with calmer water. It is charming and out of the way. Have to pay to park. The cemetery close by is worth checking out.

480969000.name: OK Beach
480969000.author: a TripAdvisor user
480969000.reviewBody: This is a small beach, not too crowded in the morning. We tried snorkeling, but the water was very murky and you couldn\'t see a thing. The currents were also somewhat strong, and it was hard to get out of the water. The beach got busier in the afternoon.

479351371.name: Escaped the waves
479351371.author: a TripAdvisor user
479351371.reviewBody: Smaller and calmer little beach to escape the big waves. Scenic walk to get there. Beach food and beverages available from local venders. No facilities though.  Scenic little bay so it\'s worth visiting. The walk there from Sayulita is half the enjoyment.

479336913.name: Smaller waves, less people
479336913.author: a TripAdvisor user
479336913.reviewBody: This is a small isolated beach few minutes from Sayulita beach. Waves are smaller and its considerably cleaner. But no restaurants and u have to pay 50 pesos for parking. Nice shade from trees

478651559.name: Not as busy, but not as many services nearby
478651559.author: a TripAdvisor user
478651559.reviewBody: It\'s a short walk beyond Villa Amor with less people on the beach, but there aren\'t the same services (e.g. restaurants) nearby. Bring pesos for the bathrooms/showers.

478604975.name: Smaller Beach
478604975.author: a TripAdvisor user
478604975.reviewBody: It is the sister of the main beach of Sayulita. Unless you have a car, bike or golf cart I do not think it would be worth walking all that way to get there. It was nice but we were there during the Easter week and it was so packed you could not find a place to sit.

478567630.name: Very disappointed!
478567630.author: a TripAdvisor user
478567630.reviewBody: No longer secluded and not crowded.... The beach was packed this past Friday and Saturday.  They are charging 50 pesos for parking now, and what used to make this spot great, is no more.

477479619.name: Los Muertos Beach
477479619.author: a TripAdvisor user
477479619.reviewBody: This beach is small, but quieter than the main beach.  I would recommend going in the morning before any vendors get there.  It is a nice walk past Villa Amor and through the cemetery.

474710962.name: Beautiful small beach
474710962.author: a TripAdvisor user
474710962.reviewBody: It is a beautiful beach, but can get crowded very quickly. Be prepared for lots of vendors to come up to about every 10 minutes selling snacks, umbrellas, drinks, and more. It was a short walk from Sayulita and you walk through a cemetery which was kind of cool.

474623989.name: Worth seeing, but don\'t plan to spend the day
474623989.author: a TripAdvisor user
474623989.reviewBody:
This is a smaller beach on the south end of town.  It's in a little cove and the water rushes in and out fairly aggressively.  The swimming area is restricted by buoys for what I'm sure are good reasons.  There are rocks to climb on if you want--we didn't.

The sand is nice and receives the afternoon sun.  There aren't a lot of vendors there compared to Sayulita, but we never mind their activities and usually buy something before we leave.

Good place to spend a few hours in the afternoon.  Don't take much with you.

473929009.name: Disloyal ocean
473929009.author: a TripAdvisor user
473929009.reviewBody: We came here thinking we could safely wade in the ocean. After playing in some safe waves for 5 minutes the ocean just turned on everyone and knocked us out like pins in a bowling alley. It the ocean would calm down I believe this beach would be nice.

472817185.name: Smaller Crowds/Great Swimming Place
472817185.author: a TripAdvisor user
472817185.reviewBody: I loved the unique walk to Playa Los Muertos through the graveyard. When you arrive to the beach, there is less people than the city beach and it is very scenic. I would also add that while I was there, there were many families and children.

472793357.name: quiet getaway from the main beach in Sayulits
472793357.author: a TripAdvisor user
472793357.reviewBody: An easy 5 minute walk from the edge of the beach in Sayulita.  You have to walk through the cemetery which in itself is pretty cool.  Once on the beach there are trees for shade and not very many people

472691180.name: Surfs up cheetos puffs
472691180.author: a TripAdvisor user
472691180.reviewBody:
Muy fuerte.
Getr going feeeaaaasssst! 
VIVAS Y Muertas.  You may choose. 
Float like a boat dont getr water in your throat.
 Fack where's billy?

472180799.name: Nice getaway from Sayulita\'s busy main beach
472180799.author: a TripAdvisor user
472180799.reviewBody: Nice, secluded beach just past the cemetary with roped off swimming area.  No surfers so it\'s good for children.  Some shade under the trees too.

471916986.name: Best beach around
471916986.author: a TripAdvisor user
471916986.reviewBody: A short 15 minute walk on mostly level ground gets you to Hidden Beach, otherwise known as Playa Los Muertos.  Nestled in a small cove past the cemetery (hence the name), this beach has clean water, sparkling white sand, few people, the odd vendor selling snacks and a laid back atmosphere.  Great for getting away from the tourists and craziness in downtown Sayulita.  Our favourite beach north of PV.

471657885.name: Beautiful place
471657885.author: a TripAdvisor user
471657885.reviewBody: no words how to describe the place is amazing clean the sea is calm and is just a relaxing place to enjoy with family

471438964.name: Amazing quiet just minutes from the hubbub of the regular beach
471438964.author: a TripAdvisor user
471438964.reviewBody: Take the 10 minute walk here from downtown (head on road along edge of bay to the south) and enjoy the view, a colorful and active cemetery, and a quiet and very clean beach. Great body surfing, wonderful shade available most of the day, and often vendors selling yummy stuff. No restroom nearby, but there are bushes. :)

471380223.name: CHILL!
471380223.author: a TripAdvisor user
471380223.reviewBody: Nothing but laid back and chill when in Sayulita! Beaches, people, life style is perfect for RNR! Rent a cabana, find an umbrella man and sit back and enjoy the beach!  No jet skis, no parasailing... loads of surfing & boogie boards.

470429162.name: Remote
470429162.author: a TripAdvisor user
470429162.reviewBody: I liked this beach better than the main beaches in Sayulita. There is a wonderful little cemetery nearby, and some trees to offer shade. The hike to the beach on a muddy road added to the adventure.

470404504.name: Beautiful beach but stay out of the water.
470404504.author: a TripAdvisor user
470404504.reviewBody: Sayulita has a bad problem with sewage going into the ocean.  Everyone is getting sick after swimming at the beaches in Sayulita, very sad for this awesome community.

470345848.name: Worth the short walk to this beach
470345848.author: a TripAdvisor user
470345848.reviewBody: This is a nice family oriented beach. It has a life guard and roped off swimming area. There is a food vendor who also sells beer and a couple of people walking on the beach selling food. It has some natural shade as opposed to Sayulita\'s main beach. It\'s an interesting walk through the cemetery. Well worth a visit.

468662663.name: A nice little getaway beach within step steps from town
468662663.author: a TripAdvisor user
468662663.reviewBody: Glad we spent a bit of time here as it was a nice break from the busy setting of the main beach in Sayulita. The water is clear and clean and the rocks are nice to climb as the waves crash in.

468540788.name: Lovely beach
468540788.author: a TripAdvisor user
468540788.reviewBody:
If you walk down the beach road on the south side of the beach, pass Via Amour and take a left just after VI's amour. You will find yourself in a beautiful Mexican cemetery, which in itself is a special experience. Keep following the road and you will arrive at Playa los Muertos.

This little cove breaks the big waves that you sometimes have to struggle with on Sayulita beach. 

It is gaining popularity and is a bit more crowded than in the past, yet so worth it! You can swim and SUP in these mostly calm waters.

Mexicans bring their kids here to learn to swim. 

Enjoy!

468174457.name: Paradise
468174457.author: a TripAdvisor user
468174457.reviewBody: Quiet, serene paradise. No paddlers until 12pm. Get there early and have the slice of heaven all by yourself. Perfect area to swim and relax under the palm trees for some shade. \n\nWill return.

467611038.name: Not Crowded
467611038.author: a TripAdvisor user
467611038.reviewBody: The walk here from town is beautiful. This beach is quiet but still plenty of room for families/small groups of people. The views are breathtaking and there are some fun rocks to climb on. A little smoothie stand is right by the beach, as well. Not for shell pickers...very sandy!

465962497.name: Nice beach
465962497.author: a TripAdvisor user
465962497.reviewBody: This is a very nice beach to get away from the bustle of Sayulita Beach. The water is great for swimming, it\'s clean, and it isn\'t overrun with people.

465340057.name: A day at the beach
465340057.author: a TripAdvisor user
465340057.reviewBody: Went here a couple of times as I had a go cart to zip around in.  Definitely walkable if you don\'t mind the dusty road and cars streaming by you.  Much better with cart to carry an umbrella, chairs, and cooler.\nThe beach was fun and less crowded than Sayulita beach.  Sure, there are vendors coming around here but they don\'t bother you after a simple no thanks.\nI\'d recommend visiting this beach.

464978723.name: Hidden Beach
464978723.author: a TripAdvisor user
464978723.reviewBody: We had a great time wondering thru the colorful and eclectic Sayulita cemetery on our way to this small, "hidden" beach. It was not quite as deserted as I expected, though. Many groups of both locals and visitors had clearly discovered its charm and were enjoying its calmer waters. I was surprised that a lifeguard was also on duty. Worth the trip, for sure, but not as special as I had expected.

464623390.name: Sayulita\'s sleepy sister beach
464623390.author: a TripAdvisor user
464623390.reviewBody: Visiting this beach became a favorite part of our month long stay in Sayulita this past summer. There is a short, scenic walk through a colorful cemetery to reach this sleepy stretch of sand. The water is calmer than the main beach in Sayulita, so it is a nice spot for some lap swimming. There are also fewer beach vendors, in case you grow wearing of the constant peddling in town. But my absolute favorite part of visiting this beach is the ultra-cheap shrimp on a stick and fresh oysters sold by some locals at a make shift stand. Super delicious! (And ate many times without any stomach upset for those wary of street food)

463296847.name: A much quieter, smaller beach than the main one
463296847.author: a TripAdvisor user
463296847.reviewBody: Just south of Villa Amor through the graveyard is a charming beach. You can explore an even smaller beach just north over the rocks. When the waves are up this one is a good bet to still be easily swimmable.

463036434.name: Nice sand here
463036434.author: a TripAdvisor user
463036434.reviewBody: Nice walk to this beach where the sand is actually beach sand and beige in color.  Rocks around this cove and there is a perimeter set up to keep you safe is you go swimming.  Nice walk thru Villa Armor hotel and the cemetery to get here.

463027655.name: Great for swimming!
463027655.author: a TripAdvisor user
463027655.reviewBody: Great, small beach for swimming on south end of Sayulita. Especially good for kids!\nSome local food vendors on site.

461505017.name: Nice beach, water isn\'t as nice as Sayulita
461505017.author: a TripAdvisor user
461505017.reviewBody: This is a nice quiet beach and much safer for young kids, but the water and sand is not as nice as the main Sayulita Beach.

461260945.name: Calm bay good for swimming
461260945.author: a TripAdvisor user
461260945.reviewBody: Playa log Muertos is a great beach to go for a swim as it is generally calm and protected from the big swells.

461027627.name: Sweet beach
461027627.author: a TripAdvisor user
461027627.reviewBody: This beach is nice, it has a roped odd swim area. It\'s relaxing & the waves aren\'t as big as they are on some other local beaches. Just a short walk from town.

459187167.name: Great Swimming Beach
459187167.author: a TripAdvisor user
459187167.reviewBody: If you are visiting Sayulita, take a short walk to Playa los Muertos.  You will walk past an interesting grave yard (hence the name of the beach).  This beach is less crowded and does not have all the vendors.  The waters are calm and good for swimming.  If you have young children who might be afraid of the waves - this is a great beach for kids.

458190962.name: Quiet and Quaint
458190962.author: a TripAdvisor user
458190962.reviewBody: We much preferred Playa los Muertos to the much busier and crowded Sayulita Beach. If you\'re looking to lounge and read a book - Playa los Muertos is a much more pleasant beach. The views are beautiful as well. Quick tip: there are no chair/umbrella rentals here, so pack your towels/chairs/blanket or whatever you prefer. We also grabbed a small cheap cooler in town and packed it with waters and beer.

457477922.name: My favorite beach for swimming
457477922.author: a TripAdvisor user
457477922.reviewBody: I\'ve been to Sayulita many times and this is my favorite beach cos it\'s more quiet than the central beach, it\'s less populated at all times of day and there are fewer vendors. It\'s better for swimming cos there are smaller waves and I think the quality of the water is better, since it\'s more isolated. There\'s lots of rocks around if you like walking or sitting on them and watching the ocean. Los Muertos is just a 5 or 10 minute walk from downtown Sayulita and the view all along is fantastic. I always carry a bottle of water and something to eat, cos there are no restaurants around. Take a book and enjoy a good read lying on the sand.

456222122.name: A short walk from town to a less busy beach
456222122.author: a TripAdvisor user
456222122.reviewBody: This beach was just a 10 min walk from the main beach.  Easy to find, quiet and less busy.  Be sure to take your own water and food as there is none available.  Great for swimming!!

456014050.name: Awesome Beach!
456014050.author: a TripAdvisor user
456014050.reviewBody: It\'s a quiet beach and its excellent option if you want to take the sun in Sayulita, they don\'t allow surfers and the atmosphere is amazing, you need to walk through a cemetery but  its a short walk.

455093689.name: Fewer Crowds
455093689.author: a TripAdvisor user
455093689.reviewBody: walk away from the hustle and business to a quieter place.     The main beaches are busy and crowded with people, vendors.

454631703.name: Worth the short walk!
454631703.author: a TripAdvisor user
454631703.reviewBody: This small beach is a great spot to hang out!  The water is nice and good for swimming.  There are way less tourists and far fewer beach sales people bugging you over here.  There isn\'t much for drinks available so pack a cooler or bring a bevy.

453242224.name: Calm beach
453242224.author: a TripAdvisor user
453242224.reviewBody: We went to the Playa de los Muertos three times. It is not a busy beach. There are still many people going there to have a nice quite day. Most people are local families who come for a picnic and let the children play safely.

450504469.name: Lovely Spot
450504469.author: a TripAdvisor user
450504469.reviewBody: This beach is smaller and much quieter than the main beach in town and is well worth a visit. The waves are a bit smaller and the swimming is great. There are no facilities here, though a vender does sell some drinks. We loved our afternoon here - bring some food and drink and stay the day!

450494549.name: Relaxing and uncrowded
450494549.author: a TripAdvisor user
450494549.reviewBody: Perfect spot with easy swimming. Not may venture out here, even though it is an easy walk from town. So the beach is uncrowded and the views are awesome.

449864975.name: Great Beach
449864975.author: a TripAdvisor user
449864975.reviewBody: I almost hate to give away the secret to this hidden gem.  Go ahead and let the name scare you away, please. But if it does not, walk through the most colorful cemetery (that I have ever seen) and enjoy this beautiful little beach with shade and great surf.

448306994.name: Good if you want a quiet beach with no facilities.
448306994.author: a TripAdvisor user
448306994.reviewBody: We walked over the hill, through the cemetery to Playa los Muertos.  It is a cute little beach and a lot quieter than Sayulita. Probably would have been a good place to escape the crowds between Christmas and New Years.  We were there fairly late in the day so it is possible there was some food and drinks available, but I don\'t think so.  Didn\'t see the appeal of the cemetery which seemed to be to be just scruffy and rundown.

447840356.name: Quiet yet beautiful and refreshing.
447840356.author: a TripAdvisor user
447840356.reviewBody: Playa los muertos is a 5 minute walk away from Sayulita beach and is a really nice place if you want to get away from the busy main part of town. Also if you are a bit more adventurous, there is a cliff jumping spot that is really cool.

447644091.name: Small Friendly Beach
447644091.author: a TripAdvisor user
447644091.reviewBody: This is a small beach located at the southern end of Sayulita. To get there you walk from town, through Fisherman\'s Beach, by some hotels. You will follow a small dirt road, up a small incline through the cemetery. \nWhen we were there, there was one food stand selling skewers and beverages. There also was also an ice cream man. There are bathrooms for a few pesos.\n

447641103.name: HappycOuple20
447641103.author: a TripAdvisor user
447641103.reviewBody: This beach is small, but very lovely. The walk there is simple. The trip through the cemetery is not to be missed. Our party seemed to be hassled to buy good much less on the beach. Highly recommend!

447568141.name: off the beaten path
447568141.author: a TripAdvisor user
447568141.reviewBody: This beach is a great alternative to the main sayulita beach. It is about a 15-20 minute walk from the main beach and you go up a small hill through a colorful cemetary. It is barely crowded on a busy day at the main sayulita beach. It is best to bring your own snacks and drinks since there is only one food and drink stand as you walk onto the beach.

447530483.name: The quiet beach
447530483.author: a TripAdvisor user
447530483.reviewBody: Definitely make the trek to this beach if you want to escape the chaos of Sayulita beach. You\'ll still have a few vendors trying to sell to you, but nothing like the other beach. The rock formations are beautiful and fun to hike around.

445665434.name: Skip the main beach
445665434.author: a TripAdvisor user
445665434.reviewBody: Make sure ot find this hidden  beach and skip the main beach.  I enjoyed it alot better than the main one when wanting to chill.  The main one was fun to have cocktails and watch the surfers.

443411796.name: Not so great
443411796.author: a TripAdvisor user
443411796.reviewBody: We heard all these great reviews and it didn\'t look much nicer than Sayulita beach. The cemetery walk was interesting but a little trashy. Done once not again

443384025.name: Relax
443384025.author: a TripAdvisor user
443384025.reviewBody: Great walk from downtown. It was Interesting new part of town, through the cemetery which in of it self was worth seeing. People are nice, less vendors and more space than the main beach.

442870322.name: Perfect swimming beach !
442870322.author: a TripAdvisor user
442870322.reviewBody: A nice walk to this little Gem ! You pass through a cemetery ( which is a must see , especially around the day of the dead !)  A great place to get away from the vendors and have a nice swim . It has a lot of shade which is great on those hot days !

441431507.name: Favorite Swimming Beach!
441431507.author: a TripAdvisor user
441431507.reviewBody: South side of Sayulita walk through the cemetery and your there. Great place for those of us that don\'t like big waves! Fun cove for kids and adults.

441374575.name: Nice Swimming Beach
441374575.author: a TripAdvisor user
441374575.reviewBody: Just a short walk on the road that runs southwest along the beach then over a small saddle that has the colorful graveyard along both sides, you come to this beach.  Smaller waves, smaller crowds, no boats.  Nice place

441229389.name: Sweet beach, quieter than Sayulita
441229389.author: a TripAdvisor user
441229389.reviewBody: Spent a morning here, good swimming area. You can set your chairs up under the trees to protect from sun.  Parking is very limited, 100 pesos cash.

440422727.name: A quiet place to enjoy the beach at Sayulita
440422727.author: a TripAdvisor user
440422727.reviewBody: If you\'re looking to get away from the crowds on the main beach then this is the place to go. Head on south from town on the road just above the beach, past Villa Amor and on up the hill to the graveyard (hence the name of the beach) keeping straight on and down the other side to reach the beach in a few minutes.\n\nBring some water and you can probably leave the umbrella behind since there is plenty of shade. The rocks off to the left a ways off have a few fish if you are comfortable snorkelling out a ways. That\'s probably all you need to know... enjoy!

439166176.name: My go to beach in Sayulita
439166176.author: a TripAdvisor user
439166176.reviewBody: If you want to go to a beach that is less crowded, more scenic as well as untouched, clearer water and has some shade, look no further. Didnt bother with the main beach once I found this gem. Although the walk is a little further, the scenery on the way makes up for it. Unfortunately not a beach for surfing.

439134142.name: Our quiet oasis.
439134142.author: a TripAdvisor user
439134142.reviewBody: Beautiful, private beach a short walk from town centre. No amenities though sometimes a small stand set up with cervasa, water and fruit or veg. Better swimming than main town beach. Very peaceful.

437664392.name: great for kids
437664392.author: a TripAdvisor user
437664392.reviewBody: this is quiet beach with no waves, the color of the water is nicer too, there are food vendors on the beach and pretty rocks for pictures.  Playa los Muertos  because it is by the cemetary, but it is not creepy

437105483.name: safe
437105483.author: a TripAdvisor user
437105483.reviewBody: This is a safe place to swim in Sayulita with few waves and a life guard.  We enjoyed seeing the colorful local cemetery nearby and there are beautiful jungle hikes on the roads surrounding this beach.

436261462.name: A great escape from main beach
436261462.author: a TripAdvisor user
436261462.reviewBody: I loved the beach as it was quiet and a nice walk to reach.  Best BBQ\'d shrimp but only Friday, Saturday and Sunday.

435531572.name: Normal, but beautiful beach (Including beach cemetary)
435531572.author: a TripAdvisor user
435531572.reviewBody: During our stay in Sayulita we made a walk to this beach. Before you enter the beach there is an impressive cemetary in the forest/beach side. This makes this beach really special and beautiful

433036154.name: Smaller beach short walk from town
433036154.author: a TripAdvisor user
433036154.reviewBody: This is the beach where I did all my swimming.  Clean beach, sandy bottom, good shade.  There is a nice smaller beach to the north after a little scramble over the rocks.  Watch for pelicans, frigatebirds and the occasional blue-footed boobie to fly over.\n\nWalk to the far south end of the main beach and take the road through villa amor resort , go left up the hill through the cemetery and the beach is to your right on the other side of the hill.  I recommend walking but there is parking in a little lot for $$ - can\'t remember how much.  No bathrooms.  A lifeguard stand though we never saw it manned since it was low season - october.  There were some vendors at entrance selling drinks and on the weekend some sort of meats/mariscos on a stick were being sold.

432191034.name: Beautiful quiet beach
432191034.author: a TripAdvisor user
432191034.reviewBody: This place is quiet and tucked away. Amazing place to sit and relax! Hidden behind Villa Amor a short walk form the main beach at Playa Sayulita.

420286336.name: Beautiful beach
420286336.author: a TripAdvisor user
420286336.reviewBody: Beautiful beach with cozy company hidden between rocks. Every time we visit Sayulita, we need to go to this beach as it is one of our favorites from the area.

418675568.name: Beautiful hidden beach
418675568.author: a TripAdvisor user
418675568.reviewBody: Tropical beach you hike through a cemetery to find! Warm calm water. Lovely and worth a visit.  The beach looks like a Hawaiian hidden beach.

415760712.name: Smaller quieter and more beautiful
415760712.author: a TripAdvisor user
415760712.reviewBody: than Sayulita Beach. Still have people selling stuff. but the shrimp lady is actually cooking the shrimp on the stick right there so you can feel rest assured that its fresh and yummy :) This beach also has a designated swimming area and security. Very mellow vibe there

414271593.name: Best!
414271593.author: a TripAdvisor user
414271593.reviewBody: The beach was super nice! Quite and clean!\nYou can find easy shadow if you get tired of the sun.\nIs 20 minutes walk, and there is no shops, no water, no food to buy, so be prepared! Is worth it!

408518181.name: Relaxed isolated beach for swimming
408518181.author: a TripAdvisor user
408518181.reviewBody: Located 15 minutes walking from Sayulita beach, this isolated beach is not too crowded (comparing to the Sayulita beach), quiet and perfect for swimming. Just make sure to bring with you enough water!

406394376.name: The Other Beach in Town
406394376.author: a TripAdvisor user
406394376.reviewBody: This quiet little beach is just outside of town by the cemetery.  There are a lot less waves, which made it perfect for for families.  There is an outdoor shower for rinsing, and normally a few people selling fruit and coconuts.  It\'s a calm alternative when Sayulita beach feels too busy.

405382204.name: Family Vacation
405382204.author: a TripAdvisor user
405382204.reviewBody: what a hidden gem for taking your family to go out on the beach in Sayulita, locals found it years ago and nobody trying to sell you items on the beach.

400469622.name: Not Crowded and near dowtown swiming beach
400469622.author: a TripAdvisor user
400469622.reviewBody:
Is really easy to get there and is really nice,
Is not as crowded as Sayulita's main beach, besides you get to take a look at a kinky cemetery.
When you get to the beach you get the chance to find some natural shaded spots.
Also the beach is great for swimming, there are no surfers there nor big waves

400098230.name: Chill beach, great snacks
400098230.author: a TripAdvisor user
400098230.reviewBody: This little beach is an amazing swimming spot (waves are gentle) with some really amazing vendors (cocos y pinas, grilled mahi mahi and fruit). One of our favorite beaches, worth the short hike to get to.

387569108.name: We rented a golf cart from my town golf carts for the day. We saw a lot and had a great time.
387569108.author: a TripAdvisor user
387569108.reviewBody: We went to the hidden beach and there were only a handful of people. For lunch we went to Don Pedros and had a great lunch with a fantastic view.

387114348.name: Perfect place for a break
387114348.author: a TripAdvisor user
387114348.reviewBody: I loved this beach.  Quiet and relaxing, nice break from the main beach and all the surf lessons.  The pineapples sold at the entrance are not to be missed!

386117712.name: Quiet and peaceful.
386117712.author: a TripAdvisor user
386117712.reviewBody: Right around the corner from our place at Villa Amor and through a  spectacular cemetary is this hidden beach.  The beach is cleaner than Sayulita\'s public beach.  While there were a couple of venders, it was otherwise quiet, with one stand with great beach food and beverages.  We spent two days here, and there were maybe only 15 or 20 people there at it\'s peak.  We had the whole beach to ourselves for nearly 2 hours early.

384565211.name: The nice beach in Sayulita
384565211.author: a TripAdvisor user
384565211.reviewBody: A bit out of town, reachable by a 15 min walk or by car, the most scenic and cleanest beach the town has to offer. No food service, bring your own.

384347881.name: Not at all what we expected
384347881.author: a TripAdvisor user
384347881.reviewBody: The surf was very rough and undertow made swimming almost impossible but was not crowded at all. I consider myself a very good swimmer and I was not match for the surf so please use caution. We were not able to enjoy your typical beach setting. Sayulita Beach, although more crowded, seemed more suitable for swimming, although we did not swim at that beach.

381264620.name: Quiet, clean and shade!
381264620.author: a TripAdvisor user
381264620.reviewBody: Quiet, guarded swim beach.  Easy to swim over to see fish in the nearby rocks.  Tasty grilled food in the parking lot!

379746436.name: Cute small little beach, great for kids
379746436.author: a TripAdvisor user
379746436.reviewBody:
This is a small little beach that is perfect for families, children, and puerile who just don't want waves.  It's even roped off in the water to ensure those swimming mind the boundaries.  

It is pretty darn small so it can get a bit crowded with not much effort but I didn't feel to overwhelmed. A lot of locals,  more than tourists. I believe there were security officers at the entry from the road and I'm not too sure why as the other beaches in the areas always felt pretty safe.  They were friendly and not at all intimidating so that was all good and dandy.  

This area is kind of a small bay with rocky areas to the left and right side of the swimming areas. My husband and another local were trying their hand at fishing from the rocks but no successful catches. It was fun to hang out and try though.  

There is a very beautiful and interesting small community graveyard just a few feet from the road. These cemeteries are very different from the ones in the US and I was fascinated as I very respectfully walked through the cemetery to see the love, respect, beauty and honor surrounding loved ones who had passed. It was getting to be sundown and several families were there to light candles on the Graves. Very beautiful.  

You can get to the beach driving from the hills of Sayulita....if you look closely there are spray painted signs on wood planks kind of pointing the way.  Or,  you can walk from the main beach of sayulita and past villa amor until you get to the cemetery then hang a right and within 5-10 minutes you'll be at the beach.  Enjoy! 

Oh! And PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE dispose of your trash in the appropriate receptacles! Even if it means you walk back to town with it! If you pack it in, you can surely pack it back out.

374878846.name: beautiful family beach
374878846.author: a TripAdvisor user
374878846.reviewBody: This beach is less crowded than Sayulita beach, and the waves are much calmer for children to play/swim in

373725166.name: small and intimate
373725166.author: a TripAdvisor user
373725166.reviewBody: Walk throught eh cemetery to the beach and find that there is a place for locals and visitors to mingle.  Lovely food on sticks and cool coconuts.  Nice water temp and a cleaner environment that at Sayulita Beach

372625730.name: Pristine
372625730.author: a TripAdvisor user
372625730.reviewBody: Amazing beach south of town hidden by a beautiful cemetery. Be respectful, enjoy the safe quiet swimming area. There is usually a minimum drink vendor. You may have this beach to yourself. Just ask locals for the beach of the dead and they will point the way.

369682652.name: Gorgeous
369682652.author: a TripAdvisor user
369682652.reviewBody: Great beach, worth the short trek out of town for calmer surf and significantly fewer people. There was also a small vendor there with fresh fruit bows, drinks, etc. Still be sure to pack your own water and snacks. And remember there\'s no dedicated restroom nearby.

369310993.name: Great Little Beach as Main Beach Alternate
369310993.author: a TripAdvisor user
369310993.reviewBody: Playa los Muertos was the first beach I visited in Sayulita. It\'s a perfect swim beach for the family, or a nice quiet place to enjoy some relaxation away from the crowds of the main beach. Although there\'s no wave for surfing, it\'s a great spot to set out for a paddle board. Also, there are ample shade areas if you don\'t have an umbrella and need a little cover. It\'s an easy walk from town, or there\'s a decent sized parking area just over the hill from the cemetery.

367985650.name: Dreamy
367985650.author: a TripAdvisor user
367985650.reviewBody: Beautiful clear little beach with a minimum of vendors. Make sure to take the road by Villa Amor, which is at least 3x quicker than whatever back road I wandered in from! If you do happen to be on the back road, rest assured that the sketchy-looking spray painted signs pointing you to the beach are telling the truth.

367841404.name: Nice change of pace
367841404.author: a TripAdvisor user
367841404.reviewBody: We have gone to this beach every time we visit Sayulita and it is always pleasant and never very crowded.  The cemetery  is also very interesting .  The road is pretty steep in places but easily managed with a golf cart.

367618886.name: Great place during the week
367618886.author: a TripAdvisor user
367618886.reviewBody: Lovely quaint beach just past Villa Amore in Sayulita.  Too crowded during the weekend but lovely during the week

367513678.name: It is a real dream
367513678.author: a TripAdvisor user
367513678.reviewBody: Playa Los Muertos is a real paradise, we could swim like a children  is like a big pool. The water is clean, is a certified beach for Environment Office in Mexico. It is a little long distance from the hotel but it was worth it. Not to be missed

366951859.name: Playa los Muertos is muertos
366951859.author: a TripAdvisor user
366951859.reviewBody: Over-rated. Crowded, loud, not what I was led to believe. Lots of families, small crowded spaces, barbeque everywhere - I would recommend a more remote beach instead.

365806273.name: Good for swimming, Clean water.
365806273.author: a TripAdvisor user
365806273.reviewBody: Worth the walk from town to this little beach with clean sand and swimmable water. Bring drinking water and food, there is little there.

365796877.name: A nice alternate to the main beach
365796877.author: a TripAdvisor user
365796877.reviewBody: Playa los Muertos is an easy walk from town, and while it sounds like a risky, wild adventure to "walk on the dirt road through the cemetery" it\'s really just a close by alternative to the busier main beach in Sayulita. We were travelling with kids ages 9 & 11, and simply streamlined the gear down to towels and water to make the trek. The beach was nice, very few vendors selling, and overall less commotion. The waves were still kid friendly, and we found it to be a fun change of pace for a day.

365756027.name: Canadian couple at cemetery beach
365756027.author: a TripAdvisor user
365756027.reviewBody: Nice beach. Guy cooks shrimp on the barbecue. Sells beer and drinks. Not busy at all. Cemetery located in the jungle right at the entrance to the beach. Freaky at first. 5 minute walk to sayulita.

363775751.name: Shhhhhh. Don\'t tell anybody.
363775751.author: a TripAdvisor user
363775751.reviewBody: This beach is so much quieter and cleaner than Sayulita public beach, and only a short walk away. Walk through the Amor Hotel compound, and the cemetery, straight to the beach.

363394436.name: Excellent beach away from the hustle and bustle!
363394436.author: a TripAdvisor user
363394436.reviewBody: Los Muertos used to be kind of a secret. Not so much anymore but still a great place to get away from the crowded beaches of Sayulita. We have been is Sayulita for 15 years and this is where we hang with family and friends. Much cleaner waters, safer swimming, cleaner beach, and as nice walk from town. Enjoy!

363171394.name: The Peoples Beach in Puerto Vallarta
363171394.author: a TripAdvisor user
363171394.reviewBody: Playa los muertos is one of the best public beaches in the area where all sorts of travelers come together as one to enjoy the ocean. The calm waves and soft sand make it a nice spot for Families,Couples, Friends, Seniors. The Beach is fairly big so youre likely to find a spot that meet your needs. Within a block or two you will find all sorts of shops selling you beach wear, Sunscreen, snacks, drinks. On the beach itself youll find vendors catering to your beach needs. Its centrally located and near most attractions.

362540585.name: Great for people watching
362540585.author: a TripAdvisor user
362540585.reviewBody: There are lots of other beaches with better sand and surf.  This is the beach where all the action is.  Lots of bars and restaurants.  You pay a little more for being on the beach.  Great walking beach.

361680368.name: Must see beach
361680368.author: a TripAdvisor user
361680368.reviewBody: Getting to this beach is half the fun! Rent a golf car, and head over the hill to this quiet beach. On your way enjoy beautiful views of the ocean and enter the gorgeous Villa Amor hotel grounds. Then you head to the cemetery which is colorful and peaceful. Once you get to the secret Los Muertos beach enjoy some fresh BBQ shrimp and coconut juice and chill in the sun or under the shade of a tree:)

361589851.name: this is the place...
361589851.author: a TripAdvisor user
361589851.reviewBody: forget the main beach.  come here.  grab a shaded spot under the trees.  run into the water! Hungry?  fish or shrimp on a stick or cut up fruit cup, beer, coconut, snack vendors selling chips.  Bored?  take a hike over the rocks (north) and check out the smaller "hidden" beach; watch the kids courageously jump off cliffs into the water!

361337565.name: Awesome Little Beach
361337565.author: a TripAdvisor user
361337565.reviewBody: Nice beach - not too crowded.  AWESOME snacks sold by local vendors on the beach - get the pineapple filled with cut up fruit and rum.  There are also people selling necklaces/nick-nacks but they aren\'t pushy or intrusive.

360775509.name: Beautiful quiet location
360775509.author: a TripAdvisor user
360775509.reviewBody: A lot quieter than the main beach. We were very surprised how few people visit this beautiful bay! It\'s a quick 5 minute walk from Villa Amor

359396836.name: Smaller calmer than Sayulita beach
359396836.author: a TripAdvisor user
359396836.reviewBody: The walk over to Playa los Muertos winds thru a small cemetery which is very interesting. The beach is smaller, some snorkeling there if the water isn\'t too choppy. The current isn\'t as strong as it is on the main beach and there were always fewer people.

359096431.name: Los Muertos - More shade and fun for kids
359096431.author: a TripAdvisor user
359096431.reviewBody: If you have a golf cart or are into going a little further, this beach wasn\'t as busy. More shade for kids and we enjoyed the grilled fish / shrimp on a stick. Kids had a blast at this beach.

358844496.name: Watch the surfers
358844496.author: a TripAdvisor user
358844496.reviewBody: We spent an afternoon sitting under an umbrella having a very pleasant lunch and watching the surfers.  The surfers provided great entertainment.  If you order food and drinks the establishments along the beach provide you with shelter from the sun. Many have a minimum amount you must spend.

357950377.name: Worth the Short Walk
357950377.author: a TripAdvisor user
