357950377.reviewBody: A few minutes walk form the bustle of Sayulita\'s main beach, past the cemetery is this hidden little gem.  A much quieter beach with a nice shaded area under some palm trees.  A few vendors sell good food and drink all within easy reach of your beach chair!

357627918.name: Cool Beach
357627918.author: a TripAdvisor user
357627918.reviewBody: The water is calmer with less waves. Good family beach, and it is quieter than sayulita\'s beach it is next to the cemetery.

356847166.name: Better alternative to the main beach
356847166.author: a TripAdvisor user
356847166.reviewBody: This beach is far better than the main one in Sayulita as it\'s smaller and calmer. The walk here is enjoyable enough, too.

356803003.name: Small nice beach
356803003.author: a TripAdvisor user
356803003.reviewBody: To avoid all the tourists on Sayulita beach, just walk a short bit to visit Playa los Muertos.  You can buy food/drink from a local vendor and enjoy a much quieter day at the beach.

355799089.name: Great local beach worth the search
355799089.author: a TripAdvisor user
355799089.reviewBody: You\'ll never have the experience of walking through a cemetery to get to a beach, but this is worth it.

355129154.name: The only beach in Sayulita where you can almost always swim safely
355129154.author: a TripAdvisor user
355129154.reviewBody: It\'s a pleasant walk up through the cemetery and down again, and well worth the trip. (Most of the other beaches are too dangerous to even get in up to your knees.) It\'s a small beach with plenty of trees for shade, and usually someone selling bbq shrimp or coconuts or fruit with lime and chill. What a delight!\nI know they look ridiculous, but those backpack chairs that a lot of people carry to the beach are really practical and comfortable.

354995446.name: Great beach..
354995446.author: a TripAdvisor user
354995446.reviewBody: I loved going to Playa Los Muertos!  It has beautiful sand and there are shade (so it\'s great for children.)  it\'s fine to go there when the washes are small,  but note that they crash very closely from the beach (so it might not be the best place to swim.)  Also be careful when the Wave are really big!  I once got washed by a 10foot wave and scraped pretty badly my shoulder..  With that being said,  a great place to relax when small waves!

354342031.name: Great beach!
354342031.author: a TripAdvisor user
354342031.reviewBody: Great beach to chill out at, and avoid the craziness of the main beach in Sayulita...where there are tons of people, vendors trying to hawk everything to you, and minimal room to put your stuff without infringing on beachside restaurant space.

353621851.name: Cute beach with beautiful scenery. Great for families
353621851.author: a TripAdvisor user
353621851.reviewBody: We walked here in a few minutes from our house and it was only a fraction of the time along the beach past the cemetery from Sayulita Beach. It is a calm cove with shade and lots of food walking by for sale. A lot of families with small children had a  great day in the gentle ocean.

351455310.name: The place to escape the waves
351455310.author: a TripAdvisor user
351455310.reviewBody: The walk from Sayulita to this peach is amazing! Go along the coastal path, and pass through the graveyard. It\'s very scenic.\nThe beach itself is small and sand is average, but the waves and very calm and probably the safest place to swim.  A lot of people who are turned off by the strong waves find redeeming qualities in Sayulita by going here.

351195943.name: "busy beach"
351195943.author: a TripAdvisor user
351195943.reviewBody: this is the place with the activity.  A beautiful pier is here too to take the water taxi or watch for dolphins and whales.  numerous bars and restaurants. on the boardwalk.

350998270.name: Wonderful beach near a grave yard
350998270.author: a TripAdvisor user
350998270.reviewBody: This is a magical quieter beach than the main Beach.  Safe snorkeling. I saw a puffer fish and many around rocks. The grave yard is amazing but please be respectful this is still used and many recent graves.

349637666.name: lovely beach
349637666.author: a TripAdvisor user
349637666.reviewBody: This beach is quieter, on weekends there are some local food vendors and sellers, but on weekdays just a few swimmers and surfers. I think they are rare but I did get stung by a sting ray - shuffling in the water is a good way to avoid them apparently.

349456119.name: Beautiful hidden gem
349456119.author: a TripAdvisor user
349456119.reviewBody: A short walk from Sayulita\'s main drag, Playa los Muertos is a lovely and quiet hideaway from the crowds.

348152789.name: Gentle beach - walking distance from town
348152789.author: a TripAdvisor user
348152789.reviewBody: Nice small beach with a more gentle break than the main Sayulita beach.  Great food and beverage vendors make life easy.

348048820.name: The best beach for families with young children, in Sayulita.
348048820.author: a TripAdvisor user
348048820.reviewBody: This beach is the best place to bring your young children, if you are staying in Sayulita.  The waves are not so steep, and this is a much safer location for swimming.  There is often a lifeguard on duty, and though I would not recommend sending the little ones off into the surf on their own, if you go out with them (a lifejacket is always an easy way of securing their safety) you will likely not be bowled over by huge surf.  \nThe beach itself is very sunny, but also offers shady areas back towards the hill for those seeking a cooler location.  \nWe went to this beach several times during our Sayulita vacation, and our grandkids thoroughly enjoyed every moment at Playa los Muertos.

347735777.name: Nice little beach. Quieter than main beach in Sayulita
347735777.author: a TripAdvisor user
347735777.reviewBody: Clean quiet beach. Short scenic walk down avengeda pescadora past villa a more.Less waves. Good shady areas.

347134399.name: the yoga class was having a group hug there, but no actual hugging.
347134399.author: a TripAdvisor user
347134399.reviewBody: i just ran by one morning, having heard that it was "suitable for young children".  it probably is.  a two-dozen or so participants in a yoga class (or something which LOOKED and felt like what i imagine yoga to be) was having a session there.  probably good place for it.  but you have to go thru\' the (interesting in itself) cemetery to get there.

346943008.name: Our favorite Sayulita Beach
346943008.author: a TripAdvisor user
346943008.reviewBody: This was our favorite beach spot in Sayulita for a few reasons.... Gorgeous, quieter during the week (though very busy on Sunday), more of a local presence, fewer vendors, and calmer waters.  Definitely check it out during your stay...

346552393.name: Nice spot
346552393.author: a TripAdvisor user
346552393.reviewBody: A great alternative to the regular beaches in Sayulita. We wwre here when busy and not so busy...I prefer the not so busy, buy, hey! The waves can still kick yourbutt here, but its a clean, small and secluded spot.

346240071.name: Beautiful spot - comfortable swim
346240071.author: a TripAdvisor user
346240071.reviewBody: Nice short walk from downtown passing through the local cemetery.  The waves in this area a calmer than the beach in town.  Walking through the cemetery is also very interesting.

344646874.name: An inviting contrast to the main beach in town
344646874.author: a TripAdvisor user
344646874.reviewBody: We finally spent an afternoon at this beach, having intended to on previous trips but never quite managing it. We were somewhat disappointed that the waves were as high as they were as some reviews suggest that people snorkel here, but we couldn\'t imagine that with the surf we has this winter. Still, the beach action - kids playing in the waves, adults body surfing, a couple practicing tight rope, and a few lazy dogs -was more than enough to charm us between chapters of our latest books. We are usually cautious about vendors but we were thrilled by the three types of coconut cookies we purchased from one, the perfect afternoon snack! And don\'t forget to visit the cemetery which gives the beach its name; we don\'t have such "pantheons" in Canada.

344156444.name: Usually a Quieter Beach in Sayulita
344156444.author: a TripAdvisor user
344156444.reviewBody: Playa los Muertos is a smaller beach than the main Sayulita beach, accessible by a couple of routes south of town.  You can go along the beachside road past Villa Amor and through the cemetery, or you can go up Ninos Heroes and follow the dirt road down.  The waves are usually smaller and calmer than in town, although you can certainly experience quite large waves and a heavy undertow at Los Muertos as well, depending on the day and the tide.  The crowds are smaller and you don\'t get people coming up to sell you stuff here.  However, it does get busy nonetheless.  It\'s usually very quiet before noon and there\'s quite a bit of shade to sit in.  There is a good safe place for kids to paddle in at the back of the beach and there are a couple of stands selling coconuts and other food.  Definitely quieter overall than in town.

344089171.name: out of the way beach
344089171.author: a TripAdvisor user
344089171.reviewBody: Watch the high tide -- it takes up most of the beach.  Cold fresh coconuts was a real treat for sale right there

343758677.name: Quiet beach
343758677.author: a TripAdvisor user
343758677.reviewBody: If you are looking to get away from the crowds and the beach vendors, this is the place. A short walk from town we had this whole beach to ourselves.

343041284.name: Shade
343041284.author: a TripAdvisor user
343041284.reviewBody: Los Meurtos Beach in Sayulita is a lovely hidden beach with less surf and more shade. Walk past Villa Amor and through a very interesting cemetery and there it is.  There were food vendors ther but no other services.

339285002.name: Lovely walk to a great beach
339285002.author: a TripAdvisor user
339285002.reviewBody: Take the 10min walk through Villa Amor & up over the small hill to Playa Los Muertos. You walk through a traditional Mexican cemetery & during Day of the Dead it was a sight to see. You arrive at a small, clean beach with a lifeguard (when on duty) & shady trees to sit under. \n\nThere is a local family selling cold drinks & cooking seafood & chicken skewers for lunch. There are no toilet/showers. It is a protected beach surrounded by jungle. There is a roped off area to swim in & no boats/jet skies. Although it was relatively quite when we were there it is popular with families so can get busy.

337613010.name: Nice Walk
337613010.author: a TripAdvisor user
337613010.reviewBody: When things get busy in town hike over to los Muertos . It has nice swim area and they have a food stand with beer and seafood .

337542213.name: Best Swimming Beach in Sayulita
337542213.author: a TripAdvisor user
337542213.reviewBody:
If you're looking for a calmer beach break with generally less chaos, head over to Playa los Muertos. It's about a ten minute walk from the beach and you get to walk through a beautiful hotel (hotel villa amor) and a cemetery to get there (which in itself is kind of cool). 

The beach itself is a bit more sheltered from the wave break and it  mostly has a lifeguard on duty. Note: We went two times to this beach (once on new year's day and once after) and be warned that this beach can get very crowded during Mexican holidays but it clears out really nicely after that. 

Pro tip: Make your way back from this beach to Villa Amor for happy hour. They serve you two drinks at a time for the price of one! :)

336747805.name: Good beach
336747805.author: a TripAdvisor user
336747805.reviewBody: This is the good beach in Puerto Vallarta, not so big waves as in Sayulita, so you can lay and relax here!

335809970.name: Busier than it used to be, but still a reasonable place to swim and play.
335809970.author: a TripAdvisor user
335809970.reviewBody: Vendors and life guards are now on this beach, too.  But its worth going just for the walk through either the local cemetery or jungle routes.

334313258.name: Secluded beach
334313258.author: a TripAdvisor user
334313258.reviewBody: Ready to take a break from surfing and lounge quietly for the afternoon? Head over the hill through the cemetery and enjoy this quiet beach.

333780758.name: Quiet beach walking distance from Sayulita
333780758.author: a TripAdvisor user
333780758.reviewBody: Go where the waves are smaller and the locals go.  This is a 15 minute walk at most from Sayulita Beach.  Walk through the gorgeous grounds of Villa Amor Hotel from the south end of Sayulita Beach, take a left to pass the unforgettable little cemetery and you\'re there!  Less intimidating waves than Sayulita Beach and a little cove.  Lovely!

333134740.name: Nice, usuaully quite
333134740.author: a TripAdvisor user
333134740.reviewBody: This beach is a lot quieter than the main beach on the other side of the hill and is a nice walk thru a beautiful cemetery

332332568.name: Cool little beach off the beaten track, worth the extra walk!
332332568.author: a TripAdvisor user
332332568.reviewBody: This is a great little beach off the south end of the main Sayulita beach. The walk is neat, and the cemetery you pass on the way there is a neat Mexican cultural thing. So different from a typical Canadian cemetery. There are no beers or cold drinks for sale, so bring your own. Definitely check it out.

329269958.name: Quiet and day to access
329269958.author: a TripAdvisor user
329269958.reviewBody: This beach is a 10 minute walk from the main beach in  Sayulita. You walk on a road that goes through the cemetery, which is an interesting experience in itself. The beach is quiet, has shade and a sporadic lifeguard. It is a good place to snorkel because it is calmer than the surfing beach. There aren\'t crowds of people. No services, except the donut man who comes through from time to time. Kid friendly, the locals come here to gather for picnics and frolic in the water. \nBring your own supplies, especially drinking water.

328238437.name: Serene and beautiful
328238437.author: a TripAdvisor user
328238437.reviewBody: We visited this lovely beach after touring the colorful cemetery at the entrance.  This slice of beach fans calm, clear water framed by large boulders and a grove of palm trees.  Definitely worth visiting this place.

327730163.name: Beautiful Playa
327730163.author: a TripAdvisor user
327730163.reviewBody: get away from the main beach and enjoy some amazing waves to play in!\nWe loved spending time hanging out here, a nice walk from town.

327041707.name: Fun spot to visit
327041707.author: a TripAdvisor user
327041707.reviewBody: We enjoyed our walk to Playa Los Muertos from Sayulita. The cemetery is beautiful. It\'s worth the 15-30 min walk

325977857.name: Off the main path
325977857.author: a TripAdvisor user
325977857.reviewBody: This is a GREAT beach. Not very many people, very little vendor traffic. I recommend walking the extra 15 mins from the main beach.

325974524.name: Solitude
325974524.author: a TripAdvisor user
325974524.reviewBody: If you wish to have a beach pretty much to yourself while in Sayulita, follow the shore road south 5 minutes and ask a few locals. The cemetery is an experience in itself, be reverent. Usually a vendor with drinks at the parking lot. Pretty much a 4 wheel road or golf cart, be careful. Nice swimming area with ropes.

325938818.name: Local
325938818.author: a TripAdvisor user
325938818.reviewBody: A great place to swim without getting beat up by the waves,good shade! A local beach and not crowded.

324423512.name: small and shadow from busy sayulita
324423512.author: a TripAdvisor user
324423512.reviewBody: if You want to escape from all surfers and ,,friendly\'\' gringos, find some place in shade on this nice place. Especially in the morning You can find there 2-3 other people.\nwalk there is thru cemetery, which could be also new experience

322656122.name: Beautiful and secluded beach!
322656122.author: a TripAdvisor user
322656122.reviewBody: Playa los Muertos was about a 5 minute walk from our hotel (Villa Amor). It was such a neat experience! You have to walk through a cemetery which is beautiful and has a "day of the dead" feel to it with beautiful candles, flowers, and tombstones. The beach is smaller than Sayulita beach which means less people. It was very clean, peaceful and quiet, which was nice to experience. My boyfriend and I would swim there in the morning and would literally be there by ourselves! It was so romantic and a fantastic way to start our day!

320980026.name: Nice local beach
320980026.author: a TripAdvisor user
320980026.reviewBody: We went to this beach with a local\'s recommendation. Had a blast, it is more shaded than the main beach and more deserted. Definitely must go, kid-friendly but no surf.

319394127.name: Beautiful and quiet
319394127.author: a TripAdvisor user
319394127.reviewBody: The beach was a 10 minute walk from our hotel but very worth it. It is very quiet with shade and we spent a few hours there everyday.

310313454.name: whats up dude??
310313454.author: a TripAdvisor user
310313454.reviewBody: Surf is up, and what a fantastic place to chill with a cold bucket of beer and surfer/people watch. Laid back and very safe. Enjoy this little part of Mexico.

303766802.name: Very tranquil beach
303766802.author: a TripAdvisor user
303766802.reviewBody: Nice little beach in Sayulita, you can walk, it is very tranquil since the main movement is in Sayulita Beach, there are some people that like jumping from the rocks, anyway if you are in Sayulita plan a visit.

302896268.name: Quiet beach close by
302896268.author: a TripAdvisor user
302896268.reviewBody: Los Muertos beach is an easy walk from Sayulita main beach and the best part is walking through the cemetary on the way there, you get a sense of the community and traditions here.  I love fishing from the rocks at the beach.  I also love the fact that it is a little quieter usually and more family oriented.

296683956.name: Favorite Swimming Spot
296683956.author: a TripAdvisor user
296683956.reviewBody: Great little beach, just around the corner from the main Sayulita beach, with friendly vibes, smaller waves, beautiful sand and a quirky graveyard.

291207792.name: Recommended for Swimming, but Why?
291207792.author: a TripAdvisor user
291207792.reviewBody: I enjoyed visiting the cemetery at Play Los Muertos, but I was very disappointed by the beach and swimming. The waters were muddy and there was a very small area roped off for swimming. I just don\'t understand why it is so recommended.

290228856.name: a walk through the cemetery: a unique entry
290228856.author: a TripAdvisor user
290228856.reviewBody: A bit of a hike but well worth it if you want to avoid crush of Sayulita\'s beaches and want a safer, shadier and calmer venue.

286438216.name: A Calm Cove to Get Away from the Bustle of Town
286438216.author: a TripAdvisor user
286438216.reviewBody: To get to this beach from the town of Sayulita you have to go through a cemetery hence the name Beach of the Dead.  It\'s an easy walk from town, simply go past the Villa Amor hotel, turn left at the end of the road on to a dirt road, go under the arch and through the cemetery.  At the bottom of the hill the beach will be to the right.  When we went it wasn\'t very crowded, the water is much calmer than on the town side so you feel safe wading out pretty far.  There are beautiful rocks on either side.  When we were there, there were a few vendors selling food and drinks so you do not have to go back into town for those.  There was not any bathroom or shower facilities so that might limit the time you want to stay there.  We stayed a few hours and truly loved this spot.

676144775.name: The \u201ccute\u201d town is not so cute anymore.
676144775.author: a TripAdvisor user
676144775.reviewBody: I enjoyed going to Sayulita on day trips the first couple of times a few years ago. So we thought we would try staying there for three days on this trip. The town is filthy. I thought P.V.  Was dirty, but this town has it beat. It has always been a very bohemian surfer place that attracts the younger \u201chippy\u201d surfer types. They seem to be in nirvana there. But I do not see the allure is you do not fit into that category of festival crowd. Most of the restraints on the Main Street are really loud. Playing loud music and add to it the loud street performers. If you eat by the water it is quieter. All in all, it has lost the charm and cleanliness and turned into a dirty town that sells a lot of colorful Pom poms. The colors of these shops helps the lackluster infrastructure of the town. Very disappointed with the dirty town.

674786704.name: Not just Norovirus
674786704.author: a TripAdvisor user
674786704.reviewBody:
So. Just to keep yo up to speed. We 100% had either Rotavirus or Norovirus. 

But it wouldn’t go away for three of the four of us for about 8 days. 

Turns out we ALSO CONTRACTED a GI PARASITE that made us pass yellow water from our bowels for, as I said, over a week. 

We vacated our rental (4 days early) and returned home to Vancouver for a week on the toilet, terrible headaches and lethargia. 

Now we only ate in the best restaurants (cleanest looking places with high yelp ratings) We only used bottled water for our tooth brushes. I never went in the ocean, the kids did. One of the kids didn’t get the GI Parasite. 

My kids chew their nails. I don’t. 

I do want to add this last point. Me and my 3 sons have spent multiple times, a month at a time, travelling Thailand. We eat everywhere. Sides of streets to hotels. Never been a sick. 

Did a month in the Philippines last year. Not sickness (although a close encounter with a box jellyfish). 

4 days in Sayulita and we changed out bookings and flew home with our tails between our legs. 

So yeah. Be aware.

673786387.name: SAYULITA IS STILL AMAZING
673786387.author: a TripAdvisor user
673786387.reviewBody:
My wife and I planned our Wedding in Sayulita for May 4th 2019, around a year prior to that. We had been to the area a couple times. 
My wife has been very diligent in this planning process and has been keeping her eye on reviews of Sayulita ever since we decided to have our wedding at Villa Del Oso. We have many trusted relationships with locals in the town, including our wedding planner Yazmin Gizeh, whom we love dearly. We were gearing up for our wedding, which had 64 total guests coming in from all over the United States. We did all of the possible homework we could. We had conversations with everybody we knew in Sayulita, all of which assured us that the town was doing everything in their power to clean the town up, and that it was going to be safe to keep all of our guests in town.
We kept our wedding venue at Villa Del Oso. We are encouraged in travelling to Sayulita in the future, as our hearts are there. 
Overall, We appreciated everybody's honesty, and assistance in allowing us to do what we knew was best for our wedding. We want to thank the town for that and let everybody who's reading this know, that we will be back, we love Sayulita, and the people are amazing. 

Thanks for taking the time to educate yourselves on our real life experience, and we hope that nobody is discouraged from experiencing this magical place where the people are friendly and show love, and love to meet outsiders. 

Love
Matt and Kristen

673743608.name: Amazing Vacation Town
673743608.author: a TripAdvisor user
673743608.reviewBody:
I had my wedding in Sayulita in April 2019. All 125 guests fell in love with the little town. Although there were concerns about sickness, not a single person got sick and everyone was out in town every day. 

The town is lively, fun, and full of delicious food. Everyone is so welcoming and were very accommodating when visitors didn't speak spanish. The beach was clean and everyone was swimming.

I can't wait for my next vacation to Sayulita!

673267951.name: Great Beach for a few days
673267951.author: a TripAdvisor user
673267951.reviewBody: We just returned from a five-day trip to Sayulita with six couples.  We had an outstanding time.  We were concerned about the possibility of sickness that had been discussed but none of our group got sick.  The beach was great we Rented chairs from Don Pedro\u2019s for US$10 per day which included two chairs and an umbrella.  The setting was great the service was great the only thing that was not great was a rotation of vendors trying to sell you something.  I totally recommend people visiting Sayulita.  The town is getting busier with more tourists but the vibe is still great.  We will be back.

672183993.name: Best week ever
672183993.author: a TripAdvisor user
672183993.reviewBody:
We recently got married in Sayulita in early May 2019. We were very worried about reading some of the reviews here and nearly called this off but I'm so glad we didn't!

Out of our entire group (85ppl) NO ONE got ill, even if most of us swimmed in the ocean. The entire norovirus scare actually played in our favour, the town was quiet and so relaxing :)

We had such a great time enjoying local restaurants, going out to see live music, enjoying our villas and the beach. Our party had people ranging from 4 months old to 72 y.o. and there activities and amenities convenient to all of us.

Don't let the bad reviews scare you away, Sayulita has done a lot of Work to fix the issues mentioned - and it worked. the locals are outstandingly welcoming and the village extremely charming. Please go!

670626926.name: Return to Sayulita
670626926.author: a TripAdvisor user
670626926.reviewBody:
My wife and I have been coming to Sayulita since 2004 and will continue to visit.
This year we spent over a month and next year plan to extend our stay even longer. 
We always stay at the same place, The Beach House on Gavoitas and always stay in the Upper Garden. Despite being right on the beach, the rooms and the courtyard are very private and tranquil. Over the years we've become quite friendly with our landlady, Luisa as well as many of the local merchants and vendors. The staff are very attentive and often help us with things above and beyond their housekeeping duties. Most days are spent reading and swimming with walks up the street for breakfast at L'Espresso, street tacos in the evenings or a visit to Calypso for a fancier meal. The kitchen in the apartment is very handy for a quick lunch or afternoon snack. We're not old, but most days include a late afternoon nap with the soothing sounds of the waves and birds chattering in the trees as the sun goes down and the heat dissipates.
I wish I could sleep as well at home.
We have, over the years, had some stomach issues but this is true for all of Mexico. 
I lived and worked in Bucerias years ago and things are very much improved overall.

True, the town has grown over the years and there's been some bad reviews lately but my understanding is that things have settled down and are getting back to normal.
We will continue to visit and enjoy the local hospitality.
Our plan is to stay for 3 months next year.
Gracias Sayulita!

670002143.name: Wedding
670002143.author: a TripAdvisor user
670002143.reviewBody: I just spent the week of April 20 through April 27 and Sayulita, And I must say it was the best trip I\u2019ve ever taken! My daughter got married there, and none of her 75 guests were deterred by all the negative reviews we read before going. AND NOT ONE OF THE 75 GOT SICK!\nNeedless to say, I witnessed the housing staffs and the business owners practicing the highest standards of sanitation, right down to the sidewalks!! We ate food wherever we wanted, drank all the drinks we could possibly drink, enjoyed the beautiful views, the lovely ocean, and the warmest, friendliest people I have ever encountered. Don\u2019t let other peoples unfortunate visits deter you from going. It\u2019s the most beautiful place on earth!

669867107.name: Very busy and overcrowded
669867107.author: a TripAdvisor user
669867107.reviewBody: We decided to take a side trip for the day and take in Sayulita. Well after the 1 3/4 hour bus ride due to road construction on hwy 200 we made it. The little town was packed with people and the beach was very overcrowded. Not what we were expecting as we were told is was off the beaten track and a cool place to go and hangout for the day and do a couple water sports or relax and enjoy the beach views. Not saying it\'s always like this but no reason for me to go back and find out.

669205094.name: no bueno
669205094.author: a TripAdvisor user
669205094.reviewBody: Beach is fun but it is packed with people and very very crowded.\nThe vendors are really aggressive and there are many of them, every 5-8 minutes someone approached us. Water is polluted and dirty due to sewage problem--the town is working on this slowly so it will improve hopefully.\nSayulita town is great fun and should be visited.

669184776.name: Fantastic trip!
669184776.author: a TripAdvisor user
669184776.reviewBody: We were a group of 10 last week staying for 8 nights. We had the best time. Ate dinner out every night and most days went for breakfast in town. Such friendly people, not crowded at all. The worst that happened was too many margaritas!\nWe were nervous about the trip due to past reviews but it looks like the new treatment plant has been a huge plus for the town and solved the issues.

667967184.name: Surfing is great.
667967184.author: a TripAdvisor user
667967184.reviewBody: Went to Sayulita Beach while staying in Bucerias.  Taxi was a 300 peso each way, 600 total.  Took a surf lesson with Tiger surf school, was 900 peso for about 1 1/2 lesson.  Then they let us use the boards for an hour on our own.  \n \n The downside of the beach was trying to find a spot to sit.  Chairs and umbrella all cost money.  Found a spot that said 250 peso per person all day including drinks and food. Well end of the day it was about 500 peso per day.  Make sure you get in writing what it cost to use the chairs.   TONS of people selling items on the beach , way to much .

667733824.name: Charming day trip from Peurto Vallarta
667733824.author: a TripAdvisor user
667733824.reviewBody: First of all the beach is great, it has a good swimming area and We watched the surfers for entertainment. The service under the beach umbrellas was great and the drinks weren\u2019t bad. The town itself is filled with little shops that have some unique things. The general atmosphere is festive while being relaxing. We loved it. Finding a parking spot was a challenge

667272381.name: Sayulita = Norovirus
667272381.author: a TripAdvisor user
667272381.reviewBody: We went to Sayulita over Spring break to celebrate a special birthday. We had stayed at The Grand Mayan a few years ago and came to Sayulita on a day trip and I wanted to come back....HUGE MISTAKE!  Two days in and I was soooo sick....my husband madly dashed out the next morning to get gatorade, pepto and coconut water for rehydration.  The town is dusty, dirty, smelly and full of ill tourists.  We heard about it every time we were out.  If it wasn\'t a wedding party where most were ill and had to have IV, it was surfers who were sick.  Its all over Sayulita!! It has been just over 2 weeks since we got back and I am still not back to normal.  I contacted our Air BNB host who gave me the ...oh, its the tourists that bring it down and everyone gets sick.  I asked her if she reads what is all over the forums and told her I had been to the Dr and its Noro! We did not go in the water at all!   Unconscionable for the hosts and hotels to underplay the seriousness of this endemic in Sayulita!  Stay Away!

666774583.name: Wonderful, chill beach
666774583.author: a TripAdvisor user
666774583.reviewBody: We spun off from Puerto Vallarta for 4 nights in this gem of a spot. We\u2019d heard it was a bit like Koh Lanta or Koh Phangan Thailand before the full moon parties. That was right on the mark. The little surfer  town is super friendly and the food is outstanding and inexpensive. The entertainment was great - from live modern music bands to street performers, fire twirlers, mariachi bands and an incredible jazz band. We met left over hippies, young surfers, locals, expats, families, friends trips, Mexican tourists, American, Kiwi, Aussie, Canadian tourists. For the most part, everyone got along.  \nMy only complaint as a huge animal lover and rescuer is the fact that a large majority of the pets here are not neutered or spayed - and off leash (which likely means a big unwanted animal population). \nI feel like this place could be on the verge of bursting as the secret is out but visit soon and ideally in the off season for an authentic experience.

666506142.name: Perfect vacation except one huge thing
666506142.author: a TripAdvisor user
666506142.reviewBody: We just got back from a week long stay in Sayulita 4/6-4/13/19. There were 14 of us in total (babies, kids, teens and adults). It was as great as all the best reviews have reported except one thing (that should make you rethink a trip to this place). Everyone except 1 person got norovirus to varying degrees. Some of us very violently, some of us after we got home last night and I\u2019m expecting my teenager that didn\u2019t get it to get it any minute. I had heard that Sayulita has drainage issues. We were so diligent about tap water, hand sanitizer, etc but it didn\u2019t matter. It seems that Sayulita needs to be listed by the CDC as a place that should not be visited. Now that I\u2019m doing research it seems that most people who visit get sick.

666485345.name: Stay away!
666485345.author: a TripAdvisor user
666485345.reviewBody: The sanitation issue in Sayulita is dire. Since January all of the raw sewage in Sayulita has been flowing into the ocean in the middle of town. This is why so many people are sick. Not because of tequila, or sun, or spicy food. I\'m not buying that. it is on the business owners to warn people, and help them make educated decisions about bringing their family. Had we known how bad it is, we would have never come.

666441971.name: Wonderful town
666441971.author: a TripAdvisor user
666441971.reviewBody: I just spent 5 days in Sayulita and absolutely loved it! The town itself is beautiful and it\'s a perfect spot for beginner\'s surfing! So yes, I dared to go into the water and no, I did not get sick. Neither did the 2 friends I was traveling with. We all enjoyed our time there a lot and will come back soon. \n\nA bit annoying that you can\'t just peacefully enjoy your time on the beach because there\'s someone trying to sell something to you literally every minute.

666108500.name: Town of Sayulita Mexico
666108500.author: a TripAdvisor user
666108500.reviewBody: What a cool little town! \n\nNice beach, lots of neat little shops, restaurants & surf shops!! Town has a great vibe - recommend at least 3-4 hours there, or just stay and enjoy the day!!!

666104095.name: Busy, touristy, loud!
666104095.author: a TripAdvisor user
666104095.reviewBody: The beauty & tranquility of Sayulita is long gone. Over run with tourists, horrible smell from sewage & constant interruption by vendors. We were unable to have a conversation on the beach due to nonstop flow of vendors of all ages & items. Very uncomfortable with the extremely young children ( 2 - 3 yrs. old) approaching restaurant tables late at night - child abuse!!! Save yourself the hassle & walk over to Playa De Los Muertos Beach - no vendors, great swimming, no crowds, NO SMELL!! Lovely walk!

666031826.name: Sad but true
666031826.author: a TripAdvisor user
666031826.reviewBody:
Was really cool town to pull in. Loved the shops and the colors. Went to the beach and although there were a ton of people selling stuff, they weren’t aggressive or pushy.

We had three families for a day of fun in Sayulita, including surfing, which the kids all loved.  BUT, every family had at least two family members who got violently ill after being at Sayulita- can’t say any of us would go back. Look at all of the posts on TA of people getting sick. 

I’d recommend passing or be prepared to have your head in a toilet bowl for a day...

665769935.name: Wedding at Villa Amor
665769935.author: a TripAdvisor user
665769935.reviewBody: Beautiful spot staying at Villa Amor Villa Pacifico, great service there and beautiful wedding done by Karen.  Please be aware that there is Norovirus in town.

665311479.name: Don\'t go right now!
665311479.author: a TripAdvisor user
665311479.reviewBody: 4 out of 6 of us got pretty sick last week, and we are all experienced travelers, very careful, etc. Not sure what\'s going on in town, but there\'s some kind of contagious(?) stomach virus/bug circulating. Won\'t be going back until there\'s an all-clear. Too bad, too, because it\'s beautiful there and the people are kind and welcoming. Oh, and don\'t count on the gringo airbnb hosts to tell you the truth about the virus!

665298938.name: Sayulita Beach
665298938.author: a TripAdvisor user
665298938.reviewBody:
We went to Sayulita from April 2nd to 9th, it was our second time going and we love it. There has been a lot of work put into the development of the town and certain businesses recognizing how they can reduce their waste on the environment. 

We stayed at an air bnb that had a pool which was awesome. Right now the community is working on getting their waste treatment back up and running as there was a leak. 

Few tips! 
- If you run out of pesos and have USD, you can exchange it at the OXO, we received a 17.5pesos to 1USD exchange which was better than the ATMS. 
- Look at the beach alerts, there was a warning when we google it prior to getting in the water. You can search Sayulita Beach Water Quality. 
- Want to go swimming or surfing but the beach is crowded? The beach of the dead - Playa Los Muertos - is only a 20 minute walk away from the beach or if you have a car La Lancha is a great option. You can also get a shuttle from wildmex for USD $20 return. 
- Be conscious of your food, if your cooking at home buy the food antibacterial Microdym - even fruit/veg that has a skin you’re peeling off - soak it! You can use this for when you’re washing your dishes too.
- Always use your hand sanitizer, and be wary of your phone hygiene too. If you use your phone, then go to pick up your food ie taco - use hand sani! 

We absolutely love Sayulita, and will continue to go back.

665280952.name: Never again
665280952.author: a TripAdvisor user
665280952.reviewBody: Solace should be called Sickulita. We knew about 50 people who were going there over spring break and every one of them got sick. Three weeks later people are still off with GI issues. Apparently some folks have some severe parasites from the water or food or something. Think twice before you go. I would highly recommend not going to Sickulita and going to Punta de Mita instead and surfing at La Lancha. Never going back. We were sick the entire time.

665138766.name: STAY AWAY at ALL COSTS unless you want a bacterial infection!!!!!
665138766.author: a TripAdvisor user
665138766.reviewBody: My family (wife and two teenagers) traveled to Nuevo Vallarta with friends (husband, wife, and also two teenagers). Beautiful and amazing time, we should have stayed on property the entire week. We made the horrible decision to have a surfing excursion to Sayulita. We actually had a really fun time hanging out at El Break and Tigres were great surfing instructors, but fast forward 18 hours and 6 out of the 8 of us were vomiting back at our hotel with aches and chills. Only 3 of us entered the water, myself and my teenage son and daughter. Sadly, I always expect to get a little sick when traveling to Mexico. What happened to our group was beyond getting a little sick.  However, what happened days later when we returned to the States is truly unimaginable. We went to Sayulita on a Tuesday. By Sunday my teenage daughter was complaining of pain in her vagina. She could not urinate and was in tears just trying to move. On Monday I took her the pediatrician who recommended we go to the gynecologist immediately. Something did not look right during her clinical exam.  The gynecologist said the exact same thing. My daughter was raw on the inside, so the doctor took samples to send for culture. By Tuesday we were at the ER because her pain was so severe (one week after our excursion to Sayulita). They thought she had a UTI so she was put on an IV antibiotic and given narcotics for the pain. Fast forward 7 days later. My daughter has improved tremendously. We just received the results from the culture. She tested positive for having the enterococcus bacteria. Look it up, this in the water at high levels in Sayulita. This basically means we were swimming in feces.  Our gynecologist contacted the infectious disease center to make sure every precaution was taken to kill the bacteria and stop it from spreading and causing further issues. I cannot believe the Mexican government, both federal and local, allow this blatant disregard for public safety to occur.  Do not risk your health. Stay away from Sayulita.  Trust me. No person, let alone child, should suffer because they went to a beach and swam in the water.  I will be contacting the US consulate in Mexico, there should be travel warnings issued.

664141972.name: Sayulita, Mexico
664141972.author: a TripAdvisor user
664141972.reviewBody: Great beach for surfing..... lots of restaurants ... friendly folks and safe place to visit. Many shops

664117787.name: Please Read My Review!!!!  Please!
664117787.author: a TripAdvisor user
664117787.reviewBody:
I hate posting negative reviews but if I can spare another family from having our experience....

Having just returned from a horrific 10 days in Sayulita where 5 out of 5 of us were violently ill for most of our trip, I would strongly advise against staying, eating, swimming or breathing in the town of Sayulita.  If you don’t believe me, read the forms posted here.  Everyone (and I mean everyone) we spoke to was sick or had members of their families sick.  Several locals we spoke to admitted that there is a problem in town. 
Regardless of the fact I spent 3 days solid in bed and the rest suffering in the shade, I would never return to this town.  The beach is horribly crowded and polluted, the town (at one point I am sure was charming) is overrun by tourists and locally run businesses are being replaced by Gringo owned restaurants/ shops that have no local flavor.  There are several beautiful towns nearby where we wished we had stayed.  The only thing we loved about our time there was getting up for a daily walk around the village (when well enough) at 6:30 am to see all the locals starting their day and enjoy the views and village before the crowds of tourists flooded the street.   Charm abruptly ended by 9:30 am.  Oh...we also enjoyed getting out of Sayulita whenever we were well enough to do so.

This place has totally lost all its charm.  Getting super sick topped it all off.  You’d have to be crazy to book a trip there as I’m sure that in order for the town to be rid of “Sayulita Sickness” it will need government intervention.  Good luck with that.  Spend your travel dollars elsewhere.   There are dozens of beautiful places to see and stay in Mexico.

663955283.name: Worst family vacation ever
663955283.author: a TripAdvisor user
663955283.reviewBody: We\'ve been coming to Sayulita since 2007, and have never experienced anything like what we did this week: all five of us got sick, the younger kids violently so. Vomiting, dry heaves, diarrhea, fever, body aches, chills, zero appetite, listless. All symptoms of the Norovirus epidemic that we learned about too late, and that local business interests don\'t want you to know about. We won\'t be back until major changes have been made. Without a doubt our worst family vacation ever.

663782708.name: Sick in Sayulita
663782708.author: a TripAdvisor user
663782708.reviewBody: I got the rotavirus in Sayulita two weeks ago. I\'m on week three and still recovering. There\'s nothing the doctors can give you for it, you just have to ride it out which usually takes about two weeks. A lot of people were getting sick. We talked to groups of nine people and everyone went down. Even some of the locals were getting sick. My suggestion is to avoid Sayulita. It\'s a dirty, dusty town that grew too fast for its water and sewage systems.

663740795.name: Norovirus
663740795.author: a TripAdvisor user
663740795.reviewBody:
We just got home from Sayulita and 9 days of Norovirus and it’s horrible effects. Please do do go to Sayulita until their sanitation system is repaired and the have found a way to get rid of this virus. 
Speaking with many locals we found out that they have been battling Norovirus for over 8 years and this past month has been the worst ever. 

We visited Sayulita 10 years ago and fell in love with it, it’s a beautiful town but please stay away. 
Numerous friends and their friends have reported being very sick from staying there. A whole air transat flight had bathroom lineups with diarrhea and vomiting the entire trip!

Find another location.

663597274.name: Sayulita - Tourist should know before they go
663597274.author: a TripAdvisor user
663597274.reviewBody:
I read reviews before we left, it's a shame unless you google "Sayulita sickness" you really don't see any of these reviews.
...before you think I'm expecting Mexico to be like home, I'm not. To put it in perspective we spent a month in India this year and would go back to India in a heartbeat.
Sayulita should have a health hazard sign as you enter. 
We were a family of three and had a very lucky week (if you say only having the poops is lucky) we were in the minority of only getting tired for a day and the poops! We have been back from vacation now for 10 days we are only just beginning to feel normal.
The majority of tourists get severe vomiting. Reviews are not exaggerated there are a way higher percentage of tourists getting sick than anywhere I have ever travelled.
It's a real shame as this town is very charming, has great restaurants, bars, boutique  shopping, unfortunately you spent all your vacation hoping you wouldn't get sick and watching tourists fall like flies. Washing your hands and being picky about where you eat doesn't save you. I was told it's airborne and for the amount of tourists getting sick I believe it. Sayulita needs to admit they have a problem and either warn travelers or fix it.

663513836.name: Sayulita is a hotbed of terrible sickness
663513836.author: a TripAdvisor user
663513836.reviewBody: On our 1st day in Sayulita we learned that we didn\'t get the room we had originally booked on Bookingdotcom which was supposed to be situated in the original complex of Villa Amor. Instead they booked us in another villa that was recently added to the property. 2nd, we were told that we had to climb a lot of stairs to get to our room (approx 123), and 3rd, the room had a partition between the bed and the bathroom. So already the vacation had a few strikes against us. After our first night, my husband got sick in the middle of the night waking up with a virulent bout of diarrhea and vomiting - this went on for hours until he lost consciousness, fell down and hit his head on the tiled-floor. I ran into the bathroom to find him lying on the floor with blood streaming down his face. Luckily the bleeding stopped and I was able to help him to bed.  I was spared with only a minor bout of vomiting but I am also a savvy traveler having been to many 3rd world countries. Long story short, we were traveling with our family who were staying at a private residence, but were still stricken with vomiting and diarrhea, so it wasn\'t just at the place we were staying. Of the 7 days we were there, 5 of them were spent not eating much, and laying low. The pool at Villa Amor was the only thing that kept us going, because all we did was lie on the lounges. Then there is the extremely high prices that we were being charged for food, like ordering mashed potatoes and side of vegetables which cost $27 - but when you\'re up 123 stairs, and sick, you\'ll pay the asking price. When we were in Sayulita in 2014 for our son\'s wedding, there were at least 50 people, and none of us got sick. Since then, Sayulita has become a popular destination for people looking for beach resorts, low prices and great weather. Unfortunately, Sayulita has become a filthy, disgusting and over--priced hell-hole. I will never, ever go back there -- it will take them years to get that city to a decent level of health. My biggest gripe is with the booking agencies, i.e., BookingDotCom who should have warned us before we booked our hotel, and the airlines should have been notified that there was an epidemic here. I\'m sure there are many other great areas to visit other than Sayulita, such as San Pancho, which is very clean and less crowded, or Punta del Mita. I\'ve lodged complaints with Bookingdotcom, and Villa Amor. We\'ll see if it even matters to them?

663340955.name: Sayulita is Toxic!
663340955.author: a TripAdvisor user
663340955.reviewBody: All four of us became violently ill within 30hrs. We took every precaution. The smell of the town is horrific, and that alone may have been enough to drive us out had we not also become so sick. \nYou simply can\u2019t go here, and if you\u2019re providing lodging it\u2019s unconscionable not to warm visitors of the risks. It might be the water, but I wonder whether it\u2019s airborne....either way an extraordinary nightmare and the property manager of the home dsisnt even try to deny it

663196713.name: Feeling Lucky?
663196713.author: a TripAdvisor user
663196713.reviewBody: We didn\'t believe the hype about this Norivirus, boy are we sorry! We scored 100%, all of our group became ill, yes we were diligent with hygiene. Spent the first week of our 2 weeks in Sayulita, arrived Friday and the first of us were sick by Monday. Its been 2 weeks since I first became ill and still am not feeling right. The hype is real, if don\'t get sick, you will be in the minority of those who visit Sayulita. Enjoyed the first few days and then our holiday\'s were spent in the crapper!!

662931172.name: Go if you like to spend your holiday talking about getting sick.
662931172.author: a TripAdvisor user
662931172.reviewBody: We had planned to be in Sayulita March 23 to 30. But after 3 nights we cut our losses and left town. We even took a 50% loss on the cost of our remaining hotel reservations.\nWe had the same issue as all the other recent posts, everyone in our party and the hotel getting sick, and the smell of sewage in the town.... \nIts a cute town but not a place for a vacation.

662862163.name: Devastating sickness
662862163.author: a TripAdvisor user
662862163.reviewBody:
Within a day of surfing, got sick. Not montezumas revenge - but a real, honest to god sickness. 

The water and town stank of sewage - it was a smell that foreshadowed the rectal wreckage to be wrought. 

After great lessons and waves, we caught the ride of our life on a totally tubular set.

Within 12 hours, I was spewing mayhem from all bodily outlets. The next 10 hours involved more vomit than any time in life. Luckily, my abs received a complimentary workout from 27 times vomiting overnight. 

Between this and the disaster down under, we were absolutely wrecked. Couldn’t keep water down.  The town resembled a scene from the walking dead. 

Until this is fixed, avoid like the plague. Because, it’s like, an actual plague.

662271395.name: One of the Magic Towns
662271395.author: a TripAdvisor user
662271395.reviewBody: It\u2019s a magic place with a great atmosphere! The town is full of life, color, music and good food 24/7

662266659.name: Do not go unless you want to get sick with the Norovirus!!!
662266659.author: a TripAdvisor user
662266659.reviewBody: We were in Sayulita March 19-25 for a family destination wedding. Everyone who traveled there for the wedding (60+) got sick at one point during their stay. I mean, people were dropping like flies! We were all staying at difference hotels (Villa Amor, where the wedding ceremony took place) and condos. We stayed at the Monterosa Villa Colima. I have NEVER been so sick, with bouts of violent vomiting and diarrhea! We have been home now for almost a week and are STILL experiencing stomach issues! One of our family members who stayed with us has just been admitted into the hospital due to severe cramping, dehydration and a bladder infection. PLEASE do your research before booking a place in Sayulita! I think the hotels and condo owners are not being truthful with people. They shouldn\u2019t rent out their places there until Sayulita gets this epidemic under control!

662063054.name: Yup got sick!!
662063054.author: a TripAdvisor user
662063054.reviewBody: Prior to our trip I had read about many people getting sick in Sayulita.  But alas my hotel was non refundable, and  I "thought" the reports of sickness were blown out of proportion.  But trust me they are NOT.  We stayed at Hotel Peix on the main beach.  (Lovely Hotel), and both of us got super sick.  We did NOT swim in the ocean at all, so that isn\'t the culprit.   We were sick for 2 days there and another week after returning home.  I had to go to ER back in the US to get the vomiting stopped.  IT has been awful !!    I am still not 100% recovered.    We are experienced Mexico travelers, but AVOID Sayulita, at least for now!   And yes there is sewage being spilled into the ocean via the river.   We say it for ourselves.   Sorry Saulita, but we will not return.  :(

661947688.name: Polluted beach
661947688.author: a TripAdvisor user
661947688.reviewBody: After a drive from Punta Mita we struggled to find a parking spot within two miles from the center of town. The downtown streets are blocked by street cafes and shops. We finally walked about a mile to the beach after fighting of some vendors. There seems to be out of control construction. On the beach we notices a foul smell on the water and decided to pack our boards and go back to Punta Mita. Don\u2019t know what all the fuzz is about this place. Maybe the easy going attitude or don\u2019t care attitude.

661924535.name: Beautiful, but also go sick!
661924535.author: a TripAdvisor user
661924535.reviewBody: This was the second time visiting Sayulita with my husband. We went back because we love the culture, community, food, and prices. We went with my mother in law and her boyfriend. Sadly everyone in our party got sick and not everyone went in the ocean. I think the town is going through local epidemic of sickness as it seems everyone we spoke to had gotten sick or knew of large parties that had gotten sick. So sad. We also could not find our favorite Tacos El Ivan and the chorro guy and our favorite restaurant, Yeikame , was closed. Everyone got some variation of fever, chills, aches, vomiting, and GI issues. I hope they are able to fix this issue!

661911850.name: Very GERMY  place!
661911850.author: a TripAdvisor user
661911850.reviewBody: Do NOT drink the tap water or swim in Sayulita!!  2 of 3 persons in my party got sick - two different illnesses.  This place is pretty but nasty. It\'s in the air. Locals downplay the issues here (blaming the tourists) but the real problem is lack of clean drinking water and wastewater treatment (i.e., local officials afraid to raise taxes to improve potable water and to relocate and upgrade the wastewater treatment plant which is right in the middle of town). City just started spraying chlorinated water on the dirt streets to try and control the germs. Still air quality is bad - sewage odors everywhere. Their solution to the under-capacity wastewater treatment plant is to extend the outfall and dump untreated (or blend of primary treated + untreated) wastewater 1 mi off shore. Irresponsible!

661904498.name: Sayulita SICKNESS  - do not visit
661904498.author: a TripAdvisor user
661904498.reviewBody:
We just got back to Baltimore from 9 days in Sayulita. WE GOT HORRIBLY SICK. I puked 6 of the 9 nights... and horrible diarrhea. I will NEVER go back.

Stay in San Pancho or stay in Punta Mita... do not even go into Sayulita. Dont visit. Dont drive through.. The bacteria or sickness is in the DUST in the air. We are convinced.

The locals and Hosts will not be honest with you. They dont want to jeopardize the revenue of tourists. I am contacting the CDC. This is RIDICULOUS. We wasted alot of money on the worst experience.

We never got in the ocean or stepped on the beach at Sayulita. The stench was obvious. We day tripped each day to San Pancho or Punta Mita beaches and still got horribly sick. Our accommodations were in Sayulita so we could not avoid the AIR.

Hope this helps. AVOID Sayulita.  If you have small children please take this seriously.

661678938.name: Don\u2019t swim at Sayulita Beach - you will get sick
661678938.author: a TripAdvisor user
661678938.reviewBody: We\u2019ve traveled to this beach before and it was absolutely lovely - quiet and full of character - so we decided to book a longer stay this year for Spring Break. We are staying at a lovey casa just a few blocks from the town center and we are very pleased with the property...however, after swimming at the beach for two days, 3 of the 7 of us have become violently ill and one of us almost required a hospital visit and fainted. We visit MX often and are savvy about avoiding travelers diarrhea but this is different and seems more severe with a faster onset. The people in our party who aren\u2019t sick (so far) didn\u2019t swim at the beach and those that did become very ill within 6-12 hours of swimming. This town seems overrun. There is dog feces everywhere (yes on the beach) and it smells of sewage. I do not believe they have infrastructure to handle all these people and the water is contaminated. It\u2019s too bad as this town is so charming but I am writing this now as I\u2019m still here in the hopes that others will be warned as we really wish we had been. Don\u2019t. Swim. At Sayulita beach and I will be reporting this health hazard to the US Consulate.

661674692.name: Pretty but like everyone else - sick as can be!
661674692.author: a TripAdvisor user
661674692.reviewBody: Something is wrong - horribly wrong.  People come here to vacation and end-up sick.  My husband played in the water yesterday and last night he lost conciousness using the restroom and fell to the floor - we weren\'t over drinking that day/night either and very concious about what we eat.  He\'s bruised and vomitting like crazy as well as the other dad we are traveling with.  Be warned - we\'ve been here 4 times previously over last 10 years and also travel frequently.

661485496.name: Heed the health warnings!
661485496.author: a TripAdvisor user
661485496.reviewBody: We arrived 3/24/19 with our college kids for spring break. We are very experienced travelers and very careful about food-borne illnesses. Our 20 year daughter developed a gastrointestinal infection less than 1 day after swimming at Sayulita beach - we are quite sure this not from food or water. We walked further down the beach the next day. The rumors are true - there is a sewage pipe dumping into the ocean at the east part of the beach. It is obvious to see and smell. AVOID SAYULITA BEACH! It is unhealthy.

661358411.name: Norovirus
661358411.author: a TripAdvisor user
661358411.reviewBody: Everyone is getting it. Huge outbreak going unreported to protect tourism. Do not go there, you will get sick!

661207904.name: More Sickness
661207904.author: a TripAdvisor user
661207904.reviewBody: Took my family and friends there on March 23rd. Swam and surfed. 5 of 7 kids sick so far. Throwing up and diarrhea. Love this town, unfortunately won\u2019t go back till they clear this up.  Lost several days of vacation as a result.

661185715.name: Sayulita Escape-Fun in the Dust!!!
661185715.author: a TripAdvisor user
661185715.reviewBody:
On our recent visit to Nuevo Vallarta, my husband and I decided on the Sayulita Escape excursion which consisted of riding on the side by side through the dusty trails in the massive hills and visiting Sayulita.

We were bussed to a plant nursery where the side by sides were kept and greeted by Alan and Armando upon arrival. A quick run through of the equipment, safety rules and safety gears were given and off we went! The rocky trails on this excursion were quite exciting...lots of hills, fun curves, and some sharp turns!! We drove up to a high point where we looked down, and the view was absolutely gorgeous! After the rocky dusty trails we drove into Sayulita where we had an opportunity to wipe down the dirt followed by time to explore or have a sit down and soak in the scenery. The drive back to the meeting point was on the roads.

Overall, a super fun ride through the hills, and be prepared to be dirty the rest of the day after the trails!!!!

660900772.name: Don\'t expect a swimming/surfing vacation
660900772.author: a TripAdvisor user
660900772.reviewBody:
Sayulita is a great town with a huge sanitation problem. Their sewage "system" can't support all the people who want to go there, yet most of the locals rely on the tourism industry to make a living. It's just become an endless cycle.

I was in Sayulita in March 2019 with my partner. We originally booked the trip to be a surfing and swimming vacation, but learned getting in the water at the main beach wasn't advisable. We didn't even get in north of the river. Most of the other gringos we saw were staying out of the water as well.  We swam at Playa de los Muertos in Sayulita, at a beach in San Pancho, and at playa La Lancha near Punta Mita. We made the most of our time there by exploring other areas and going on jungle hikes, etc. We were diligent with hand washing/teeth brushing, choosing food, etc. My partner was sick with "Travelers Diarrhea" on our 3rd and 4th day there. I got it as we were leaving, and am still recovering 5 days later.

I wouldn't say not to go to Sayulita, but go knowing that you definitely shouldn't get in the water at the main beach, and even if you take every precaution, you may still get sick. It's Mexico and our "northerner systems" aren't used to their bacteria. Plan for other activities and day trips to surrounding areas and beaches.

660874722.name: Stay away
660874722.author: a TripAdvisor user
660874722.reviewBody: We read reviews that the Sayulita beach was contaminated due to a faulty sewer system. We came anyway and hoped to beat the odds since all our reservations were in place. 5 out of 5 of us got sick, including vomiting, diarrhea, aches and chills. It seems the local officials choose to ignore this horrendous health hazard and the beaches remain open.

660668747.name: Don\u2019t swim in the water!
660668747.author: a TripAdvisor user
660668747.reviewBody: Hi I\u2019m just an 17 year old kid who recently went to Sayulita Beach for a boogie board day because I heard the waves were good. There is 6 kids (including stepchildren) and my step mom and dad. All the kids went swimming, including myself, and got extremely sick.. Im currently writing this review while sick because I think it\u2019s ridiculous how they let people swim in the water. This is the worst sickness I have a ever had. I know you may not trust me, but DON\u2019T swim in the water, you will regret it.

660624520.name: Enchanting
660624520.author: a TripAdvisor user
660624520.reviewBody: This town is very cute, lots of shops and restaurants. I love the shopping here brought back some very unique souvenirs but the beach was over crowded and could use some cleaning. If you are visiting the area there\u2019s a ton of more appealing beaches to relax and take in the rays.

660390378.name: Already made up your mind not to go? Then don\'t
660390378.author: a TripAdvisor user
660390378.reviewBody:
But you will be missing out.
  I really don't understand all the hate for Sayulita on this forum. Yeah, you can get sick, just like any small town in Mexico. Overall I would say it's a far better place all around, than the next two closest tourist traps. The streets are cleaner, the people are friendlier, and the prices were not astronomically high like in Playa de Mita. Sometimes in the afternoon heat you can smell the treatment plant, which over the last 18 months has had extensive upgrades done. They are currently installing the new outfall from the plant, which will extend 2.3 kms off shore. 
  The people of Sayulita are really what makes it shine, everyone is so friendly. Even the street dogs are lovely to interact with. 
  In our group of about 20, everyone most people did get sick for a day. That is unfortunately the way with the Norovirus, as soon as one person in a group has it, it will likely spread through the whole group. It's way worse on cruise ships, just google: cruise ships and Norovirus. 
  This was our second time visiting Sayulita for over a week at a time. And one gastrointestinal sickness isn't going to keep is away. That being said, if you live in fear of discomfort for 24hrs this isn't for you, in fact, maybe Mexico isn't for you.

659884271.name: Be careful!
659884271.author: a TripAdvisor user
659884271.reviewBody: I have just returned from my 5th trip to Sayulita.    11 out of the 13 of us became pretty sick with stomach, diarrhea, and vomitting.   I believe they are doing something with the sewage and sanitation.    I\'m not sure if it was from swimming in the ocean (where the drainage is taking place) or the water is just really contaminated??   Several got very sick after eating at eateries we frequent.  It\'s almost a week since we\'ve been back and some people are still complaining of stomach issues.   I started taking antibiotics, the followed by probiotics..     Just be careful.

659731291.name: Sayulita Cute but be aware
659731291.author: a TripAdvisor user
659731291.reviewBody: Really cute town but look out for the infrastructure water and sewer. We really liked Sayulita fun music nice down town but the smell on the beach and around there and the contaminated sea water at the main public beach that no one tells you about was too much for us. It\u2019s bad and be very careful. So sorry \ud83d\ude10

659683601.name: cutest little town but become violently Ill
659683601.author: a TripAdvisor user
659683601.reviewBody: We visited Sayulita a few years ago for a day trip and I loved the small town. We decided it might be a fun place to have our wedding, so we took a \'research trip". My fiance and I both became violently Ill our second night. When we finally made it back to town we were speaking with others who also got sick, even someone from the North side of town who got sick twice. We didn\'t even go into the ocean. The Dr. was also running out of supplies and was treating 4 other patients in our hotel. He said he has never seen it so bad. We will not be having our wedding there and will not be returning until the sewage situation is fixed.

659613189.name: Had my wedding here and loved it!
659613189.author: a TripAdvisor user
659613189.reviewBody:
I love Sayulita! We stayed at Villas Rana Verde. Rented a property across from the north beach and loved it. Barry was great to deal with. Lucia the cook and Dinora the planner were fabulous! 

As far as the town goes there is a bug going around half of us contracted food poisoning or Norovirus from a restaurant in town (cafe artist) or a purple breakfast place (left before the bridge) coming into town. 13 out of 20 for varied amounts of time. This didn't wreck our trip/ it didn't come from the ocean or the air. It's a bug and it's Mexico. My new husband have been here for 10 days and were sick for 12 hours. Last year we didn't get sick at all, sanitary conditions have improved since then and will be deal tr with by the end of the month. Come to Sayulita. Or stay away and be scared so it stays the way it is. 
The people are fabulous, the food is incredible and it's incredible but I'd your scared we don't want you anyways.

659311791.name: Sad situation - charming town but stay out of the ocean!
659311791.author: a TripAdvisor user
659311791.reviewBody:
We have been going annually to Sayulita for family vacations from 2004 to 2012.  Just returned from our first trip back in a while.  The town is still charming, much more bustling and has a lot to offer.  

We would typically spend all day at the beach swimming and surfing while always staying at different and unique rental homes.  We would do this with other families and friends and always were huge fans.  We started to see the impact on the town in 2011/12.

On this past trip, after surfing one day and my wife swimming in the water - we both became awfully sick.  We take all the normal precautions when eating, drinking and using tap water, etc.   

You'll see the main river flowing into the beach that is currently being dredged and small creeks from the south side of town.  These are flowing with untreated sewage that you can both see and smell, unfortunately.

I have been to Punta Mita the last few years and surfed la Bahia and la Lancha.  The local boat captain said, "....whatever you hear about the water in Sayulita.....it is 5x worse".

It is so sad but until the town figures this out, the quality of experiences there will continue to fall.  I will definitely NOT go back to vacation although I will certainly go into the town for a night for dinner/drinks if staying in Punta Mita.  Even the increased 'seediness' (more kids in backpacks selling crappy weed and cheap coke) we witnessed at night was not such a big turnoff.  The health factor is, however.

658857984.name: Funky town with a great beach atmosphere.
658857984.author: a TripAdvisor user
658857984.reviewBody: Casual, almost hippie, atmosphere, with lots of young people, surfing, boogie boarding, etc. Some interesting local shops and a number of casual restaurants.  A great way to spend a day by yourselves or with the family.  I would not want to stay there, but still a fun day.

658094682.name: Fun, Exciting & Relaxing
658094682.author: a TripAdvisor user
658094682.reviewBody: Our family has visited Sayulita beach for many years.  Great place to learn how to surf or boogie board.  Great swimming.  You can get massages on the beach for a reasonable price.  We rent chairs & umbrellas from local venders, because we like to read & take naps to the sound of the surf.  Will return next year!

657652761.name: Coarse sand and smelly
657652761.author: a TripAdvisor user
657652761.reviewBody: I have heard much about Sayulita over the years so felt a visit was in order. Took the bus from Nuevo Vallarta to see this quaint surfing town but a bit disappointed. Compared to Bucerias and NV the beach sand was coarse and hard on the feet (we walked over 45 minutes to the north) but at the entrance from town to the ocean the air was smelly with sewage(?) . The town itself was busy with people as we had chosen the market day but had i to do it over....probably not.

657152387.name: Not Good
657152387.author: a TripAdvisor user
657152387.reviewBody:
Was really looking forward to Sayulita Village so booked a trip. Then I read the sayulita reviews which did not paint a pretty picture but thought these people are not being careful or are to fussy. In hindsight I should have listened and I hope you take this as an honest review based from someone whom has done a fair amount of traveling. So people it’s bad, very bad. 
1) Sewage: The rumor is true you will not go a day without getting a good smell of raw sewage. The good thing is that they are putting in some infrastructure but it’s a long ways off from being under control. 
2) In our party of three two of us got sick. Lucky we had antibiotics for bacteria so it was dealt with quickly but I’d hate to thing how we would have felt if we didn’t have medication. Note we are very careful with what we drank and ate. Something to note is that the only one that didn’t get sick is the one that didn’t go in water very much. 
3) Beach is stupid crowded. 
4) Noise: Construction is everywhere so trucks with poor mufflers and squeaky breaks running none stop on dusty roads. Motor bikes and quads. Peaceful it is NOT!!
5) Vendors on beach are not stop. Every two to three minutes. 

Basically, don’t do it. It is not a holiday you want to spend your money on. You will regret it.

657113014.name: great place
657113014.author: a TripAdvisor user
657113014.reviewBody: great beach and vibe to this place, nice to wander around town and beach,we had no problems with sickness as some say , choice of food and restaurant , maybe , but we had no problems at all , and in the evening street performers and music everywhere , NICE

656628833.name: Wedding
656628833.author: a TripAdvisor user
656628833.reviewBody: Just recently returned from a wedding in Sayulita. Please be aware of Sayulita Illness. 80 % of 79 people that attended fell ill with different forms of the Norovirus. It was such a beautiful ceremony and so unfortunate that so many that COULD actually attend were not feeling well. Beware, be wise, and go elsewhere !

656414927.name: Beautiful
656414927.author: a TripAdvisor user
656414927.reviewBody: We took a Cab to Sayulita Beach for the day and had lunch on the Beach. They had the Best Quacamole and it did not cost us a fortune and the atmosphere was very relazing.

656411595.name: Decent beach, too crowded
656411595.author: a TripAdvisor user
656411595.reviewBody:
Nice beach with decent size waves, a good break for beginner surfers.

It's a little short and quite dark brown sand, so not the most beautiful beach in the world,  however the vibe is great.

I didn't like how many rental places, beach "clubs" and boats were on it. They really took away from the natural beauty.

Not a lot of vendors, that was nice to see.

656112587.name: Love Sayulita
656112587.author: a TripAdvisor user
656112587.reviewBody: great surfing town, lots of shops. Lunch on the beach is a must. Great specialty wine store was what brought us back

656071233.name: Sorry -  Don\'t come here
656071233.author: a TripAdvisor user
656071233.reviewBody:
Beautiful Town and Gracious People

Multiple Health Issues - Driven by too many people in an area without good sanitation

10/12 people sick for most of the 7 day trip.  Never again.

655483304.name: Beautiful beach, fairly busy
655483304.author: a TripAdvisor user
655483304.reviewBody: It\'s a busy beach as compared to Bucerias, but the Sayulita is a small village with a small downtown area. We never had trouble finding a chair and umbrella to rent.  Vendors and restaurants provided lots of options for refreshments and snacks. Boards can also be rented, with instruction for those wanting to play in the surf.

655067076.name: Sayulita has reached its tourist mecca end
655067076.author: a TripAdvisor user
655067076.reviewBody: Too many visitors now and much too millennial \'cool\' vibe for my liking. The smell of urine and human feces doesn\'t help. Zero available parking if you have a rental car. \nHighly recommend the area to the North about a thirty minute drive -- La Penita de Jaltemba. Cheaper, more authentic Mexico experience, less people, beaches not as crowded, cleaner water and better surfing just north of La Penita in Chacala.

654877284.name: EVERYONE IN OUR GROUP GOT TERRIBLY SICK!!!
654877284.author: a TripAdvisor user
654877284.reviewBody: We just visited Sayulita earlier this month and the entire group of 11 people including young children and elderly became extremely sick with a stomach virus (norovirus) which apparently is rampant in Sayulita due to the pollution and dirty ocean water. I spoke to several locals which told me they do NOT go anywhere near the ocean and just saw a Mexican article ranking Sayulita as one of the top 5 most polluted beaches in Mexico (you can find it on Google). Apparently Sayulita grew too fast and it does not have the adequate infrastructure or water treatment plant to handle it, so there is literally "fecal matter" washing out into the ocean. I could smell "sewage" while out in the ocean surfing...I do not recommend anyone going to Sayulita!

654842506.name: Sayulita has health issues
654842506.author: a TripAdvisor user
654842506.reviewBody: If you stay in Sayulita for more than an overnight you will most likely get sick!Water issues, ocean issues.Overbuilding beyond its capabilities to handle these issues.The locals don\u2019t swim there!\nThey need some expertise to go in & find the reasons for illnesses that set in to most  visitors, even the well  traveled as we are.\nThe Mexicans may be happy when all the Tourists are gone.

654585435.name: Won\'t be back
654585435.author: a TripAdvisor user
654585435.reviewBody: Sewage flowing in the ocean. At 1 point we counted just as many peddlers as beach goers. It\'s a shame as we\'d heard it was a great place awhile ago. We didn\'t get sick but I honestly think we were lucky not to.

654567475.name: Sayulita - Enter at Your Own Risk!!!
654567475.author: a TripAdvisor user
654567475.reviewBody: We just returned from 2 weeks in Sayulita.  Only 3 out of THIRTY PEOPLE did not get sick.  A three year old is currently with a doctor here at home being diagnosed.  Many of our group got sick more than once, with about a dozen getting sick on the plane or once we arrived home - with nausea, vomiting, diarrhea.  Sayulita even took down one of our group who lives in Mexico year round & has for years, so this cannot be passed off as "traveller\'s diarrhea".  My 4 year old, after evacuating his entire body, could not eat or even hold down water for days.  His sickness so far has lasted 5 days although he is now starting to improve.  We were all very very careful - only bottled water, no salads/raw vegetables in town, washed what we bought for our vacation rental with Microdyn, almost constant hand-washing, etc.  We will never, ever EVER go back to Sayulita.  Even at a beach that wasn\'t the town beach, there were "brown bubbles" in the water.  So disgusting.  During the walkthru of our vacation home upon arrival, they even included a spiel about how a lot of people get sick in Sayulita and here\'s the doctor\'s number and location of the hospital.  Like seriously?!?!  There should be a TRAVEL ADVISORY for this god forsaken place.  We knew beforehand but it was too late to change our travel plans & we were a large group.  If you can cancel - do it!!

653918832.name: A surfers paradise
653918832.author: a TripAdvisor user
653918832.reviewBody: The beach was clean and chairs and umbrellas for rent available. The venders as with everywhere walked the beach. There are quaint restaurants on the beach.

653791424.name: Not a sleepy surfer town
653791424.author: a TripAdvisor user
653791424.reviewBody: We went to Sayulita because we heard it was a little surfer town.  Well, it was a cute town with a lot of upside, but it was very busy, touristy and there were no waves to speak of (or "surfing").  The beach was extremely busy with locals and travelers not into the all-inclusive scene.  The locals and their children were non-stop on you to buy something.  It was good to experience Sayulita, but we were looking for something more quaint and relaxing.  We have been to Bucerius a couple of times before, and this just seemed like Bucerius on crack.

653785355.name: Do not visit Sayulita! Cancel now.
653785355.author: a TripAdvisor user
