653785355.reviewBody: We arrived to Sayulita early this week and almost our entire group is sick with norvovirus. All of us have eaten at different locations - mostly eating at our vacation property, used bottled water, and have taken measures to stay healthy. The town is filthy and there is raw sewage flowing into the sea. You\u2019ll be shocked when you smell the sewage for yourself. You\u2019ll be even more shocked to watch the stink flow into the ocean. The stench is overpowering. We spoke to a local who warned us to stay clear of the ocean. A child in our vacation complex screamed \u201cwho else has diarreah?!\u201d If you have booked a vacation to Sayulita, cancel it now. Take the hit. It\u2019s not worth it. The town doesn\u2019t seem interested in cleaning up the mess.

653374938.name: Health Hazard!!... Recovering from a Sayulita vacation.
653374938.author: a TripAdvisor user
653374938.reviewBody: My spouse and I returned 5 days ago from vacationing for a week in Sayulita. Our bowels are just now getting back on line thankfully. I visited Sayulita 12 years ago. It was beautiful then. Sayulita is now a Bio-Hazard. I would strongly encourage people not to visit until this municipality has resolved it\'s SEPTIC CRISIS. It is not acceptable to market Sayulita for tourism until reasonable health standards can be proven. The contamination of Sayulita\'s river, beach and bay with black water is not a new phenomenon and it certainly has not been corrected. Sayulita has lost it\'s "magic" and should lose it\'s "Magical Mexican designation" as well. \n     As a tourist I would be willing to monetarily support the remediation of Sayulita septic infrastructure with say a tourist tariff or an accommodation tax. I am not naive to the fact that as a tourist I am partially responsible for this community\'s crisis. The tourism industry   however must be held accountable for creating a sustainable economy that doesn\'t jeopardize the health of a local ecosystem.

653153503.name: Sick norovirus
653153503.author: a TripAdvisor user
653153503.reviewBody:
Got a very very strong Norovirus in Sayulita.

Like everyone explaining it. 
It’s going around for years. 
A lot of tourist. A big sewer problem, black waters goes in the river, the river goes directly to the beach.
Virus infect people/ water /dust and so on. If you talk to restaurant they will show you a paper with instruction on how to get rid of the virus with bleach (the scent passing by villa amore).
I told myself « if there is people in the water it must be safe » worst thought ever.

Won’t go there again.

653119227.name: Noro Virus Outbreak
653119227.author: a TripAdvisor user
653119227.reviewBody: Sayulita is a lovely, beautiful town with incredible charm and beauty. However, due to a lack of sewer and water infrastructure, it suffers from chronic and ongoing outbreaks of NoroVirus. We came with a party of 30 and 25 fell ill within the first 2 days in Sayulita. After conversations with local people and research, it was clear that the culprit was not bacterial food poisoning, but NoroVirus. Furthermore, it is clear from research that this is an ongoing problem. There is a water and sewage infrastructure project underway to remedy the public health issues in Sayulita, but be sure to do research before you visit and do not bring young children, vulnerable adults. Our hunch is that the infamous \u201cSayulita Sickness\u201d that is discussed ad nauseam on Travel Forums is not predominantly caused by bacterial food issues, but chronic NoroVirus outbreaks.

653066259.name: Great Beach
653066259.author: a TripAdvisor user
653066259.reviewBody: Sayulita was a lovely place to visit. I only wish they had a good gym to work out in as it was hard to run on the pavement. Beautiful location and great weather.

653018869.name: Sayulita Disaster Stay Away
653018869.author: a TripAdvisor user
653018869.reviewBody:
Here is a reality check so you want the facts here you go...I wish we knew this before.
We arrived on Mexican Holiday weekend for 12 days...Sayulita is not prepared to handle the mass crowds. The infrastructure of town is just not capable of basic standards of 
living and the city was totally overwhelmed for 3 days.
The sewage system is absolutely disgusting. Do not let anyone tell you that it 
is fixed. The river which divides the town is also the sewage path which flows
right into the ocean where everyone swims and surfs. 
To get the to the "safer" beach area north of the river you have to cross a small wooden
plank over reeking stench human waste filled river water flow. This is 3rd world plus. We would not venture into to the water especially after hearing all the people who were getting sick.
The town people are friendly. However so many restaurants have most tables 
right on the street. Cars are going by within inches of your table, street dirt & dust, car 
fumes in your face while eating. 
Maybe 20-30 year olds like these conditions but for most people we spoke to this is not what is expected. We left the town 3 days to escape the dirt. One day to San Pancho and 
2 times to Bucerias where conditions are vastly improved and beaches safer to 
swim in. 
Should also mention, poverty is very evident with countless families on street asking 
for money and also coming up to you at your table when eating in a restaurant.( Vendors
also hounding you every 5 minutes everywhere!)
Dogs everywhere on the loose,dog feces on street and barking all night long.
If you are staying anywhere near the area of YAH-YAH cafe there is 
a donkey farm nearby and they HE-HAW all night long. That along with 
roosters cockadoodling all night make sleep a  huge challenge.
We did find a few spots where we had nicer dinners that we felt we would not 
be sick from eating food. However when you think about the sewage and water system
and general sanitary conditions it is not surprising that even with all our precautions
we got a stomach bug.
There is more but I think the message is clear.
We will not return there even if we won a free trip. Think very hard before planning
anytime there.

652809938.name: Was a nicer place in the Past
652809938.author: a TripAdvisor user
652809938.reviewBody: I went there 6 years ago. What a beautiful little town back then with pristine beach and surfers from all around the world.  Now...well things habe changed.  There are blocks and blocks of merchants selling stuff everywhere.  The beach is now controlled by beach chair moguls out to gouge you for a seat. The place is crawling with merchants on the beach....every 10 seconds someone is trying to sell you something.  The smell of the sewer floing into the ocean stinks.  They being Sayulita are working on a project to correct this.  Would I go back. Absolutely not

652739909.name: A must in Riviera Nayrit
652739909.author: a TripAdvisor user
652739909.reviewBody: This is definitely a town to stop by if you are visiting Riviera Nayarit. Very colorful beach town with a lot of nice restaurants and boutique shops. No problem with locals, it a place full of good vibes. Recommended to visit Sayulita for the evening/sunset

651962265.name: Quiet get-away from Puerto Vallarta
651962265.author: a TripAdvisor user
651962265.reviewBody: Village atmosphere with wonderful uncrowded beach. Lots of great smaller restaurants.  You\u2019ll fall in love with the place.

651899499.name: Construction near hotel Amor - beach road blocks
651899499.author: a TripAdvisor user
651899499.reviewBody: If you\u2019re staying at the end of town near hotel Amor or boutiques hotel Amor and arriving via taxi be aware you road is blocked and you\u2019ll need to go around and over the hill and through the cemetery to the hotel. And from then on your walk into town will be an obstacle course of big holes, trucks, concrete etc. a flash light or cellphone light is necessary. Beach itself is fine. Not smelly or sewage like other reviews say. See photos of construction to hotels.

651723106.name: Perfect stay
651723106.author: a TripAdvisor user
651723106.reviewBody:
We had a great stay for about 4 weeks in January 
We defenetly felt in love with Sayulita, the north beach and playa de los muertos was perfect for a day at the beach with our 2yo daughter, it can be crowded during week end but nothing compare to our beach in south west of france during summer time. Amazing early surf every single day at the main break, longboard is really good there!!!!
I have been reading so many bad reviews on this beach about water quality but none of us got sick during this trip and we’ve been at the beach and on the water allday for about a month. 
We have been of course drinking water on bottle only. 
We had great food from vendors, cheap places and markets nothing happened.
Then we wash our hands about 1000 times a day ( especially our 2yo daughter ). 

There is a few rules to respect when traveling otherwise you will get sick even in Sayulita! 
Ps : there is big construction going on the sewage river, who stinks I agree but not worst than in Kuta Bali or ko Thao in Thailand... 
we will back soon for a longer stay!!!

651720135.name: Stinky by the River
651720135.author: a TripAdvisor user
651720135.reviewBody: We didn\'t swim at this beach which is too bad as the surf looked great.  Too many stories about people getting sick after swimming here due to the sewage running down the river and into the ocean.  This beach was also very busy.  We went to Playa Los Muertos instead.

651574428.name: So Very Sick!
651574428.author: a TripAdvisor user
651574428.reviewBody:
My husband and I came to beautiful Sayulita 3 days ago for a long awaited vacation. 
We have walked into town twice now and have noticed the dirty creeks running through town. Unfortunately AFTER booking, we had people warn us about Sayulita and the gut virus that is taking people down. 
We barely made it back to our accommodation’s this morning before my husband started running from both ends. He has been vomiting and has had diarrhea all day. We have not been swimming in the ocean and we do take care to wash all fruits and vegetables before cutting or eating them. 
We have been to Mexico countless times on both the East and the West coast and I have never seen anyone this sick before. We ate the exact same things yesterday so I know it’s not food poisoning. I do hope this ends soon because he looks like a wrung out dish rag. Hopefully I won’t be updating this post because I came down with the same. 
Sayulita has a lot to offer but we won’t be back until they sort out the sewage problem. Read the other posts. Sounds like several of us are in the same barrel. 😫☹️😠

651126327.name: Some issues with sewage
651126327.author: a TripAdvisor user
651126327.reviewBody: The north beach in Sayulita is where you want to sit although the main beach is always busy with surfers.  They are working on the sewage issue right now so I expect in another month there will be a vast improvement.

650903840.name: Great getaway
650903840.author: a TripAdvisor user
650903840.reviewBody: Upon arrival, you will be saturated with locals trying to sell you something. Once past all the salespersons the beach offers a wide expanse of sandy beach. Walk further from the entry points to pass the crowds for a more a quieter place to enjoy it. There\u2019s a smaller less crowded beach Bah\u00eda de Banderas, a five minute walk away if you prefer, that offers some very scenic picturesque views. Overall it was pretty clean but some recent road construction on the path from one beach to the other gave way to a lot of loose debris. I\u2019m sure once finished it will make accessing both a beautiful stroll along some picturesque coastline. The are many surfers, so take note, the waves can be an advisory to young swimmers.

649408592.name: Had To Cancel Yoga Retreat
649408592.author: a TripAdvisor user
649408592.reviewBody: I had high hopes for Sayulita and a yoga retreat hosted by Yoga Dicha. My husband and I are both surfers and it\'s a place that\'s been on my bucket list for years. My first night there (a Tuesday night) was filled with bass noise from the discotech and barking dogs until about 2am.. by approximately 4am the roosters started. There was no chance for sleeping and definitely NOT a serene place for yoga.\nThe beaches are dirty, ocean polluted, streets filthy with feral dog feces everywhere. After 1 night I canned my whole 3 week journey and lost over 4K in yoga training and accommodation fees.\nSave yourself some money, time, and a case of Montezuma\'s revenge from simply breathing the pollution here.

649153663.name: Sayulita is a must see for the PV area
649153663.author: a TripAdvisor user
649153663.reviewBody: Sayulita is a very inviting small surf town with long and sometimes busy beach.  It is safe and has many touristy stores.  You\u2019ll find good food, beach front beers, art stores, and very safe environment.  You will be pestered to buy things (any things) on the beach, but that is to be expected.  Drive here, Taxi here, in some cases you can golf cart here.  Don\u2019t miss this one, just for the sake of saying you visited!

648608036.name: Totally over run
648608036.author: a TripAdvisor user
648608036.reviewBody: Beach vendor every 2 minutes, smell of sewer in mid beach, noisy crowds at access roads. But gave it second star because the ATM worked. !\nCaution: Mexico Constitution Day is coming in early February, expect crowds......

648158194.name: Disappointing
648158194.author: a TripAdvisor user
648158194.reviewBody:
The central beach at Sayulita is small and over-crowded.  Be prepared to walk towards the east end of the beach for peace and solitude.  Saylulita Beach is a destination for surfers, which I knew ahead of time, but still was not prepared for the overwhelming numbers of people.  Unfortunately, the beach is not very clean and the smells are sickening. 
I do not recommend this destination.  The town is extremely busy, dirty, noisy and smelly.  It has been overtaken by street performers . . . bongo drummers, flame throwers, and a disappointing number of untalented musicians.  The noise is deafening.  
My sympathies for the local residents having to deal with the unpleasant cacophony made by buskers and tourists alike. 
My husband and I were both very ill during our stay in Sayulita, after eating in local restaurants.  We are experienced travelers to Mexico and this was the first time we have suffered with prolonged stomach cramps and diarrhea.  
We changed our flights and returned home early.

My advice?  Plan your Mexican vacation carefully.

647766042.name: Surf Town
647766042.author: a TripAdvisor user
647766042.reviewBody: Very cool little town to visit, lots of surfing going on, great little shops, and restaurants,  A bunch of pharmacies in this town where you can buy just about anything that requires a prescription back in the United States.

647657294.name: overcrowded and filthy
647657294.author: a TripAdvisor user
647657294.reviewBody: This place has been completely overtouristed - a victim of it own success. It is expensive. it was crowded and filthy. Granted, I was there at Christmas break, but I had been warned before I got there to not get in the water. There are so many people in Sayulita now, the infrastructure (ie sewage system) is completely overwhelmed. Too bad.\n I think San Pancho is now what Sayulita used to be - cute with good food and a hippy vibe. Go there.

647192059.name: Day visit
647192059.author: a TripAdvisor user
647192059.reviewBody:
We visited here from Puerto Vallarta by taxi after visiting San Pancho first well worth a day out you could also visit by the local bus 

Very busy as it was a Sunday with lots going on both in the town and on the beach lots of surfing with the associated shops 

Great value restaurants even on the beach

647044659.name: PACKED but decent surfing & surfing leasons
647044659.author: a TripAdvisor user
647044659.reviewBody: This beach was PACKED with people. Vendors all over the place and nowhere to sit. They wanted to charge us for a spot on the beach!  Well, maybe just for the umbrella, but damn. \n\nStill had a blast surfing though and ended up getting some glasses from a vendor.

646160758.name: You so have to go.
646160758.author: a TripAdvisor user
646160758.reviewBody:
Get there fast. Hippy surf village. 
Amazing place. Seriously. Go there. 
It was awesome. 
Surf lessons on the beach. 
Gorgeous water waves and sand. 
Really cool shops offering so many different items. 
Great places to eat. 
Great for a day trip or extended stay.

646133336.name: Beautiful & Less Busy Mexico Spot
646133336.author: a TripAdvisor user
646133336.reviewBody: We stayed in a house rental that was a bit too far out of the main town than we would have liked but still well maintained and wonderful views.  The town itself offered mostly traditional Mexican food fare and once a week a great farmers market.  Felt safe the beaches were for the most part pretty clean.

644342951.name: Love this place!!!
644342951.author: a TripAdvisor user
644342951.reviewBody: We had an amazing week in Sayulita. Thought we would stay there and go to other towns and villages but we stayed the entire week exploring fabulous restaurants, pristine beaches, warm ocean waters, colourful and fun scenery, great artisan shopping, historical sightings and the friendliest locals who obviously love where they live. A must on everyone\'s bucket list!  Must put an emphasis on how wonderful the restaurants are. A foodies delight!!!

644110859.name: Great day trip or center for surfers.
644110859.author: a TripAdvisor user
644110859.reviewBody: We wanted a day out of Puerta Vallarta and chose Sayulita. It is younger and more hippy than PV feels alot cooler and more "Mexico" though it is a tourist resort. The surfing beach is great, beside a beautiful graveyard which has all the colours and life  of Mexico even if it is for the dead...there is an interesting eco and yoga resort close behind, well worth hiking around her though some of the paths are blocked by land disputes...(cartels?)....lovely place...great vibe...pay a visit....!!! I would like to have stayed a night or 2 but it was our last day....

643891689.name: Contaminated water! Do NOT swim there
643891689.author: a TripAdvisor user
643891689.reviewBody: We went to Sayulita to surf on Thursday and there were about 100 people swimming there. Out of our group, the 2 of us that swam got violently ill a day later. The worst sick I have ever been in my life. What baffles me is that there was a lifeguard there and after googling it this seems to be a known fact so why are there no signs or advisory not to swim here? Ridiculous.

643845350.name: Sayulita Beach
643845350.author: a TripAdvisor user
643845350.reviewBody: This place is recommended for the whole family; but the beach is more for people that likes to surf or want to learn how to surf; the food is delicious and this is a place to forget the working routine and just relax.

643524848.name: Good beach for surfing
643524848.author: a TripAdvisor user
643524848.reviewBody: If you surf, this is the beach for you.  There were people learning how to surf as well.  Beach was busy but we managed to find a less crowded spot down the way.  Lots of vendors.  Parents tell your children to pay attention to the lifeguards when they are blowing their whistles.  There is no marina here so when a boat is coming in they try to clear the way in the water for them to come into the beach.  We were kind of clueless.  I have NOW seen reviews about raw sewage on beach.  Blech.  If you come to body surf be aware of the novice surfers behind you.  My son got hit by one\n

643444309.name: Nice But Noisy
643444309.author: a TripAdvisor user
643444309.reviewBody: It\u2019s January  3 and this is our second night and say later. We\u2019re here until January 12. I think the town is super cute. The beach is not.  The beach is very dirty and full of vendors and tourists. We walked down to the north beach which is pretty nice and isolated. I wouldn\u2019t touch the water at a Sayulita Beach. The sewage runs right into the water. This is our first time here and probably be our last time here. The only thing that I can really say about this place is it\u2019s the noisiest place I\u2019ve ever been.  Don\u2019t come here to relax and get sleep. It\u2019s 1130 right now and we are in a casita not far from town. And the music is so loud that I don\u2019t know how we\u2019re going to sleep. Fortunately our bed comes with earplugs.  There is music blaring from town. Motorcycles and quads up and down the streets nonstop. And they got these vehicles with huge speakers attached to them that drive up and down the streets advertising stuff. In the morning you get to wake up to the sound of roosters and dogs.   Will start going back to Cozumel.

643432003.name: Filthy and disappointing
643432003.author: a TripAdvisor user
643432003.reviewBody: Very dirty, crowded and stank like raw sewage. Got very sick along with at least half our group of 12.

643328475.name: Love the town, but beware of the ATMs and street food
643328475.author: a TripAdvisor user
643328475.reviewBody:
Just got back from a family trip to Sayulita.  The town is super cute with tons of great restaurants, shops, and nightlife.  A couple of things to note that I wished I knew before going:
1. The ATM machines are expensive to use. Approx $25 usd to make a $300 withdrawl (ouch).  Come with plenty of Peso and a wad of usd to make your life easier.  Also, important to know that the ATMs often run out of money over the weekends and then you are stuck.  
2.  The street food is prolific and smells wonderful.  Do not eat it!  4 of the 5 people in our party had late night street tacos and were violently sick for 3 days.  The 1 person who held out was the only one who enjoyed the trip.
3.  If in Sayulita during the winter busy season, be sure to make reservations for dinner.  Many of the good restaurants fill up early.  Also, be prepared to pay in cash, even if the restaurant takes credit cards.  The network went down several times causing last minute payments in cash.

My overall impression is that Sayulita is a charming little town with alot to offer.  However, it also seems that the infrastructure is not set up for the growth that has recently occurred.

643298119.name: Norovirus
643298119.author: a TripAdvisor user
643298119.reviewBody: It\u2019s back.   Many people getting it and we have 4 with it now in our group and more getting sick.  They need to clean up this beautiful little town.  Been here before but when this many people getting sick it becomes obvious from all the posts there is a problem.  All 4 were in the water as well and the 3 not sick have yet to go in the water.  Can\u2019t say for sure but seems to make sense

642781597.name: Overcrowded, overpriced, disappointing.
642781597.author: a TripAdvisor user
642781597.reviewBody: The beach as such has nothing special and it has become overcrowded with both turists and vendors. Some 10 years ago this place had a charm (also the downtown) , but that is no longer the case. Also, the infrastructure has become insufficient for the number of turists. If you are thinking of a relaxing beach try Bucerias or even other states further south.

642678529.name: Beautiful City-Amazing Beach
642678529.author: a TripAdvisor user
642678529.reviewBody: We visited Sayulita on the 3rd day of our trip to Puerto Vallarta. We got there early in the morning and had breakfast while the day warmed up a little. The center of town was so colorful and beautiful, I felt like I was in the middle of a movie! The beach was great too, perfect waves for surfers. Grab some chairs and settle in, waiters will bring you food and drinks all day!

642444551.name: Beautiful but we all got sick!
642444551.author: a TripAdvisor user
642444551.reviewBody: Sadly the town does not have the infrastructure to deal with the number of tourists visiting. 15 of  the 21 people in our group became ill over our seven day trip, likely due to the sewerage flowing into the ocean. Sayulita is a beautiful beach and town but until these issues are resolved I would recommend choosing a safer town such as Punta de Mita.

641859922.name: Messy,  dirty and poorly kept is not "charming old Mexico"
641859922.author: a TripAdvisor user
641859922.reviewBody:
I say this from a place of caring, and because I am Mexican, that messy, unlawful, dirty and unkept is not charming and is not the general state of a Mexican town.
I find it fascinating that foreign folks are so in love with Sayulita.  If you are a surfer, sure, probably this is a great spot for you. But I have traveled to other places in Mexico where the towns retain their history, culture and charm and that does not translate to unleashed dogs, ex-pats driving around and ignoring rules of the road, and worse of all, insufficient services such as water treatment plants.  
We walked around town and saw businesses needing to close because the city was pumping sewage out of drains in the middle of the streets, downtown! 
If you really need to go to a town with charm, history and culture, go to San Miguel de Allende, Oaxaca, anywhere in Chiapas.

641605984.name: Great beach
641605984.author: a TripAdvisor user
641605984.reviewBody: We spent many hours on this beach boogie boarding, people watching and walking. Our condo was about a km from the busy part of the beach. Would recommend Sayulita any day but this comment is going to stir the pot could definitely smell sewer at the mouth of the river!

641462905.name: Sayulita main beach is crowded.
641462905.author: a TripAdvisor user
641462905.reviewBody: Sayulita main beach is crowded but the north beach is not.\nBut the north beach have rough waves.\nNorth beach have also turtle release in some evenings and that very nice.

639620000.name: Sayulita Magic
639620000.author: a TripAdvisor user
639620000.reviewBody: It is a magical beach, walking through its streets full of color with salty aromas without so much heat is an experience that you can not miss. Do not bring a car, there are no spaces to park, comfortable shoes, the beach is full of vendors but they are friendly at all times. It takes enough money, there are ATMs and places to rent tables. \nAdri

638806770.name: Quintessential Mexican Beach
638806770.author: a TripAdvisor user
638806770.reviewBody: Yes can be crowded but find spots if you walk away from center.  Shops and restaurants pour onto beach.  Great surf.  Music and vendors for everyone.  Amazing views.  Just pick up after yourself and take care of environment.  We\u2019re all guests to beauty when it comes down to it.

638206862.name: Going To Sayulita Is A Must
638206862.author: a TripAdvisor user
638206862.reviewBody: A funky artsy surfer beach and community. You won\u2019t regret a day trip to Sayulita if you are visiting Puerto Vallarta.

636770064.name: Nice Area
636770064.author: a TripAdvisor user
636770064.reviewBody: Our boys wanted to surf. We went they tried the waves, we enjoyed and few drinks. Very busy weekend with a surf competition. Still enjoyable and great to visit.

636757617.name: Great beach to watch the waves
636757617.author: a TripAdvisor user
636757617.reviewBody: Enjoyed a few hours chilling on the beach and soaking up some rays. Local restaurant had a staff member walking up and down the beach taking food and/or beverage orders. Lots of local vendors stopping by our towel to share their wares and numerous surfers  bobbing on their surfboards waiting for the perfect wave. Was surprised the water was warm however the surf made it hard to swim. Good to jump in quickly and cool down and I enjoyed a little seashell hunting on the beach.

636374686.name: Great beach, pushy sales people
636374686.author: a TripAdvisor user
636374686.reviewBody: Sayulita had a great beach! Popular for surfing but has great food and shopping. Definitely have to bargain with the sales people, overall a great place to checkout.

636132951.name: best beach i visited
636132951.author: a TripAdvisor user
636132951.reviewBody: best beach i visited in a 7 day 7 different beach vacation. i\'ll come back to learn how to surf. getting crowded go there soon!

635438682.name: Water is CONTAMINATED with sewage -- you will get very SICK if you swim in it.
635438682.author: a TripAdvisor user
635438682.reviewBody:
Our ENTIRE family of 7 people and several friends all got violently ill immediately after swimming in the waters at Sayulita Beach.  Untreated sewage is running directly into the water right in the middle of the beach  -- you can see it -- and the surf is filled with bacteria.  This problem is widely known locally and there is a fight over it but no one is alerting the unsuspecting  tourists.

We have been coming to this area for years and love this region of Mexico.  We prefer to stay in the quieter town of San Pancho but come to Sayulita Beach because it has calmer waters for our kids to swim in.   They love taking surfing lessons here.  We never really minded the beach side concessions or the crowds.  We would spend some days on Sayulita Beach and on others escape to one of the many hidden beaches in this area to relax.

Before we travelled this year a friend warned us that the water on Sayulita Beach was making people sick.  We swam there last year with no incident so blew this off as an American being too sensitive to a crowded Mexican beach.  I wish we had listened.

We spent a nice long day taking surf lessons and then swimming in the waves.  Almost as soon as we got back to our rental house in San Pancho, sickness started hitting us.  First my son started sweating and vomiting.  An hour later my daughter, followed by our toddler, my wife, and my bother and sister in law.  It came on quickly and was terrible.  The friends we were swimming  all day with us also collapsed.  (None of us ate the same thing or even from the same place all day -- and our friends only met us on the beach.)   It was a nightmare -- just the worst sort of sick.

We soon heard from locals that this was happening to so many families, always right after they swim.   As soon as we started telling people who work in Sayulita what happened, they shared stories of watching so many people fall ill.  And that they wouldn't let their kids swim in the water on Sayulita Beach.

There is a river/waterflow that runs thru town and empties into the sea right in the middle of the beach.  You can see how dirty it looks (especially if you look at it in town) and it smells bad.

What we were told by several people  that everyone knows this is an issue and there is a big fight locally about how to handle it.  We were told that the water had been tested many times and is filled with dangerous bacteria.  That there have been multiple attempts to fix it and all have been bungled.  We were also told that there is a group backed by private industry from outside Mexico that wants to fund a new sewage treatment system but that is being blocked.  We heard a version of the same story from several people.

Whatever is going on, one thing is clear -- the water has bacteria, it is dangerous, nothing is being done to fix it, and no one is warning people. 

We will return to this area -- we love it -- but never to this beach.

635021775.name: Do NOT choose Sayulita - You WILL get sick!!
635021775.author: a TripAdvisor user
635021775.reviewBody: Don\u2019t vacation unless you want to get the novovirus. Most of our group got very sick! Water is seriously contaminated and non-food safe practices of most restaurants guarantees that within a day or two of arriving in this surfer dirty and muddy town, you\u2019ll end up with severe diarrhea, vomiting, cramping, headaches and fatigue. If you want to spend to holiday having to call the local doctor to come to your place to give you an IV with fluids and be in bed for part of your holiday, then this is your holiday destination. Please don\u2019t waste your money or plan a wedding or attend one here; especially if you have children. High risk that is completely unnecessary! Choose a safer city or resort to holiday in...

631293173.name: Beautiful and relaxing
631293173.author: a TripAdvisor user
631293173.reviewBody: Chilled place to experience a small town.  Tons of food, activities, shops and relaxing beach!  Rentals for chairs, table and umbrella reasonable price for an all day stay.

630718858.name: Cute and Colorful .
630718858.author: a TripAdvisor user
630718858.reviewBody: Sayulita is a great place to visit or to stay if going to Banderas Bay area. Surfing,shops, cafes and eclectic lifestyles are diplayed beatufilly in this charming town. You go  by bus from Puerto Vallarta  but is going to take awhile or taxi. Guided tours go to the town everyother day. However don\'t get to Sayulita before 11 am because  most shops open around that time. This time the main square was decorated with  Day of the death altars and look beautiful. Ask around for the monthly events in the area Totally worth the visit.

630695707.name: What a busy place
630695707.author: a TripAdvisor user
630695707.reviewBody: We drove from PV for the day .We were there on the beach within an hour .There was some road repaving . Sayulita Beach was beautiful . The water was warm and lots of people were surfing.

629222869.name: A great place to enjoy a margarita and watch the world go by...
629222869.author: a TripAdvisor user
629222869.reviewBody: My family spent a year here - surfing, body boarding, swimming, suping, etc... Great beach, great people, great food... don\'t miss it!

628606083.name: Fun but a lot of sellers
628606083.author: a TripAdvisor user
628606083.reviewBody: I enjoyed the beauty of the beach. Being able to walk through the cute streets and right out to the sand and water is wonderful. The only think I don\u2019t like is the people continually trying to see you stuff every 2 min.  Beach is nice

626614102.name: Do you boo boo!
626614102.author: a TripAdvisor user
626614102.reviewBody: As many times as I\u2019ve visited Puerto Vallarta, this was my first time visiting Sayulita. My boyfriend and I stayed in the romantic zone of PV and it was about a 40 minute cab ride to Sayulita. We had no plans once we arrived so we just got out and started walking around. I\u2019m so happy that we chose to explore Sayulita this way. We walked through the swap meet and through the markets. This little town is truly a gem! It\u2019s so colorful and chill. There are plenty of shops to check out, art galleries displaying art by the local Huichol people, and lots of murals on the buildings. There are tons of surfers there so expect a lot of white people. Some people don\u2019t like being on the beach with vendors who walk up and try to have you buy stuff- if that\u2019s you, don\u2019t visit. But if you like supporting locals and buying handmade goods then get ready to shop!\n\nWe loved Sayulita so much that we came back again the next day! We made friends switch some bartenders at a hostel and hung out with them for a while. Then we swam in the ocean for the rest of the day. If you go far enough along the beach, the sand is black with little gold flecks in it. I\u2019ve seen many black sand beaches in my travels but this looked like something out of a pirate movie! I actually filled an empty cup with sand and brought it all the way back to California!

624541383.name: Great vibe
624541383.author: a TripAdvisor user
624541383.reviewBody: The surf is really good here, so many cool bars and places to eat for all types of people. You can rent surf boards right on the beach too

622951065.name: Gorgeous
622951065.author: a TripAdvisor user
622951065.reviewBody: First off if you love humidity then go in September October otherwise avoid the rainy season the heat was uncomfortable! But I\u2019d go back in a heartbeat beautiful people, food, beaches, that chill vibe is just what we were looking for and the jungle is out of this world! Highly recommend and will be back!!

622871140.name: Fun Party Beach - Too Many Vendors
622871140.author: a TripAdvisor user
622871140.reviewBody: Fun times. Good food, great drinks and it\u2019s fun to watch the surfers.   There are way too many vendors and you have to say no 5-8 times before they will leave.  They will interrupt your conversation and put goods right in your face.  I get that they need to make a living, but less harassment might make the tourists buy more.

622475608.name: Beautiful beach!
622475608.author: a TripAdvisor user
622475608.reviewBody: Excellent and beautiful beach! Great for swimming, surfing and beach combing. Lots of places to stop for food or drinks. Lots of beach vendors selling everything you can imagine. Very clean and beautiful water.

621866813.name: Sayulita Beach
621866813.author: a TripAdvisor user
621866813.reviewBody: Great place to enjoy a day of fun with your family or just with your partner. The beach has people there renting beach umbrellas and you can eat there too! They have waitress from the restaurant nearby. So you can eat and drink almost everything your craving from you spot. Also people selling mangoes and chips.\nI really enjoy Sayulita. The people there super nice.

618003707.name: Drop out of life and come here
618003707.author: a TripAdvisor user
618003707.reviewBody: I kept expecting to see Charlie Manson pop out from a storefront.  The town is worn out, tired and very dirty.  Looks like those who sold it all in California set up residence.  Not hung about this place will make you come back...

615560977.name: Overrated
615560977.author: a TripAdvisor user
615560977.reviewBody:
Went to Sayulita with a group of friends.   We all live in Puerto Vallarta full time so may have a different perspective than a person who is visiting Sayulita as a tourist.  It's hard not to compare Sayulita to Puerto Vallarta since they are only 24 miles apart geographically but are worlds away in terms of service, prices and ambiance.

I found Sayulita to be dirty and smelling of sewage.  It is no secret that the water is some of the dirtiest in the area as the infrastructure doesn't support the rapid growth of the village.  Knowing this we definitely weren't going in the water.  As for being a surf town, well there were no waves to speak of.  It is low season and even with the oppressively hot and humid weather the town was very busy.  I can't even imagine how crowded it would be during high season.

The prices of everything in Sayulita were at least double what they are in Puerto Vallarta for the very same type of item or service.  I suppose its designation as a Pueblo Magico gives them the impression that it is alright to gouge the tourists.  I have been to several other Mexican cities that have the Pueblo Magico designation and Sayulita doesn't hold a candle to these places. Service and attitude of waiters etc was terrible.  The faux hippie atmosphere is pretty humorous. 

Taking the public bus from Puerto Vallarta is easy and it's a journey of about 1 to 1.5 hours at a current cost of 42pesos.

613441548.name: Fun day trip
613441548.author: a TripAdvisor user
613441548.reviewBody: We took a ride up to Sayulita while visiting the Nuevo Vallarta area.  The ride through the mountains was really nice.  The town is small and very tourist friendly.  There are lots of little shops and restaurants.\nThe beach was very busy when we were there.  It was covered in beach umbrellas.  It was easy to rent one.  The waves were fun to play in and the water was nice and warm.  There were people surfing just off shore and you could rent equipment or take lessons.  I had a massage right I the beach at a reasonable price.

611005280.name: Amazing little Mexican town!
611005280.author: a TripAdvisor user
611005280.reviewBody:
Sayulita is a hidden gem, we will definitely be going back!  My only recommendation is not to go during the month of July.  It was extremely hot and somewhat miserable to walk around in.  Although it is considered their rainy season, it didn’t rain once during the week that we were there which caused even more humidity.  The locals advised us to come back during October or November as those are the best weather months.  

Once in town, check out Barracuda (restaurant) and order the tuna tostadas.  They were amazing!  

Also, the margaritas at La Rustica, were so delicious and refreshing.  

There is also a lady (Pollo Yolanda) who sells freshly grilled chicken along with homemade rice, beans and salsa.  Perfect for a mid day lunch/snack.  

Overall, the food was some of the best and we truly enjoyed walking through all the little surrounding shops.  Definitely a place to visit!

609326480.name: Sayulita
609326480.author: a TripAdvisor user
609326480.reviewBody: Must come back it is a happy town perfect to relax, enjoy good company family & friends, good waves, good music, nice dinner, perfect for weekend escapes

608189321.name: Learn to surf Sayulita
608189321.author: a TripAdvisor user
608189321.reviewBody: First time to Sayulita and I was not disappointed. The swell was smallish and the water warm and I was able to get up on my board and ride the first wave under direction of my surf instructor. Would recommend learning here and with Sayulita surf school. It Was also hot as hell with 100% humidity during the day but umbrellas and fresh drinks were readily available. People I met were super friendly and there were some more upscale places to hang out. This is not a resort town. Small and roads are cobblestone but if you want some local interactions and can forgo an all-inclusive resort feel then this is the place. Hotel Piex is on the beach with a restaurant and bar below. My balcony was overlooking the beach and walked out to surf and swim anytime, including nights. Food and service there was great as well as at my other favorite in town which was all in walking distance,  La Rustica. Felt safe most of the time. You can get away with traveling alone here ladies.

605802246.name: Family
605802246.author: a TripAdvisor user
605802246.reviewBody: One of the best beaches on the Pacific coast, as busy or as quiet as you want if you walk a little further.\nSo much to see and do and not commercialised, perfect day out and want to visit for longer next time \u2665\ufe0f

601268876.name: Great Beach!
601268876.author: a TripAdvisor user
601268876.reviewBody: This beach is just great. It is definitely a happening beach. You can tell it is very popular and well worth it. The beach is clean and water is nice and warm. I came with some friends and my daughter we had a great time. Great place for shopping and learning how to surf! I hope you enjoy it as much as we did.

598589554.name: A corner of Europe on the pacific
598589554.author: a TripAdvisor user
598589554.reviewBody: A beautiful cozy beach with surfing for beginners. On the left a hill with palm trees and villas, and on the right several deserted beaches. A buzy little town with colorful shops ends with a few restaurants on the beach and a thick strip of beach umbrellas (for only a couple hundred yards) that reminds a bit of a Mediterranean beach town.

597989156.name: Nice beach, but water seems dirty
597989156.author: a TripAdvisor user
597989156.reviewBody: Nice beach but the water seems filthy and smelly like trash... We do love the city Sayulita though, it\u2019s very nice.

597648867.name: Beautiful Beach
597648867.author: a TripAdvisor user
597648867.reviewBody:
Took the trip from PV to this beach on recommendation from family who live here saying it should be less crowded than PV. Well, it was jam packed with people. 

However, the beach itself was beautiful. Didn’t know before hand but noticed the gold sand (like flecks) that make the sand almost shimmer. Amazing. Plus you can walk out quite a way from the beach and still touch. Aside from some seaweed, the bottom is pure soft sand. Water was very warm! I need to get used to the vendors (which are everywhere) trying to sell their wares. Gets old saying “No gracias” after a while. Ha

About an hour trip by bus from PV.  Also quaint shops and restaurants in the city.

594519026.name: Beautiful sunsets!
594519026.author: a TripAdvisor user
594519026.reviewBody: Nothing better than sipping a Margarita watching the sunset on this beautiful beach!  Miles of soft sand under your feet and gentle waves to cool down in! Great for surfing and paddle-boarding as well!

594279414.name: Brilliant town/ place to spend a day
594279414.author: a TripAdvisor user
594279414.reviewBody: Took a taxi from Neuvo Vallerto and back. A great little town, so colourful and vibrant. Enjoyed delicious tacos, looking around the street markets, little shops and massage on the beach. Could have easily returned here, or spent a couple days staying. It was so hot, make sure you take water.

594075007.name: Beautiful Gold Sand - Very Popular
594075007.author: a TripAdvisor user
594075007.reviewBody: This is a beautiful beach in a cute town. The sand rolling in the surf is filled with flakes of (fool\'s) gold creating a beautiful effect.\n\nToo bad the word us out though, the beach and streets were PACKED! There was basically no room left on the beach and the water was full of people. Everyone was having a great time, and the restaurants and vendors were great so if you\'re looking for a busy place to shop and eat you won\'t be disappointed. If you\'re looking for a quiet place to get away from it all, this may not be the place to go on a Thursday afternoon in July.

592759144.name: Beautiful town
592759144.author: a TripAdvisor user
592759144.reviewBody: Beautiful little authentic town! It\'s getting touristic but still has good vibes. Lots of stores and nice packed beach!

592032072.name: Perfect beach scene
592032072.author: a TripAdvisor user
592032072.reviewBody: Surf is gentle most of the time south side beach has few rocks and you can walk out 100 yards on a nice sandy bottom. Many choices for food and drink on the beach and vendors are polite. Beach chairs, umbrellas, surfboards and stand up paddle boards and lessons etc all for rent as well as a great spot for massages. My favorite area is down towards the fishing boats at a beachfront concession called Mi Chapparita   \n

591540256.name: Beautiful beach
591540256.author: a TripAdvisor user
591540256.reviewBody: Great beach for beginner surfers with several venues offering training. Drinks at the local bars were very watered down

590406950.name: Nasty and disgusting!
590406950.author: a TripAdvisor user
590406950.reviewBody: We heard so much about this wonderful little city so we decided to take a day trip up to Sayulita.  We drove in and it was crowded and looked like a busy little city.  We found a place to park and started walking around.  It didn\u2019t take long to smell the horror of the sewage.  Several times I almost puked from the smell.  People were in the water and swimming, digging in the sand all around the sewage river.  It was horrible.  We walked away from the sewer river and found loads of tourist traps.  It\u2019s was just nasty and gross.  If you want a traditional, adorable place to go visit, go to the little village Punta de Mita..... not behind the gates but the true village.  It\u2019s wonderful!  (They have the same sewage issue but on a much smaller scale and it\u2019s isolated to the Marina area and its not sent into the water like Sayulita.

590016351.name: Fun tourist beach
590016351.author: a TripAdvisor user
590016351.reviewBody: This is a busy tourist beach area. It is alive with bars, restaurants and trinket hawkers. Don\u2019t come here if you\u2019re looking for serenity. Come here if you want fun, action and food.

589956004.name: Wonderful Sayulita Visits - twice in one week
589956004.author: a TripAdvisor user
589956004.reviewBody: Loves Sayulita! Inexpensive cab ride from Vidanta and great little town - just like the reviews say. Our cab driver took us to San Pancho, Sayulita and Punta de Mita and back to Vidanta - spent 6 1/2 hours with us for 65 USD incl tip.

589827404.name: Beautiful Beach
589827404.author: a TripAdvisor user
589827404.reviewBody: We hung out at Coco\u2019s Beach Club. No charge if you by your drinks from them. Really enjoyed it. Boogie boards, surfboards, paddle boards, massages, hair-braiding, all available. Even oysters Rockefeller

589213022.name: Bustling surf beach
589213022.author: a TripAdvisor user
589213022.reviewBody: We spent two days surfing and swimming here. There was a slight whiff of sewage, but it looked like since there had been no rain, the arroyo with the sewage wasn\'t reaching the ocean. We had our shoes (crocs) stolen when we left them on the beach during an early morning surf session. I recommend burying yours in the sand. It was a fun place with lots of life.

588535621.name: Sweet surf beach but
588535621.author: a TripAdvisor user
588535621.reviewBody: Sweet surf beach but, by noon the vendors are out like flies.  Lots of places to eat, drink and shop! If we get back to this area we\'d still love to go back to Sayulita!

588418243.name: 1st trip to Sayulita,Mexico
588418243.author: a TripAdvisor user
588418243.reviewBody: Great little hidden surf town with good energy.Where the locals & tourists intertwine.Nice Bars,Restaurants,inexpensive hotels.....U basically get a GOOD BANG for your buck.

587734605.name: year round surf
587734605.author: a TripAdvisor user
587734605.reviewBody: The one place with year round surf.  Great for beginners/intermediates.  Know the rules, don\'t get in the way of the locals.  If you\'re swimming stay to the left side of the bay out of the rip tide.

587675091.name: Fantastic waves, chill people, and great food
587675091.author: a TripAdvisor user
587675091.reviewBody: Sayulita is somewhat of an unknown compared to several other towns in the general area, but our family thinks it is a hidden gem. During the weekdays it is not very busy and has all sorts of great food from the best fish tacos we ever had to red snapper on homemade corn tortillas. My wife said the gelato she had here is her new favorite. Great waves, perfect for surfing or just jumping into. People are very relaxed and it just adds to the atmosphere. Taxis are everywhere when you are ready to leave, but remember to take pesos when you go. Many shops do not take credit cards and the exchange rate is not usually the best at the shops, but the stores are definitely worth looking through.

587296939.name: Chill surf artsy town with fun boutiques and a great beach
587296939.author: a TripAdvisor user
587296939.reviewBody: We stayed in Punta Mita and I\'d heard Sayulita was a great place to take a little day trip. I totally agree! We had a rental car and easily found the town from basic directions we\'d be given. We went on a weekday in early September so there were plenty of people out and about, yet it was easy to find parking and figure out where to head in town. It\'s clearly a favorite vacation spot for lots of people- there were golf carts going through the streets, open air restaurants, and a great feeling of everyone ready to play/hang out. First we stopped at a super cute little boutiquey shop with jewelry, clothing, and home decor kinds of things- Corazon d\'Hafa. I have a favorite pair of gold plated earrings I found for a reasonable price. We walked through the festive streets- fun chill vibe with a big market going on, flags strung across that made for a great ambiance. Then we headed to the beach area which is very happening. Tons of people out surfing, hanging out at the beach, walking around. We stopped at el Break cafe and bar for margaritas. I loved the outside seating area amongst some big palm trees with large fabric pieces hung for shade. Blissful break! There were lots of peddlers coming by selling things so we had to say many times no thank you, but they weren\'t overly aggressive and we were able to sit and enjoy our drinks. We also ended up with a really fun woven hanging chair from one of them that our daughter loves in her room! So overall a productive and just really fun day in a unique chill town.

586034972.name: Family Vacation
586034972.author: a TripAdvisor user
586034972.reviewBody: I feel in love with this little town. Plenty of tourists walking around so you won\u2019t feel like you are the only tourist there. I highly recommend to bring your Hydro flask wiled with ice and a towel to dry the sweat of your face. Walking around the shops is ideal to have Pesos small bills would be best.

584886603.name: Chill out place
584886603.author: a TripAdvisor user
584886603.reviewBody: Spent afternoon here, beautiful views from the beach, just simple and laid back atmosphere, street vendors don\u2019t bother me they are only trying a earn a living they are not rude just say no thank you, lovely painted little shops down nice little streets very quaint, if we had known how nice it was going to be there we would of gone all day, about 30 minutes in taxi from Riu Palace Pacifico much cheaper than going through tour reps

583617882.name: Super chill town and gorgeous beach.
583617882.author: a TripAdvisor user
583617882.reviewBody: If you ever find yourself on the west coast of Mexico near the bay and Puerto Vallarta make the time and go to Sayulita. It\'s a small surfing & fishing town right on the coast north of the bay. There are a bunch of great little bars and restaurants to check out on the beach and in town. Spend the day or a couple of hours and stroll through this cool little town tucked out of the way.

583474384.name: Don\u2019t miss the sunset
583474384.author: a TripAdvisor user
583474384.reviewBody: Make sure and grab a spot on the beach for the sunset!! Best spots are down the north end of the beach either at a little beach bar or a little hidden gem with swings to chill out and watch the sun go down

583403694.name: Wonderful!!!
583403694.author: a TripAdvisor user
583403694.reviewBody: Sayulita, Mexico is a wonderland...teeming with excitement, wonderful food, accommodations, entertainment, culture, beautiful beaches!

582860447.name: Very charming town!
582860447.author: a TripAdvisor user
582860447.reviewBody: Beautiful and hot during the day. Relaxed and easy atmosphere with the locals day and night. Everyone is out in the evening for great food and entertainment. Very charming look little corner of the world!

582730406.name: Great beach but so many vendors
582730406.author: a TripAdvisor user
582730406.reviewBody: The beach is ok.. not overly clean but the waves are nice for surfers. There are so many vendors though. Between trying to relax/read and takes pictures of my husband surfing I kept getting interrupted every 30 seconds by someone trying to sell me something. And then the same people over and over again. Not really very relaxing.

582230444.name: Beautiful But Dirty
582230444.author: a TripAdvisor user
582230444.reviewBody: The sand was like a dark gold colour. The view from the beach is amazing! It\'s all very breathtaking to look at. The sunset is truly worth it! walk to the far right side of the beach (left side for surfer terms). But it is a little dirty on the beach and I was hesitant to go swimming because of the fact that they are struggling with sewage run off right now.

581823510.name: I would say a must see if in the area!
581823510.author: a TripAdvisor user
581823510.reviewBody: Sayulita is a great little surf hippie town with tons of shopping and restaurants.  The main city beach is something everyone should see.  Lots of surfers and paddle boarders riding the small waves.  My wife and I bought a few beers at a local store and sat on the beach people watching.  Lots of vendors and not really the cleanest beach, but it was a terrific way to enjoy the sunshine and enjoy the day.  We arrived around 10:30am and it was definitely getting busy so arrive early.

580384467.name: Center of the action
580384467.author: a TripAdvisor user
580384467.reviewBody: Took my first surf lesson here, waves were great for a beginner. It does get crowded, so grab a spot with an umbrella and a chair early in the day. Also amazing place to watch the sun go down and the real surfers do their thing.

580198531.name: To crowded .
580198531.author: a TripAdvisor user
580198531.reviewBody: Almost no place in the beach to relax , to many vendors . food and drinks very expensive . No place to park it has lost its charm.

579630181.name: Great day trip
579630181.author: a TripAdvisor user
579630181.reviewBody: We came for a day trip. If you head toward the beach there lots of little shops and restaurants. Typical Mexican wares , but it\u2019s a cute little town to see.

579547801.name: Little beach town
579547801.author: a TripAdvisor user
579547801.reviewBody: We went on a day trip to this beach and it was fabulous. Had great restaurants that were on the sand and offered good Mexican dishes like tacos and burritos and fresh fish. The waves were just right and you could surf or Paddleboard.\nYou can rent paddle boards and surfboards. It wasn\u2019t too crowded and the beach had lots of families and young people. The town itself was very busy with lots of opportunities to shop or to stay over. We want to go back and stay a couple days. It\u2019s a great place to get away too.

579334222.name: Surfing like Hippie
579334222.author: a TripAdvisor user
579334222.reviewBody: Sayulita Beach offers something unique that maybe no other beach in the world has. And it is  it\u2019s unique real Mexican hippie atmosphere. You can rent there Surf equipment and start practicing. We do recommend bringing a cooling box, some water and a six pack of cold beer. You will never forget the colorful magic of this town!

579033860.name: Beautiful and Private
579033860.author: a TripAdvisor user
579033860.reviewBody: An amazing beach with incredible views and there were two other people on the entire beach.  What a way to spend the day!

578152688.name: Beautiful but crowded and polluted
578152688.author: a TripAdvisor user
578152688.reviewBody: So we went in the water the 1st night we got there and it was great... but when we were leaving the water and walking back to our place, stinky water and visible sewage was flowing directly into the ocean, about 50 meters from where we were swimming. This then led me to research about the beach and we realized this was a huge problem and folks getting sick. We stayed out of the water for the rest of the trip and got lucky... but most of the locals said that the situation had improved and they were working on it.... \n\nAlso pretty crowded, people trying to sell you stuff every where you went.

577500230.name: lots of vendors
577500230.author: a TripAdvisor user
577500230.reviewBody: The vendors are constant on the beach, which can be a bit much.  It\'s not a swimming area, as the surf is fairly strong, but great for surfing.

576964910.name: melow beach
576964910.author: a TripAdvisor user
576964910.reviewBody: had a great day on the beach, drinking excellent pina colada\'s and eating good food.\nweekend midafternoon sunny hot and great wave\'s. a surfing beach good time\'s

576343476.name: hip, surfer town !
576343476.author: a TripAdvisor user
576343476.reviewBody: we spent the day in sayulita, took a cab from melia resort. 700 pesos each way. we shopped, had the best fish tacos and beer batter shrimp ever!!! we would go back and spend a night or two next time! watched the surfers from nice restaurant on the beach. loved it

576295729.name: Swimming
576295729.author: a TripAdvisor user
576295729.reviewBody: Warned about swimming in the water.   Some in our party got sick after surfing.  A lot of hawkers on beach selling trinkets.  Not a place to relax

576264634.name: Surfers and anyones paradise
576264634.author: a TripAdvisor user
576264634.reviewBody: Such a beautiful beach and little town to boot whether it\'s a day tour a night / sunset tour you\'ll not be disappointed in Sayulita you\'ll see why so many Hippy\'s have settled in this area it\'s fantastic

575003283.name: Our favorite place on the planet ( so far )
575003283.author: a TripAdvisor user
575003283.reviewBody: Sayulita is our happy place, we have traveled there around seventeen times in the last 15 years or so. Stayed at several private homes, casitas and boutique hotels. Love the beach for walking and people watching, great local food, we feel safe there too. \nEasy flight to Puerto Vallarta and 45 minute cab north to Sayulita.

574934857.name: Very crowded
574934857.author: a TripAdvisor user
574934857.reviewBody: This is a beautiful beach however it is packed..i mean packed with too many people.  Its a nice place to visit and probably wonderful for kids and very young people, but I prefer less people.

574451520.name: BEAUTIFUL TOWN
574451520.author: a TripAdvisor user
574451520.reviewBody: Beautiful town and beach area. Great for shopping, eats or just hanging out. Good place to walk your dog. Hard finding parking.

574364705.name: Too crowdy
574364705.author: a TripAdvisor user
574364705.reviewBody: There are too many people at this beach. There is no room to swing a cat.\n It\'s not clean. \nWaves are big, it\'s ok only for surfers

573601577.name: So beautiful
573601577.author: a TripAdvisor user
573601577.reviewBody: So beautiful.  Paid $20 and got an umbrella and 3 chairs for the entire day.  Included waiter service for drinks and food.   Vendors came by, but were very friendly and not bothersome.

572883820.name: Beautiful people
572883820.author: a TripAdvisor user
572883820.reviewBody:
Clean restaurants
Beaches gorgeous
Lots if surfing and can fish 
Tours available
Golf carts for rent to get around town easier
Bathrooms are 5 pesos with toilet paper given to keep clean. 
Dogs off leashes
Beware some dog owners don't pick up poop.
A umbrella for like 1.5 hours was 100 pesos. With a small table.
I sat painted listened to waves.
Worth the drive or boat ride from Puerto Vallarta. Vendors come up but not as commercial more handmade things from locals to people from Colombia. 
Loved the live music locals sing for pesos.

572683036.name: beautiful beach, but Its on a tipping point
572683036.author: a TripAdvisor user
572683036.reviewBody: What used to be a heavenly view from any standing point is now slowly turning into yet another exploded beach, too overwhelming to go solo(although the amount of interesting people you can meet is amazing), yet definitely a place that you\'re bound to end up in if you go to sayulita.\nif you went to the main beach and did not enjoy it, I recommend going to Playa Los Muertos for a better experience.

572218412.name: The view is beautiful but the sand is dirty!
572218412.author: a TripAdvisor user
572218412.reviewBody: The water smells of sewage, too many crowds and the vendors are relentless.  Trek over to Carricitas Beach for a relaxing beach.

571695790.name: Too busy
571695790.author: a TripAdvisor user
571695790.reviewBody: Be careful of local holidays - beach gets totally overcrowded. Other much nicer beaches nearby. Also need to check regarding water quality as local water treatment plant can overflow when town is busy

571365055.name: Too crowded
571365055.author: a TripAdvisor user
571365055.reviewBody: I will recommend walking to Playa los Muertos in order to get a better beach experience. This is more of a local beach and gets super packed.

571126324.name: Oh the sewage!!
571126324.author: a TripAdvisor user
571126324.reviewBody: We just returned from a week in Sayulita for our Spring Break. This is such a lovely little town, full of activity and fun. The surf is perfect for beginners to learn. The beach is pretty and the place we stayed was wonderful.\nThe huge down-side was the sewage visibly pouring into the ocean. The smell was horrific. It is not surprising that 5 out of 6 of our party were sick throughout the week, and continue to be post vacation. \nI cannot imagine returning until this awful problem is solved. Had I known about this before we arrived, I would have changed our plan.

571125541.name: Busy Local and Tourist Beach
571125541.author: a TripAdvisor user
571125541.reviewBody: We visited this beach on a weekend and it was packed with people as was the small seaside village of Sayulita.   Parking is hard to come by and the seen is fun if you like people watching.   Be prepared for a throng of folks.  Their are several camps sights around the town.

570912096.name: Safe and easy place to learn to surf
570912096.author: a TripAdvisor user
570912096.reviewBody: This is a magical Mexican town with a clash of local and foreigner tourist, as well as a similar mix of those who call it home. The beach is a direct reflection, you have as many local businesses as well as street vendors. The surf is decent and the beach ranges from shallow sand which is easy for beginners to decent swell for more experienced surfers. It\'s great for paddle boarding and just lounging and relaxing.

570745607.name: Loved it....
570745607.author: a TripAdvisor user
570745607.reviewBody: Far cry from the million dollar condos and high rises going up in Puerto Vallarta.   yes there are hotels but no high rises.    Lots of people on the beaches but everyone is very nice.    The town is authentic, driving around with golf carts.  Very laid back.   sorry they are having issues with their sewage system.   Just remember where you are going and where you came from.   not everywhere is Canada or the US.    You are going the there for the experience, the people and the hot weather.....and I never got sick

570633182.name: Awesome beach experience
570633182.author: a TripAdvisor user
570633182.reviewBody: Everything you need is right there.  People come to you as you enter the beach and offer you inexpensive umbrella rental and food vendors are also there.  The surrounding area is full of restaurants and shopping and you might not see it all in a week.  Highly recommended.  The ocean was somewhat clean and there\u2019s a lot of rocks so you have to be careful.

570612329.name: Busy! But nice.
570612329.author: a TripAdvisor user
570612329.reviewBody: The reviews that say this beach is contaminated may have a small bit of validity. But, if you go just a little to either the south or north of the main beach it is fine. We had a group of 20 people and all swam in the ocean near this beach, about a 1/3 of our group got sick. I think the stomach issues have more to do with the water quality that many Americans experience in Mexico and less to do with the ocean water itself. That being said, there is a \'poop river\' in the middle of town, but it is easy to avoid. Sayulita is amazing and totally worth the visit.

569973812.name: Beautiful town!
569973812.author: a TripAdvisor user
569973812.reviewBody: Love this little surfers haven! The beach can get crowded so get there early to get the ideal spot. restaurants and bars on the beach are great!

569799182.name: Delicious BBQ ribs  with delicious pineapple slaw!
569799182.author: a TripAdvisor user
569799182.reviewBody: Get ready, because the ribs are really delicious at this open street grill.   They are served with a unique and tasty pineapple coleslaw.  The carne asada burrito also got high praise from our group.  The  meal is even more exciting if you eat on the slightly rickety second story deck because of the fun high vantage point and good mood lighting.

569494483.name: nice waves
569494483.author: a TripAdvisor user
569494483.reviewBody: We went to Sayulita beach while staying in town. There are some nice waves and there were lots of people surfing and leassons were available at several places. There are lots of bars/restaurants along the beach to sit at or you can rent a couple of chairs and an umbrella and have drinks brought to you. I also got a very nice massage by the beach for a reasonable price.

569323897.name: Busy but fun!
569323897.author: a TripAdvisor user
569323897.reviewBody: Busy but still fun.  Tried our hand at surfing and rented boards from a couple different establishments.  Lots of vendors but they move on quickly with a \u201cno gracias\u201d. Go to the northern part of the beach for a quieter time with calmer surf (better for swimming). I\u2019ve noticed a lot of comments about foul smells, we walked a long span of the beach and we never noticed anything other than normal ocean salty air smells.  I think people just like complaining. The beach was clean and vendors and patrons all do their part picking up any stray garbage. \n\nGood times, preferred the quiet northern part but all around a fun beach!

568985576.name: Feel the Energy!
568985576.author: a TripAdvisor user
568985576.reviewBody: Sayulita\u2019s main beach earns 5 stars for those who like the buzz of a high-energy crowd. If you\u2019re looking for something more laid back or want to put distance between you and the river, you\u2019ll find it less than 10 minutes in either direction, on the north beach or at Playa los Muertos. Be informed, take precautions or stay away, but keep in mind, it is we tourists who are taxing the Sayulita infrastructure. Human waste is part of nature, and we all share responsibility for managing it safely.

568679135.name: Save Sayulita from raw sewage!
568679135.author: a TripAdvisor user
568679135.reviewBody:
I fell in love with this town when I visited in March of 2018. It's the perfect size town for me. No huge hotels or condos and the streets are rustic. Food, culture, music and scenery are some of the best I've seen in Mexico. 
However, there is one major downside to Sayulita. The raw sewage problem. There is a stream of raw sewage flowing into the sea right beside the main beach area. Additionally, the smell wafts into the market area that is on the river bank. These poor merchants and their children have to breathe in the foul air all day. It's disgusting! 

Thankfully, the beach is wide enough so that you can go swimming in clean water. The north side is less busy. There is also the option to walk to Mal Paso, an uninhabited beach just north of Sayulita. 

Something must be done to resolve the sewage problem. Also, if you're going to the beach for the day, pick up any crap you brought in and if it's no inconvenience, bring some trash to the garbage on your way out. 

I would love to return to Sayulita but the sewage situation would have to change before I do.

568186303.name: Beautiful Beach Life
568186303.author: a TripAdvisor user
568186303.reviewBody: We heard a lot about Sayulita in the past and finally made it happen. Supposedly the tourism really took off about 15 years ago and now people feel that it has lost its charm but I guess it can be different things to different people. My wife and I loved it, and obviously a lot of people feel the same way. One of the taxi drivers told us that it made it on the list of \u201cpueblos m\u00e1gicos\u201d merely because of its charm and ability to attract people. Otherwise it does not meet the usual characteristics. Very entertaining to walk around and taste all the food carts and sit at the different restaurants for a great meal. The beach is beautiful although it was a bit crowded while we were there. Definitely a must see at least once.

568168200.name: Fun day
568168200.author: a TripAdvisor user
568168200.reviewBody: Loved our day trip just to see what it was about.  Great little town.  If you go, see the beach of the dead.  We had an awesome lunch at Don Pedro.... on the beach.

568082432.name: Sewage flowing in to the ocean
568082432.author: a TripAdvisor user
568082432.reviewBody: Very surprising to watch sewage being dumped in to the ocean at the beach. The smell of raw sewage was a turn off and from a sanitation perspective this should not be happening.

567781905.name: Hard not to love!
567781905.author: a TripAdvisor user
567781905.reviewBody:
The sand is golden and soft, the water is warm. Surfers beginners and experts playing in the waves, beautiful people around, good food and super afordable but... it wasn't perfect I was sad to find cigarette butts and beer caps in the sand.

I was told the locals and expats are working together to keep Sayulita clean. It's hard not to recommend a town that has much to offer and I really hope people learn to respect nature. 

Next time I'd like to explore other towns further north!

567566607.name: Great Place For People Watch
567566607.author: a TripAdvisor user
567566607.reviewBody: Sayulita Beach is one of the few public has large size crowd.  There are just very many different type of people like surfers, families, young people, which is very fun to watch.  \nThere are also many beach front restaurants offer shades and drinks. The food was just so so.. but good enough for snacks.  \nIf you are near by, worth couple hours of visit... unless you a surfer.

567545594.name: Mayhem
567545594.author: a TripAdvisor user
567545594.reviewBody: If your idea of the beach is hundreds of people stuffed in a tiny beach with raw sewage running into it this is the place for you.

566913664.name: Nice beach -but...
566913664.author: a TripAdvisor user
566913664.reviewBody: Be careful. Walk down the beach to the edge of town, not very far and you can see and smell the sewage being dumped into the ocean. Did not go in the water. It might get diluted by the ocean, but watch the tide and current to check conditions. Beach is great for sun and relaxation however I would not recommend water activity.

566904762.name: Day in the sun
566904762.author: a TripAdvisor user
566904762.reviewBody: We enjoyed sitting int he sun at  the beach and getting our feet wet walking along the sand.. Our hotel had lounge chairs, a bar and restaurant. If you don\'t have an umbrella you can rent them. We found the water a little cold, so we did not swim, but it was fun to splash in the surf.\nThe beach appears to be divided into tow parts. The main beach, which is busy with lots of umbrellas, vendors and people lying in the sun and the other beach. It is closer to the camping area with a few less people and vendors. You can still ent an umbrellas and enjoy the sun. But if you want drink on the north beach area you will have to walk to a bar or bring your own.

566754165.name: My favorite get away!
566754165.author: a TripAdvisor user
566754165.reviewBody: Been to Sayulita 5 times, never disappoints, always leave with a relaxed smile...the seafood, massages on the beach, music, craft cocktails...

566687688.name: sayulita beach
566687688.author: a TripAdvisor user
566687688.reviewBody: Lovely beach, lots of services, great waves, easy access, great night walks.but stay away from river.

566360299.name: Great people watching ...
566360299.author: a TripAdvisor user
566360299.reviewBody: The main beach is a wonder; beach itself is nice and the people watching is great ... can be busy busy at times; especially weekends ... lots of eating/watering establishments should you get tired of walking, surfing, paddleboarding or just plain people watching...

566187190.name: Too crowded for our taste
566187190.author: a TripAdvisor user
566187190.reviewBody:
I've not been here in the last 6 years so I was surprised to realize how crowded it's now and the number of restaurants, hotels and bars that have been opened since those days (we got a Tulum vibe now with the multiva ATMs in every corner)

The beach was full of people with rented umbrellas and there are also a couple of beach clubs and you'll get surf lessons offered

As we were missing old Sayulita we decided to visit "playa de los muertos" instead that is at walking distance from the main beach.

If you love crowds and music this is your place, otherwise find a quiet corner in the extremes, go early or try visiting the beaches nearby (San Pancho, Lo de Marcos, etc)

565921674.name: If you\u2019ve visited the beach you will understand
565921674.author: a TripAdvisor user
565921674.reviewBody: The beach, in a short distance, provides you the youthful surf scene to the relaxing quiet pace on the north end.  Regardless of mood, atmosphere- an enjoyable day can be found.

565873280.name: Beautiful Beach
565873280.author: a TripAdvisor user
565873280.reviewBody: Sayulita is a great place to visit / stay while in Mexico as it is not touristy, and you get a good flavor of Mexican culture

564940659.name: Sayulita
564940659.author: a TripAdvisor user
564940659.reviewBody: We were in Sayulita for  three weeks and enjoyed it very much. The food and service in the restaurants is great and we did not get a bad meal except at the beachfront bars. We found the service to be poor or non existent, food to be mediocre and drinks to be watery. At one bar north of the river the drinks were so bad we just left them. I got food poisoning at El Break. There is a little bakery on Delfines street. We found the pastry to be half raw  and with practically no filling. For good pastry go to Bolangerie on  Calle Jose Mariscal. There is  good place to get Empanadas almost right door. Away from the beach we went to various resteraunts and always had good service and very good food. Our favorite place was Tierra Viva. The best Huevos Rancheros in Sayulita.

564753016.name: Cried tears when I was leaving
564753016.author: a TripAdvisor user
564753016.reviewBody: Sayulita has the most beautiful beaches and the main beach is so fun to walk on with a view of the town and the ocean and the sound of the surf is awesome. I loved this beach so much.

564750368.name: Stay out of the water!
564750368.author: a TripAdvisor user
564750368.reviewBody: I\u2019ve been to Sayulita at least 10 times and the sewage/grey water flowing into the beach has gotten disgusting. The beach smells like sewage. Stay away until they get the sewage problem under control. Go to San Pancho.

564736828.name: Beautiful... to look at
564736828.author: a TripAdvisor user
564736828.reviewBody: Its a beautiful beach... with problems. There is sewage flowing into the water. Don\'t swim in it. Whether you do or not you\'ll still get Norovirus and puke for a day. Everyone gets it, even the locals. It\'s probably airborne. Don\'t go there if you are of low constitution or have infants. You\'ll get asked to buy stuff at least once a minute. Some of it you might want to buy. There are some good products for sale there. But it gets annoying after a while, especially once the musicians come around. But it is beautiful. Walk over to Playa de los Muertos for a more secluded and less poopy beach experience.

564577968.name: Beautiful beach - LOTS of vendors!
564577968.author: a TripAdvisor user
564577968.reviewBody:
This is not just another beach in Mexico. You can rent umbrellas, chairs, and mats from vendors on the beach close to town. There are many restaurants that you can sit and get a margarita and food at. Farther down the beach away from town there’s not as many people but there are still some vendors available to get these amenities from. The water is beautiful and the sand is really fabulous- no seaweed here!

However, there are many vendors out selling hats, purses, toys, jewelry, bottle openers, etc. that will approach you constantly trying to get you to buy.   To be honest I haven’t seen it this bad in other parts of Mexico - just be prepared to say “No!”a lot!

564462456.name: Crowd beach
564462456.author: a TripAdvisor user
564462456.reviewBody: This is a very popular beach.  Interesting sand with gold flecks in it.  Great waves for surf boarders.  The beach was a solid with beach umbrellas and people.

564074185.name: Good waves
564074185.author: a TripAdvisor user
