564074185.reviewBody: Great beach if you want to learn how to surf. Several surfing schools around. You can rent a palapa or chair or both if you want. But there is also place for your own towel if you dont want to rent any. Food and toilets available around.

563543409.name: Beautiful Beach
563543409.author: a TripAdvisor user
563543409.reviewBody: Really enjoyed my time on the beach. Loads of folks walking around selling different items but if you say no thank you they don\'t bother you more.

563194361.name: Beaches
563194361.author: a TripAdvisor user
563194361.reviewBody: Sayulita beach is more lively and busy. But not jammed by any means. The quieter beach is the North beach, just down the beach to the north a little bit. There are other beaches around Sayulita that are hidden and nice too.

562307490.name: Its a ZOO
562307490.author: a TripAdvisor user
562307490.reviewBody: If you like a lot of people and bunch of vendors ofering the same items over and over its a place to be.\nThe beach is nice lots of people not sure if its normal or not for february,lots of surfers.waves are not that great to surf,maby for the beginers its ok.there is quaet a few restaurants on the beach and side streats.\nOver all i would say visit if you want to learn  how to surf and just for a diferent experience.

562040104.name: Beautiful
562040104.author: a TripAdvisor user
562040104.reviewBody: Picturesque beach, many surfers fun to visit. Many restaurants located right on the beach where you could watch the surfers while enjoying your meal.

561814068.name: Surf city here we come.
561814068.author: a TripAdvisor user
561814068.reviewBody: Not a surfer but really enjoyed watching those who  were new to the surf or more seasoned riders.  Lovely beach .  Friendly workers who would set up a umbrella to avoid the hot sun.  Lots of surf lessons for the beginners variety of food and venders.

561584354.name: The best experience in our week
561584354.author: a TripAdvisor user
561584354.reviewBody: Pleasant afternoon and a good find, a co-worker has been going there for 15 years, cheaper everything, laid back, only  down is that Edwardo the taxi we hired was 5 times the price as the bus, and pestered us for a  large tip to make him happy. Take the bus one way and the taxi back, as  it is really more affordable.

561364188.name: Tourism has removed the sole of this town
561364188.author: a TripAdvisor user
561364188.reviewBody: Fabulous beach, good shopping but the sole of this hippy surf town has been crushed underfoot by the shear number of tourists in hired golf buggies whizzing around like lunatics.

561283455.name: Very Nice.
561283455.author: a TripAdvisor user
561283455.reviewBody:
We found the ocean water to be much cleaner here then by our resort. Some nice colourful shells up the beach. The sand is also very nice. 

It does get very crowded with people as many locals also come out to visit for the day. 

Lots of markets and good places to eat at. Some nice entertainers around as well. 

We enjoyed watching the Horses, Donkeys, Roosters, Dogs, and many birds around the area. It was sad however to see how skinny some of the animals are. We fed one dog what we had. 

We rented a golf cart, it was worth it for us even though it wasn’t cheap. Around 50.00 USD for about 4 hours. My sister injured herself and was in a cast so it was worth it for us so she could see much more and get around easier with having the cart.

561124006.name: Getting Too Touristy
561124006.author: a TripAdvisor user
561124006.reviewBody: We visited Sayulita about 4 years ago.  At that time it was popular but it has really grown.  We arrived early in the afternoon and the beach was so crowded we had a hard time time finding an open space.  Good for a day trip, it may be losing it\'s hippy vibe or I could just be getting older :+)

560321253.name: Bustling but Beautiful
560321253.author: a TripAdvisor user
560321253.reviewBody: Sayulita has become a very busy beach. It was wall to wall umbrellas with many vendors selling crafts, bracelets, food, and blankets. The water is pretty but there are a lot of surfers in the water so that disrupts the freedom to be in the water enjoying the waves where you want freely... It\'s still very pretty and fun!

560241513.name: Crazy busy
560241513.author: a TripAdvisor user
560241513.reviewBody: Good people watching but very busy and not clean. Go to San Pedro or lo de Marco for a nicer beach. \nUnlike scary reviews, we did not get sick in Sayulita and we were here a week. Had a good time.

559329528.name: Beautiful town
559329528.author: a TripAdvisor user
559329528.reviewBody: Enjoyed a tour of the area and its beautiful beach.  Surfers gravitate here.  Unique shops and artisans abound.

559322047.name: Sayulita sewer/ water infrastructure
559322047.author: a TripAdvisor user
559322047.reviewBody: Years ago, Sayulita was a fishing village. In a way, it is sad that the Internet changed that. The town is now a tourist attraction, designated and marketed as a pueblo magico.. The existing sewer/water infrastructure does not have the capacity to keep up with the demands placed upon the system by influx of massive numbers of tourists. Similarly, the town was never intended to be a "parking lot" for every tourist who could manage to drive a vehicle into it. Get real, people, you are all part of the "problem". Try thinking about how to become part of the solution.

559106433.name: Sayulita Beach
559106433.author: a TripAdvisor user
559106433.reviewBody: Interesting beach. North End has some riptides that make swimming a little scary. South End, however, has good conditions for young families, beginning surfers and sun worshippers. \nIf you want quiet, however, wrong beach. Lots of vendors.

559082442.name: Beach is beautiful
559082442.author: a TripAdvisor user
559082442.reviewBody: excellent vibe - cool shops just really busy over Christmas but still awesome - take surf lessons from the guys on he beach they are located in front he restaurant but hey guarantee - they are extremely good

558919789.name: A sewer
558919789.author: a TripAdvisor user
558919789.reviewBody: Sayulita has grown to fast and this has destroyed it. This was obvious as we got off the bus from PV and walked through the town and then down the side of a river of raw sewage and onto it\'s beautiful beach. The towns stinky untreated sewer runs into the ocean right in the middle of this amazing beach. Do not swim here if you value your health. \nDo go and see the town and shop.

558914603.name: Not a pretty beach, where we went the sand was extremely coarse and the ocean was strewn with many large rocks
558914603.author: a TripAdvisor user
558914603.reviewBody: I would never choose Sayulita for it\'s beaches, the Pacific side of Mexico doesn\'t have the beautiful beaches as the gulf side does

558464343.name: Sayulita norovirus
558464343.author: a TripAdvisor user
558464343.reviewBody:
I am very disappointed that there were no travel alerts or advisory regarding Sayulita lack of quality infrastructure that appears to be causing major/on going health issues for visit ours. I have always relied on trip advisor in the past.

I did love the town, but it is not a small fishing village as your site suggests. It is becoming very crowded. Noisy witgh bar music and GI tract disorders even with all precautions taken.

Ocean water quality is not guaranteed, dangerous at times.

Please address this somehow. My entire family became violently ill. We will not return there. And I will not depend on TA as I have in the past.

558308318.name: Sayulita beach is one of the most beautiful in Mexico
558308318.author: a TripAdvisor user
558308318.reviewBody: We visited Sayulita beach two years ago and spent a day under the umbrella and in January 2018 we spent two nights staying at the Hotel Amor overlooking the beach. The views are stunning. When we were there in November 2015, the swimming was serene and relaxing and we felt safe among the surfers. There are many places to eat in front of the beach and you can easily get massages. The folks selling jewelry and blankets can be annoying but they will leave if you simply say no thank you. The village has a boho-chic feel with many shops in addition to the vendors. There are several excellent coffee shops and restaurants around the main square.

557823740.name: Great Area
557823740.author: a TripAdvisor user
557823740.reviewBody: Great place, family friendly, good food but I would not get in the water there.  Most days you can smell it.  I would advise to go around the point and enjoy the water there.  The town is growing so fast they have been unable to keep up with the sewer issues.  I know they are working on it!

557448387.name: Fun Day Trip
557448387.author: a TripAdvisor user
557448387.reviewBody: We took a bus to Sayulita for the day for only $3 each from across from our hotel. About an hour and 20 min ride each way.  Fun town.  Surfing, massages, many blocks with unique stores and stalls.  Lots of restaurants & bars. Great hippie atmosphere.  Friendly place.

557195008.name: Nice town, average beach, decent food
557195008.author: a TripAdvisor user
557195008.reviewBody: Spent a day at Sayulita in early January. Drove up from Punta de Mita area (Los Veneros / W Hotel). The town is a typical Mexican town with various shops selling the standard Mexican fare. Some unique jewelry shops but no bargains here. The beach is average and somewhat crowded. Most surfers. No worth going for the beach alone unless you want to surf. The water cleanliness has always been in question however. (One trip last year the smell from the beach area was not good. Not sure if it was the water however). The town is a laid back town, 90% Americans or visitors, very safe. Good place to walk some, and sit in a bar near or on the beach and drink cervezas. (Beer and drinks are very affordable). Lots of people that are just getting away from it all or have already gotten away from it all.Young, old, hippies, non-hippies, etc. but all very nice. All the locals are very nice as well. Worth one trip to visit but I would not stay for more than a day or two, unless surfing at the right time of year. My opinion only. I you drive, parking could be an adventure. You will need to park on the streets several blocks from the main square so be ready for a short walk.

556384451.name: Beautiful
556384451.author: a TripAdvisor user
556384451.reviewBody: The beach was crowded at Christmas break but the shops and views are stunning.\nI am so happy to find this little place.

556304758.name: Average Beach
556304758.author: a TripAdvisor user
556304758.reviewBody: Very crowded and lots of rocks etc. Beach near PV and Bucerias is much much nicer. Depends on what you like. We spent no time here.

555738816.name: Dirty
555738816.author: a TripAdvisor user
555738816.reviewBody: We came by bus and were excited as we thought it would be a beautiful, relaxing experience. It just seemed to dirty and desparate with the unbelievable amount of beach vendors.

555729082.name: Busy
555729082.author: a TripAdvisor user
555729082.reviewBody: We didn\u2019t really like the actual beach in Sayulita. It was incredibly busy and it is pretty well known how dirty the water is......the main source of people getting sick here. Good surfing but not worth the health issues that are present.

555302374.name: Fun and Unique
555302374.author: a TripAdvisor user
555302374.reviewBody: Spent a day wandering around Sayulita town and the beach with some friends. It\'s a great place filled with cool and interesting shops, very busy and bustling.the beach was beautiful with lots of restaurants to chose from and activities to do! A must do day trio or more for anyone staying in PVR or Punta Mita.

555290705.name: Sayulita
555290705.author: a TripAdvisor user
555290705.reviewBody: We loved Playa Escondida, great quiet private beach and resort. Playa Sayulita is full of vendors selling chotskis and lots of hippies. Fun vibe but on the grungy side.

555019570.name: Wonderful paradise
555019570.author: a TripAdvisor user
555019570.reviewBody: Sayulita Is a very small town with very nice beaches to surf. You can buy  lot of typical Mexican handcrafts done by their inhabitants.\nIt\'s a very nice place to visit with the family or with friends.\nTypical Mexican food and wonderful beaches makes this place an obligated stop in the Pacific.

554976669.name: Sayulita is dead, overrun by hordes and hippies.
554976669.author: a TripAdvisor user
554976669.reviewBody:
Our first trip to Sayulita was in 2002 and our most recent was in January 2018.  It hasn't changed much over the years, It's still that quaint, funky little surf town but there are just too many people visiting on any given day for this to be an enjoyable experience any more.  

The beach is a mad house.  Surfing in Sayulita is a full contact event - I witnessed too many collisions to count, one of them being a glass longboard to the noggin of a young girl which opened up her scalp. There are too many vehicles in town, they're packed like sardines along the road.  When we were there, they had to open the baseball field to parking to accommodate the crowds. 

To their credit, the locals haven't become jaded and are, for the most part, still very welcoming.  Some of the hippie/boheme flotsam running around town are a little much but to each their own. 

I'd recommend moving about 10 minutes up the road to San Francisco/San Pancho and ruining that place next.

554856594.name: Sayulita town/beach review
554856594.author: a TripAdvisor user
554856594.reviewBody: We rented a one bedroom apartment on Marlin Street, a block south of the town square, spending 10 days in Sayulita. The trip was great, I would recommend it, lots of good points but you should be aware of some of the negatives. Our trip started on the 9th of January, next time I would go in the period, the last two weeks of January to the first two weeks of February. The first part of our trip was loud and busy. Visitors are a very mixed bag, singles in their 20/30/40s, young families and retired but fit couples. We fall into the last category. Bring ear plugs, the bars are loud and stay open til 3 or 4 in the morning. We could not keep our windows open. Spoke with younger singles and they complained as well. Restaurants and food are great and reasonably priced. Roads are dusty so any restaurants with outside seating, you might want to stay away from busier streets. Lots of traffic, golf carts and atvs everywhere. The beach is nice, big waves, lots of vendors. You can just walk further down the beach to get away from the crowds but most people do not. Surprised that the water treatment plant runs their out water right into the ocean in the middle of the beach area and the out water did not look too clean. As mentioned, we walked a lot and felt very safe [just be careful to look for dog poop], dogs run freely everywhere. Fun because you are a visitor but there are lots of locals to share food carts and sights. If I were mayor, I would increase property taxes and use the money to clean the town up a bit but still keep its rustic feel.

554637301.name: Formerly nice. Now very overrun. Not "sleepy" anymore.
554637301.author: a TripAdvisor user
554637301.reviewBody:
We've visited several times over the past 10 years, but this time was probably our last. As far as the beach goes, yes it is a scenic setting with rugged jungle hills in the background. Be aware this is the open Pacific Ocean so waves break short and the beaches generally have a noticeable slope and can be a bit cooler - not the greatest for swimming. The sand is generally larger so maybe not as smooth as Florida or the Caribbean, for comparison. Local dogs roam the beaches here (yes they are friendly and cute) but they leave poop so step carefully! Constant loop of vendors - they have nice things and are willing to negotiate on prices but sometimes I just want to lay down and relax for a few minutes :-) 

Most troubling is that the town infrastructure hasn't kept up with growth especially the sewer sytem. A recurring theme you will see on online forums is the reports of sewer smells and of murky water pouring from pipes directly into the town's river that pours into the ocean right next to downtown Sayulita. This causes the ocean near downtown to smell bad, and since I don't know if it is untreated or not, I avoided the ocean during my recent trip. It smelled and looked off to me, so I finally got into the water after walking about 10 minutes north to a more remote area farther from downtown.

I really enjoyed it before when it was a sleepy little town where you could disappear and witness a slice of small town Mexican culture. But it has now gotten too popular with the party crowd so you can't barely walk around town or find a place to eat that isn't mobbed with people. Restaurants are getting shady by adding items you didn't order or adding gratuity without telling you. And, I withdrew money from an ATM that charged (without showing it on the receipt) a $16 service charge, in addition to a ripoff exchange rate. Those are the types of tactics that drove me away from the bigger touristy areas in nearby Puerto Vallarta so it is sad to see those elements so prominent in Sayulita.

554594119.name: Sayulita Beach
554594119.author: a TripAdvisor user
554594119.reviewBody:
The vibrant seaside town of Sayulita could be a lovely place to spend a Mexican holiday, but its success comes with serious drawbacks.  
The town is booming and the infrastructure can’t keep up.  We stayed for a week and had a nice Casa on the hill.  Perfect except that there was construction noise every day all day.  Couldn’t enjoy our patio at all.
  We never swam at the Sayulita beach.  There is no sewage treatment!!  The river is full of sewage and it  comes straight out at the beach!!    Parts of the beach smell like a sewage plant in the great outdoors!!  And people are happily surfing and splashing in the waves meters away...
  We bussed to some nearby small towns every day to enjoy cleaner beaches.
  Can’t recommend Sayulita until they get this Health issue organized. Stay in another of the small towns up the coast.  San Pancho was nice but an older crowd.

554504537.name: Lots to Love in Sayulita!
554504537.author: a TripAdvisor user
554504537.reviewBody: I am a single woman traveler in my 60\u2019s and I just loved Sayulita! I spent 2 weeks here and enjoyed every minute, never got sick (as some warn) and took pleasure in every aspect of being here. Was it crowded? Yes! So enjoy the \u201cscene\u201d when you want to and book a hotel or house just a little outside of the action. I was a 5 minute walk away up on \u201cGringo Hill\u201d and my place was serene, green and almost always quiet (check out Xocotla). Then, I could choose between the main beach with lots of folks, beach vendors, perfect easy waves or I could walk 15 minutes south and be on a less busy beach (Playa de los Muertos) or walk 20-30 minutes south or north and be on an almost empty, wild and gorgeous tropical beach\u2014all beautiful places with jungle backdrops, and clean sand and water. I saw about 25 different kinds of tropical birds, the trees all over town are full of green iguanas, and you can see whales from the beaches or take a tour to the Islas de las Marietas and see whales plus snorkle and watch the blue footed boobies. Then, back in town, pick from dozens of mostly inexpensive fantastic restaurants, enjoy the bars and nightlife if you wish or head home to your quiet rental if that\u2019s what you wanted. Did I mention that the people are incredibly friendly and welcoming? And yes, there is some trash because this is a small place with a lot of folks in it, but they are mostly keeping up with it pretty well (especially compared to southeast asia if you\u2019ve tried that). Most shop and restaurant owners wash and sweep and make clean every morning the sidewalks and cobblestone streets in front of their businesses. Sayulita was a fantastic base for making day trips to Puerto Vallarta (fun but so happy to return to Sayulita) or north to the sleepier San Pancho (I went twice and loved the mellow beach scene there but appreciated all my options in Sayulita). Don\u2019t let any negative reviews convince you that Sayulita is only for young hippies! I happily look forward to my next trip to Sayulita!

554292347.name: Great boogy boarding
554292347.author: a TripAdvisor user
554292347.reviewBody: Spent a few days boogy boarding, it was awesome. The beach was great and so close to all the shops and restaurants that it made for a wonderful day.h

553599160.name: Sayulita
553599160.author: a TripAdvisor user
553599160.reviewBody: I\'ve been visiting Sayulita since 2004 and in that time I have watched this \'sleepy fishing village\' with only one payphone, to a town that has become more and more a popular tourist destination, with typical growing pains.  Reviews from even as recent as 5 years ago called it sleepy, but it really is more about day-trips and night life now days. yoga, restaurants, hiking, fishing, etc.  And if you visit during any of the national holidays, book a room on the north side of town where it\'s beautiful and a little more quiet.

553573935.name: Charming, quaint little beach town
553573935.author: a TripAdvisor user
553573935.reviewBody:
Wasn’t sure what to expect when I booked this trip to Sayulita. We tagged along with friends last minute so it didn’t give me time to learn and research about Sayulita so I didn’t know what to expect. Let me start by saying that my family and I loved this place. We stayed at a beachfront townhome at villa palmar complex and it was a 2 minute walk to the beach making it a perfect spot as I have a 2 yr old who loves the beach. The host had all the beach gear needed to hang out at the beach. Villa palmar also has a pool and a kiddo pool right in front of the beach and as you step down the stairs heading to the beach on your right you will find a beach bar called sirenitas and a massage tent. The drinks are really good and the massages run around 23 dollars for an hour. Villa palmar is gated and has security guard but all of Sayulita is very safe. It was also a 5 minute walk to Sayulita’s small town square making it ideal for a family as it’s much quieter from the night life. 

Make sure to exchange money before coming to Sayulita as restaurants/shops will give you 4 pesos less for every dollar. Things are also more pricey than in Puerto Vallarta but then again we were also there during high season. 

Our favorite restaurant hands down was Yeikame. Everything offered was delicious authentic Mexican food. All the staff was friendly, attentive and made sure you were well taken care off. We completely fell in love with this place and wish we had something like this at home. The cafe de olla was the best, chilaquiles were on point and the dinner plates were amazing. 

This town is very family friendly, has a great vibe, locals are super friendly/helpful and has everything you need.

553475788.name: Great beach - overrun with people
553475788.author: a TripAdvisor user
553475788.reviewBody: We hadn\u2019t been to Sayulita for a number of years and were shocked by the number of people there.  The beach is great and the break is great for beginners.\n\nUnfortunately the facilities can no longer serve the number of visitors creating problems with garbage, sewage and traffic.  Still ranks 4 stars though.

553238048.name: Fun beach with hippie vibe
553238048.author: a TripAdvisor user
553238048.reviewBody: Spent an afternoon here wave crashing and hanging out.  Lots of interesting and friendly folks. We went weekday and was quite busy

553068776.name: Busy but wonderful
553068776.author: a TripAdvisor user
553068776.reviewBody: We were there during Semana Santa, which is supposed to be their busiest week. Do bring your own blankets and towels, but we didn\u2019t feel it was worth it to pack our own umbrella or tent. There are vendors that rent umbrellas in case you want one for about $10 for several hours. Lots of other vendors who will offfer jewelry and hair wraps. We bought fresh oysters and smoked marlin off a vendor which was an amazing beach meal. Very easy to find restaurants along the beach as well. The waves can be a little crazy at times, so watch the little ones. The beach section toward the south seemed slower than the rest.

552553894.name: pretty setting with beach and jung;e
552553894.author: a TripAdvisor user
552553894.reviewBody: We stayed on the north end and liked the beach there as it was not crowded. The surf was calm and fine for swimming.

552233997.name: Dirty dirty beach town
552233997.author: a TripAdvisor user
552233997.reviewBody: Can\u2019t believe this is a \u201cpueblo m\u00e1gico\u201d is very dirty, infrastructure is poor, there is sewage smell everywhere, streets are muddy and you have to cross the sewage river in bare feet when walking on the beach! Food in town is great and there are really nice shops, however I would not recommend until more investment is made in that town.

551863460.name: Dissapointed. It is way over rated
551863460.author: a TripAdvisor user
551863460.reviewBody:
Just came back from visiting this town and Me and my Wife were really upset. It is not what we thought or were sold. 
Let me tell you that we are a couple in our mid fifties so our opinions are influenced by our age and our tastes that can be defined as picky. Maybe for a younger less demanding audience this might not be an issue. 
First this is a town that its infraestructure has been surpassed by far by its popularity. 
It is dirty and chaotic with local authorities doing nothing to put some order. 
There are no signs or directions. 
Parking is hellish and the few places to park abuse you. We were able to park in a dirty lot for 100 pesos and when we complianed we received the response that everything in Sayulita is expensive and that we were lucky to pay that because in other lots the rate is 150 ?!?!? Which is not advertised anhwhere so they basically charge you depending on how you look. 
You have to walk in the middle of the street as walkways are dirty, blocked or in terrible shape. 
Everything is more expensive than in other towns and in this dates you can hardly find a spot on the beach. 
It might be appealing to youngsters looking to party but not if you want something peaceful. 
It looked to me the same as Caleta a populous beach in Acapulco. 
In my opinion this town is suffering due to its own success and lack of planning.

551614900.name: Good Place
551614900.author: a TripAdvisor user
551614900.reviewBody: Pretty crowded these days, but a fairly young population which is fun. Definitely a diverse cultural place. A good mix of mexican, Canadians, Europeans, and folk from the US.

551033163.name: Ugh
551033163.author: a TripAdvisor user
551033163.reviewBody: The locals tell me there is actual sewage flowing into the ocean at the site we named "poo river". They are working to fix the sewer system currently but right now, it is not safe. We did not swim here. We did sit on the beach and enjoy the sounds of the ocean. It was VERY crowded. However everyone\'s behavior is very nice and despite the crowding it remains very pleasant. If you don\'t like vendors this will annoy you as they are constant. We actually found it nice that they showed us the local goods while we drank cold beer and lay in the sun. The vendors were polite and their prices were fine. We found a few beach clubs to sit/lay at and that was the way to go. Service and a good place to hang with a bathroom.

550949879.name: beautiful
550949879.author: a TripAdvisor user
550949879.reviewBody: As someone who has lived here forever, of course I find the main beach beautiful! It\'s more crowded than ever but I still love to go.

550768973.name: Don\'t Go to this beach!
550768973.author: a TripAdvisor user
550768973.reviewBody: Don\'t go to this beach!  I want it all to myself!  It\'s the best beach for surfing for all levels.  Shhhhhhhhh.....don\'t tell anyone.

550749910.name: Worst beach ever ? Probably !
550749910.author: a TripAdvisor user
550749910.reviewBody:
Please don’t come here, ever !
Forget the hippie legend, it’s just horrible, and so so dirty and ugly. 
The local river is contaminated by the brown sewage water and everybody seems to be getting sick swimming at the main beach.
The sand is dirty, it’s full of ‘campers’ everywhere (and not really glamping believe me)...run, it’s hell !

550647143.name: They killed paradise
550647143.author: a TripAdvisor user
550647143.reviewBody: Very polluted water, sewage river is running into the ocean. Vendors bug every 2 min so you can\u2019t sit down and relax. If you are coming here - I would not recommend going to this beach. We ended up going to La Lancha closet to Punta De Mita. No restaurants on the beach but clean. Wild mex do surfing lessons here so water and waves are really good.

550531648.name: Beautiful!
550531648.author: a TripAdvisor user
550531648.reviewBody: If you go for no other reason n but to help release Olive Riley turtles, it\u2019s well worth it!! The beach is gorgeous, the surf is radical, and the fun is unlimited!

550449296.name: Beautiful!
550449296.author: a TripAdvisor user
550449296.reviewBody:
We were worried before visiting Sayulita about the beach. It’s gets so many mixed reviews. Here’s some clarification.

1. It is not polluted - no one got sick, there were no bad smells 

2. It’s very busy yes, but if you walk up the beach a bit - there are loads of gorgeous spots to set up a peaceful scene for the day

3. Surf is rough - if you aren’t confident in the water you won’t swim. Period. I’m scared of large surf and enjoyed my book on the beach. My BF loves the waves and played in them everyday. Personal preference. 

4. Beach in cove by cemetery is nice and has smaller waves - I swam there and water was beautiful and warm 

5. Vendors. What I can say. Yes, a little annoying but they don’t bug you if you have your face in a book or are napping. A simple ‘no Gracias’ and they are on their way. 

6. Good people watching

7. Umbrella a must for some shade! 

Enjoy your trip - Sayulita beach is awesome!!

550315880.name: Sayulita mx
550315880.author: a TripAdvisor user
550315880.reviewBody: This place is a - - - - hole!!!!\nMexico\u2019s version of Coney Island without the rides and adequate infrastructure to support to hordes. The beach is filthy as heck, packed and the ocean not fit for swimming. The traffic, construction and dust is unbearable.\nMake sure to bring a mask. This town is sold as a quaint fishing village but it is an over run polluted dump. Spend your hard earned money somewhere else. If you do decided to go be prepared to get sick.

550094198.name: dirty
550094198.author: a TripAdvisor user
550094198.reviewBody: It\'s true, from what I can decipher. Sayulita Beach is dirtier than almost any beach in Mexico. Infrastructure has not kept up with the development in this area. Sewage treatment appears to be a problem and it is becoming evident on the otherwise beautiful beach directly in front of the town. Such a shame. I suggest taking the 10-15 min walk on over to Los Muertos Beach. It appears to be much cleaner.

549609574.name: Hidden restaurant gem
549609574.author: a TripAdvisor user
549609574.reviewBody:
Bahía Condessa is bit off the beaten track but worth the effort. 

Outdoor space is beautiful- staff very accommodating. Most importantly food quality is excellent

We enjoyed Caesar Salads , grilled octopus , fresh mahi mahi and paella 

One of our best meals in the week we spent in Sayulitas

Muy Bueno

549355992.name: A tale of two beaches
549355992.author: a TripAdvisor user
549355992.reviewBody: The southwest side of the beach, just off the city streets is as close as chaos as I can imagine, with vendors trampling over each other and more surfboards on the water than available sea, making swimming almost impossible. Blaring nonstop music and happy hours at the beach bars seem to make the area quite friendly to a younger crowd. The opposite on the north side, requiring the physical act called \u201cwalking\u201d but rewarding with a more quiet environment. The ocean has short waves helping to learn surfing but making the water less than clear. Generally sandy surfaces.

549206729.name: Viva!
549206729.author: a TripAdvisor user
549206729.reviewBody: Crowded, happy, vibrant beach. You can rent chairs and umbrellas, get a massage for $20US, buy food and drinks, watch turtle hatchlings run to the ocean, go surfing, listen to whatever music is playing, or just sit down among the people and dogs. Not for people wanting peace and quiet.

548757400.name: Waves
548757400.author: a TripAdvisor user
548757400.reviewBody: Nice, clean, very wide, surfer paradise, to much beach seller, good food, good service on beach, small town behind, easy going place.

547395689.name: Nice little cove, bigger waves, smaller beach
547395689.author: a TripAdvisor user
547395689.reviewBody: This is the perfect beach for the more active folk. Definitely a younger crowd here, less interested in sunbathing more interested in water sports. Lots of rentals but surfing is the main attraction here.\nThe beach is not as clean as the beaches in Vallarta resort area\'s, and a lot of dogs which really puts me off.\nA few beach restraunts allow you to have a beer and a snack while watching the surfers, but if you\'re looking to have lunch or dinner walk a few blocks into town for the best eateries. Stay off the main drag and you will find lots of cool hole in the wall restaurants more reminiscent of the small fishing village this used to be.

547060164.name: Would not return
547060164.author: a TripAdvisor user
547060164.reviewBody: This beach was dirty and crowded. I would never return. The highlight of this place was the town full of fun little mexican restaurants and great shopping.

545846567.name: Good times
545846567.author: a TripAdvisor user
545846567.reviewBody: Great beach, very easy to get to. Get an umbrella with chairs and you won\'t be bothered as much by vendors selling things.

545151205.name: Popular, and populated!
545151205.author: a TripAdvisor user
545151205.reviewBody: This is the main town\'s beach. We love coming into town from our outskirt hotel, but we don\'t love the beach as we don\'t love all the crowds! They have grown so much over the past hand full of years. There is often a charge to sit at a lawn chair (affiliated with the restaurant or hotel they\'re in front of) but you can still find a small area here and there you can just take your towel to. I\'d go to the locals beach if you want serene swim time. But if you\'re looking for a party, stay at this one! :)

544470822.name: Very loud and crowded. But a nice beach with access to food and drinks.
544470822.author: a TripAdvisor user
544470822.reviewBody: A nice beach with access to food and drinks. It was very loud and crowded when we were there, but you can find a place on the ends of the beach that are quieter. Also, there are some rocks or stones in the water at certain places so watch where everyone is getting in and get in there.

544445366.name: Smelly
544445366.author: a TripAdvisor user
544445366.reviewBody: There is literally sewage running out of the river and in to the ocean at the beach. I didn\'t believe reviews I read, but it\'s true.

544039781.name: Very quaint town that has lost its Lustre
544039781.author: a TripAdvisor user
544039781.reviewBody: This was my second time in Sayulita; This time around I could not help but notice the complete disregard for the environment. The town is filthy, there is garbage everywhere, and it is a non stop flow of plastic containers, styrofoam, and plastic bottles. There is no incentive or marketing to reuse, recycle, or reuse. We went for a walk on the beach on our last day and had to walk through the river flowing into the ocean full of raw sewage right on Sayulita beach. The town feels like  a Mexican Las Vegas. Environment aside;  the local artisan shops are lovely, the people are friendly and the food is excellent. Great surfing but the beaches and water are so crowded it is best to get out and enjoy it early in the day if you can. This was very sad to see especially coming from a eco-resort in Zihuatanejo one week prior that produces almost no waste.

544034517.name: Crowded, loud, dirty, smelly
544034517.author: a TripAdvisor user
544034517.reviewBody: What more can I say? We came here to spend a week at a beach/surfing destination and never felt comfortable walking barefoot in the sand let alone getting in the ocean. It was a huge disappointment. We regret not having done our research in advance.  Once we arrived we read the TripAdvisor reviews and were stunned! Thankfully we had great hotel accommodations that included a rooftop swimming pool. That\u2019s where we spent most of the vacation.

543699461.name: Sun or no Sun it\'s Your Choice
543699461.author: a TripAdvisor user
543699461.reviewBody: When you compare this beach to many beaches else where this beach is  wide open and clean ,many vendors come to you to show and sell their items clothes, jewelry kites and food.back to sun or no sun you can rent unbrellas, the recliners  and tables from some of the restaurants on the beach or you can rent single unbrellas from other people.

543667892.name: Surf\'s Up!
543667892.author: a TripAdvisor user
543667892.reviewBody: It is a fabulous area for surfing and paddle boards. Lessons are available. It is also very popular for swimming. There are many umbrellas and restaurants on the beach.

543239726.name: Super busy
543239726.author: a TripAdvisor user
543239726.reviewBody: Sayulita has grown so much, but the beach is still the beach.  Fantastic place to spend the day, learn to surf or just catch some sun.  Enjoy

543084379.name: Meh
543084379.author: a TripAdvisor user
543084379.reviewBody: Would not recommend, unless you enjoy getting bothered by vendors every few minutes. Would not spend more than one day here, just to say I did and eat on the beach. Find a more secluded beach to the north or south--worth it.

542043320.name: Filthy, stinky and dangerous for your health
542043320.author: a TripAdvisor user
542043320.reviewBody: The black water flowing to the ocean via Sayulita River at Plays Sayulita has apparently been a known issue among locals for years but they don\'t broadcast it widely. Its only when you step foot on the dirty sand, see the cloudy ocean and smell the river water that it becomes clear that this is not the place to swim or surf. Had I known this, I would have stayed in nearby Punta Mita, which does not have such infrastructure issues. \n\nIf you are staying in Sayulita, swim at Playa de los Muertos, just south of Punta Sayulita. It does not have the sewage outflow that has made Playa Sayulita one of the dirtiest beaches in Mexico.

541789669.name: Not a Sleepy Little Village Anymore
541789669.author: a TripAdvisor user
541789669.reviewBody: We started our visit with a trek from Puerto Vallarta.  After a slow but nice drive through the mountains, we exited the highway and headed toward Sayulita.  It wasn\'t long before we were in bumper to bumper traffic on roads that were very narrow winding through the town.  Upon finding one of very few parking spots, we headed to the beach for a beer.  Everything was very crowded and beach vendors were frequent.  We had our beer and left, wishing we had not made the journey.

541463478.name: The beach
541463478.author: a TripAdvisor user
541463478.reviewBody:
The beach is stunning and has golden flecked sand. The water is warm and the waves are too high so it would be good for learning surfing and bodyboarding. Although there were a few close calls with boards. Maybe they have to do some zoning so people don't get whacked with a board.
Now the reason why this place didn't get a five star for me was because the people selling stuff on the beach or driving me bonkers. If there is a place that's quieter that would be nicer.
They rent chairs and umbrellas in the front of restaurants but they do want you to buy a drink or two, maybe a meal. Approximately 250 pesos for that. Or free and you order 250 pesos worth of drinks or food. I found just renting an umbrella or umbrella or grass mat was between 150 pesos to 200 pesos.
Added bonus around dusk you can release Turtles. The nonprofit just asks for a donation. That was so fun and very touching.

539814486.name: A drinking town with a surf...and sewage problem
539814486.author: a TripAdvisor user
539814486.reviewBody: Sayulita, once a truly charming place has become a noisy crowded armpit. With the great restaurant scene you get late nite noise better suited to young drunken backpackers than families or anyone trying to relax. Seriously, the noise level at 3AM can make your ears bleed, and overflowing sewers turn the waves stinky but that\u2019s ok as long as business is brisk. I love the place but can\u2019t do it anymore. It\u2019s played, find the next place.

539781773.name: Pleasantly Surprised
539781773.author: a TripAdvisor user
539781773.reviewBody:
Very happy with our decision to rent a house on the beach, with three adult children.
Bring beach sandals, its rocky in places.
Lots of opportunity to rent beach chairs and umbrellas.
Many vendors walking up and down the beach.
Pretty respectful if you say no right away.
Easy walk to a variety of eating options.

539781549.name: Best beach around
539781549.author: a TripAdvisor user
539781549.reviewBody: Always love this place. Never stay there long enough. Its a big swimming & surfing beach, with areas for beginners and advance surfing.

539688895.name: Vacations
539688895.author: a TripAdvisor user
539688895.reviewBody: Nice an safe place beautiful beaches and wonderful hotel great seafood friendly people \nPlaning going back next year

539154865.name: Destination Wedding
539154865.author: a TripAdvisor user
539154865.reviewBody: I\ufe0f came for the first time when we decided to get married here after my uncle got married here 6 years ago and I\ufe0f absolutely loved it! There are many mixed reviews but after being in this cute little town I\ufe0f don\u2019t know how anyone can say anything bad about it! We will be visiting again very soon. We stayed on the north side of the beach which is best to have a golf car but loved that we had our own private beach area.

539125606.name: Nice Beach but Crowded
539125606.author: a TripAdvisor user
539125606.reviewBody: This is a pretty setting, but a very crowded beach. Assume, it is even more so during High Season. Worth one visit, for sure.

538290143.name: Very crowded
538290143.author: a TripAdvisor user
538290143.reviewBody: Party beach with big crowds. Chairs, umbrellas available. Tons of beach bars, music. Fun for the young party crowd.

537488004.name: Nice Average Beach
537488004.author: a TripAdvisor user
537488004.reviewBody: My wife and I decided to come here on mere curiosity, we read so many mixed reviews that we needed to find out for ourselves what was all the fuzz about. It\u2019s colorful little town, full of tourists (mostly Americans) and a lot of little shops, restaurants and bars. If you\u2019re looking for a place we\u2019re to grab a beer, you won\u2019t be disappointed. As for the beach, the south end, where all the beach front restaurants and bars are located is a bit to dirty and hectic for my taste. If you\u2019re into something more relaxed, you definitely need to walk north, many spots with no people around and much cleaner beaches. If you decide to skip Sayulita on your trip to Puerto Vallarta you won\u2019t be missing out anything anyway.

537007463.name: Avoid the Place like Nuclear waste!
537007463.author: a TripAdvisor user
537007463.reviewBody: Vendors that walk up to you in restaurants & bars, 8-10 times a night, trying to sell you something, anything! Dirt roads so badly eroded & full of pot-holes that they could swallow a small car. Rip off merchants renting Golf buggies for USD$40/day & then trying to extort money later claiming they had been damaged. And as I found out, after leaving, the entire place is controlled by a major drug cartel.

536962273.name: Beautiful
536962273.author: a TripAdvisor user
536962273.reviewBody: We made a brief visit to Sayulita Beach during an excursion we were on. What a great place, laid back and a stunning beach. You can take a surf lesson or a massage on the beach. There a friendly little bars and returaunts scattered all around the small town.\n\nWell worth a visit, we only wish we had more time to chill out longer.

536648319.name: Interesting Mexican village with a surfer vibe
536648319.author: a TripAdvisor user
536648319.reviewBody: We visited Sayulita for the day while we were in Mexico. The town is a quaint, dusty village with some lovely traditional art. There were several street vendors that added a touch of local color. I didn\'t find the street vendors to be overly aggressive, but earnest people trying to make a living. Apparently, this is a popular surfing spot.

535817453.name: Extremely dirty public beach
535817453.author: a TripAdvisor user
535817453.reviewBody: We saw tons of trash strewn everywhere and a strong smell of sewage at times. Did not invite us to want to swim in the ocean just beyond!

535527953.name: Reminds me of Thailand
535527953.author: a TripAdvisor user
535527953.reviewBody: Nice beach , bars, mellow waves, fish with lures off the beach, listen to music, get a massage, drink a beer, watch the construction run off enter the creek...\n

535248083.name: Great little side trip from Puerto Vallarta
535248083.author: a TripAdvisor user
535248083.reviewBody: I took a little day trip from Puerto Vallarta to this sweet gem of a village and beach. Highly recommend the quaint town for something different if you\'re staying in Puerto Vallarta. The beach is busy, lots of restaurants and bars but the town is a little bit of small village authenticity mixed with tourism. Still... not as busy and developed as the big towns and pretty photogenic, if you like that.

533218967.name: Rocky beach, lots of vendors
533218967.author: a TripAdvisor user
533218967.reviewBody: The beach was super rocky and we were bombarded by vendors. I couldn\u2019t get through one page in my book without someone coming by to try to sell me something. And lots of rocks as you go towards the water.  Tons of glass in the sand!!!

532751093.name: Nice drive through the mountains.
532751093.author: a TripAdvisor user
532751093.reviewBody: If not for the drive through the mountains which was nice and tropical and the stop at a wayside fruit stall for coconut and Jackfruit, it would have been a waste of time.\nThe town itself is very small and did not have anything special. The beach is dirty. We saw a tree which had a few iguanas resting on its branches which our driver was excited to show us.

529921878.name: Dirty Beach
529921878.author: a TripAdvisor user
529921878.reviewBody: The beach is very dirty due to river runoff right into the beach.  Too many people constantly bothering you to purchase their goods.  We were approached by the same people a minimum of 3 times over the course of 2 hours.

528396110.name: Big disappointment
528396110.author: a TripAdvisor user
528396110.reviewBody:
I was very excited to visit here from all the pictures and good reviews. However I can not believe it was the same place. 
What stood out most was the rubbish everywhere. It would be better described as a shanty town.
While on the beach watching my husband surf I was continually harassed by people trying to sell me junk. I lost count at 73. It became more desperate when women with babies strapped to them and small children stood in front of me and tried to sell me wrist bands. They were very persistent and even disturbed me in the bar where I was sitting. 
It is a filthy place and I would never return. 
The beach just smelt of poo. Lots of dogs running around and no one picking up after them. 
It's a shame as I can see the potential and it's great to be amongst the locals. No parking either just lucky if you manage to find a dingy back street to park down.

527930162.name: AIDS
527930162.author: a TripAdvisor user
527930162.reviewBody: Come on, sewage straight in the water by the surfers paradise, go and see yourself, all the locals know and none of them reaches the waters o even the sand...

523872543.name: Dirty and full of rubbish
523872543.author: a TripAdvisor user
523872543.reviewBody: Very different from previous years. Dirty beaches, dirty streets full of rubbish. So sad what "progress" has brought.

523273381.name: Lovely little surf town
523273381.author: a TripAdvisor user
523273381.reviewBody: The first time I visited Sayulita I quickly fell in love with the place. It\'s serene, hippyish atmosphere made it the most relaxing beach ever. I loved it so much that after visiting for only a day, I had to come back and at least spend the night. But, here is the thing, we came back on their low season. It rained the whole time we were there, many businesses were closed and would reopen in October. My kids, who were excited about the surfing lessons we promised didn\'t understand why I had liked it so much. The town was pretty much dead and not the lively little piece of heaven that I remembered. The weather was such that even the surfing instructor told us that he would only be robbing us of our money due to the perfect conditions not being there. So my recommendation is make sure to visit, but find out when their high season is, you won\'t regret it.

522692263.name: Very nice town
522692263.author: a TripAdvisor user
522692263.reviewBody: This is one of the coolest pueblo magico I\'ve ever been in. The main beach is not cool. But if you walk a little right behing the resorts by the cementery you will get to playa de los muertos which is a completely different story. I would come back again. I recommend AMAZING HOSTEL 300 pesos a night.

522272033.name: Sayulita beach
522272033.author: a TripAdvisor user
522272033.reviewBody: We visited this beach in August. The beach town is great and we liked eating at the seafood places. Overall the beach had a fun ambience. You can rent a table and chairs at the beach which is very convenient. The nearby restaurants bring you menus and drinks to the beach also convenient and they let you use their restrooms.  However the actual water was full of jelly fish when I went. I found out the hard way after I was stung. The local restaurant was nice enough to give me vinegar for my leg. Soon after I was stung many other beach goers also started getting stung. These jelly fishes cleared the people out the beach.  More unsuspecting people entered the beach later. We were informed that this is a normal occurrence at this beach, wish they  would post a warning somewhere.

522035252.name: Sayulita Nayarit
522035252.author: a TripAdvisor user
522035252.reviewBody: We went in the beginning of September. It is very beautiful and the people are very friendly however a lot of people will try selling you things such as toys, jewelry, food etc. We had these bracelets made there and they are of very good material. The beach water was warm which I loved and it said you can swim in the beach even in winter. The weather was around 80 degrees, but it was very humid and therefore there were many bugs.

521836760.name: FUN TOWN, BUT NOT SAFE FOR SWIMMING
521836760.author: a TripAdvisor user
521836760.reviewBody: The one-hour drive to Sayulita from Puerto Vallarta,, partly through jungle, is  winding and beautiful.  Formerly a small fishing village, this is now a popular beach for surfing.  The small town is lively and filled with colorful shops, most all of them geared for tourists.  No bargains, but some unique merchandise.  Pachamama is expensive, but great stuff.  . Plenty of small restaurants in town.  Don Pedro\u00b4s is a large one right on the sand.  Sadly, it is next to that restaurant where one sees "agua negra" running into the bay.  The infrastructure of Sayulita cannot support the sewage system, so the water is polluted.  The water doesn\u00b4t look dirty, but people are getting sick from ecoli.  Best advice.. enjoy the wonderful views... nice food and shops... and if you have to swim... go the the very north end of the beach where there are no restaurants or beach vendors.  You\u00b4ll be safer there re sewage problem.  If you go further north about 15 minutes, San Pancho has clean water.. but it is open ocean and there are rip tides and strong currents.  The town is much smaller and quieter.. a few shops and restaurants..

520610096.name: Lovely
520610096.author: a TripAdvisor user
520610096.reviewBody: Lovely beach in a great Town. The beach can be busy. Bars are close to the beach. You can rent a bed to make your stay more comfortabel. Even you can get a massage at the beach

518862304.name: Excellent Beach & Calm Sea
518862304.author: a TripAdvisor user
518862304.reviewBody:
We had travelled to Sayulita for the day up from Bucerias. We hired a driver to take us and to pick us up at an agreed time. After we'd had a wander around the town, we decided to spend a couple of hours on the beach.
The beach is located in a horse shoe bay with the western end protected by the steep cliffs which has buildings on the side. It is well protected from the wind and not exposed so the sea is relatively calm with only gentle waves - ideal for paddling in or swimming. It is popular with surfers too, and as well as numerous surfers who were quite experienced we noticed a group of beginners out on the waves too.
The sand is a nice golden colour, but it does seem to get darker as you head round towards the rocky end of the beach.
There were a couple of bars & restaurants on the beach too and what we appreciated was there were a couple of vendors from those bars who were going round asking if anyone would like drinks. This was a nice touch as they took your orders and brought your drinks out to you on the beach.

518667727.name: Paddle surf Beach FTW!
518667727.author: a TripAdvisor user
518667727.reviewBody: This place is absolutely awesome. It has tons of things to do like paddle surfing, tours to isla Marietas, snorkel, etc. The beach is beautiful, I\'m not going to lie, sometimes is crowded but I think it\'s normal. The town is beautiful covered with good vibes. Bars and restaurants all over the place. I totally recommend this town for the traveler that is looking for an small and fun town instead of big resorts type of beach.

516488380.name: Detour
516488380.author: a TripAdvisor user
516488380.reviewBody: My sister and I stayed at the Grand Fiesta Americana, but we wanted to explore a bit outside the resort. Somebody recommended we travel to Sayulita. So we did. To get there for cheap, you take the orange and white bus in front of the resort to downtown. Then you connect to another bus (Walmart) written in front and you go to where Walmart is located. From there, you take the Sayulita bus. It seems complicated, but it\'s not. The ride is about 1hr30, but worth it. Sayulita offers nice restaurants, shopping and little bars...and the beach of course. We are glad we went.

516121574.name: Different Sand
516121574.author: a TripAdvisor user
516121574.reviewBody: The sand looks like it has flecks of gold in it. People enter the water, and jump the waves. This isn\'t really a swimming type of beach. It is a surfers beach. The water was very clear and warm. Make sure you have pesos to pay for the shower to rinse off. The shower is at the entrance to the beach, at the end of the street where all those flags are.

515505321.name: Nice time
515505321.author: a TripAdvisor user
515505321.reviewBody: We spent a whole day in this little town. Beautiful beach friendly people. Great food yes we are coming back.

514412974.name: Not really for kids
514412974.author: a TripAdvisor user
514412974.reviewBody: Went for a day trip with our eleven year old. The main part of the beach is very very busy so went to the quieter end. Beach is dirty and littered in all areas. The quieter part of the beach has lots of rocks around two metres into the water. Very sharp so take necessary precautions - our son cut his foot quite badly. Paddle board hire is cheap and the sea was flat on the day we visited, so fine for us to paddle board on. but the waves had surfers on at the southern end. As ever all the vendors etc were very friendly and helpful. Scored as a two due to the litter and rocks-dont recommend for smaller kids but surfers are sure to enjoy.

512914223.name: Surf and Paddle Board Beach!
512914223.author: a TripAdvisor user
512914223.reviewBody: We enjoyed our day here.  We rented paddle boards and had a great time!  You can rent beach chairs which we did.  There were vendors walking around.  They were not too pushy. A simple no and they moved on.  There were people out and around but it didn\'t bother us.  It was fun to people watch.\n\nThe town was super fun.  A crafty, hippy kind of vibe.  Loved it!

508872466.name: Family visit
508872466.author: a TripAdvisor user
508872466.reviewBody: Sayulita is a good place to visit once in your life. The beach is very dirty there are razors and poop all over the beach so I don\'t recommend going in the water. There are lots of cute shops to go to and buy junk. \n\n

508826506.name: SURFERS BEACH!
508826506.author: a TripAdvisor user
508826506.reviewBody: The beach is ok........not the best but the Marietta Island  is another story!  We love you any way Sayulita!

508531313.name: Great Beach in the right season - don\'t go in the summer!
508531313.author: a TripAdvisor user
508531313.reviewBody: Sayulita is a beautiful beach with a great surf wave, fun beach bars and nice sand. I would not recommend to go here in the rainy season (meaning during the summer months). We were there in July and there were two problems: There are hundreds of non-swimmers standing in the first shore break, which makes it impossible to surf the lower wave. The sewer system cannot handle the daily downpour that happens in the afternoon. The water quality is very poor after it rains.

508227129.name: Too busy
508227129.author: a TripAdvisor user
508227129.reviewBody: Too much of a good thing, this town is out of control. Even in July, parking is non-existent and by the time we got to the beach it wasn\'t worth the effort. Not impressed. I guess the Pueblo Magico status is also a curse?

505479572.name: Beautiful
505479572.author: a TripAdvisor user
505479572.reviewBody: This beautiful unspoilt little town and beach is an absolute Jem.\n  A must visit if you\'re in the area.  The beach is gorgeous with surfers doing there thing, to people just relaxing in the sun.  After a hard day\'s sunbathing you can visit any number of great restaurants or bar\'s.

505244820.name: To crowded and $30 for mat and umbrella
505244820.author: a TripAdvisor user
505244820.reviewBody: Beach is now to busy and never a slow period anymore. Unless you bring own blanket, chair and/or umbrella you will have to pay $30 us for mat and umbrella

504223880.name: Nice beach with a lot of activities
504223880.author: a TripAdvisor user
504223880.reviewBody: Nice beach to hang out with a drink, beautiful view. Of course people want to sell you stuff every 15 minutes but other than that, it\'s a real mexican beach, right next to a super cute village.

504191631.name: Girls getaway
504191631.author: a TripAdvisor user
504191631.reviewBody: Vibrant and fun Mexican town! Loved the beach, the food, the bustling streets, with vendors & people from all over.

504046855.name: Ok beach
504046855.author: a TripAdvisor user
504046855.reviewBody: The wave are good for surfing but beach is dirty. People pick up the plastic everyday but it could be cleaner.  The south side is fairly crowded and the north side has strong currents

504022199.name: Day trip from Punta Mita
504022199.author: a TripAdvisor user
504022199.reviewBody: Sayulita has a small, artsy, beach town feel. We found some nice, original pieces, and had some great tacos too!

503867695.name: very charming little village.
503867695.author: a TripAdvisor user
503867695.reviewBody: We felt safe & walked everywhere.  If you have mobility issues, this area of Mexico could be tricky or difficult. lots of hills, brick & cobblestone paths.  Friendly people.  A very hippie vibe.  The food was good & cheap.  Too many vendors. Not a lot of A/C in restaurants or pubs.  Hot & humid in the summer. I have never seen so many dogs, most running around loose.  Sanitation was a growing problem, after it rains all the pollution just runs into the ocean.  In many places sewage runs into the ocean too.  The mountains are beautiful, it is not very crowded most days.

502510623.name: Fantastic little town for surfing and unique shopping.
502510623.author: a TripAdvisor user
502510623.reviewBody: Fantastic little town to visit for the day or stay the entire trip. We love to stay here for a three days during our annual trip to Puerto Vallarta. The surfing is excellent for beginners and you can rent a board and get private lessons right on the beach. The town has many great restaurants and is a fun place to shop. the beach is clean with soft golden sand. Parking can be a bit tricky but if you go early and have a small car we always find a spot. rent a house on Gringo Hill or along the playa. Many inexpensive and luxury options available.

502058909.name: Beach town vibes in paradise
502058909.author: a TripAdvisor user
502058909.reviewBody: We absolutely love this little beach town! The vibe is very relaxed and hippie like. The beach is surrounding a gorgeous tropical forest and the town has some of THE BEST food we\'ve had in all of vallarta! You can walk around the plethora of shops and out door stands, sit in one of the many restaurant or taco/seafood stands....which is what we prefer! You can enjoy coconuts and mangoes on the beach while watching all the surfers... HIGHLY RECOMMEND this place!

501962639.name: Heaven on earth
501962639.author: a TripAdvisor user
501962639.reviewBody: We traveled to the little town of Sayulita in February.  It can\'t be any more fun!  This town is so quaint.  Yes, there is construction and growth.  But it still holds quiet simplicity.  The shops are unique.  The street vendors aren\'t pushy, and many of them have good quality items to sell.  We enjoyed great cocktails in town, awesome breakfasts and dinners...Caf\u00e9 Sayulita is delicious.  One of our top favorites.

501788084.name: Great beach
501788084.author: a TripAdvisor user
501788084.reviewBody: Great beach and vibe.  \n  Watch surfers and sunsets and join in either paddle boarding,  surfing, or boogey boarding.  Most open and friendly beach to hang out and explore.

501782527.name: Cozy & hippy beach town
501782527.author: a TripAdvisor user
501782527.reviewBody: Beautiful & friendly beach town. Safe for family. There is plenty of great restaurants & local Mexican food joints

501617223.name: Sayulita is a little gem
501617223.author: a TripAdvisor user
501617223.reviewBody: 1st time visitor, this little town has a lot charm, perfect for a beach day trip.  Perfect town to get an authentic feeling of the day to day life in Nayarit, to mingle with the local people, enjoy the beach activities (a boat ride, surf or just people watch) and taste great local seafood and treats the sell on the beach.  Definitely a must see.

500525768.name: Relaxing with the family
500525768.author: a TripAdvisor user
500525768.reviewBody: My family and I spent one week just relaxing in this beach, It is has been one of the most wonderful places we have visited. Beach is clean, not too crowded, you can take your own food there or if you prefer you can buy food and beer from the local restaurants at very reasonable prices. I\'ll definitely come back.

500455279.name: Great beach for surfing or just relaxing!
500455279.author: a TripAdvisor user
500455279.reviewBody: Sayulita is a very pretty small Mexican town. If you are looking for a vacation where you just sit by the ocean or surf the small waves, this is perfect. There really isn\'t much else to do here.

499764051.name: Must for everyone!!
499764051.author: a TripAdvisor user
499764051.reviewBody: An awesome beach!! Has something for every taste! If you want action or just leisure time! Great surfing! Dining options are improving a lot! Good night life! We stayed at the Amazing Hostel! The best in Sayulita! We willl stay there again for sure!

499687806.name: Sayulita town
499687806.author: a TripAdvisor user
499687806.reviewBody: Not much to share about this place still thinking on why some people like it\nGood enough to look around take some pictures and maybe eat

498956226.name: Warm, clean water
498956226.author: a TripAdvisor user
498956226.reviewBody: The beach is quite pleasant. There is an area for surfing and other areas for swimming and paddle boarding. Water was clear and clean. The sand was a bit dark and not fine. Gentle place to spend the day.

498920498.name: Quick visit to Sayulita Beach!
498920498.author: a TripAdvisor user
498920498.reviewBody: We did a quick visit to Sayulita on a Sunday evening. I really was interested in staying here but at the last minute decided to stay at an all inclusive because of traveling with teens. I definitely would like to return to Sayulita but probably without the kids. I loved the vibe of the town and the beach but it definitely was more crowded than I expected. My husband surfs and we stayed out in Punta de Mita where he was able to surf everyday all day on a pretty quiet beach. Sayulita Beach seemed a bit jammed....we are use to that feeling back home so it was nice to be somewhere a little more quiet and less busy but like I said I would be interested in visiting the area again. There were so many great restaurants that I would love to go back and try.

498861247.name: Excellent place to visit with family
498861247.author: a TripAdvisor user
498861247.reviewBody: So many things to see, full of beautiful Mexican culture and people. Lots of restaurante, shops, attractions and beach to relax on

498725039.name: Hot but good
498725039.author: a TripAdvisor user
498725039.reviewBody: Warm water, small swells, shallow water, all created an awesome experience for my grand kids.  We played in shallows for hours.  Also got to snorkel around the point, a bit of a swim, but saw a lot more fish than I had anticipated.

498451737.name: Beautiful
498451737.author: a TripAdvisor user
498451737.reviewBody: We arrived around 10am and turned right along the beach and walked until we reached large boulders (which you could climb to get to the other side). We stopped here as there were beautiful views.\nWhen we walked back around midday the beach had become really crowded. I definitely recommend an early morning trip here to take in the beauty

498246678.name: It is perfect place
498246678.author: a TripAdvisor user
498246678.reviewBody: I\'ve visited this place more than 10 times. It is perfect beach. Cheap umbrellas for the whole day, serfing, paddle boards... great food. Don\'t forget to visit iguana garden.

496709877.name: Coolest \'hidden\' beach town!
496709877.author: a TripAdvisor user
496709877.reviewBody: We trekked out to this little gem of a town and had a fantastic beach day with the kids. It\'s about 30 mins north of Nuevo Vallarta and I gave it only 4 stars because the beach was super super crowded and the surfing was just so-so when we went. Bring booties if you surf, the rocks are cruel! The vendors walking up and down the beach selling yummy grilled shrimp skewers was pretty awesome, I had like 7 of them for 35 pesos apiece. We rented a table, chairs, and a beach mat for $200 pesos for the day and it was well worth it ... man it was hot out there! Plenty of opportunities to buy souvenirs and trinkets from an abundance of vendors so bring some effectivo (cash). Massages given right on the beach for $20 is a killer deal and you can also get the fish pedicure if that\'s your thing. It\'s a little tricky to navigate the narrow streets and to find parking but if you\'re patient, I guarantee you\'ll love it if you like rustic old beach towns. There are a few trendy looking restaurants along the main drag and I just hope they don\'t ruin the old school Mexico vibe of Sayulita. I can\'t wait to come back next year!

496675651.name: Sayulita
496675651.author: a TripAdvisor user
496675651.reviewBody: Enjoyed the waves, not the dirty sand, or constant barrage of vendors, but shops, food and ambiance was cool

496554501.name: Busy but fun!
496554501.author: a TripAdvisor user
496554501.reviewBody: We spent more time at Playa de los Muertos but had fun walking the shoreline at Sayulita Beach. The beach is very busy with both locals and tourists. The vendors can be somewhat annoying but such is life! :) We enjoyed supporting the locals whenever we had the opportunity to do so. We didn\'t swim much here but it looked very relaxing. We had big huge cold margaritas on far end under the yellow umbrellas, which were awesome! We recommend a visit.

496329726.name: Deep sand, a good breeze, not many people, endless concessionaires.
496329726.author: a TripAdvisor user
496329726.reviewBody: We attended a wedding held on Sayulita Beach.  The wedding was set up in the sand and the bride/groom were barefooted.  Everything came off well and it seemed everyone was happy with the arrangements.  Reception at Don Julio\'s Palapa- great.

495276464.name: Terrible, dirty, too many tourist.  UUK
495276464.author: a TripAdvisor user
495276464.reviewBody:
Don't waste your money, infrustuture gross. DIRTY

I have lived here many years, never thought i would ever want to leave, DO NOW!!!!
Croweded sewer problems, SICKNESS.

494716160.name: Sayulita Magical town
494716160.author: a TripAdvisor user
494716160.reviewBody: Picturesque, friendly, small, surfing village. Great restaurants, cobble stone roads and a very lively atmosphere.

494422321.name: Not the same
494422321.author: a TripAdvisor user
494422321.reviewBody: Sayulita used to be a quaint, beach town with perfect waves for people wanting to learn how to surf.  It is now overcrowded, with cut throat, unfriendly wave hogs that have no regard for children or beginners.  There are also too many cars and golf carts driven by 1/2 drunk, obnoxious tourists.  Skip it and go further north or to Punta Mita or stay in Vallarta.

493620195.name: Nice beach
493620195.author: a TripAdvisor user
493620195.reviewBody: It\'s a nice beach, but for surfing it has been as drag. If you ride a long board the surf isn\'t bad but if you ride a short board you have no chance. The locals say that the waves are usually pretty good and big but this year (Summer 2017) it has been very different.

493372450.name: Beautiful Beach
493372450.author: a TripAdvisor user
493372450.reviewBody: I stayed on the north end of town, and used the beach on that side.  Less crowded than in the heart of Sayulita, with great sand.  Lots of great waves, little hills, and crabs to watch.  My favorite area.

492589031.name: Too crowded
492589031.author: a TripAdvisor user
492589031.reviewBody: Unfortunately, the word is out on Sayulita. We went to Sayulita twice last week during our vacation. Needless to say, it was WAY to crowded for our liking. Our last trip in 2015, it was still a quiet and sleepy beach town. There are plenty of other beaches to go to that are away from the hustle and bustle.

491390688.name: Sand of gold!!
491390688.author: a TripAdvisor user
491390688.reviewBody: The sand in the water looks like gold and feel like silk on your feet! Very nice people with umbrellas to rent, beach front messages and dinning!

490704972.name: Sweet Sayulita
490704972.author: a TripAdvisor user
490704972.reviewBody: Sayulita is such a cool little beach town and while I am not a surfer this is a surfer\'s paradise. The beach is lovely and filled with surfers and lots of action so it is a busy area. There are many unique shops here and street vendors as well. There are lots of great little spots to eat and Don Pedro\'s is one we enjoyed. This seems to be a trendy place to be with a younger crowd so if you are traveling with younger children or want more peace and quiet Punta Mita is a 30 minute drive and might be more appropriate. IF you are looking for FUN Sayulita has is all!

490441191.name: Quaint town of Sayulita
490441191.author: a TripAdvisor user
490441191.reviewBody: This is such a great little town for shopping, restaurants, galleries and of course surfing. Love the little streets lined with street vendors, taco stands and colorful stung flags above. About 35 minute easy drive from Punta de Mita.

490179959.name: Surf and Socializing!
490179959.author: a TripAdvisor user
490179959.reviewBody: A fun - often crowded beach - bring your own chair and umbrella, unless you\'re willing to pay 200-250 pesos to "acquire" a spot in a chair in front of a restaurant - PLUS buy food and drink.  Young hipsters play and surf in the awesome waves here.  Colorful, busy, with warm wonderful water

489437116.name: Beautiful beach, lots of activity
489437116.author: a TripAdvisor user
489437116.reviewBody: This is the main beach in Sayulita. It has soft sand and gentle waves. You can sit in a chair and have food/drink service. The constant beach vendors are annoying though.

489219259.name: A fun place to spend the day
489219259.author: a TripAdvisor user
489219259.reviewBody: The beach is nice is recommend the tiger surfs umbrella area if you want to swim.  The beach is not as rocky and the waves are smaller.  We rented the chairs under the umbrella as it is very hot in May.  The extra benefit is you also get food and drink service.  You should spend at least a day at the beach.\ud83c\udf1e

489211097.name: Bus from PV to Sayulita.
489211097.author: a TripAdvisor user
489211097.reviewBody:
Staying in PV for 3 weeks and wanted to go to Sayulita.  Caught the "Walmart" bus from Insurgentes & Cardenas streets - which comes every few minutes - to Walmart/Sam's Club bus stop (near cruise ship).  Then took a Sayulita (Bucerias) bus for 40 pesos to Sayulita, comes every 20 minutes.  Travel time was 1 hour 10 minutes.  

Then just a 5 minute walk to town to the Kapuri Hotel -- if you book directly you will get a larger and better room and pay $100 approx.    We paid $139.  I learned that online hotel-deal-websites make you think you are saving money but are limited.

Coming back got a bus from Sayulita to PV - which was the same, 40 pesos, every 20 minutes, stops at Walmart.  We got off at the end of the line which was at the bus terminal in PV not at Cardenas so we wandered around a few blocks and a bus driver helped me to get on the correct bus to "Centro" PV within minutes. 

I find everyone here to be very helpful.  Even if I may be lost there is always someone to guide me on the path!  

At the beach in Sayulita we didn't know how to put the beach umbrella into the sand (rented from the hotel). A worker from a surf board rental saw us struggling and offered to get a shovel to put the umbrella in and up.  We gave him 60 pesos ($3) for his wonderful assistance.  If he hadn't helped us we would have been completely sunburned!  Thank you, Tony!

488799047.name: A very quaint town
488799047.author: a TripAdvisor user
488799047.reviewBody: Puerto Vallarta is a little pretentious with luxurious all inclusive resorts, expensive restaurants and shopping malls. Sayulita is the absolute opposite! and a very welcomed change, it has a completely different vibe, a true surfers town, plenty of artisans offering their crafts, quaint little shops and restaurants, a very friendly and inclusive atmosphere. It has a very tropical feeling, and the food is just what the doctor ordered.

488748815.name: Surfers beach
488748815.author: a TripAdvisor user
488748815.reviewBody:
We went to Sayulita with Peurto Vallarta Adventures where we had a stop at the surfers beach which was very interesting .

You get to rent your own surfing board or watch other surfers riding the tides .

There are also restaurants and shops near the beach where u can grab a bite and shop for some souvenirs .

488550561.name: Fuuun  !!!!
488550561.author: a TripAdvisor user
488550561.reviewBody: Surfed here a few times over a week, waves were fun, the beach is  chill lots of tourists and still pretty clean, great foid spots all over, you can walk the town easy or rent a golf cart, we walked!

488295490.name: Very Nice Clear Water
488295490.author: a TripAdvisor user
488295490.reviewBody: We spent the afternoon for about four hours and had a great time.\nVery safe and friendly. Had the Taxi driver that dropped us off know exactly what time we planned to leave and he was there promptly.\nNo public bathrooms that I could see in the area.

488209213.name: Day trip to Sayulita
488209213.author: a TripAdvisor user
488209213.reviewBody: Small beach with all the amenities of a larger beach.  I preferred the vibe at Playa los Muertos....more lively I guess.  The town itself is cute with colorful storefronts and little eateries.  It was worth checking out the town for a day.

488041523.name: Amazing place
488041523.author: a TripAdvisor user
488041523.reviewBody: This is a place where the modern day "hippies" would go. Beautiful beach/water. Lots of shops selling the usual stuff in a tourist town; art, souveniers, food of all kinds. Local people are friendly and courteous. There seems to be a bar or restaurant every other establishment. We sampled a few; excellent food, drink and service. Always an intersting view. Even found a sports bar to watch the hockey playoffs. Quaint streets which were interesting walks. There appears to be a lot of money in the mansions in the hills surrounding the bay.

486715179.name: pretty beach with nice beginner suf
486715179.author: a TripAdvisor user
486715179.reviewBody: This is a nice looking beach, the main area gets quite busy and there is good beginner surf...I love Sayulita, but the \'vendors\' all over this beach will harass you...non-stop, really ...it never ends, it\'s off putting. Its doesn\'t matter how many times you tell them you don\'t want their jewelry, beads, hammocks, cigars or artwork, they will come back and back and bother you until you leave. The river that runs into the water here is contaminated and smells it.

483750931.name: If you are over 25, skip it. Totally filled with chairs, hawkers, and party types.
483750931.author: a TripAdvisor user
483750931.reviewBody: This used to be a nice little spot, but way too many people and hawkers selling beads and hots and heroics and massages and...and... and the whole beach is lined with chairs for rent, all the way to the smelly river.  On the other side (north), much better, few people and more solitude.  If you are 16-25 and a party type, this might be perfect.  I felt it sad the town had been so ruined, used to be decent.  If you are not the backpacker/party crowd, rent a house or a hotel room out of the town, you might enjoy it.

483713367.name: Guapaaaaaaa
483713367.author: a TripAdvisor user
483713367.reviewBody: We love sayulitaaaa. The beach is very nice. With lots of nice bars and good foods. We want to come back for corona festival

483235616.name: So Mexico
483235616.author: a TripAdvisor user
483235616.reviewBody: Scudgy beach with murky water and that is the best part. Half naked people receiving massages under open air tents and the street vendors are off putting.
