482725468.name: Rent a beach chair and chill
482725468.author: a TripAdvisor user
482725468.reviewBody: I really like hanging at this beach and people watching   Rent a beach chair with an umbrella for approx 150-300 pesos for a couple and enjoy some cold beers and enjoy your afternoon. There area lot of beach peddlers but a polite no thank you and they will leave you alone.

482455969.name: Lovely
482455969.author: a TripAdvisor user
482455969.reviewBody: Big surf, nice walking beach, a tranquil place to hang out. We stayed right there, so it was very convenient with chairs and umbrellas, since it gets hot in the middle of the day.

482432607.name: Get away
482432607.author: a TripAdvisor user
482432607.reviewBody: The beach was clean with easy access. Lots of options for lounging, boating, surfing, paddle boarding, food, and beverage. Waves were great and people are friendly. Lots of restaurants and shops next to beach

481933010.name: Will go back!!!
481933010.author: a TripAdvisor user
481933010.reviewBody: Stayed at an All Inclusive nearby that offered  a daily shuttle into Sayulita. Well worth the trip! Tuesday morning it was relatively sleepy but Thursday afternoon was crazy! Great shops and great vendors. Tons of options for eating..... definitely a must see if you\'re in the area!

481906465.name: It\'s a beach.
481906465.author: a TripAdvisor user
481906465.reviewBody: Much more crowded then it was when we came in 2014, as was the whole town of Sayulita. We were staying in Nuevo Vallarta, so compared to that beach, this one just felt dirty. I kept my flip flops on and didn\'t go in the water, but 4 out of the 6 of us rented boogie boards and had a great time in the waves. Nobody got sick. We decided to take a little stroll to the North side of the beach to check it out as some of the houses we had looked into renting were this way. Once we started getting closer to the River, the sewage smell kept getting stronger. When we hit the river, we all looked at each other and decided that was as far as we would go. We were not putting our feet in that!! Sayulita is a super cool town and I really hope that they get the sewage issues under control so that it can accommodate the amount of people who visit.

481632610.name: Visit before it gets over- discovered.
481632610.author: a TripAdvisor user
481632610.reviewBody: Sayulita has gone from undiscovered to discovered (by both Mexican and American tourists).  It is still a fun, funky town with great shops and places to eat.  The main beach can get very crowded on weekends and during holidays; the North Beach and the Playa de Los Muertos are less crowded and cleaner.  I\'d be careful about swimming in the ocean off the main beach (although many people do) because the Sayulita River that runs into the ocean just to the north is very polluted.  One tip:  there have been warnings about using the ATMS in town because of possible fraud, but we used the ATMS inside the better restaurants or businesses (like Don Pedro\'s) without a problem.

481447291.name: Needs help
481447291.author: a TripAdvisor user
481447291.reviewBody: The beach is lovely.  The problem is that this is advertised as a Bohemian style town.  It was gross.  I wanted to so badly buy stuff to help the economy.  I could not find anything that was affordable.  How can a small town that looks poor sell a bathing suit for $90 or a tiled mirror for $350?  This was not my style and I only stayed 45 minutes.

481173778.name: great vibe, very busy, we stayed safe, didnt go into the water
481173778.author: a TripAdvisor user
481173778.reviewBody: sayulita beach is an exciting and lively area, with bars and restaurants on it. We decided to play safe and listen to our local friends - so didnt go into the water and wore footwear on the sand. So we didnt get ill at all. They have the best well behaved stray dogs on the beach - no sign of dog mess.

481117764.name: Crowded yet fun Mexican beach/surf!
481117764.author: a TripAdvisor user
481117764.reviewBody: Save yourself the hassle/rush and head early to reserve all-day cabanas (or reserve the night before as we did) as it is well worth it! Our group set up around 9:30am and started surfing around 10am for a couple of hours. We broke for lunch for another couple of hours and returned for more beach time/surfing and the place was packed!\n\nBy the way, thankfully nobody in our group got sick from swimming in the ocean or eating street food. We spotted several stray dogs randomly urinating on table/chair legs - sanitize your hands before eating and be especially cautious with kids who like to touch everything!

480752419.name: Hippy happy
480752419.author: a TripAdvisor user
480752419.reviewBody: Great day out surfers paradise cheap delicious food and drinks\nWould love to return to this colourful place with quirky shops.

480744670.name: Slice of beautiful Mexican surf culture!
480744670.author: a TripAdvisor user
480744670.reviewBody: We loved our visit to Sayulita beach. People and little kiddos of all ages were surfing. It was so fun to watch. Surf school, vendors and spas were all set up to take advantage of this local gem. Popular with the locals and tourist alike. We enjoyed wonderful food, company and shopping all right on the beach.

479969590.name: Don\'t miss it!
479969590.author: a TripAdvisor user
479969590.reviewBody: We took a day trip to Sayulita while vacationing at Iberostar Playa Mita.  It was a great day.  Don\'t miss this little jewel. Lots to see and experience here!

479842775.name: Beautiful and authentic
479842775.author: a TripAdvisor user
479842775.reviewBody: the sunsets were amazing here, The beach was clean and the sand was wonderful. Surfers were all over the place and were a great time to watch, Many opportunities for getting on the water, like boats, paddle boards, surf boards or swimming

479838917.name: A place to have a good food, Mexican culture and surfing community
479838917.author: a TripAdvisor user
479838917.reviewBody: A nice place to walk around and see different little shops, restaurants, cantinas, and Surfing School...

479742300.name: Decided to do a day trip from Puerto Vallarta and wished we had planned to stay the night.
479742300.author: a TripAdvisor user
479742300.reviewBody: We took a $45 cab ride from Puerto Vallarta  (Icon Vallarta ) to enjoy this little beach town we had read about. We loved Sayulita and wished we would have brought an overnight bag and could have stayed. Very laid back vibe, great food,extremely friendly people and a clean and gorgeous beach.

479510748.name: Nice beach
479510748.author: a TripAdvisor user
479510748.reviewBody: Beach was nice, town was dirty...I  got deathly sick, my wife got sick...it seemed every group of travelers had a "sick"story

479351804.name: Sunsets are amazing
479351804.author: a TripAdvisor user
479351804.reviewBody:
Love love love Sayulita beaches. Rocky sand in some parts, but mostly nice. Good friendly crowds and Epic waves to play in! A bit turbulent for swimming at times. 

One downside, dogs run free, horses wander as part of tours/trails, so you do sometimes come across animal droppings in the sand.

But overall great!

I spend so much time on the beaches. It's the reason I go to Sayulita.

478568836.name: Very nice beach, but too crowded
478568836.author: a TripAdvisor user
478568836.reviewBody: Very nice beach, great for learning to surf.  Way to Crowded!\n\nHard to find an empty square meter or yard of space for 2 people to put down towels, it was so crowded.

478377608.name: Great Beach in Surf town
478377608.author: a TripAdvisor user
478377608.reviewBody: The beach is the centre of life in Sayulita. You can swim, surf, eat, drink, be entertained, watch people, all without leaving the beach. A great trip and by all accounts, a great place to stay!

478355586.name: Very nice beach
478355586.author: a TripAdvisor user
478355586.reviewBody: While in Sayulita you must go to the beach.  Watching the waves slapping up on the sand is very relaxing.  Do not forget to go to the beach while in Sayulita.  They also had many vendors selling things along the beach.  Very nice beach to visit.

477833607.name: Quaint Town vibe
477833607.author: a TripAdvisor user
477833607.reviewBody: Went to sayilita for a drive and ended up loving it. Easy to drive around, easy enough to find parking and easier if you just pay to park in a lot. Walk to the beach has plenty to see and do and loved every minute there. If driving stick to the main road don\'t take the side road it was cool adventure but wow it was brutal.

477806609.name: Too crowded.  Hubby and I got sick.
477806609.author: a TripAdvisor user
477806609.reviewBody: 2nd time to Sayulita.  Probably won\'t be back.  I agree with other reviewers:  I imagine 20 years ago this place was awesome.  Now EVERYONE and their madre know about it!  We ate at the outdoor taco place in the center of the beach--- the one that has the fresh coconuts to drink down.  The food was good, we ordered different items.  I got a little sick that evening.  My poor husband the next day!  Sick out of both ends, moaning in pain and in bed the entire day.  \n\nDefinitely stay away for the holiday weeks and avoid the crowds!

477478603.name: Sayulita Main Beach
477478603.author: a TripAdvisor user
477478603.reviewBody: Very busy during Easter week.  Too crowded.  My daughter took surf lessons (red tent) which were well worth it.  She was up and surfing waves all the way in by the end of her lesson.  However, if you want some r&r, this beach is not for you.  The vendors come by every 20 seconds.  That is not an exaggeration. They are not persistent if you say no, but it is constant and bothersome.  If you are into surfing it\'s cool, but otherwise, I\'ve seen many nicer beaches.

476609187.name: Holy Week!
476609187.author: a TripAdvisor user
476609187.reviewBody: Sayulita use to be a quaint surfer town.  It has about 10,000 people.  DO NOT GO THERE DURING THE WEEK BEFORE EASTER.  the town swelled to the ten\'s of thousands and was overwhelmed.  It does not have the infrastructure to handle the crowds and some locals close shop or leave the area.  we hated it and if you were anywhere near the town itself you would not get any piece and quiet or sleep.  The visitors do not respect the place and just leave trash everywhere. Impossible to walk on the beach, get into restaurants, etc

475265813.name: Nice beach.  Crowded during Semana Santa
475265813.author: a TripAdvisor user
475265813.reviewBody: We came here during Semana Santa (Holy Week).  The beach and water were very crowded.  One of the best things about it is that it seems to be protected from the wind.  We went to other beaches and they were just as crowded but very windy.

475235863.name: Perfect do it yourself day trip from Nuevo Vallarta
475235863.author: a TripAdvisor user
475235863.reviewBody: Recommended by our kids who had been there the month before. From Riu Palalce Pacifico in Nuevo Vallarta it was a 300 pesos taxi ride(about $30 US at the time) and 350 pesos for the return taxi. Then enjoy the old style Mexican town, with lots of shops and restaurants before hitting the beach. An area known for great surfing with a perfect breaking wave. Rent a beach chair and umbrella. A beach waiter provided us a great deal on a bucket of ice and beer for less than $2 US each and some of the best food we had - a mahi mahi fish burrito with generous portions of fish and a chicken quesadilla my wife thought was great. Great for relaxing, people and surf watching. Better than a tour where you might not get the time for the things you want to do here and a better than or at least competitive to a tour cost.

475149653.name: Nice beach
475149653.author: a TripAdvisor user
475149653.reviewBody: It is too crowded so you have to get there early, but it has a beautiful view of the coast and it\'s clean and well maintained

475000197.name: Cool beach
475000197.author: a TripAdvisor user
475000197.reviewBody: Cool beach to relax, surf and play in the ocean but ver crowded. Which is ok if you are into that, otherwise, there are other less crowded places

474802649.name: Surfer vibe - lovely area!
474802649.author: a TripAdvisor user
474802649.reviewBody: I\'m not a surfer, but you can get lessons there and the whole area has that surfer, laid back feel to it.  The beach during the day is really alive with restaurants and vendors - and of course you can get surf lessons.  In the evening half of the area closes and the other half opens!  Bars. cafes, restaurants - food vendors.  Had the best churro I have ever had in my life from a random street vendor.   we are considering staying in Sayulita rather than the resort next time we go because the area had such a wonderful feel to it.

474620946.name: My favorite place
474620946.author: a TripAdvisor user
474620946.reviewBody: We have gone to Sayulita every year for 10 years at least once if not twice a year! This town has a great energy and vibe. Great restaurants, people, shops, yoga and many other activities! Great SUP and surfing!

474287279.name: Great place to surf and chill!
474287279.author: a TripAdvisor user
474287279.reviewBody: Even though it was about an hour away by bus from Puerto Vallarta it was very worth it. We went surfing on the beach which was very cheap. You can even get a 1.5-hour surf lesson for a pretty cheap price. We just rented a surfboard right on the beach for 10 dollars for the hour. It was very fun even though we could not surf very well. The waves are good for beginners but there are also bigger waves for more advanced surfers if you paddle a bit further.

474240977.name: another great year
474240977.author: a TripAdvisor user
474240977.reviewBody: if you like to fish, go with Angel whose brother is Chinga lin....they are amazing...we have caught fish with them every single year....enough to feed multiple people...

473928513.name: Too small, too crowded
473928513.author: a TripAdvisor user
473928513.reviewBody: We were encouraged to visit here to see surfers and were disssapointed. The town is tiny and super crowded with tourists. We drove through and decided it wasn\'t for us.

473920837.name: Honest Sayulita Review 2017
473920837.author: a TripAdvisor user
473920837.reviewBody: First time to Sayulita beginning of April 2017. I had read a lot about people getting sick while staying here, but whatever, never know until you do it yourself. First off it\'s a cool little surf, tourist town. Much more active and noisy then I imagined. Our AirBB was one the road where all the traffic was being routed since the main road was closed for repairs. Also the roosters and the local birds were our alarm clock every morning at 6AM. If you love Mexican music then this is your place. Get ready to listen to it blasted well into the late night, thanks Chilly Whilly. The good. food was yummy, coffee in morning was excellent (go to the banana place), cheap beer (Negro Medelo!), weather awesome, nice beaches (Playa los Muertos!).\nNow to the Sayilita Sickness. Out of 5 people, one being a 6 month old, only I and the baby didn\'t get sick. Was it from the ocean? The food? The ice? I don\'t know. I\'m guessing probably all the above. My advice, drink only bottled or can beer and don\'t drink ocean water. Be cautious of ice and drinks made with ice. I ordered all my beers without the limes.\nBottom line. Sayulita is worth the visit. Maybe for the day and not for a whole trip. Would love to see Mexico get it\'s trash and sanitation crap together, pun intended.

473479379.name: More vacationers that got sick
473479379.author: a TripAdvisor user
473479379.reviewBody: We visited Sayulita from March 29 through April 6.  We experienced a similar fate of sickness that you can read in a number of other recent reviews. One by one every last family member (8 in all) developed nausea/vomiting, weakness and light headedness.  We were sorry to learn about the water contamination as we spent quite a lot of time body surfing and boogie boarding.  In hindsight we wish we had been more mindful of the foul smell in the area and done more reading of reviews.  We ended up cutting our vacation from hell short.

473450422.name: Caution of the Sickness linked to dirty water
473450422.author: a TripAdvisor user
473450422.reviewBody: Beaches are a surfers and wave riders dream and excitement. Not very clean, dog poop around , annoying peddlers. a part of the culture, but ENUF.

472938147.name: Family Trip
472938147.author: a TripAdvisor user
472938147.reviewBody:
Sayulita has been on my radar for quite some time. My brother and his family decided to book a trip there for 9 days so my new boyfriend  and I decided to join in. After all the pictures, reviews and being from Hawaii we couldn't wait to hit up Sayulita the "sleepy little surf town". 

Enter Noro Virus factor: A few days before my brother was to depart he received a warning about the Noro Virus from his Airbnb host because he was traveling with a 6 month old. We researched it and know things can happen in Mexico so we all proceeded with caution. My sister-n-laws fell ill Friday night, my brother fell ill Saturday night and I finally caught it on Tuesday night. Violent vomiting and diarrhea. You're down for the count for 24 hours at least.  There is a serious sanitation problem in this little town and people have been getting sick for years. You can take your chance but is it really worth it? Waste money like that? 
The beaches were beautiful but the main beach was dirty and water was contaminated obviously. We hit up other beaches where we felt better swimming. 
The town is crowded, noisy with a lot of traffic. I'm sure this was the place to go to back in the day, but it's done. If you're still interested make sure you get a place outside of town to avoid night club noise, town traffic on the cobblestone streets (cars are louder) and the screaming birds (roosters). 
I'm an 18 year flight attendant with a major airline and I've never been so disappointed with a trip in my life. We made the best of it and had a good time but there will be no repeat visits anytime soon.

472799401.name: beautiful
472799401.author: a TripAdvisor user
472799401.reviewBody: a bit of everything is there, food, fun, sun & shopping. clean beach with surfing opportunities. close to everything we had a wonderful day!

472743165.name: Sorry. Smelly, dirty, crowded.
472743165.author: a TripAdvisor user
472743165.reviewBody: Not my idea of where to spend a vacation. You couldn\'t ignore the smell. Loads of people, vendors, and umbrellas shoulder to shoulder. Where\'s the vacation??

472690122.name: Boogy baby
472690122.author: a TripAdvisor user
472690122.reviewBody: Bring a board, huy. Any sixe any shape. The waves are lovely. Get wet and get warm all at the same time. Check it out por mo fun.

472379850.name: Doesn\'t get much better than this!
472379850.author: a TripAdvisor user
472379850.reviewBody: Our family considers Sayulita our \'happy place" and we try to visit as often as possible.  The beach, the locals, the shops, the food, the sun and surf...   We love our time here..

471799574.name: Just walk a little further and it is gorgeous!!
471799574.author: a TripAdvisor user
471799574.reviewBody: Sayulita is a great town. The beach is nice where the town is, but if you don\'t like crowds just make the effort to walk to the end, less people by far, you can even climb the rocks by the house and go to the next beach. Other spots are Playa los muertos and Carricitos. Love it!!! Good base town to visit the surrounding areas.

471774150.name: Ecoli in the water!!
471774150.author: a TripAdvisor user
471774150.reviewBody: Almost everyone i ran into who came into contact with the water, from various different parties, over the past week became violently with with ecoli like symptoms - vomiting and diarrhea.   If you plan on  entering the water make sure you have antibiotics!  \n\nThe beach is nice and the surf is great. But the water is filthy and a serious health hazard.

471713079.name: Scenic and fun!
471713079.author: a TripAdvisor user
471713079.reviewBody: A nice, bustling beach. You will be bugged by vendors trying to sell you stuff, but it\'s all good. There\'s lots of food nearby, you can rent a surfboard, shop, swim, take shelter under a beach umbrella and otherwise enjoy yourself. TIP: Be aware that locals say the water quality isn\'t fantastic, from a sanitation standpoint.

471554302.name: A bit dirty and crowded
471554302.author: a TripAdvisor user
471554302.reviewBody: Way too many people and a bit dirty. It seems to be over run with vendors and cheap restaurants. The northern end of the beach seemed better.

471515951.name: Fantastic beach, even when busy!
471515951.author: a TripAdvisor user
471515951.reviewBody: We spent an amazing day this week at the Sayulita Beach.  Sat on chairs in front of Don Pedro\'s (great lunch and service) and had a very fun surf lesson at Get Up Stand Up.  The waves were perfect for beginner surfers and we also had a ton of fun boogie boarding, body surfing and people watching.  Worth the trip and can\'t wait to return.

471439559.name: Sunsets are amazing, water not terribly clean
471439559.author: a TripAdvisor user
471439559.reviewBody: I suspect the sewer system in town is aging and not keeping up with the development and popularity of this amazing little town. The sunsets are so beautiful, the beach is safe, there are bathrooms for hire nearby, and you can surf, paddleboard, swim. But the water here is not that clean - murky and suspicious, with smelly stuff running into it here and there.

471433172.name: Mexican hippy town
471433172.author: a TripAdvisor user
471433172.reviewBody: This little "hippy town" as one of the Mexican staff said to me here at Iberostar is a fun place to visit if you are in Punta Mita ... it\'s about 20 min away (15 for us thanks to our "vamanos" shuttle driver) and is fun to walk around and look at the little boutiques that offer all sorts of fun items. Our shuttle left the hotel at 9:45 and at noon, we came back. We had initially thought we\'d stay longer, but a couple of hours was more than adequate time to walk around, buy a few things, grab a gelato, and head back to the main square to pick up our shuttle.

471414763.name: The city sewer flows into this beach
471414763.author: a TripAdvisor user
471414763.reviewBody: So many of my friends were sick while we were there for a wedding..........they were thinking it was a flu bug going around but after they found out that anyone that went swimming got sick.Its only certain areas but its there & its a shame that this little town does not do something about this.

471413185.name: Wonderful town, buzzing with athletic tourists, laid back locals, and resident surfers
471413185.author: a TripAdvisor user
471413185.reviewBody:
BUT THEY ARE EXPERIENCING A HORRIBLE HUMAN HEALTH ISSUE
We were told that Sayulita's solid waste treatment facility is over capacity.   It smells and looks like partially processed sewage is flowing continuously into the ocean, at Sayulita beach.   The result is at least 1/2 of our crew are purging out of one end or the other. That, in spite of drinking bottled beverages and bagged ice.  

MY ADVISE:    CANCEL YOUR TRIP.  It will make a strong case for Sayulita to update their infrastructure now and restore the beach and bay to its former glory
Unless you enjoy playing in sand that smells like sewage or navigating thru yellow/green currents while you play in the water, don't go.

My direct experience with the partially processed sewage includes paddling through countless polluted currents that fan out from Sayulita as far out as I chose to paddle my SUP (easily 3 to 5 miles from shore on 4 occasions). Constantly hoping to avoid an untimely swim while paddling through the hazard.  Lol
As well, we dug many holes in the sand to create castles and beach art.  In the process we unveiled peculiar odors of a variety that only our Mexi-mixto dog Nacho could fully appreciate.

471133449.name: Lovely Beach Right Downtown
471133449.author: a TripAdvisor user
471133449.reviewBody: This beach was lovely. The water temperature is nice and it is very beautiful. The earlier in the morning the better, because it can get quite crowded. There are lots of nice restaurants off this beach. The waves at this time of year are mellower in the morning if you are a surfer.

470989979.name: Good surf but too crowded.
470989979.author: a TripAdvisor user
470989979.reviewBody: Busy, busy, busy.  Beautiful sandy beach that slopes into the water.  Surf is easier for beginners on the left side where there is a sand bar.  Further to the right is for more experienced surfers.  For a quieter experience, go to Playa Los Muertos.

470639160.name: Lovely introduction to Mexico
470639160.author: a TripAdvisor user
470639160.reviewBody: We came here on the recommendation of several people and had an absolutely wonderful time.Even though it\'s classed as a tourist destination, we felt the people were genuinely happy to see visitors and wanted them (us) to enjoy the sights, sounds, food,shops, and experiences that Sayulita and Mexico have to offer. Everyone was very friendly all the time. I\'ve been to other countries and cities and have never felt as safe walking around at night as we did on this vacation.

470429584.name: Questionable cleanliness
470429584.author: a TripAdvisor user
470429584.reviewBody: Sayulita is growing like crazy, with houses and hotels being built everywhere. The beach is beautiful, but I don\'t know if the infrastructure can accommodate all the sewage that the town produces. Both my friend and I got sick in the evening after swimming in the ocean at this beach. We went to other beaches nearby and had better results.

470320481.name: Interesting drive through town to the beach
470320481.author: a TripAdvisor user
470320481.reviewBody: Sayulita has an interesting approach before reaching the town and beach.  It is a narrow winding mountain road past junk cars and shacks.  Then....wow...a funky town appears and a great surfer beach.  Wish I could have spent a few days here.

470304012.name: Great beach
470304012.author: a TripAdvisor user
470304012.reviewBody: Sayulita is a great hippie town with surfers, nice cafes, restaurants, shops. The beach is always busy with locals and visitors. This beach is much better than Puerto Vallarta\'s   Los Muertos beach. It has nice bars, cafes and restaurants along the beach, often times with live music going on. Will go again...

469716781.name: Relaxation
469716781.author: a TripAdvisor user
469716781.reviewBody: Beach was very nice. It was more crowed than I was used to but it turned out to be a plus. We had been to other nearby beaches but the locals dogs like to visit there too. This beach gets raked out and cleaned every morning. The water front restaurants had waiters on the beach and the food was amazing and extremely affordable as was renting the chairs and umbrellas.

469165629.name: Sorry to Say.....It\'s Not What It Use To Be!!
469165629.author: a TripAdvisor user
469165629.reviewBody:
Sayulita was one of our most favorite beaches and towns to visit for many years. 

Sadly, that is no longer the case.  The beach and town have literally exploded....tourists flock here for the beautiful beach and friendly people.  But, the town has not been able to keep the beach clean and free of sewage.  We could not even sit at the beach because the sewer smells were so strong...it made us nervous about even going into the water because we were afraid of the contamination. 

I hope the town manages to find a way to fix the problem, as Sayulita has much to offer - a beautiful beach, fun restaurants and shops, and the people are great!!  

But, for now....we will go to San Pancho or Punta Mita to swim in the ocean, and enjoy the bars along the beach.

469140849.name: Sayulita Beach Fun Fun Fun!
469140849.author: a TripAdvisor user
469140849.reviewBody: By Far a very Fun beach my kids are usually in and out of the beach, noticed on our first time visiting Sayulita they were in the water 100% of the time and would only leave it to come and eat! Learning to Surf ? Sayulita is the place! The only thing I would change is the entrance to the beach homes and Sayulita can become a wonderful place to stay and relax! But must be a bit more presentable and attractive! Will go again next year!

468998939.name: Clean beach
468998939.author: a TripAdvisor user
468998939.reviewBody: The beach is clean. The water is cold as expected since it comes from the North. There are vendors who approach you about purchasing items (blankets, jewelry, tattoos). However, most move on with a simple "no gracias"

468941246.name: A family oriented beach yet perfect for couples too.
468941246.author: a TripAdvisor user
468941246.reviewBody: I liked this beach because it felt less commercial like some vacation beaches can be.   Although there was plenty to do from bonfires to fishing.  Surfing to beach side pubs.  A 25min shuttle ride takes you to the launching site for day and sunset cruises.

468932130.name: Sickness in Sayulita is a real problem!
468932130.author: a TripAdvisor user
468932130.reviewBody: So sad to write this but it must be addressed. We just got back from Sayulita along with a wedding group of 140 people. All but a few got very ill. The rehearsal dinner had to be canceled as so many people in our party were sick. In fact the wedding scheduled at the same wedding venue that the wedding we attended was at. They had to cancel that wedding due to the fact almost the entire party fell ill. \nSymptoms are, fever, chills, vomiting and diarrhea. I wish I did not need too write this but the problem is real. The locals say it\'s the water at main beach. It\'s the best place ever! The locals are the best!

468608829.name: Beautiful beach
468608829.author: a TripAdvisor user
468608829.reviewBody: Beautiful beach and close to everything, restaurants, shopping and massage.  Very reasonable rentals on the beach, chairs, umbrellas, surf boards, bogie boards etc.  Only negative is the constant barrage of locals pedaling their wares. I guess they need to make a living too but it is non-stop.  Those that we did buy from were very nice and willing to provide exactly what we were looking for.

468275105.name: Spent So much time enjoying the sun, water, and drinks on the beach!!!
468275105.author: a TripAdvisor user
468275105.reviewBody: Sayulita beach was a great time! I rented a chair for most days and was able to enjoy sun and shade when I wanted.  the water was a great place to cool off.  I found the beach to be clean and a nice place to vacation.  There were many food options--- THE FOOD WAS AMAZING! and the COFFEE was UNREAL!!! I clearly enjoyed myself. I would go back again for sure!

468146619.name: Authentic beach town, 1 hour north of Puerto Vallarta
468146619.author: a TripAdvisor user
468146619.reviewBody:
While staying in Nuevo Vallarta of April 2016 we took the bus north to Sayulita for the day.  Caught the bus at Walmart (at the very end of the parking lot there are multiple bus stops).  From there the bus ride was about 30-40 minutes or so.  It was crowded at times but all four of us found seats.  Stay on the bus until its last stop in Sayulita (they will tell everyone to get off).  From here you walk about 5-10 minutes towards the beach (there are signs or you can ask).  Be prepared with some change to pay for bathrooms.
Sayulita Beach is great for families and felt very safe (but don't leave money or valuables laying on your towel, obviously).  The water was of decent temperature (not super warm but bearable).  It is a bay and there didn't seem to be any undercurrent.
The beach is mostly sandy with a fair amount of tumbled ceramic mixed in.  Nice size waves for the kids to play in.  
We paid to get two loungers under an umbrella, which was well worth the $15-20.  There are many "clubs" and restaurants that offer this, so you can check with a few of them to see what the best deal is.  I love the vibe of Sayulita and the beach had tons of activity, but was not too crowded.  I have never stayed in Sayulita but definitely would in the future.  It looked like there were many great restaurants and stores to explore.  It is not the nicest beach we've been to, but the atmosphere and cute town make up for that.

468119934.name: Charming!
468119934.author: a TripAdvisor user
468119934.reviewBody: The beach, shops and restaurants of Sayulita have a wonderful charm to them.  Sayulita beach offers something for everyone whether it\'s reading a book on the beach, surfing, shopping or drinking a beer.  Spending a day on the beach in Sayulita is my idea of time well spent!

467027674.name: Neat, eclectic, out of the way
467027674.author: a TripAdvisor user
467027674.reviewBody:
We spent a day here, on the beach, in the many shops, and wandering. Many nice little shops here. And a large variety of eating places. We had lunch at a roadside cafe and then a late snack at the Real Fish Taco where they cook right in front of you. Shrimp or mahi mahi tacos are only 40 pesos and tasty. Three tacos and two beers for 200 pesos! And the big score-- a classy painted shot glass instead of the tacky touristy ones you find everywhere else. 

But you would really never know it's here unless you were looking for it. A brief ride over a bumpy dirt road (the main road in from the east was closed) opened up into a hidden gem.

Beware: if you are driving like we were, parking is a headache. But the people are very friendly. A nice vibe here.

466980720.name: Really liked the vibe there!
466980720.author: a TripAdvisor user
466980720.reviewBody:
The first place I've ever 🏄 at.
The one place I'll never forget.

Nice place to walk around, shop and eat.

Lot's of people though

466231199.name: loved it, nice town and beach
466231199.author: a TripAdvisor user
466231199.reviewBody: enjoyed this town but had to visit twice , first time got drunk in a beach bar , so had to return as we saw nothing of the beach and town , but upon our return , very active town , with shops and nice beach front ,good bars and restaurants and just a lovely place

465828260.name: Avoid Sayulita until sewage in the ocean problem is fixed
465828260.author: a TripAdvisor user
465828260.reviewBody: Great  town, good food everywhere, really nice, non-jaded local people. We have been coming to Mexico since 1981 and have witnessed many small towns grow a bit too fast and outstrip important infrastructure. Sayulita is unique in how long it has been ignoring its sewage problem which is making an alarming percentage of travelers sick. We talked to a number of people who live their full time who agree the sewage system---dumping sewage right into the ocean at the main beach--is completely overwhelmed and local politicians are ignoring it. They will probably fix it sometime but for now, spend your precious vacation days in some other town in Mex (rather than sitting on your hotel room toilet day and night) and check back later for possible improvements in Sayulita.

465498812.name: Surfers and views
465498812.author: a TripAdvisor user
465498812.reviewBody: Sayulita is a easily reached by bus from Puerto Vallarta! This is still authentic small seaside town Mexico. Popular with surfers you can just sit on the beach and enjoy the views. We were lucky enough to arrive on a fiesta day with Oompah bands and dancing horses!

465341890.name: Fun, but dirty
465341890.author: a TripAdvisor user
465341890.reviewBody: Very active beach with a lot of people and surfing opportunities.  Unfortunately, the raw sewage flowing into the water directly north of it is disgusting.  I wouldn\'t go in this water on a bet until they clean up the sewage flowing onto the beach.

465282685.name: Nice view but very dirt water
465282685.author: a TripAdvisor user
465282685.reviewBody: I would avoid visiting Sayulita Beach (and Sayulita all together) if you have small children or those with compromised immune systems.     Yes the locals are great, there are a lot of little bars around town, and some cool shopping stalls around town.  I certainly understand the allure that some visitors might feel toward the area.  However, the probability of getting sick here is much higher than other destinations. The water is very dirty with village sewage being pumped into the river area at the center of the beach.   If you have your mind set on spending time in Mexico, there is so much beautiful coastline to choose from.   Just want to be honest about my perceptions.

464903445.name: The Boulder of Mexico
464903445.author: a TripAdvisor user
464903445.reviewBody: This town is hip and fun. Lots to see and do. Very busy but worth the time to find a parking place!!!

464864741.name: One of our favourite places
464864741.author: a TripAdvisor user
464864741.reviewBody: We spent a month in Mexico and visited Sayulita beach with friends on three separate locations. Sit in front of Don Pedro\'s restaurant and you can order chairs and umbrella and drink service directly all day long. The beach is full of thousands of people and hundreds of surfers or people enjoying the water. All day long vendors will come and offer you there wear\'s of food. the stream is constant but they do not annoy as you they simply move on if you put up your hand. In the course of the day we had fresh oysters, shrimp on a stick, fresh macaroons, donuts, candy as well as we bought clothes, hats, sunglasses, jewellery all from the comfort of our beach chair. The three different times we visited we brought different people and each commented they wish they could spend a night or two in the area as this is how they visioned a real Mexican experience. Next year we may actually spend a couple of nights in the local B&Bs so we can enjoy more of a local cuisine and nightlife. If you are in the Puerto Vallarta area do not miss to Sayulita.

464799120.name: Where my elderly dad walked barefoot on the beach for the first time in his life!
464799120.author: a TripAdvisor user
464799120.reviewBody: Sayulita Beach is a magical place that affords travelers both excellent surfing, people watching and beach walking. Stop by a small local bar for a margherita or a cervesa or watch baby sea turtles being released at dusk. Laze around on a beach towel and read a book or be amazed at the skill of the local fishermen riding their pangas to the beach.

464402216.name: perfect family getaway
464402216.author: a TripAdvisor user
464402216.reviewBody: Our kids love Sayulita, the boogie board all the time, tried surfing too.  The town has this special vibe, traditional, eclectic, little hippie but everything works together, as well the community which is half locals and half expats. We love this town!

464373906.name: SIck
464373906.author: a TripAdvisor user
464373906.reviewBody: Sayulita is a cool town with great people, restaurants and sights. We were there in February 2017 and 4 out of 5 of us were  ill, and one of us is still sick a week later and will be seeing a doctor for the second time. We have traveled a lot and take care with what we eat.  We have never been sick during travel before. I do not know for sure but I suspect the beach water might be the problem. It rained the day we arrived and the river was dumping a lot of smelly brown water into the ocean very close to the main beach. Our surf instructor was also ill and mentioned the sewage draining into the ocean as a possible cause. We went on an excursion and everybody we met who was staying in Sayulita had been ill. We were unwell and to nervous to swim in the ocean for most of our vacation. I regret going.

464163078.name: Go on your own
464163078.author: a TripAdvisor user
464163078.reviewBody: This was a day tour offered by Grey Line. The content was poor. The tour guide was obnoxious. We didn\'t know we were doing yet another tequila tour and it took almost 2 hours to go the short distance. This made the time in Sayulita very brief. Wouldn\'t recommend or do this again.

464153246.name: gorgeous
464153246.author: a TripAdvisor user
464153246.reviewBody: we spent basically all day everyday of our honeymoon on this beach. we hired some lounges for the day, surfed, sunbaked & drank cocktails. absolute bliss.

463914851.name: Cool beach
463914851.author: a TripAdvisor user
463914851.reviewBody: It\'s a cool beach, not good for swimming (lots of rocks). A bit crowded and not so clean. Good environment with friends though.

463788495.name: Not worth the trip from Puerto Vallarta
463788495.author: a TripAdvisor user
463788495.reviewBody: If you are quite young and like to surf, this is the place for you. I am not so young, and don\'t like to surf. Not much else to do here, although lunch at Don Pedro\'s was lovely.

463759661.name: Beach
463759661.author: a TripAdvisor user
463759661.reviewBody: Very busy beach.  Not for me but was cool.  Watching the surfers was fun.  Felt safe...no worries.  Don\'t recommend the restaurant on the corner with the sand floor...wasn\'t good!!

463499213.name: A Great Beach
463499213.author: a TripAdvisor user
463499213.reviewBody: Sayulita\'s main beach is a great beach for the whole family.  You can swim in relative safety at the south end of the beach or boogie board or surf near the reef.  Numerous opportunities to rent SUP boards, surf boards and anything else you might need to have a fun time.  Food and drink abound and the usual suspects ply the beach offering trinkets and souvenirs of every kind.  The bad thing about Sayulita...and the beach...is you will not want to leave!

463036022.name: Sand here gross
463036022.author: a TripAdvisor user
463036022.reviewBody: Restaurants on beach were good, but the beach sand here, if you want to call the black dirt that, was disgusting.  Don\'t bring your good flip-flops.  There are 2 water flows running into the water that carry the run off from the streets and who knows what else.

463029082.name: Nice little town to v isit with lots history.
463029082.author: a TripAdvisor user
463029082.reviewBody: Very nice beach area . Nice sand, Relaxing place Nice little town to v isit with lots history. Nice tour  excellent guide

463023922.name: Surfing a beach ,a great place to people watch
463023922.author: a TripAdvisor user
463023922.reviewBody: We loved the excitement of this area , it is busy ,but part of the fun and lots to see and do.  The town is alive with people. The waves are something to see. We ate on the beach and enjoyed the visit.

462975178.name: Not clean for swimming
462975178.author: a TripAdvisor user
462975178.reviewBody: If you have small children, head to Playa los muertos, just a short walk south of Sayulita for a cleaner, safer swim!

462938061.name: Awesome!
462938061.author: a TripAdvisor user
462938061.reviewBody: Fun, fun, fun.\nWarm sandy beaches. Great waves. Safe and lots of cool shops. Like Tofino, BC? You\'ll love Sayulita

462937644.name: Amazing day trip from PVR
462937644.author: a TripAdvisor user
462937644.reviewBody:
Our family of 9 took the Compostela bus from our resort northbound to Sayulita at just before 10am. The trip was in a modern & comfortable bus and took us about an hour. We walked through town from the bus stop towards the beach for about 20 min - a walk with many stops to look at wares along the way.

The beach was spectacular. There is surfing, paddle boarding or just playing in the waves all day. Beachside vendors come by to serve you drinks or food. (pricey but good) 

This was a great day trip for us and we seriously are considering a longer stay next trip.

462793005.name: Love love love!!
462793005.author: a TripAdvisor user
462793005.reviewBody: I\'ve been to this beach numerous times now and it never fails me. Always a good time and would highly recommend getting a massage, they are wonderful and very reasonably priced!

462685015.name: Pretty. Busy
462685015.author: a TripAdvisor user
462685015.reviewBody: Beautiful!\nCan get crowded. Don\'t go during spring break . Surfing lessons, bars and restaurants on beach, dogs everywhere! (It\'s a good thing!)

462593741.name: Nice but smelly
462593741.author: a TripAdvisor user
462593741.reviewBody:
There's no denying the natural beauty of this beach but we noticed in one area they are pumping out some pretty smelly water onto a dirt road that eventually empties into the ocean and gives the whole beach an unfortunate odor. 

Its also al little more crowded than some of the other beaches we've been to in Mexico but not overcrowded. Swimming is challenging as with many pacific ocean beaches and there are some rocks but if you're careful you can have some fun int he water. We don't surf but it does seem to be quite good for that and there are a few surfing schools on the sand. 

There are also many restaurants. We went to only a few of them and I have to say I've had better in terms of both food and service. The real disappointment though was in the quality of the drinks we kept finding. Margaritas everywhere seemed to be weak and cheaply made. Several seemed like some kind of cool-aid mix with little to no tequila. We had some luck with regular margaritas on the rocks but as soon as you add a flavor it becomes bad. 

One more sad thing is the lack of a sunset. On the main beach the sun goes down behind a mountainous area so you don't see it. 

On a positive note, the beat vendors aren't overly pushy and have a varied selection of goods. 

3 stars might be a little harsh because even with its faults, its a pretty relaxing place to spend your vacation.

462386253.name: Nice day trip through the jungle to Sayulita
462386253.author: a TripAdvisor user
462386253.reviewBody: Short and sweet, Sayulita is a lovely, compact, romantic town with glorious beaches, excellent choices for restaurants and coffee, shopping, surfing, paddle boarding and just relaxing and enjoying beautiful weather. Although we have for decades, vacationed in Bucerias, we love taking an adventurous 45-50 minute bus ride through the jungle to Sayulita for the day where we are always greeting by friendly, helpful folks, an occasional pet water buffalo, lovely views, excellent shopping, and many delicious dining choices. A wonderful town on Bandaras Bay to stay or just go for an exciting day trip.

462305973.name: Mexican Surfing Town
462305973.author: a TripAdvisor user
462305973.reviewBody: Well real Mexico is in this town, full of surfers, paddle boarders, Hippies, Yuppies, Seniors, students.  Hopping all day long.  Variety of restaurants and shops, (lots of coffee shops) you can sit on the beach, sipping a tall drink or cheap beer 25 pesos and just watch all the activity, great watching the surfers catch a wave.  Loved it, take a bus trip from PVR or rent a Casa on Gringo Hill (great exercise)

462276625.name: great wide walking beach...
462276625.author: a TripAdvisor user
462276625.reviewBody: surfing at the far end, but the dominant sense is relaxed and NOT crowded... wonderful evening surf sound!

462222112.name: Sayulita for the win!
462222112.author: a TripAdvisor user
462222112.reviewBody: We came to Sayulita for the day and it was the best of our vacation! We are now planning a vacation back to Sayulita. The beach is great. The ocean is wild - we sat on the sand mesmerized by all the surfers. Instead of renting the beach chairs we went into a local shop and got a large beach blanket and put that out on the sand. Loved the vendors that come by the beach with doughnuts, candy and fruit! So yummy! I had to try it all! Very pleasant vendors that if you were to say no they just keep on going. \nSo many restaurants and shops around you could eat for days!!! Best tacos for the best prices!!!

462032177.name: Fun beach
462032177.author: a TripAdvisor user
462032177.reviewBody: We\'re we\'re here almost three weeks. The beach is a gas:  people watching, walking, interacting with multiple vendors, shopping-eating/drinking at the various establishments near town. The first week we were there (late January) the surf was angry, temperatures chilly because of the wind--and red flags up because of the rip tides. The surfers were not having any problems. This is just a fun beach.

461875566.name: Watch the surfers from your table
461875566.author: a TripAdvisor user
461875566.reviewBody: Surfing classes and board-rentals make this a favorite beach for surfers. Sip a cocktail, and watch the surfers from your table.

461748832.name: get away to Sayulita
461748832.author: a TripAdvisor user
461748832.reviewBody:
Sayulita is a very nice surfing town on the Riviera Nayarit coastline. Colourful and vibrant with lots to see, from vendors selling souvenirs to local markets you can visit to find what you're looking for.
Great restaurants all around town, i recommend El Costeño for a really good margarita (try the Mango Margarita).
If you're a surfer you'll love the scene there, and even if you're not it's a great place to give surfing a try. There are many spots that give you surf lessons for a very fair price.
Did i mention beer costs a few cents/bottle?

461282125.name: Great surfing, people watching and nice beach
461282125.author: a TripAdvisor user
461282125.reviewBody: My husband and I took a cab out to Sayulita from Riviera Nayarit which was approximately 40 minutes and a beautiful drive. Once we arrived we went straight to the beach which were filled with surfers and sun worshippers. I liked that the surfboard rentals were right on the beach. This was a happening place to be compared to the resort community we were staying at. If you stay out there while the sun is getting ready to set, there are a lot more advanced surfers out. Fun to watch them. The only negative thing about this beach, as with any public beach in Mexico, is there are a lot of people soliciting their goods. It seemed to me to be more than normal but that is part of the experience I guess. Still worth checking out!

461024846.name: Nice beach
461024846.author: a TripAdvisor user
461024846.reviewBody: The beach is nice, be careful not to get caught in the undertow.  We saw several people get rescued.\nWe stayed just off the beach for a week & it was wonderful.\nWe\'ll be waiting to see if the city cleans up the river that flows into the ocean, before coming back.

460988621.name: Busy Beach
460988621.author: a TripAdvisor user
460988621.reviewBody: Was busy throughout my stay which is good for some and maybe a downer for others.  The north part of the beach across from the "sewer creek" tends to be much quieter.  Fun to kick back, soak up the sun, and watch the surfers.

460915302.name: Sayulita Beach Is ok.
460915302.author: a TripAdvisor user
460915302.reviewBody: Sayulita is a surfing town, the waves are consistent and big so it\'s great for surfers. For Swimming and snorkeling it is not much fun. The Waves are too big for most people to swim and they have a huge problem with water quality in Sayulita. The River that dumps into the ocean is filthy and smells terrible, They really need to start getting their infrastructure figured out before they allow more and more airbnb\'s and vacation rentals to inundate the town. It\'s Charming and beautiful and the people are wonderful just don\'t expect pristine swimming beaches and expect to get sick and your love it.

460784629.name: ok beach
460784629.author: a TripAdvisor user
460784629.reviewBody: nice beach but crouded. To get away from the crouds go a little further north.San francisco Los Ayala and others

460655796.name: Prettiest Bay Beach on the West Coast
460655796.author: a TripAdvisor user
460655796.reviewBody: Went to Sayulita beach,  small scale, gorgeous people, bohemian vibe, better music than PV beaches, got to get here more often.

460469536.name: Busy beach
460469536.author: a TripAdvisor user
460469536.reviewBody: You can\'t watch the sunset from here in winter but the beach is beautiful and the water is pretty calm. Good for families!

459427533.name: Best beach town experience!
459427533.author: a TripAdvisor user
459427533.reviewBody: Sayulita is a fantastic day trip experience.  You can eat, shop, relax, learn to surf or just explore the streets to find some hidden gems. Friendly people everywhere. Lots of people who stay here for the winter are friendly canadians.  You can get here by bus easily from most bus stops.  Even the bus trip is an experience in itself.

459408561.name: Relaxing Sayulita Beach
459408561.author: a TripAdvisor user
459408561.reviewBody: Spent a day in the tourist town of Sayulita and naturally gravitated toward the beach. After about an hour walk on the sand, it was cerveza time. Found a charming little outdoor restaurant right on the beach and spent the next couple of hours just enjoying a cold one and letting the world walk by. Epitome of relaxation.

459306582.name: A reason to return
459306582.author: a TripAdvisor user
459306582.reviewBody: My boyfriend and I usually don\'t like to return to places we\'ve already travelled because we figure it\'s such a big world and we only have one lifetime, but Sayulita is the exception.

458900183.name: New fave
458900183.author: a TripAdvisor user
458900183.reviewBody: You have to see it to believe it (but maybe you shouldn\'t  ... part of its charm is how quiet it is) ... Our new favorite spot in Mexico. Incredible views, friendly people, delicious food and drinks, talented artisans - all unite to make for an authentic Mexican holiday.

458851997.name: A nice little gem!
458851997.author: a TripAdvisor user
458851997.reviewBody: it looks like a good place to bring your children to learn how to surf because the break happens in about 4 feet of water so you could hold the board for your child wild a catch a wave. I am however, a little concerned about the quote un quote Rivers that come into the ocean in the middle of town.. It looks like raw sewage to me.

458487207.name: Awesome
458487207.author: a TripAdvisor user
458487207.reviewBody: Love sayulita and everything that is has to offer.  Smells a little funky sometimes but so does BC!!!!

458477435.name: Too many tourist
458477435.author: a TripAdvisor user
458477435.reviewBody: The beach is ok but there\'s far too many tourist in the town and cars to enjoy it. There\'s also a waste outlet right into the main beach which stinks.  You can see sick on the water when your surfing and one guy said to disinfect your cuts if you have any once your out the sea. Pretty bad. I\'d give this place a miss, it\'s like a saga holiday for Americans.

458289697.name: Beautifl Beach
458289697.author: a TripAdvisor user
458289697.reviewBody: On a day trip from Iberostar Playa Mita we strolled the beach and watched surfers, amateur and semi-pro alike, and really enjoyed the laid back feel of Sayulita Beach!

458146213.name: Beautiful beach with local color
458146213.author: a TripAdvisor user
458146213.reviewBody: Our family has been coming to Sayulita for years. We love this spot. It is not for those who like resort locations. This beach has more "local color."  You can rent beach chairs or buy an umbrella & mat from a vendor.  Several places offer surfing & paddle board lessons. This place is great for surfers & surf watching. We love ordering a bucket of cold beers and enjoying the sights.

458120721.name: Great beach for surfers
458120721.author: a TripAdvisor user
458120721.reviewBody:
The beach here offers surfers pretty good waves.
The sand is a little more coarse than the beach at Nuevo and also much smaller. It can get pretty crowded with young people.
There are beach vendors renting matts and umbrellas.
Nice day visit but not sure I'd want to stay for a long period of time.

457982035.name: Great Beach
457982035.author: a TripAdvisor user
457982035.reviewBody: The town of Sayulita and the beach offers a great excursion from Puerto Vallarta. Nice to enjoy the beach while watching the surfers.

457871785.name: Nice sandy beach.  Waves are good for surfing as well in some locations along the beach
457871785.author: a TripAdvisor user
457871785.reviewBody: Great for swimming or surfing.  Not much of a snorkelling  spot however.  Several good beach bars for people watching and a cool thirst quencher!

457672420.name: Average beach but great for surfing.
457672420.author: a TripAdvisor user
457672420.reviewBody:
It's not that we expected much from this beach from reading previous reviews, but this area could use a little work if they want to keep the tourists happy. Most of my problem with this beach stems from the smell that the river, which empties into the ocean, emits. The river flows through town and carries an aroma with it that may stop just short of smelling like sewage.
    However, if you were to walk a little north of town, the beach becomes less crowded with fewer vendors trying to sell assorted trinkets, cigars, etc. 
    Understandably, the beach is only a minor attraction to the fantastic surfing available off it's shores! But if you are coming here to enjoy a relaxing day on the beach, you may want to rethink it. 
    Also, if you were to walk a little north of town, the beach becomes less crowded with many less vendors trying to sell assorted trinkets, cigars, etc.

457620372.name: SeeYouLater.... Sayulita
457620372.author: a TripAdvisor user
457620372.reviewBody:
Spectacular views and beach, but what a stink hole! The creek that splits the beach reeks of raw sewage and 3 out of 4 of us were sick after our visit. I agree with Mark1539's comments about the pounding surf putting sewage mist into the air. 

Prices for food and drink are higher than average and the beach services are posted in US $$'s, not Pesos. ??? 

Been there, done that, bought the T-shirt. SeeYouLater, Sayulita!

457364242.name: Always interesting
457364242.author: a TripAdvisor user
457364242.reviewBody: Love the beach here, always lots of people watching, surfers to watch, food and drinks readily available. Lots of good surf schools/ board rentals up and down the beach. You can buy almost anything from the vendors, they can be annoying but a polite" non gracias" usually gets them to leave you alone. Lots of discussion about water quality but after six years I\'ve never been sick.

457352802.name: Day trip to Sayulita
457352802.author: a TripAdvisor user
457352802.reviewBody: We went here for a day trip. The shopping are is bright and very busy! We were never hounded by anyone.There seems to be more restaurants than shops. We went down to the beach and it was very pretty! Lots going on and the beach was full! Fun to watch the surfers. We only spent a few hours here and enjoyed it.

457035649.name: Don\'t Go!
457035649.author: a TripAdvisor user
457035649.reviewBody: This is definitely not the best place on the coast. It\'s not adorable or laid back or friendly. The food wasn\'t delicious and the beach gorgeous. Please, nobody should ever go. Unless you\'re cool. Be cool...

456803440.name: Sewage discharged into the surfing area. Many sick people.
456803440.author: a TripAdvisor user
456803440.reviewBody: Beautiful town and beach. Unfortunately the town discharges sewage into the river that feeds into the surf area of the ocean. I was there over Christmas 2016. It was very busy and the town  sewage system not able to handle the capacity of people. At one point raw sewage was backed up through the manholes on a main street and there was raw sewage everywhere. You could smell it on the beach and I could see it being discharged into the river from the town sewage facility. Ultimately the sewage emptied into the ocean and became airborne from the pounding surf so you were breathing it in just walking on the beach. I met numerous sick people who stayed at different places, ate at different places and some who were not even in the ocean.  The only common thing the sick people had was that they were on the beach breathing in the airborne sewage. I would not go back to Sayulita unless the town invests in a adequate sewage facility.

456577439.name: Awesome small town feel
456577439.author: a TripAdvisor user
456577439.reviewBody: This beach was amazing.  It has fine sand, and plenty of space to lay out.  We rented 2 recliners for the day for $20 USD.  The beach was very clean and not to busy.  Great surfing!

456463659.name: Gorgeous Beach - a bit smelly
456463659.author: a TripAdvisor user
456463659.reviewBody: I\'ve been to Sayulita a number of times.  There is no denying that the beach there is gorgeous, walkable and has spectacular sunsets.  However, each time I\'ve been the "sewage" smell has been getting worse.  This last time was really nasty and I wonder if it\'s healthy to even swim there.  I hate to say it as it\'s a great place to go but be careful where you swim and avoid any of the "river\'s running into the ocean from town.

456426897.name: Beautiful scenery - rough sand
456426897.author: a TripAdvisor user
456426897.reviewBody: Beautiful place to look at, rough on the feet to walk. Not a swim beach, rough waters abound. Lots of surfers to watch and many, many peddlers trying to sell their goods. Most the time a gracious "no, gracias" works, but their was one insistent soul determined to not take a no... Period! Go for the views, enjoy the sunset, even ride a horse on the beach.

456286010.name: Beach ok
456286010.author: a TripAdvisor user
456286010.reviewBody: Beach ok but sewage at the north end makes it unpleasant some days. Great surf if that\'s you\'re thing

456221822.name: Loved the beach!
456221822.author: a TripAdvisor user
456221822.reviewBody: It was a little crowded, but a great family beach with lots of restaurants nearby. Beach was clean, kids loved boogie boarding in the waves.

455913749.name: Beach
455913749.author: a TripAdvisor user
455913749.reviewBody: Wonderful beach. Big waves. I would not go in water with out buggie board attached to me. Even then it\'s very rough. Need water shoes. Lots of rocks come in with the waves. They are large and non stop. The waves will knock your top off. I suggest. Getting a surf suit at local shop. Don\'t try to be a hero. Rip tide is strong. Be smart. It is so much fun

455675845.name: Wonderful day at the beach
455675845.author: a TripAdvisor user
455675845.reviewBody: We visited sayulita on a whim as I was bored at our resort.  The reviews were somewhat mixed but my gut instincts were that it would be worthwhile to go and it was.  It was so great that we wished we had stayed there instead of at the grand palladium resort in punta mita.  The beach was fantastic, the locals were friendly,  the town was colourful and fun.  We stopped for gelato and it was some of the best I have ever had.  I would definitely go back again and rent a villa as we have come to learn we are not interested in all inclusive resorts.  \nIf you are looking to experience the laid back atmosphere of a small surf town this is the place for you.\nHighly recommend!

455663282.name: Day trip worth taking
455663282.author: a TripAdvisor user
455663282.reviewBody: We took a day trip to Sayulita and loved every minute. Yes, it can get crowded, but we went in the morning and it was perfect. We had a guide that explained the history and introduced us to \'breakfast\' tacos. We sat on the beach, had lunch and then visited San Pancho close to Sayulita. San Pancho was much quieter and peaceful, i.e. no crowds. But with that said, it didn\'t have much commerce like Sayulita. If you want a balance, go to both towns.

455445091.name: Be prepared
455445091.author: a TripAdvisor user
455445091.reviewBody: We spent a month at a beautiful house which looked over the beach. That was the best thing about our stay. Halfway through, the transit police confiscated every golf cart in town and apparently in all the surrounding towns. That included people\'s personal golf carts as well as the rental golf carts we enjoyed. That put everyone on foot. Would have spent twice as much money in Sayulita had we been able to get around more easily. Walking up and down cobblestone hills carrying groceries was too much for 65 year old knees. It was sad and inexplicable. Also, be prepared for a town that has massively outgrown its infrastructure if there ever was any. There is trash everywhere.

455302604.name: Baby sea turtle releases!
455302604.author: a TripAdvisor user
455302604.reviewBody: This may be an event that only happens in early January, but we happened to be present when a local turtle conservation group was releasing newly-hatched sea turtles into the sea. Both children and adults released the baby turtles onto a prepared area of the beach, and we watched and cheered them on as they crawled towards the incoming waves. Delightful!

455288668.name: So very sad
455288668.author: a TripAdvisor user
455288668.reviewBody: We had heard that Sayulita had become way over crowded and that was no joke!  Yep there are a lot of hippies there (and we were two of them) and a lot of other eclectic folks, which is the good part of the town.  The population has overgrown the town\'s infrastructure and in many areas what you smell is sewage, raw, nasty sewage.  There\'s a river that stinks so bad and then you see it running right into the ocean, very sad.  The beach itself, though the waves are beautiful and somehow the water still has a nice color, it\'s just plain dirty.  With so many other wonderful beaches and towns in the area, Sayulita just isn\'t for us.  So sad to see that this happened.

455195548.name: Barracuda Restaruant is awsome
455195548.author: a TripAdvisor user
455195548.reviewBody: fresh, burrittos, cerviche and amazing service.  We spent most of the day here.  We took the bus from Mega mall for 20 pesos and a 35 min drive.  Wow, such a great and unexpected treat.

455089812.name: Very busy place!
455089812.author: a TripAdvisor user
455089812.reviewBody: The beach itself is lovely with lots of wave action and a fun place for people watching. The surfers tend to be at the south end so if you want quiet, head down to the north end.

455076995.name: By far our favorite from this vacation
455076995.author: a TripAdvisor user
455076995.reviewBody: We travelled here two separate days on our vacation. The vibe was great really laid back and a good mix of local and tourist. The little shops and vendors along the way we\'re great. Many many food locations to chose from along the way. The beach itself was very nice scenery wise although there was lots of people it still had a very relaxed enjoyable atmosphere. A place I will always fondly remember!

455067991.name: avoid at all costs
455067991.author: a TripAdvisor user
455067991.reviewBody: Have been there 10 years ago and kept a nice memory of it. Went back today from Puerto Vallarta where I am  vacatuonung. What a huge disappointment. Lots of tourists, dirty beach and not appealing ocean water. We had lunch in obe of the restaurants just on the beach and I am not going to describe the awful status of the washrooms despite the fact they charge you a fee.\nNever again

455001567.name: unexpected surprise
455001567.author: a TripAdvisor user
455001567.reviewBody: Got brave and took the bus to Sayulita after many people recommended it.  What a blast!  Hippie, surfer, artisan shops, good food and drinks.  Would def go back!

454598346.name: Fun trip
454598346.author: a TripAdvisor user
454598346.reviewBody: This was a great day trip on the bus out of PV. It\'s a little weird when they drop you off in what looks like the middle of nowhere but just follow everyone else to the beach down the dirt road.  The town is very laid back and the people are great.  The beach is nice with many chairs you can rent (almost free if you buy food or drinks from the restaurants).  We rented some surf boards just to try it out for $5/hour and had a blast in the waves.

454550391.name: Not worth our time
454550391.author: a TripAdvisor user
454550391.reviewBody: We came here for a few hours looking forward to seeing a beautiful beach, real Mexican culture and having a relaxing day away from our resort. Sadly it was just another overcrowded tourist trap only with a not so beautiful beach as there was dogs poo all over. I had to tell my son not to pick sea shells because we weren\'t sure what he might pick up. Adding to the list was broken lounge chairs that they wanted to rent to you, beach vendors that never knew when to stop, the same  restaurants as anywhere else with the same filthy bathrooms with toilets that haven\'t been flushed all day because the water is shut off.  The only thing we did enjoy was watching a few good surfers hit some of the waves that were rolling in and the drive through the "jungle" as we called it. Save your time and go to Bucerias. They have beaches worth visiting.

454394833.name: Slice of paradise
454394833.author: a TripAdvisor user
454394833.reviewBody: Took the bus from PV with 19 month old and 4 year old and it truly did not disappoint.  Surfer town that still holds on to its Mexican authenticity with pride.  Very chill town with an eclectic group of tourists.  Just beautiful.  Will definitely be back.

454337996.name: Our favourite place in Mexico!
454337996.author: a TripAdvisor user
454337996.reviewBody: This is the place to go if you are wanting big waves and a good place to learn how to surf. Sayulita gives you a really great peek into the true Mexican culture. The vendors were very different than in Bucerias, a lot more crystal necklaces and funky art. The service everywhere we went was great, the food was good, and the beach and ocean was beautiful. We took a bus from Puerto Vallarta for only 40 pesos to bring us to Sayulita, but next time we definitely will stay right in Sayulita. It was our favourite place that we visited!

454272768.name: Beautiful beach in a great little town
454272768.author: a TripAdvisor user
454272768.reviewBody: We went to Sayulita and the beach when we were near Puerto Vallarta recently. Great beach and a great little town. You have to go here if you are near Puerto Vallarta. Great crafts, great people and cold beer!

454101095.name: Sayulita by the sea
454101095.author: a TripAdvisor user
454101095.reviewBody: Sayulita, great town full of energy and life, even if most of the people are there for odd reasons. This melting pot of drop-outs makes for a very interesting mix of "locals". Town has all kinds of shops, bars, coffee houses and surfing places.\nDon Pedro\'s is a nice place as well many other great restaurants.

453511685.name: Not a quite fishing village. This is a tourist village, plain and simple.
453511685.author: a TripAdvisor user
453511685.reviewBody: Im tired of reading tourists call Sayulita a little fishing village. You must be from New York and never seen a real Mexican village, certainly not a real fishing village. This is the farthest thing from a Mexican fishing village there is, the economy is almost entirely based on tourism, what fishermen there are are fishing to provide for the restaurants for tourists. If you want to visit a real fishing village, try Tehuamixtle in Cabo Corrientes. Sayulita is cool for what it is, it is a richy rich tourist hipster beach. I wouldnt even call it a hippy town. . . Most hippies wouldnt stand for the prices that can be found here. This place is pricey, hip, and not sleepy fish village in the least bit. Get real people. Call it what it is.

453472454.name: Sayulita beach red flagged
453472454.author: a TripAdvisor user
453472454.reviewBody: Do not swim in the beach many tourist are getting ill from the contaminated waters. Please check the flag at the main beach before swimming. We have been here for a month and it has been red flagged for contamination the whole time. Unfortunately, many tourists are still swimming in it.

453436927.name: Small and crowded!
453436927.author: a TripAdvisor user
453436927.reviewBody: Sayulita has gotten much more crowded over the years, and touristy. The surf lessons are great. It\'s hard to get a decent chair or place to lounge. In my opinion it\'s good for a day or 2, then you may seek adjacent beaches.

453237334.name: Beware of runoff into water
453237334.author: a TripAdvisor user
453237334.reviewBody: We stayed in Sayulita for 10 days in January. The beach was lovely with many swimmers, boogie boarders and surfers. HOWEVER....one day while we were there there was a sewer/water flood of a street in town and all that eventually makes it way down into the ocean. I had joined a FB group and it was abuzz with locals talking about it and saying \'don\'t go into the water\'. Too late...we already had gone in. 3 of the 4 of us got ill on this trip. Was it from the ocean? From a restaurant? Water? Who can say? \nThere was also a rash of break-ins and thieves stealing cash from safes in rental properties while we were there. I thought Sayulita was charming but I\'m not sure I would return.

453122839.name: Lots going on here
453122839.author: a TripAdvisor user
453122839.reviewBody: A great beach if you want to surf or watch surfing while having a tasty lunch on the beach. Too many people to be a relaxing spot to sunbathe but worth checking out.

453037775.name: Beautiful Beach
453037775.author: a TripAdvisor user
453037775.reviewBody: We walked to Sayulita while staying at a local resort, Playa Escondida.  The town was lovely and the beach was breathtaking.  The only negative, was it was very crowded.  We were told that it is hard to swim there due to the surfers, but that was not the case.

452097628.name: Make sure to check out the north end of the beach!
452097628.author: a TripAdvisor user
452097628.reviewBody: The beach right down from the main town square is tiny and in a little cove so you can\'t immediately see that the beach actually continues for quite a stretch north of the immediate patch in town. The part right by town is small and very crowded in the high season but if you walk around the little cove to the right and explore the north end of the beach, it\'s extremely beautiful and not remotely crowded.  The water is not very cold even in winter and the waves make for amazing body surfing and boogie boarding, but watch out for the wicked rip tide especially at the north end of the beach. The southern end is much gentler.

451985987.name: High rent to use a lounge chair!
451985987.author: a TripAdvisor user
451985987.reviewBody: Sayulita is an awesome little beach town, laid back, little shops don\'t hawk their wares, the craftsman are working on their art and you can watch and aak questions.  But, beware of wanting to use a lounge chair.  We stated we wanted drinks and lunch and could we use lounge chairs.  We were told would be 20, we presumed pesos, so said yes.  Then man came over and wanted $20 just to lay in lounger.  Food would come from a restaurant a couple of blocks away.  We left and went to a hret taco restaurant a block away and then came back and laid on our towel I brought.  Great beach walking.  Took bus from PV for 40 pesos.

451765929.name: A great beach experience
451765929.author: a TripAdvisor user
451765929.reviewBody: The beach here is great for wading, swimming, body surfing or boats surfing.  There was a nice gentle surf and occasional medium sized waves the day we were there.  Get there early and rent a lounge chair and umbrella.  Beach side service for drinks and snacks is available.  Hieme (Jimmy) was a perfect host and very attentive.

451714839.name: family taxi ride
451714839.author: a TripAdvisor user
451714839.reviewBody: we ventured here with local taxi driver, stopped off a few different places on route.  the town itself was very pretty, there was lots of surfing going on, restaurants and art gallery type shops.  I purchased a few pieces, local handmade wine glasses, some wall art and tiles.  \ni would say a few hours would be enough here unless you want to surf.  the food prices were reasonable here, although i think some of the crafts were overpriced.

451503158.name: Crowded but fun
451503158.author: a TripAdvisor user
451503158.reviewBody: The waves and undertow can get a bit crazy and this is a very popular beach but we had a lot of fun hanging out here.

451259113.name: Bohemian beach
451259113.author: a TripAdvisor user
451259113.reviewBody: Great landscape and vibe. The beach is great for surfers especially if they are just learning. Great bars, very energetic atmosphere

451250046.name: Everyone has their own taste in beach...this was not exactly mine
451250046.author: a TripAdvisor user
451250046.reviewBody: There are some great pluses to the beach here. Pretty. Black very fine sand. Nice location. But the day that I was there it was extremely packed. Bee\'s were an issue so at least one person in our party was stung. The vendors were plentiful...but not overly aggressive. All and all a nice beach.

451240713.name: Awesome Beach
451240713.author: a TripAdvisor user
451240713.reviewBody: Beautiful and clean beach. Saw a turtle release. Great surfing. One end of beach is very calm and quiet while opposite end is popping with food, restaurants, massages, surf schools and more!

451074988.name: Fun beautiful beach
451074988.author: a TripAdvisor user
451074988.reviewBody: My fiance and I spent a beautiful morning on this beach while on vacation in Puerto Vallarta.   The beach was very busy and everyone was friendly and having a wonderful time. We ate at a small restaurant on the beach and did a little shopping in the town.  Can\'t wait to go back!

450861858.name: Can\'t get sick of this place
450861858.author: a TripAdvisor user
450861858.reviewBody: I\'ve only been to Sayulita for a day whilst visiting Puerto Vallarta, but the place is awesome, the perfect nice not so crowded beach with a very nice vibe, perfect for any kind of plans you have from surfing to simply chilling. I\'m really looking forward to go again any time soon

450858781.name: Family vacation
450858781.author: a TripAdvisor user
450858781.reviewBody: We have done a few day trips to Sayulita beach. This is the first time we are doing an extended stay. The beach is fantastic. You can walk so far into the water and there are great waves for surfing and for boogie boarding. The beach is also a great place for people watching. One of our favourite beaches to visit.

450832116.name: Great Beach - dumpy town
450832116.author: a TripAdvisor user
450832116.reviewBody:
NOT a kid friendly town.
The GOOD:  The beach is packed but vibrant and the waves are great compared to anywhere I stayed in PV.  Big difference.  No need to bring anything they rent boogie boards cheap, umbrellas, beach pads.

The BAD:  The town is a dump.  You will descriptions like quant, unique etc.  Its a dump waiting to be glossed over by nighttime where I'm sure it turns into animal house.  I'm not kidding at all.  It is a hippy, pot smoking party town.  The town simply prepares for a night of whoring, drinking, puking and drinking.  I'm no wuss but if you are over 40 and have a career this place will be a complete turnoff.  If you are under 40 and still living with your parents, drink your face off and smoke pot - You will LOVE IT!

450797341.name: Amazing beach town
450797341.author: a TripAdvisor user
450797341.reviewBody: This place is a charming beach town; a relaxed atmosphere can be felt once you are there, if you are near you must go there.

450736496.name: did Not meet our expectations of a romantic beach town
450736496.author: a TripAdvisor user
450736496.reviewBody: This beach town was NOT up to our expectations.
