We anticipated a romantic stroll through cool little souvenir shops, ending the evening with a nice Mexican style dinner on the beach with margaritas, great guacamole, etc.  Unfortunately, unless we were miss directed, and we were guided there by the FS service, the roads were \u201cdirt\u201d and you could only imagine if it was raining, it would be mud and streams everywhere.  Going along with the dirt, the town felt dirty to us, not very safe, and basically for sale was a lot of Tijuana trash.  We were not impressed.  We had made a dinner reservation at Don Pedro\u2019s which we were told was the best.  And I would have to say it reminded me of a dirty shack, on a back road in San Diego that the public health department failed to inspect.  Needless to say, after an hour, we turned around and had our driver take us back.

450734540.name: Nice for an afternoon of surf and sun
450734540.author: a TripAdvisor user
450734540.reviewBody: Nice beach near downtown Sayulita.  On a nice sunny afternoon, it can be a little crowded, but overall, very relaxing.  Waves are not huge but allows for beginner surfers to test their skills.  Nice for body surfing.

450554842.name: Not that bad
450554842.author: a TripAdvisor user
450554842.reviewBody: I read that this beach was filthy. Our rental home was just above it on the hill. We would walk the beach each morning. Lots of surfers out early and it did get crowded about 1:00. I did\'t think it was filthy but there was an area a little north of where we sat that was smelly. There are other beaches that are walking distance if this isn\'t your style.

450493862.name: Stay north for a better beach experience
450493862.author: a TripAdvisor user
450493862.reviewBody: The beach at the north end of Sayulita is cleaner, prettier and less crowded. It is a 8-10 minute walk to town. The beach to the south is where the calmest easiest waves are, but the area is crowded and dirty. We only went to the south beach to surf/SUP.

450448862.name: Armpit would be a compliment.
450448862.author: a TripAdvisor user
450448862.reviewBody: First thing honest people will tell you is that the sewage plant often malfunctions and pollutes the beach.  Don\'t stay anywhere close to town because the nightclubs  start at 11 and play till 4 in the morning.  Add roosters and barking dogs to the mix along with clanging bells in the morning.  Everything is grimy and most of the restaurants look like an invitation to the hospital.  After being here for a week I can tell you that you should not believe the romantic flowery language used to describe this filthy town.

449882496.name: Filthy Terrible Place
449882496.author: a TripAdvisor user
449882496.reviewBody: Sayulita used to be a small sleepy Mexican village with a nice beach and good surfing.  Unfortunately, the town now overflows with next generation hippies and unsuspecting tourists who have arrived on mega buses from PVR.  Some may call it quaint, but we found the town completely covered in a layer of dust. Drainage water (and I suspect some raw sewage) runs in the streets and the local river.  While there are places to stay and have a meal, I would not do either.  The recent crowds over New Years made it a nightmare for driving, parking, etc.  Better to spend your time at Punta Mita, Tuito, etc.

449863126.name: Good Beach
449863126.author: a TripAdvisor user
449863126.reviewBody: The main beach was crazy busy, but we where there during the busiest week of the year.   Next time, I would like to see it during an off week.

449567213.name: Christmas and New Year\'s in Sayulita, Mx
449567213.author: a TripAdvisor user
449567213.reviewBody:
Sayulita, is a quaint town about one hour north of the PVR Airport.  We have been coming here for years, the last three over the Xmas break to accommodate extended family vacation schedules.

Late December has become busier & busier with many more restaurants, street vendors, stores and accommodations being offered.

We do love coming here and will return again.  However,if you haven't been and you are contemplating a visit, I would encourage anyone to come for their first time during a season other than Christmas or New Year's (especially New Year's)!!

I do not believe that the infrastructure of Sayulita can cope with the vast number of visitors during this time and every year we witness the same failings - no water in town, sewage back-ups, garbage spilling out of every receptacle as well as discarded on the streets and beaches, power outages and long lines for access to restaurants, bars and stores and ridiculous traffic jams (yes, traffic jams in such a small place)!!!  Why so many golf carts when the town is so walkable?

Sayulita is a beautiful place and the people here are wonderful.  We love coming here for our vacation!  We have always felt safe, although I know there is some crime, mostly theft.  However, if you use common sense, locking up valuables, such as cash and passports, and leaving expensive items like jewellery and computers at home, you should not have any problem.  

So, in case you have missed my point, visit Sayulita for sure!  But think about doing so at a time other than Christmas or New Year's!

449445365.name: Riding waves. Watching surfers and loving the sun
449445365.author: a TripAdvisor user
449445365.reviewBody: Magic as always.  Worth renting some chairs a brolly and then get the use of the shower and a bathroom to use. We used to bring a roll of toilet paper.  Nice to not have to this time.  The undertow was a bit rough this time. The good thing was the life guards on the main section really communicated where it was safe.  Had a great time watching the surfers and boogie borders. Great day \n\nCheers

448507168.name: Shoulder to shoulder
448507168.author: a TripAdvisor user
448507168.reviewBody:
The beach is steepish.
Unbelievably crowded. 
Waves are medium to large and all beach break. 
Meh......

448116534.name: Surf break
448116534.author: a TripAdvisor user
448116534.reviewBody: Cellulites there is a small beach town, with an excellent surf break. On some days it is excellent for body surfing and there are plenty of people renting boogie boards and surfboards.There are excellent restaurants and vendors on the beach too.

447837627.name: Best place in the world to learn how to surf
447837627.author: a TripAdvisor user
447837627.reviewBody: Sayulita is one of the best places in the world to learn how to surf. There are many surf shops that offer lessons for beginners and will rent surf boards for cheap. The water is warm and the beach is always bumping with activities!

447609522.name: HappycOuple20
447609522.author: a TripAdvisor user
447609522.reviewBody: Beautiful beach! This beach is great for surfing and boogie boarding. The undertow is strong, and it is an active beach. There are several hidden beaches close by, for a more quiet experience.

447558906.name: busy beach
447558906.author: a TripAdvisor user
447558906.reviewBody: This is the main beach of sayulita, where you will find restaurants and bars that line the beach. It is very busy especially on weekends and holidays. If you want your food and drinks to come to you, and don\'t mind all the vendors this beach is for you. If you want to surf here, there are two breaks, which get very busy as of 10am with the surf schools

447527609.name: Great beach but gets crowded
447527609.author: a TripAdvisor user
447527609.reviewBody: Nice beach, but it gets really packed during the Christmas week. It\'s less crowded to the North end, but not by too much. Umbrella rentals are 200-250 pesos and are nice to have. You\'ll get approached to buy things all day long!

447268717.name: great beach but less value
447268717.author: a TripAdvisor user
447268717.reviewBody: We love to bring friends and family here when they visit. Since it has gotten more popular they started charging 200 pesos for two chairs and an umbrella.  10 pesos for the bathroom too.  Used to be included if you bought lunch and cervas.  The main road is also under construction making bus travel from PV much more complicated.

446599674.name: Nice beach, but too many people!
446599674.author: a TripAdvisor user
446599674.reviewBody: Lots and lots of people. Wish there were more space! We were here over Christmas, which I am sure didn\'t help.

446552907.name: Nice beach, clean, strong surf!
446552907.author: a TripAdvisor user
446552907.reviewBody: Family vacation- our second in Sayulita. Beach is very nice and feels safe. Careful of the surf- it can knock you over. Calmer closer to town which has rentals and beach bars!

446494656.name: Great Beach
446494656.author: a TripAdvisor user
446494656.reviewBody: Great beach. Take with you the sunscrean, and some beers of course. You can do Surf and rent equipment

445995531.name: Awesome beach great body surfing
445995531.author: a TripAdvisor user
445995531.reviewBody: We enjoyed our time at the beach. Good body surfing waves and lots of space. Tons of people in the hot afternoon sun. The 300 pesos for a table and 4 chairs rental was a bit ridiculous, especially since we needed two sets for 8 people and the guy wouldn\'t bargain. This was definitely a happening spot.

445396596.name: Sayulita Beach
445396596.author: a TripAdvisor user
445396596.reviewBody: In December the temperature was 85 degrees. The water was a pleasant temperature. The waves were just right for swimming or surfacing. It was relaxing and beautiful. There are very cheap surf board rentals on the beach.  50 pesos for a hour. If an ice cream vendor visits you out there--don\'t miss out!  It was the best, most natural ice cream you have ever eaten!!!

444925510.name: Go there constantly
444925510.author: a TripAdvisor user
444925510.reviewBody: I actually planned on moving there. However it has outgrown itself. Lots of construction in the south end. Unless you are literally a off-road driver, parking is impossible so grab all your friends and take a cab$$$. Great shopping $-$$ off the beaten path, otherwise $$$. GO to Don Pedro\'s -a must. Everything on the menu is great! \nMy favorite is the battered shrimp and stir fry.\nLots of Americans and Canadians have relocated to Sayulita and setup shop there Beautiful beach!!

444913784.name: Sun and fun at the surf beach!
444913784.author: a TripAdvisor user
444913784.reviewBody:
We traveled to Mexico during the summer months to get a sense of the different seasons. Staying in Sayulita for a few days was supposed to be a diversion and it turned into the highlight of our trip. The beach at Sayulita is much different than those of Puerto Vallarta. The small coves catchs just enough tide to create small waves several meters off shore. Swimming and surfing is very enjoyable. 
  On the beach we were offered many amenities and the vendors were friendly when we gave them a polite 'no thank you'. The items we did want however, were easily bought or rented and close at hand. We decided that instead of buying a sun umbrella we would rent one for only a few pesos a day. Vendors offered everything from surf board rental with instruction to massages on the beach. 
   Entering into the beach at the southern end we noticed a little trash that would wash up each day and this is where the boats were stored on the shore. 
  (The fishing boats are available for charter you're interested in fishing.)
    After asking around we met a gentleman who was knowledgeable about spearfishing and he took us out one afternoon for some great snorkeling and fishing. 
     This is a great hidden secret and worth a visit. Get a room for the night and enjoy two days there, you'll be hooked!

444900577.name: Great spot.
444900577.author: a TripAdvisor user
444900577.reviewBody: Really nice beach.  Surf is fairly low but hear it might pick up as we get past full moon.  Lots of beach clubs to rent a deck chair or plenty of space to set up own spot.  Lots of vendors which is unfortunate but that seems to be standard in Mexico.  Did not find them to be pushy though.

444433572.name: Surf, shop, Supper
444433572.author: a TripAdvisor user
444433572.reviewBody: Sayulita is a wonderful little town for enjoying the beach, water activity, shopping and local foods.

444125974.name: Thailand???
444125974.author: a TripAdvisor user
444125974.reviewBody: Recommended by our rep with the description of being like Thailand so we jumped on the local bus (1hr30) and what we found was beautiful. Nice beach, lots of surfers, lots of bars and restaurants. Really nice vibe to the place.

443895759.name: Day visits
443895759.author: a TripAdvisor user
443895759.reviewBody: Great beach to read a book and drink a margarita. I would suggest walking a ways down the beach away from the crowds. Ocean swimming is great. I would love to take my kids here. Great waves! Fairly clean beach compared to other beaches near Cancun. People along the beach are friendly and ok with you saying no to there wares.

443051350.name: Beautiful surfing beach
443051350.author: a TripAdvisor user
443051350.reviewBody: After staying on one of the nearby beaches, we ventured out here towards the end of our trip. I wish we visited this location earlier in our trip, because we would have returned. Lovely waves for boogie boarding, surfing, or stand up paddle boarding. The town is quaint as well.\nWe strolled the beach and found a small more private cove which was beautiful. ....Private until a large group found it and brought a boombox. At this point we left, but we enjoyed it while it was there. The water was warm and clear.

442935085.name: Who knew
442935085.author: a TripAdvisor user
442935085.reviewBody: After 20 years of vacation in Puerto Vallarta, we never traveled north. What a wonderful day trip and possible weekend trip. The beach is beautiful, massages everywhere. Great food, great drinks and relaxing. I highly recommend Sayulita beach and the surrounding local area and shops.

442867863.name: A Great Place to surf and Watch the surfers, very Dog friendly!
442867863.author: a TripAdvisor user
442867863.reviewBody: Sayulita\'s vibe is a perfect combination of surfers , locals and Dogs out on the beach . There is always lots of activity and vendors to fulfill all of  your shopping needs.. Lined with beach bars and and good quality restaurants for when you get hungry without taking your eyes off the surf.!  One thing to consider if you are there to surf ..if you are not bringing your own board  rent and keep it overnight if you want to  catch early morning waves ... .The shops don\'t start renting till 9am or later!

442666514.name: Many people at Sayulita
442666514.author: a TripAdvisor user
442666514.reviewBody: Nice colorful town unfortunately over run with tourists. Beach nice once you get used to the smell.  Sanitation system appears inadequate for the number of people that are using it.  Lots of interesting shops.

442498278.name: Great beach for all types
442498278.author: a TripAdvisor user
442498278.reviewBody:
The beach in Sayulita is great because it is a welcoming scene for all types of people, without any particular group dominating the area. There are surfers, but they are not the "locals rule!" aggressive type. There are families with children, but there are not little kids running around everywhere. People are lounging on the beach, sipping beers, but not being drunk and obnoxious. As is to be expected, there are locals who walk along the beach selling various food and wares, but I did not encounter a single individual who was pushy or rude. Even after I had told them I was not interested, many replied with "ok, thank you, have a nice day". I did purchase a few food items from these individuals - fresh donuts, for example - and they were delicious and inexpensive. 

The ocean water was quite warm when I visited in November. The waves relatively close to the beach were strong enough for boogie boarding, with waves suitable for surfing found 100 yards or so away from the shore. Whatever one's desired level of activity - whether simply splashing in the shallow water, doing some serious surfing, or anything in between - this beach should keep most visitors entertained for at least a few days.

The town of Sayulita is laid back and has a bit of a bohemian vibe. Locals and tourists alike are all pretty mellow and friendly. There are lots of cool little restaurants and bars, as well as small art galleries, souvenir & apparel shops, surf shops, etc. Modified golf carts seemed to be the primary mode of transportation for many locals and expats, and these are available for tourists to rent as well.

441752404.name: crowded but pretty
441752404.author: a TripAdvisor user
441752404.reviewBody: cute place.  Full of tourists and surfers....  fun to visit for part of a day.  We were happy to go back to our secluded beach at our resort.  Lots of cheap shopping, little places to eat and drink, and surfboard rentals!!

441597877.name: Groovy spot!
441597877.author: a TripAdvisor user
441597877.reviewBody: Cool spot! We visited Sayulita for a day when we were in PV. Interesting little arty bohemian town. The surf was not great today but there were still avid surfers out on the waves.\nWell worth a visit!

441417007.name: Mexico at its best
441417007.author: a TripAdvisor user
441417007.reviewBody: Watched the turtle release on the beach then into town for a real Mexican experience bars with music street performers roadside tapas and everybody so friendly so relaxing will visit again one day when next in mexico

441340226.name: AWESOME AS USUAL!
441340226.author: a TripAdvisor user
441340226.reviewBody: 3rd time here and still love it! Great waves, feel safe, lots of places to eat and shop! Just watch out for sea urchants (wear water shoes and stay away from the rocks).

441246258.name: Fun Beach
441246258.author: a TripAdvisor user
441246258.reviewBody: Fun Beach. Could only imagine it being packed during high season. The black sand and "gold" flakes along the southern portion of the beach is beautiful.

441101471.name: Left Puerto Vallarta to stay in Sayulita!
441101471.author: a TripAdvisor user
441101471.reviewBody: Sayulita Beach can get pretty crowded, but the vibe of that town, and the waves are amazing! We left Puerto Vallarta to stay here for 10 days!

440482929.name: Best Little Surf Town in Mexico
440482929.author: a TripAdvisor user
440482929.reviewBody: Hard to find a more relaxing place to spend some time. Sayulita is a beautiful small surfing / tourist town in Mexico about 30 miles north of Puerto Vallarta on the Pacific coast. The beach in Syaulita is great. It gets lovely waves year round and the beach is primarily soft sand with a bay that shelters it from the South. There is a more expert break for surfers to the right (with a rocky bottom and some boulders) and areas to the left that are more chilled for surf schools, beginner surfers, boogie boarders and swimmers of all ages and levels. There are some great restaurants and lots of  shops that border the beach. The beach has plenty of other services like fishing, whale watching, surf lessons, etc. You can of course just lie on the lounge chairs, get massages and have a cerveza. Its super family friendly, safe and welcoming with a great group of people who call it home.

440170510.name: Fun beach to watch surfers.
440170510.author: a TripAdvisor user
440170510.reviewBody: What is black and white and red all over? A gringo covered in Sayulita\'s black sand. So wear sunscreen. Many of the local surfers wear natural sunscreen to protect the fish and the coral around the near by islands. I found some at the Friday market in town called Muchococo and can see why its said to be your best lover. Back at the beach there were consistent warm waves with lots of surfers. While laying on the sand you will be offered: beer, drinks, umbrellas, hand woven palm mats, mexican blankets, jewelry, massages, and you can get a variety of braids put in your hair on the spot. I enjoyed all this and found it festive and interesting. Some people don\'t like all this buzz and go to quiter beaches but for me this is where the action is and I prefer Sayulita beach.

439938900.name: Great place to watch the surfers having fun!
439938900.author: a TripAdvisor user
439938900.reviewBody: This is our 3rd visit to Sayulita (as we usually stay in Puerto Vallarta) and the bus trip is interesting (1.5 hours), love the small town feeling here, watching surfers are fun, exploring the small streets is fun...  Relax in the shade and try Mary\'s restaurant - a great fried whole fish!

439802863.name: Very pleasant beach
439802863.author: a TripAdvisor user
439802863.reviewBody:
Sayulita tourism got its start as a surfer's beach, and remains so, but just about all other good aspects most folks want in a beach are here as well.  Warm water, pretty setting, sunny days, cheap beer, decent beach cafes.

Polite vendors offer umbrellas, chairs, crafts, etc., but a simple no thank you gets a nod and a smile and on they move.

Like any surfing beach, some days are better than others, but this Thanksgiving week the surfers are out in large numbers and the good ones on the best waves must be getting rides of close to 100 yards.

And while the town has a strong touristy element, it has not lost its charm as a Mexican town where kind, welcoming Mexicans go about their lives normally.

439786182.name: Harassment
439786182.author: a TripAdvisor user
439786182.reviewBody:
I live in N.Vallarta and having been visiting Sayulita weekly, for about 10 years.  We all get that the beach peddlers are part of the charm and colour of the place.  This year, however, the pestering is bordering on harassment.  The tall hippy with the big hat and the whale songs would not take several "no thank you's" for an answer.  Finally, our "please go away, you are bothering us" provoked a nasty outburst and a lecture.  We threatened to call the police, which sent him scurrying along.

As I said, I live in Mexico and am very used to the beach scene, but this guy was a bridge too far.  Sayulita is working hard to improve its infrastructure, but peddlers like this unpleasant Rastaman (who is likely not even a Mexican national), will ruin it for everyone.  

It will be a long while until my family, and my very large circle of friends, and their wallets return to Sayulita.  San Pancho will be our new beach hangout.

Pay attention to this problem, Sayulita municipality.  This will ultimately hurt you financially.

439644267.name: Best beach for many things...
439644267.author: a TripAdvisor user
439644267.reviewBody: Learning to surf, renting a SUP, having a $20 60 minute massage on the beach, having waiters bring fresh drinks & food...water temp is perfect this time of the year too!

439507421.name: A little piece of heaven on Earth
439507421.author: a TripAdvisor user
439507421.reviewBody: Imagine a beach on the pacific coast of Mexico that has all the charm of the old world, the chill vibe of a surfers retreat, people from all around the world, and the views of paradise.  there you are - a must visit.

439373812.name: Surf and Sand
439373812.author: a TripAdvisor user
439373812.reviewBody: This is a beautiful beach to visit especially if you like surfing. There were opportunities to take surf lessons or just rent a board and hit the waves.\nThat not your thing? Grab a massage at one of the many tents on the beach. There was also plenty of restaurants to grab a bite to eat. You might find something to buy from one of the many people selling a variety of items. \nThat was the one thing I did not like. If you want to be left alone good luck finding a spot. These people find you as they are everywhere.

439166381.name: Fun beach with surfing waves
439166381.author: a TripAdvisor user
439166381.reviewBody: The main beach in Sayulita. Can be crowded and commercial but still a great place. They further south you go (away from the river) the better it is.

439135821.name: Sunset is beautiful
439135821.author: a TripAdvisor user
439135821.reviewBody: It\'s difficult to get a great sunset photo at this time of year here, because it sets behind the point...so we walked all the way to the end of North Beach to get amazing photos! The sand is soft in most places and it\'s flat enough to walk almost the whole length right by the water\'s edge. Not very populated at the north end but there are beautiful homes to see and warm water to walk in!

439133065.name: Beautiful as always.
439133065.author: a TripAdvisor user
439133065.reviewBody: Getting much busier now, especially near the main town centre, but walk north a bit and you\'ll have all the space and peace you want.

438179901.name: Perfect.
438179901.author: a TripAdvisor user
438179901.reviewBody: Beautiful sandy beach.  Gold flecks in black sand and the water even glitters.  -absolutely amazing.  Lots of vendors, but really nice ones who don\'t harass like in Cabo.  Excellent experience.

438134193.name: Walk the beach..its a must!!
438134193.author: a TripAdvisor user
438134193.reviewBody: Very long beach. Sit on the beach...soak up the sun!! The beach is beautiful...lots to do like...paddle boarding, surfing and swimming.  Take a walk/run along beach.\n\nWatch out for all the of the men and woman trying to get you to by something. Never ask how much...unless you really really want something because once you start they wont give up..

437543813.name: Great beach
437543813.author: a TripAdvisor user
437543813.reviewBody: Great beach. Good for surfing & people watching. Great scenery. Would defiantly recommend anyone to visit this place, they won\'t be disopointed.

437528052.name: Overcrowed
437528052.author: a TripAdvisor user
437528052.reviewBody: We stayed in Sayulita for a week. I found the beach to be to crowed for such a small area. It was a little disconcerting to me that the surfers were surfing within feet of the swimmers. Typical restaurants on the beach. Not to many beach vendors. I was disappointed I could not see the actual sun set from this beach. 6:30pm north beach, they release the turtles, they even give you your own turtles to release. Besides seeing the turtles, I would not make a special trip to this beach

437237858.name: Good times!
437237858.author: a TripAdvisor user
437237858.reviewBody: The shopping was great with many little artisan shops throughout. Great little food venues including the best little taco kiosk ever! The beach was a fun but a little dirty with vendors offering everything from food to gifts and surf lessons. We bought a six pack and hung out like locals. Quick cabs all over. Get your art piece here!!

437092468.name: Amazing surf beach
437092468.author: a TripAdvisor user
437092468.reviewBody: If you want to learn to surf this is the place to go. Everyone is super helpful and chill. The beach is gorgeous and very clean. There are people from all over the world coming to this little town to surf and I can see why.

436759901.name: Fantastic day out at this beautiful beach
436759901.author: a TripAdvisor user
436759901.reviewBody: Our Rep at our hotel recommended we check out Sayulita (a taxi from Bucerias was about 250 Mexican pesos). We are so glad we did. It is a lovely little town with great restaurants and unique souvenir shops (perfect place to buy souvenirs at a reasonable price). The waves at the beach were huge and loads of people were surfing and there were lots of huts on the beach teaching surfing lessons. There are plenty of massage parlours along the beach and me and my fianc\u00e9e both had a full body massage which was amazing!! There are plenty of bars also. If you are in the Bay of Banderas I highly recommend a visit to Sayulita!!

436711893.name: Cool Surf Town
436711893.author: a TripAdvisor user
436711893.reviewBody: Sayulita is a cool little surf town off the beaten path. We were staying in Nuevo Vallarta and took a 30 minute cab ride to Sayulita. It was an awesome little town to explore for a few hours. Very laid back and lots of tourist shops and restaurants. Worth a day trip visit.

436636567.name: Sea turtles at the beach!
436636567.author: a TripAdvisor user
436636567.reviewBody: I didn\'t have as much of an opportunity to swim due to weather but the water was beautiful. We also got to take in the sea turtles and help with the release. Inspiring and amazing. Fantastic sunsets.

436461900.name: Sweet place
436461900.author: a TripAdvisor user
436461900.reviewBody: We had a great time at this place. So much fun and awesome place to visit... lots of great people watching and surfing to be had... don\'t miss this place.... fun fun fun....

436449710.name: Great place to visit and relax!!!
436449710.author: a TripAdvisor user
436449710.reviewBody: We came here after we did a zipline tour hosted by a local company. The company gave us 2 hours to explore the city so we grabbed some food nearby and headed straight to the beach.\n\nThe beach was beautiful. Packed with locals and tourists but not overly crowded. It was great to just sit back and watch all the surfers go.

436014323.name: Amazing beach life
436014323.author: a TripAdvisor user
436014323.reviewBody: Super fun place. Went for dia de los muerto. Wow!!! A must nov 2. Ate at Carmelitas, Don Pedros, Chile Relleno And of course found the Tacos Ivan...a must!

435707654.name: Sunset walks
435707654.author: a TripAdvisor user
435707654.reviewBody: We went down to beach every night at sunset to release turtles, and a late dinner.  Beautiful sunsets, tide is in and strong.

435527739.name: Just a normal beach
435527739.author: a TripAdvisor user
435527739.reviewBody: The beach is Sayulita isn\'t special, although the view around the bay is beautiful. It is a nice beach to spend some time, if not bothered by the salesmen who ask ridiculous prices because they think you\'re an American.. The \'boulevard\' of the beach offers nice restaurants and bars though!

435458370.name: Full of gringos and bad service
435458370.author: a TripAdvisor user
435458370.reviewBody: The place is so full of gringos that things are quite expensive and the service is not good anymore. Better go to Puerto Escondido in Oaxaca

434400879.name: Nice Beach..
434400879.author: a TripAdvisor user
434400879.reviewBody: Nice little beach area at the end of Sayulita.  Plenty of bars/restaurants/shops in this part of town so you can relax and take in the beautiful scenery.  Plenty of surfers use this area.

434042370.name: Scenic beach that is swimmable.
434042370.author: a TripAdvisor user
434042370.reviewBody: Unlike the beaches in a number or areas in Vallarta bay this one is swimmable. Nice quaint town too that you have to stumble around a bit once you get off the bus to find but that was part of the fun, never knowing 100% for sure where we were going.

433825015.name: Beautiful way to spend a day
433825015.author: a TripAdvisor user
433825015.reviewBody: Sayulita beach has warm water, moderate surf (many places rent boards and offer lessons) fine sand, and numerous spots to rent chairs, tables and umbrella for the day.  Some chair set ups are connected to a bar/restaurant and others are not. We opted for seating that was not connected with a restaurant and paid about $15 for two chairs, table and umbrella for the day. There are many restaurants very close to beach that offer takeout.  We brought some shrimp tacos and beer back with us. Super relaxing day, at a truly beautiful beach.  The only negative is that you have to deal with vendors approaching you and asking you to buy their items.  Generally they move on when you decline,  but the stream of sellers is pretty frequent.

433787947.name: Lots if interesting characters to watch, surf is consistent
433787947.author: a TripAdvisor user
433787947.reviewBody: Since the flood that added 100 ft of sand to the beach, the character has changed fom a sleepy beach town to more of a palapa beach scene.  Not sure its an improvement, but the surfing is still good and everyone is very friendly.

433399594.name: Get away
433399594.author: a TripAdvisor user
433399594.reviewBody: The sand on this beach is incredible, in places it almost looks black with gold in it. Water was warm and waves were just big enough to have fun with them. Plenty of places to rent chairs and great places to eat.

432953213.name: Great place.
432953213.author: a TripAdvisor user
432953213.reviewBody: Came here for my anniversary. Great romantic place, the ocean is well known by surfers but you can also swim in it (not every season). It has a lot of night life.

432941605.name: Crazy traffic! Nice surfer town
432941605.author: a TripAdvisor user
432941605.reviewBody: Crazy traffic jams. Quaint shops, not too touristy. Beach looked beautiful. Lots of surfers in the water.

432280146.name: Chill and relax
432280146.author: a TripAdvisor user
432280146.reviewBody: I would visit this beach again and again! Loved the beach drink services and had a great time trying to surf!!! Such a chill area! Loved every minute

431547650.name: beautiful!
431547650.author: a TripAdvisor user
431547650.reviewBody: Fun waves for the beginner!  Lots of interesting shops along the shore line  Great people having a relaxing time!  Perfect

431274096.name: Day at the beach
431274096.author: a TripAdvisor user
431274096.reviewBody: The beach was nice. Not too crowded. We relaxed in a couple of lounge chairs all day  having drinks and food . The water was warm and inviting .

431138640.name: Lovely beach great for surfing and relaxing
431138640.author: a TripAdvisor user
431138640.reviewBody: Get away from it all in Sayulita. Its a protected Mexican village with a real bohemian feel.\n\nHas a youth hostel and hotels but I visited for the day by bus from Puerto Vallarta. Definitely worth the effort of getting there

430229146.name: Olive Ridley Turtles and Surfing
430229146.author: a TripAdvisor user
430229146.reviewBody: Don\'t miss these opportunities. Turtle releases are well supported between Oct and December and the hatchlings are cute.\n

429838481.name: Gone down hill from 6 years ago
429838481.author: a TripAdvisor user
429838481.reviewBody: Thought this place was so cool, but now it\'s crowded and full of people trying to sell you their crap. They just won\'t let you alone. The water is great with big waves and people surfing which is fun to watch. We got a massage for $20. So keep looking for the best deal. You can also rent chairs and an umbrella, but again look for the best deal. Some restaurants don\'t open until 5:00 so make sure you know where you are going.  It\'s really an unusual little town. The roads are horrible but that\'s part of the fun.

428165011.name: What a cool little town
428165011.author: a TripAdvisor user
428165011.reviewBody: The beachfront is beautiful but this quaint little town is such a nice find.  There are shops in abundance, some great beach bars, and some nice restaurants but the real adventure is simply the atmosphere.  The very narrow streets and the rough road to get there make you nervous but the town itself is so much fun to experience.

427477472.name: We found a time machine!
427477472.author: a TripAdvisor user
427477472.reviewBody: If you are looking for Mexico of the past, this is the place. No high-rise buildings, no Senior Frogs, just cobblestone streets, sand on your feet and the chill of a cold drink in your hand. The food is great and the people are even better. We rented a house on the beach and cruised the town on our rented golf cart. We rode horse back in the jungle, jumped off cliffs into the ocean, and body surfed with no cares. The secret is out on this place and it is a gem.

427053912.name: A quaint beautiful small town
427053912.author: a TripAdvisor user
427053912.reviewBody: Great little town about 45 minutes from our hotel at St. Regis.  It is lined with cobble stone streets, many souvenir  vendors, corner bars and great food stands.  It was off season when we were there (end of September), so it was not as crowded as we thought it would be.  Overall we spent half a day buying souvenirs, drinking a few beers and eating great street tacos! You must eat at "The Real Fish Taco" when you are in Sayulita   ITS AMAZING  the taco stand with the bright yellow sign!!!

426162108.name: Best surf for all levels.  Family and dog friendly.
426162108.author: a TripAdvisor user
426162108.reviewBody: I love this beach, and the town.  People are from all over, they are lovely and friendly.  The food is fresh, it is a fishing village so still has its old work charm.  Surfboard rentals and lessons available and the break is great for beginners but offers more challenging surfing as well.

425986459.name: It is now discovered.  Very busy beach but, great waves
425986459.author: a TripAdvisor user
425986459.reviewBody:
We spent today at Sayulita Beach today and had a great time enjoying the waves.  Many lounge chairs were to be rented which was acceptable.  Various restaurants included a chair with a minimum purchase.  
This is a beautiful 1/2 moon shaped beach that wraps around.  The beach was clean and sand was coarse.  The waves were decent and enjoyable.  A fair amount of seaweed and debris in the water during the first 20 feet of water but, clean once you get out past this initial area.
We drove to Sayulita Beach in a rental car.  Not a problem and the drive was jungle like and beautiful once you leave Bucerias.  Parking was not bad at all and only took us a few minutes to find a spot.  
We were scoping out this location for our next vacation in March with kids.  It's a great place to come visit but, we probably will try somewhere else for spending a period of 10 days in March.

425976429.name: Awersome, Beautiful, Fantastic Views, Chilled
425976429.author: a TripAdvisor user
425976429.reviewBody: So Far, Sayulita is Wonderful.  Lovely Setting with great setup and fabulous views.  Chilled with a cool vibe, nice little town atmosphere, great restaurant options, friendly people, inexpensive.  Beaches are okay - water is a little dirty and surf options in town are limited, but there are some fun beginner type waves.  Good beach options nearby.  Feels very safe.  Good accommodation options for reasonable rates.

425955585.name: Review
425955585.author: a TripAdvisor user
425955585.reviewBody: Went from the hotel zone because we was told this was a very 70\'s hippy place to go and yes it is, a bit hard with the street and beach hawkers, we went to a bar on the beach and spent the whole day people watching,

425309467.name: Beautiful and quiet beach
425309467.author: a TripAdvisor user
425309467.reviewBody: Sayulita beach has very fun surf. A really fun right hander lines up on the main beach and is great for long and short boards. The locals are not super aggressive in the line up and the break offers up some really long rides!!

422223729.name: Fun place to visit.
422223729.author: a TripAdvisor user
422223729.reviewBody: Quaint little town in mexico that seems to cater to tourists.  Nice beach and amenities to make your experience even better.

421926915.name: Lovely family retreat- when PV is too much
421926915.author: a TripAdvisor user
421926915.reviewBody: Easy and simple for teenagers to have some freedom but regroup with family later. Surf, beauty, food, relaxed but not off the track (it\'s not that quiet, not Australian-beach small-town quiet).

421844862.name: Stunning virws
421844862.author: a TripAdvisor user
421844862.reviewBody: Came here on a day trip from Vallarta for the day the views are breath taking and the town is also very nice.

421491316.name: Breathtaking views, soft shimmering sand, paradise on the Pacific.
421491316.author: a TripAdvisor user
421491316.reviewBody: We spent the week of September 10-17 in Sayulita.  Rented a house just above the beach about a mile north of town.  The beach was beautiful, soft and shimmery with golden flecks.  The water was like a bath.  The waves were not very large when we were there but the break is nice and good for beginners.  The beach gets a little dirty right near town because of the number of visitors but all in all the beach is fantastic.

419991359.name: Used to be way better...
419991359.author: a TripAdvisor user
419991359.reviewBody: TOTAL disappointment ... I went there 2 years ago it was looking friendly, nice, clean. Now It\'s dirty, traffic jam in the all town (20 minutes to arrive to our hotel) and the beach is smelly, like old fish. No more beautiful terrace in the sand where you can enjoy a cocktail ... I felt waisting my time visiting this town, so cute in the past.

416946871.name: Nice beach, really cool little town
416946871.author: a TripAdvisor user
416946871.reviewBody: The beach was nice, but what we enjoyed most was wandering through the town. Very trendy and cute, and so of course a little bit more expensive than many other places. Well worth an hour or even a day trip to check it out if you are staying nearby!

416550397.name: Fun beach
416550397.author: a TripAdvisor user
416550397.reviewBody:
Great surf vibe and culture but the swell was non existent, this was expected since it's the off season. Heavy rains moved in and really made the water nasty. Good news was several surf companies were able  to take us to different breaks nearby that were fun and the water quality was much better.

The massages on the beach were great, my favorite were the ladies under the green tent. Very relaxing to have a massage in the morning before the beach is too crowded.

The beachside tables were a great place to chill, drink and eat while taking in the action.

Plenty of beach peddlers will hound you a bit but are not overly aggressive and some of their goods are interesting to say the least.

Be aware of the rip currents, especially with the kids and heavy drinkers in your group. 

Have fun!

415752884.name: Fun and busy Beach
415752884.author: a TripAdvisor user
415752884.reviewBody: Great for renting chairs, umbrellas, boards, etc. Also great for people watching and families. Tons of people selling food and items but so goes beaches in Mexico

414270559.name: Camping
414270559.author: a TripAdvisor user
414270559.reviewBody: Super nice beach!\nIf you are young and looking for adventure and meet new people wild camping is the best place in that side of Mexico!

413601078.name: Quaint Mexican Town
413601078.author: a TripAdvisor user
413601078.reviewBody: Wonderful shopping for high end curios as well as traditional junk.  A beautiful town to stroll up and down the streets, stop for a cold beer, dine, or just look around. Had lunch overlooking the beach, delightful.

412073729.name: Avoid the town of Sayulita if you don\'t like crowds. The sea can be rough at times and it is a surfers town.
412073729.author: a TripAdvisor user
412073729.reviewBody: We were not impressed with the town of Sayulita & the beach and found it to be dirty. We went at a time where not many overseas tourists go, so it was quite for the Restaurant trade. Monsoon season so lots of rain in the evening from 5.00 pm - midnight, so your stuck if you have no transit ( golf cart ) to go for Dinner into town.

412061434.name: Just an ok beach
412061434.author: a TripAdvisor user
412061434.reviewBody: This beach is famous for surf but the waves aren\'t anything special. Definitely good for beginners though. The service on the beach isn\'t that impressive either. It\'s ok but Mexico has so many other amazing beaches I wouldn\'t return to this one.

411056148.name: Go for the village, not the beach
411056148.author: a TripAdvisor user
411056148.reviewBody: As you may have read this is an old surfers village.  The village is pretty cool. They have little custom shops all over and decent bars and restaurants.  The water isn\'t clear and the sand isn\'t pretty.  The sand is a little more rocky and pebbly and than your typical beautiful beach sand.  There are two large city run offs going into the beach but they didn\'t smell. The beach is also rocky and has urchins.  I saw several people sitting down trying to pull urchins out of their feet. However there is an area where its mostly sand.  The rocky area is where most of the surfers are.  Overall its an average beach.  Like I said, go to Sayulita for the village, not the beach.

410826371.name: Watch the surfers and paddle boarding as the waves crash
410826371.author: a TripAdvisor user
410826371.reviewBody: Love this place. Spent the whole day dancing in the waves like it was 1978.  So relaxed.  Whole town is reflected in the beach life style.  Peace, love, nature, man-buns and tattoos. All good. All welcome. LBGT friendly such that it is no big thing at all.  So great. Healthy life style.  Lots of vendors but not huge pressure. Amazing food up the road at YeiKame and surf lessons on the beach.  Beautiful people and families everywhere.  Great adventure

410481308.name: Cool hippie surfer village.
410481308.author: a TripAdvisor user
410481308.reviewBody: We were a party of 6, we took about 40 mins taxi ride from our hotel, the driver decided to wait to take us back which meant we didn\'t stay as long as we would have liked. the atmosphere was just getting going when we left. Lovely little bars and restaurants. Loved it when the cars in the cobbled streets stopped to let street entertainers do their shows.

408092882.name: So overrated.  It is not a sleepy, laid back place like people say.
408092882.author: a TripAdvisor user
408092882.reviewBody: I went there because everyone says Sayulita is so laid back.  On the contrary, it is a popular destination for rich people.  Every accommodation is so expensive, almost unaffordable.  The beach is full of rich Mexicans from Mexico City and Guadalajara wanting to be on a "laid back, hippie" beach.  The pedestrian streets are typical touristy spots, full of shops and expensive, trendy restaurants.  The black, sewage water runs into the sea in the middle of the beach!  The smell and the color of this body of water put me off totally!!!  I\'ve lived in Mexico for 8 years and have seen so many more beautiful and laid back beaches.

406830838.name: Fun for surfers and non-surfers alike
406830838.author: a TripAdvisor user
406830838.reviewBody:
I only gave the beach 4 stars because there was quite a bit of trash that seems to have washed up (not necessarily recently) and wasn't picked up because it was at the ends of the beach. 
  The River Nayarit flows into the bay and as we were there during the rainy season there was a day or two when the water was a little dirty. We saw this in Puerto Vallarta on a few days as well. The tides clear up the water pretty fast and the waves are great to enjoy. The waves at Sayulita start rolling in in sets, of course this is why it is known for its surfing. There are numerous (vendors?) areas set up from which you can rent surf boards or boogie boards and get lessons throw. In for free. I believe these where hourly rentals however, I'm sure you could get daily rates. I watched the boards delivered to customers on the beach to begin the rental than picked up and carried off afterwards. 
  We spent time swimming and sunning. The waves were fun, not too big to swim in and there were portions of the beach with very low waves where children played. 
   Food and drinks of all kinds are available as are chairs and umbrellas. Some restaurants rent the chairs and some are just rented from chair rental folks. We rented an umbrella from a local salesman one afternoon for a few hours as we weren't staying all day (and didn't care to buy one). 
  A very good time. Don't forget massages offered on the beach and all the souvenirs you could care to buy.

406735384.name: Must Visit
406735384.author: a TripAdvisor user
406735384.reviewBody: Sayulita is a beautiful and clean beach in a small fishing village north of Puerto Vallarta. There are loots of places to shop, eat, or just relax and people-watch (there are surfers and paddle boarders aplenty). My husband and I are returning in September and cannot wait to explore the places we didn\'t have a chance to visit the first time around.

406393775.name: Gold Sand Beach
406393775.author: a TripAdvisor user
406393775.reviewBody: The beach has flecks of gold in the sand.  The water is warm, with gentle waves and it\'s a great place to learn to SUP or surf.  Although, to be honest, I was a terrible SUPer.  There are lots of places to rent boards and get lessons.  But it gets really crowded, so try to pick your spot early in the day.

405381641.name: Family vacation
405381641.author: a TripAdvisor user
405381641.reviewBody: Great place, wish it was still a secret. Will come back but more than likely during October to May time. To many local tourists and no decent swells\n

404899851.name: Must see
404899851.author: a TripAdvisor user
404899851.reviewBody: Great little place that is well worth a visit. Thriving upcoming location with lots to explore and enjoy. Lots of food/drink places and street vendors.

403240218.name: Beautiful Beach
403240218.author: a TripAdvisor user
403240218.reviewBody: Spent the day here as part of a Punta Mita/Sayulita tour we purchased through Expedia.  This is MY KIND OF PLACE!!! Absolutely fell in love with the hippie vibe and classic surfer/beach atmosphere.  Not to mention the BEAUTIFUL landscape!  Almost looks untouched and spotted with bright, vibrantly colored houses and buildings, and lush gardens.  The dirt roads are rustic and really add to the overall feel.  Plenty of FANTASTIC restaurants serving up delicious, locally-caught seafood and authentic Mexican dishes.  And the art galleries make this is nice place to spend an afternoon!  Of course, if you are a surfer or paddle-boarder, this is Heaven on earth, for sure!  Great day trip if in the Puerto Vallarta area, and one that you won\'t forget!

402243088.name: A place to see
402243088.author: a TripAdvisor user
402243088.reviewBody: We took a cab from Nuevo Vallarta to Sayulita. It\'s was about 360 pesos to get there. Super place to explore. Cute little shops and places to eat. We felt very safe there.

400863104.name: Beach Excursion
400863104.author: a TripAdvisor user
400863104.reviewBody:
I was in Nuevo Vallarta at the end of July and did a day beach excursion to Sayulita.
If you are visiting Puerto Vallarta or Nuevo, it's a must see of a quaint beach town of 4,000. It is run by primarily expats and has cute little shops/restaurants to see. It definitely has a lot of character and is a little hidden spot that I would recommend anyone to visit. I am hoping to go visit for a week next time.

399793439.name: Nice beach
399793439.author: a TripAdvisor user
399793439.reviewBody: This beach offered surf lessons, had good waves for surfing, nice sand, blue water, clean beach. Only issue is the stray dogs, beach vendors who won\'t leave you alone. Once you get dropped off bus don\'t be discouraged of what you see as you walk towards the beach/town the scene gets a lot better.

399270371.name: Waves, umbrellas, beautiful view. Beware the rain!
399270371.author: a TripAdvisor user
399270371.reviewBody: I love Sayulita Beach but the sewage plant runs into the river and the river runs into the ocean. When it rains, the water seems especially bad.

398499784.name: Laid back attitudes, great shops, great food
398499784.author: a TripAdvisor user
398499784.reviewBody: The only problem was the beach was crowded as it was vacation season - can\'t wait to go back in the months of September October.  The waves perfect for learning to surf.  Super kid friendly calm, clean waters.

397125912.name: Forget the fancy, go for the street tacos
397125912.author: a TripAdvisor user
397125912.reviewBody:
Certainly restaurants bring in the crowds with all the fancy stuff, nice settings, well designed menus, etc... But in Mexico and particularly in this beautiful beach, you will never go wrong with the street tacos. 
Theres this taco stand, wirh a couple of tables, by the fully stocked taco cart, at the end of Main St, as I called it, that you dont want to miss. 
Before you hit the beach and just before the big right hand restaurant, theres this Señora and her "plancha", sauces, cilantro, tortillas and sea food that will have you come back for more of her tacos.
One thing is coming back to Sayulita, and another is to come back two or three times to eat this great "camaron" (shrimp) or "pescado" (fish) tacos in Sayulita
Order one, then another, ask her to serve you whatever she wants, oh but always with a cold beer.
Forget the fancy, go for the street tacos!

397095196.name: Crowded and full of strays
397095196.author: a TripAdvisor user
397095196.reviewBody: Aside from vendors on top of you every 10 seconds, the water has 10 times the acceptable ( human tolerance ) of E - Coli. I jog or walk 15 minutes South to clean water . Raw sewage entering the main beach through a river and s stream and a failing infrastructure - no thanks!!

396935616.name: Good local beach
396935616.author: a TripAdvisor user
396935616.reviewBody: Water not as blue or clear as shown on US tv. Great beach service, easy to get chairs, umbrella and drinks if wanted for a small fee. Lots of local surfers who are protective of their wave territory. Great people watching. Lots of shops and restaurants to walk to.

396430711.name: Sorry  :(
396430711.author: a TripAdvisor user
396430711.reviewBody: I know lots and lots of people absolutely love Sayulita Beach but I am not one of them. The beach is definitely not clean. Lots of people, trash, dogs, etc which in hot weather is compounded.  Compared to the Caribbean side of Mexico the beaches on the Riviera Nayarit are disappointing (at least in Sayulita and San Francisco). Lots of bums hanging around, too. The entire town is  definitely not clean, huge potholes in the streets, uneven pavements, dirt outside, unfinished houses, etc. You cannot compare this to Tulum in any shape or form.  It might look differently in season (November - March) when more stores are open and perhaps then the beach is also cleaned more often.

396310536.name: Fishing with Nacho and Los 3 Garcias
396310536.author: a TripAdvisor user
396310536.reviewBody:
My husband and two boys spent two half days fishing with Nacho and his son Sergio on our recent trip to Sayulita. 

It was very reasonably priced and they caught a TON of fish. The prize fish was a 6ft Sailfish!  Very rare to catch I might add. Nacho and Sergio were GREAT with the kids. We will definitely ask for him on our next trip here. 

Nacho also recommended a great guy named Carlos that took us all horseback riding. So fun!!

396039607.name: Perfect beach in Wixarica lands
396039607.author: a TripAdvisor user
396039607.reviewBody: Beautiful beach for swimming or surf. The sand has natural gold glitter. This is the beautiful magical tierra de los Wixarica. Tourists should honor the sacred here.

394047784.name: Don pablo restaurant ( not sur if that correct spelling )
394047784.author: a TripAdvisor user
394047784.reviewBody: Lovely and authentic Dinner on beach with live music and dancing Watching the surfers and sunset Fabulous  Fantastic for trip out

392553089.name: Great Beach and Atmosphere in small town!!
392553089.author: a TripAdvisor user
392553089.reviewBody: Sayulita is what a real small Mexican beach town is all about. Lots of vendors on the beach, but just say "No gracias" and they will move on. Take a $35.00 peso(about $2 us dlls) bus trip from PV Walmart bus station to Sayulita. Bus has A/C and mix in with the locals on your way there. Had a great time!!

392360702.name: Pretty packed
392360702.author: a TripAdvisor user
392360702.reviewBody: It is a beautiful beach, but the day we were there, it was ridiculously packed with people. I felt like things there were nice and clean and the shopping was fun, but the beach was crazy packed with people and teenagers. Tooooooo many people for me. I would go again, but maybe just for the shopping!

392217113.name: Day Trip
392217113.author: a TripAdvisor user
392217113.reviewBody: This an awesome destination for a day trip. You can visit the beach of course where it is famous for its surfing. There are so many places to shop and eat. This surf town has a very hippie feeling to it. Visit the Aloha Bar for a cold coconut. Drink the water and eat the coconut meat. It\'s refreshing! Also, you can\'t leave Sayulita without visiting Chocobanana and Revoluci\u00f3n del Sue\u00f1o shop.

391728440.name: Busy and nice beach
391728440.author: a TripAdvisor user
391728440.reviewBody: Beach was busy on the weekends and ideal for beginner surf classes. There are plenty of people trying to sell you stuff. I like that restaurants are nearby. Relatively clean except when you go further toward the rocky parts where you will see come garbage. The sand is nice and the water is warm.

391500153.name: Quiet in the summer
391500153.author: a TripAdvisor user
391500153.reviewBody: The beach restaurants were almost deserted at this, the quiet season.  The beach is long and wide and clean.  Looking back south you can see Punta Mita.

391213252.name: vibrant community, beautiful atmosphere and energy
391213252.author: a TripAdvisor user
391213252.reviewBody: The market and beach were beautiful and full of vibrant colors, culture and shopping! Walking through there was very artistic shops...most by foreigners rather than natives but still beautiful. This beach had a very earthy and artistic vibe.

389763917.name: Good place to share the beach with the fishermen
389763917.author: a TripAdvisor user
389763917.reviewBody: We hiked to the beach from our vacation lodge which was about a mile outside the city. The beach is a lovely spot, with lots of fishermen as well as bathers. We got there early before the crowds, which I highly recommend. Very close to the public part of the beach is the Sayulita Cemetery, where you can walk through the creative and intimate monuments that citizens of the town have been creating for their deceased loved ones over a period of several hundred years. This is worth looking at if you are visiting the beach. Just ask around to find it.\n\nThe town is very pleasant. Many Americans have second homes here. You can shop and eat in the more upscale tourist section or cross over the bridge for a more typical Mexican atmosphere.

389453540.name: Absolutely beautiful
389453540.author: a TripAdvisor user
389453540.reviewBody: We came here so the kids could take surf lessons.  The little town was absolutely beautiful.  We took a 14 passenger van from the Grand Mayan and the taxi driver hung out all day until we were ready to go back for $125.

388876419.name: Great spot to shop and people watch
388876419.author: a TripAdvisor user
388876419.reviewBody: This is a cool town with a town square and side streets all around filled with shops of every kind. Souvenirs, restaurants, pharmacies, general stores and street vendors galore. One section of sidestreets lead to the beach, covered up with mores restaurants and tourists. Seems very safe, and a really nice stop. It does get hot in the middle of the day, so plan your trip in the late afternoon. From Punta Mita the ride cost $84 including two hours of wait time.

388591777.name: Day trip
388591777.author: a TripAdvisor user
388591777.reviewBody: We were very impressed with this quaint little town during our visit. We will make this our next stay in the future as everything within walking distance.

387900744.name: Beautiful Beach for a relaxing day
387900744.author: a TripAdvisor user
387900744.reviewBody: This beach is a beautiful beach that seems to be a world away from the beaches in PV. Un-crowded and a perfect spot to lay in the sun or snorkel without being approached by a million vendors. We had some amazing seafood skewers from a barbecue vendor that was set up right as you enter the beach. Fish, Octopus, and chicken. You can bring your own food and drinks, just leave the glass bottles at home.  Police may check your cooler on entering.

387831464.name: Worth to visit while in Puerto Vallarta!
387831464.author: a TripAdvisor user
387831464.reviewBody: A colorful town with plenty of  restaurants to choose, nice beach and another great alternative to spend a day while in Puerto Vallarta. Whether you are looking to sleep over or just spend a day, you won\'t regret to had visit this town.

387474341.name: Worth $20.00 for a taxi to go to Sayulita
387474341.author: a TripAdvisor user
387474341.reviewBody: My husband and I will probably never go back to the Iberostar Playa Mita.  But we sure want to go back to the nearby beach town of Sayulita.  Cobblestone streets down to the beach.  Friendly people and friendly dogs.  Interesting shops and fun street vendors.  Killer Margaritas (at Captain Cook) and good inexpensive food. A surf\'s up beach scene for entertainment.

385659208.name: Sweet little surf town
385659208.author: a TripAdvisor user
385659208.reviewBody: Stayed here a week, at the bungalows Jacqueline. \nToo many restaurants to list. Great vibe. Not super cheap as its pretty touristy but worth it. \nGlad we got here now because in ten years, this place will be a mini Vallarta

384420554.name: I got to see it!!
384420554.author: a TripAdvisor user
384420554.reviewBody: I\'m not the best person to assess a beach, but I am glad I got to see it and watch the early morning action, mostly surfers getting ready to go out to sea.

384346783.name: Great place to people watch
384346783.author: a TripAdvisor user
384346783.reviewBody: Don Pedros is the best location to be in the action and watch the surfers in the afternoons with the best margaritas.

384310319.name: Adult destination
384310319.author: a TripAdvisor user
384310319.reviewBody: Our trip to Sayulita was nOt what we expected. Don\'t get me wrong, it\'s a gorgeous beach but it\'s more geared for people that want to get tipsy.  I\'d recommend it for crowds with no kids. I saw too many hammered up people for my liking, at least not when I\'m with my little ones. It\'s definitely a surfer\'s paradise.  The waves are really high.

384301502.name: Great atmosphere and waves for surfers
384301502.author: a TripAdvisor user
384301502.reviewBody: Lovely town with very friendly and laid back atmosphere. Great location to learn or to enjoy wave surf in total safety. Highly recommended.

383196751.name: Beautiful Beach
383196751.author: a TripAdvisor user
383196751.reviewBody: Perfect to spend the whole day at the beach, walking distance from shopping and a lot of small restaurants. Very friendly people. we took surfing lessons and my wife took a massage.

383163741.name: Nice Beach but...
383163741.author: a TripAdvisor user
383163741.reviewBody: We stayed north of the main beach and it was much nicer than the downtown beach. We enjoyed the food vendors, surfers and overall culture of Sayultia Beach but for a peaceful swim, we hung out near our hotel (Palmar and Sabalo) which was paradise! For the record, we did see teenagers with green bags picking up trash along Sayulita Beach.

382964191.name: Nice beach
382964191.author: a TripAdvisor user
382964191.reviewBody:
A nice long beach to stroll along. The surf can be strong at times, I would recommend to swim nearby others.
Near the OXXO supermarket it seems the sewer is draining into the ocean. It smelled bad along the first part of Calle Pelicanos near the beach.
A pity that still too many folks leave their garbage on the beach. There is no beach cleanup by the city. Please pick up some trash, even if it is not yours and deposit it in the bins. You hopefully set an example.
Sayulita is a great little town with a nice beach to hang out for a few days.

382944945.name: Lovely, Funk surf and beach town!
382944945.author: a TripAdvisor user
382944945.reviewBody: you gotta love this bohemian feel, funky and cool....this is a great surf and relax, or party if you like! its not big like Playa del Carmen, but well worth the trip!

382527088.name: Disappointing
382527088.author: a TripAdvisor user
382527088.reviewBody: This place has grown so much and is over crowded. The market was repetitive and the vendors were pushy. I would describe it as a mini version of Waikiki beach. We went 10+ years ago and it was so different and not enjoyable. Do yourself a favor and pick somewhere not so crazy. You can find surfing somewhere else!

381264870.name: perfect beginner waves
381264870.author: a TripAdvisor user
381264870.reviewBody: Perfect for the beginning surfer.  Gentle waves the carry you to shore, not slamming you into the sand.  Awesome for paddleboards, super smooth water especially in the morning.

380655485.name: Very beautiful!
380655485.author: a TripAdvisor user
380655485.reviewBody: Great place to go and visit there are many little shops and restaurants in the beach. Definitely you should surf, if you are more than 3 persons it is only 40 USD.

379953957.name: Very good place to start surfing and for advance skilled as well
379953957.author: a TripAdvisor user
379953957.reviewBody: I was in Sayulita with my spouse and our 3 year old daughter.  We were on the beach every day.  The waves are just great there because depending on which part of the beach you are they change in sizes and intensity.  You can boogie boards, surf and even swim in the waves.  If you get the right timmig with the waves it can carries you up to the shore.  I made few times both with the boogie board and free swim.  If you want to surf you can lease a board for 300 pesos for the full day. It can also be per hour.  If you are new to surf you most rental place also offer teaching lessons but the aren\'t cheap.  We were lucky enough to meet a local who\'s nickname is Charlie Brown (almost every locals in Sayulita know him) and he offered to teach us for 200 pesos each.  If you see him tell him you saw Hugo\'s family review here.  He loved our daughter Valentina (he called her "preciosa" = precious).  Depending when you go there it can be really hot.  You can rent or buy and umbrella for 350 pesos.  Do not hesitate to deal with the vendor.  Rental goes for  150 pesos a day so it worth to buy it.  Also check the technique they use to dig it into the sand so your umbrella is planted solid.   We also used solar cream with a 60 protection and came back so dark.  Probably the darkest I was ever in any trip.  I you want to heat in Sayulita I recommend to not limit you search on trip adviser.  There is a lot of very nice restaurant that are very cheap that are not registered on trip adviser that are as good as any restaurant you could find here.  Also they would be cheaper.  Be careful with the restaurant category on trip adviser.  Most restaurant that are categorized as cheap you would pay for two: meal, small appetizer and drinks for about $60 USD tip included.  But you can find local place for half price of that.  The hiccup is that they are not necessairly on trip advisor.

378862414.name: Beautiful beach with tons of bars and activities
378862414.author: a TripAdvisor user
378862414.reviewBody: The beach can get a bit crowded at some points but also has plenty of places that are a bit more secluded. There are lots of different restaurants to grab some food or drinks as well as a number of surfing schools. Considering this is what Sayulita is known for, I\'d definitely suggest stopping there for at least a day.

378738739.name: Ugly beach
378738739.author: a TripAdvisor user
378738739.reviewBody: The main beach in Sayulita is ugly black sand that looks like mud and no palm trees but that\'s where the tourists go to surf (small waves) or paddle board. And the vendors put out beach chairs but I never could believe why anyone would go to that beach when Mexico is full of gorgeous beaches.

378482981.name: smelly beach
378482981.author: a TripAdvisor user
378482981.reviewBody: the overflow of the sewage treatment plant was horrible. The smell across the river was so bad, we had to keep our mouths and noses covered

377312395.name: Beautiful beach with a Mexican feel town.
377312395.author: a TripAdvisor user
377312395.reviewBody: The beach is clean with clean water,waves for beginning as well as advanced surfers.  We rented a tent with chairs so as to keep out of the sun when not in the water.  Natives selling jewelry, clothing and junk were annoying.

377023774.name: Stunning Beach
377023774.author: a TripAdvisor user
377023774.reviewBody: The beach was gorgeous.  Water was a little rough with undercurrent however, life guards on duty to assist if necessary.

376733396.name: Dirty
376733396.author: a TripAdvisor user
376733396.reviewBody: The sewer flows into the ocean.   It is beautiful.....    But.....   Walk by the sewer plant, smell it and it is a few feet from the ocean.  You can see brown water coming out from a large pipe.

376299406.name: HOT HOT HOT
376299406.author: a TripAdvisor user
376299406.reviewBody: Well the weather was sweat-worthy but the beach was beautiful. Free of trash, not too many vendors, and enough activities to keep you busy for a few days to a week. Really enjoyable small town vibe.

375952164.name: Worth the drive from Puerto Vallarta
375952164.author: a TripAdvisor user
375952164.reviewBody: Beautiful sand and a lovely surf make this beach ideal for those interested in surfing, wake boarding, boogie boarding, or swimming. And, if you\'re like us, just sitting on the beach!

375900705.name: Cool surfer town
375900705.author: a TripAdvisor user
375900705.reviewBody: Only 1/2 hour from Puerto Vallarta and well worth the taxi ride. We paid the driver 900 peso for 5 hours of his time. He drove us to the town, gave us a tour and then waited while we enjoyed the town

375815130.name: Dream Wedding
375815130.author: a TripAdvisor user
375815130.reviewBody: We stayed in Sayulita for my sisters wedding! We have been to Sayulita once before and this little surfer town is on the rise!! AMAZING beach, the friendliest people and the most delicious food around!

375513590.name: Nice day trip
375513590.author: a TripAdvisor user
375513590.reviewBody: This was a nice day trip.We took the public transit from our hotel.(Friendly Vallarta,Jalisco) It took about 1 hour. The beach is nice.We saw many people enjoying the surfing action.The little town rents golf carts to get around or you can walk it with ease.Lots of shops and vendors.It\'s definitely worth a visit.

375127421.name: Great surfing school for everyone!
375127421.author: a TripAdvisor user
375127421.reviewBody: This is a nice hippie beach, with soft sand and clear water, lots of watersports and love that is a great pet friendly place. Love the food, tasty and over the beach, lots of alcoholic drinks and the best of all were the oysters, fresh delicious oysters with hot pepper sauce!

374977876.name: Mex beach day
374977876.author: a TripAdvisor user
374977876.reviewBody: The beach was very crowded with young people swimming and more surfing, I thought they we having a great time and never saw any problems. Sayulita is a great little seaside location for tourist as many restaurants and small shops to buy just about anything. We always had delicious meals and quick service, I look forward to going back soon.

373749552.name: A dirty little town with polluted waters and no parking
373749552.author: a TripAdvisor user
373749552.reviewBody: I just don\'t get the attraction. There are lots of street vendors seems like everyone has decided to open a caf\u00e9 on the street or sidewalk while you\'re having breakfast a dog is urinating on your tables leg. There seems to be some good waves for surfing if you don\'t mind the pollution and excrement in the water. After finally finding a parking spot our vehicle was vandalized. The friends we came to visit we\'re about to move out of the rental apartment after the second break in. The only reason I believe people must go to Sayulita for the drugs. I found no other redeeming value. There are definitely much prettier beaches and cleaner towns up-and-down the coast.\nAs a Mexican I find it difficult to understand why this is called a Pueblo M\u00e1gico. Cada quien a lo suyo. Sayulita no es para m\u00ed.

373725134.name: Not so nice
373725134.author: a TripAdvisor user
373725134.reviewBody: Worried about draining streams that cross the beach. Seem to bring some pollution i would rather avoid by climbing around the point and through the cemetery to Playa de los muertos.

373717752.name: Birthday Trip
373717752.author: a TripAdvisor user
373717752.reviewBody: Beautiful place to visit and beautiful community of locals. The shopping is amazing. The restaurants are all very good, we ate at so many different places it is hard to pick a favorite. We explored in our golf cart to find our way around which is pretty easy once you do it a couple of times. We even adopted a dog while we were there. We will continue to go back yearly.

373525744.name: Sayulita: surfers, hippies and other awesome things
373525744.author: a TripAdvisor user
373525744.reviewBody: This little town in Mexico is so freaking cute you just want to hug a puppy!!\nLittle houses built into the mountains, shops, surfers from all over and golden beaches (like when you go in the water it looks like flecks of gold). \nIt is getting pretty Americanized and touristy but still cute as hell and an amazing day trip from Nuevo or Puerto Vallarta .

373481024.name: Amazing and Relaxing Beach
373481024.author: a TripAdvisor user
373481024.reviewBody: I just love Sayulita. We went for Spring Break and I wouldn\'t have chose anywhere else. Beautiful waves and people, and amazing food.

373071686.name: Warm water, hot beach, easy to get to.
373071686.author: a TripAdvisor user
373071686.reviewBody: The beach at Sayulita is family friendly, hot, beautiful gold sparkles, with warm water, and easy on the waves with an average swell.  I really enjoyed relaxing there.  You will will be relaxing with the locals and tourists.  My only caveat is that on the weekends (Sat and Sun), it is very busy, since more locals will come to the beach!  I would go back.\n\n

371939730.name: Excellent beach for surfing, food and people watching
371939730.author: a TripAdvisor user
371939730.reviewBody: The beach at Sayulita is known for its surfing  and its an entertaining place for not only surfers but also for people who want to relax with a beer or two, some fish tacos and a deckchair outside one of the main beach-side cafes, bars and restaurants that line this sandy paradise. The swimming is reasonably safe providing you font go out too far but there is an undertow- so be careful. Sayulita was a small village thirty years ago but it has now become a bustling tourist centre with plenty of shops, eating venues and lots of night-life. It does attract both locals and foreign visitors but in the Winter and Spring  seasons (December to May) you\'ll encounter crowds of happy people from the US and Canada so if you want to keep away from your compatriots you;d better head further north into Nayarit state where development has been slower and less invasive.

371931073.name: Enjoy a beverage/cerveza on the beach!
371931073.author: a TripAdvisor user
371931073.reviewBody: Sat along the beach for a while in one of the restaurants along the strip. Great place to enjoy the surfing sights and watching people going by. The local beach vendors kept us busy with looking at various pieces of jewelry, cigars, sarongs, and sunglasses...it was the usual game of barter, and have fun, and nobody acted intrusive.

371640873.name: Great place
371640873.author: a TripAdvisor user
371640873.reviewBody: A great place to stay and Visit. Food ,Sand , Surf, people, watch, Drink. All is good in Sayulita. some of the best margaritas i have ever had.

371228379.name: Nice beach for surfing
371228379.author: a TripAdvisor user
371228379.reviewBody: Nice beach, fun to watch surfers.   Great little beach bars with cheap drinks and good food.   Alot of ANNOYING vendors constantly pestering you and won\'t take no for an answer

370789722.name: Surfing
370789722.author: a TripAdvisor user
370789722.reviewBody: Fun surf beach with beginner surf breaks on the west side of Sayulita beach, and a more aggressive break on the east side (shallower with rocks/boulders).

370769256.name: Surf is up!
370769256.author: a TripAdvisor user
370769256.reviewBody: Visiting during Spring Break so it was crowded with tourist. But what a cool place to visit! The surfers seem to love this beach. Don\'t worry if you don\'t have a board. They rent them there and give you lessons! Wow!

370719642.name: Worth the trip north
370719642.author: a TripAdvisor user
370719642.reviewBody: Sayulita is a great beach/surfer town. It\'s small (although seems to be growing as people are finding about its awesomeness!). Wonderful little shops, art galleries and restaurants. Wonderful way to spend the day - and you can even take a surf lesson! First time we came here (many years ago) maybe 4 people on the beach, this time the beached was full of people & surf schools but still really nice. It\'s a one day trip that\'s worth the effort every time we head to NV. I have friends that have stayed in Sayulita in one of the small boutique hotels and they have said that\'s awesome as well. Great day of fun in the sun!

370429258.name: Great beaches and beautiful waters!
370429258.author: a TripAdvisor user
370429258.reviewBody: The beaches were fantastic, the waters were a pristine blue, the waves were excellent for surfing or boarding.

370281105.name: Beautiful, busy beach
370281105.author: a TripAdvisor user
370281105.reviewBody: We walked through the little town, past all the taco stands and street vendors, sensing that all roads probably would lead to the beach.  And they do.  The beach was bustling with families playing in the sand and surfers catching waves.  It is a small enough town with a large enough expanse of beach that even at its busiest, we did not feel crowded.  We sensed more that we were happily surrounded by a like-minded community of true beach aficionados.

370268739.name: C J
370268739.author: a TripAdvisor user
370268739.reviewBody: Great view of surfers, enjoyed an inexpensive and very cold beer . The restaurants were plentiful and reasonably priced, the activities available were many and varied for physical ability

370218266.name: Sayulita Shopping and Beach
370218266.author: a TripAdvisor user
370218266.reviewBody: We visited Sayulita last week when attending a family wedding at Iberostar Playa Mita. Went into town to do some shopping and have lunch. I had heard a lot about Sayulita being this cool, sleepy little surer town from friends and coworkers that had been there in the past. It seemed to be just a small, crowded, busy, dirty town with far too many people and businesses in it. On the beach, there are a lot of vendors that seem to never end! I like to go to the small towns in Mexico, however this town seems to be just too crowded. My daughter went into one of the galleries to look at dream catchers and the owner of the store was very rude to her! as if she didn\'t have time to help her. Probably will not be visiting again. Will stick to more quaint smaller towns.

370116828.name: A bit tourusty but still good.
370116828.author: a TripAdvisor user
370116828.reviewBody: If you had traveled arround M\u00e9xico, you\'ll know there are better beaches out there, but the vibe that you\'ll experience from this one makes it all. If you are learning how to surf this is a great option, plus all the eye candy you\'ll find.

370002249.name: Lovely sunsets....too many fishing boats
370002249.author: a TripAdvisor user
370002249.reviewBody: Every year I head to Sayulita at the same time.  I\'ve been going now for about 8 yrs.  This year two things were somewhat of a bummer.
