There are local fishing boats that literally fish close in the bay while paddle boarders are trying have some recreation.  I understand this is a fishing village; it\'s unfortunate they have to be so close.  Usually, they head out to the open ocean.  This time, boards were "net" fishing very close to recreation.  It was a bummer. I\'ve also noticed increase in plastic and trash left on the beach. The upside of this fabulous town is that the sunsets are always remarkable; especially in April.

369582163.name: Playing with waves
369582163.author: a TripAdvisor user
369582163.reviewBody: If you like to roll with the waves, this place is for you but watch the undertow!  .. and expect sand in your suit!

369508844.name: Great Beach
369508844.author: a TripAdvisor user
369508844.reviewBody: Visited Sayulita for the first time and we really liked the area.  The streets were very crowded with cars and people, but the overall atmosphere was great.  The vendors weren\'t too pushy, there were lots of restaurants to choose from.  The beach was really nice.  The surf was small and lots of people were out playing in the waves.  We will go back

369394518.name: Beach-out!
369394518.author: a TripAdvisor user
369394518.reviewBody: Great swimming, clean beach, access to food, beverages & beach apparatus rental. Nice to watch the surfers.

368862467.name: Unique experience...people, shops, food surf
368862467.author: a TripAdvisor user
368862467.reviewBody: The beach was awesome!  Surfers all over the place...not us, though...we just watched!  Vendors up and down the street...will say that this is not your typical shopping like in Cancun where you can negotiate! Prices were pretty high but so, too, was the quality of workmanship on some of the special pottery and jewelry.  We limited shopping because of this but we\'re so glad we made the trip over.  Would be great place to beach it for the day or just stroll for a cpl hrs and take in the ppl and the sights.  Great food available all along the streets.

368730661.name: Great surf village
368730661.author: a TripAdvisor user
368730661.reviewBody: We love Sayulita. Great surf village near Puerto Vallarta. Lots of cool shop and cafe. We visited the farmers market. Awesome.

368525360.name: Perfect!
368525360.author: a TripAdvisor user
368525360.reviewBody: This beach is so perfect! The vibe is incredible and the town is so full of character. We spent half the day there watching the surfers, drinking micheladas, and eating fresh ceviche from the beach vendors. This is the perfect location to spend a few hours enjoying the sun, having a drink at one of the beach front bars, and doing a little shopping. Oh and the drive from Nuevo Vallarta is not too bad, kind of scenic!

368248323.name: Beautiful!
368248323.author: a TripAdvisor user
368248323.reviewBody: We stayed toward the North end of Sayulita where the beach was quieter (bigger waves).  Lovely sunsets. Wonderful people in this town.

368181710.name: Gorgeous beach town
368181710.author: a TripAdvisor user
368181710.reviewBody: Have been wanting to check out Sayulita for a few years now and finally made it. Will definitely coming back to stay because it is a very laid back, artsy and funky little place :)

367971100.name: Great for surfing!
367971100.author: a TripAdvisor user
367971100.reviewBody: Lots of surfers and surfing activities. Great exercise just walking the length and enjoying the sunrise.

367635372.name: Surf town in Mexico
367635372.author: a TripAdvisor user
367635372.reviewBody:
You can get to this beach town easily by bus from Walmart. Just ask the man with the clipboard and he'll help you catch the right bus. $35 pesos will take you on a tour through the countryside on the way to Sayulita. The town is the end of the line, so you can't get lost.

Once you disembark the bus, you will have a short walk through town to get to the beach. The town has tons of boutique shops, coffee and snack bars, as well as taverns and restaurants to choose from.

At the beach, you can rent an umbrella for $200 pesos and you'll likely have one of the local friendly beach dogs greet you. If you want to surf, there are boards for rent and lessons available. Body surfing and boogie boards are popular too. 

The town can seem overcrowded and dirty, golf carts and scooters fight for space with you as you navigate the narrow cobblestone roads. Despite this, it is a quaint and safe village with a number of spas that can take the stress of the street noise away.

Most people seem to stay for the day, but we stayed overnight to see what the night life was like. Locals come to skateboard the plaza, while many young hostel visitors get out to dance and eat.

I can't see spending a week here. A day trip is more than enough in my opinion.

367509795.name: Close to the complex
367509795.author: a TripAdvisor user
367509795.reviewBody: It is very nice to see the ocean, but it is a brave waves. Like it is close to the hotel we used to take the sun, ideal for reading meditate or have a drink.

367252275.name: Small Quiet Enjoyable
367252275.author: a TripAdvisor user
367252275.reviewBody: In the last few years I been to numerous beaches all over from oceans to lakes and even a pond with a beach. How you rate a beach...not sure this is my first attempt. The sand was soft and clean not super white like Florida, I was told this helps not be reflective. Along the waters edge there were alot of stones however which if you have soft feet beware. There were vendors walking on the beach and they offer stuff for most everyone. The water is was fairly clear but that changes I am sure. It would be great for all ages to enjoy a day in the sun.

366878550.name: Crowded but just move down the beach
366878550.author: a TripAdvisor user
366878550.reviewBody: Sayulita is a busy town...but very nice.  We found the beach a great area to swim and walk.  Very crowed at the main entrance to the beach but all you have to do is walk a block to the right down the beach and you will have plenty of room.  Grab an umbrella and bamboo mat from a beach vendor ($12 for the day) and enjoy a cold cerveza while taking in the waves and people watching

366465572.name: Sayulita...ALWAYS a must when we are staying in Nuevo Vallarta
366465572.author: a TripAdvisor user
366465572.reviewBody: We stay in Nuevo Vallarta one or two times a year and always rent a car because we plan on heading to Sayulita for day trips at least a couple of times.  We love the vibe in this small, but lively little beach town. Lots of great little eateries and shops to keep you busy when you aren\'t on the beach. It is a great place to take photos as the buildings and decorations are really colorful and distinct.  Surfing is a prominent feature here with surf schools and surf boards ...not to mention actual surfers...everywhere.  Does get kind of crowded when the surf is good, but pretty laid back at the same time. The beach itself is great for all ages.  You can rent beach umbrellas, but you can also buy one from a beach vendor for very little, which we do, and then we give it to a local before we head back to the states.  Our family group of ages 4 - on up all are happy here...little ones love the sand and romping in the surf, some surf, some fish off the rocks, some roam town for little treasures and we all enjoy food at several different restaurants.  It is a cool, relaxed and happy environment that we highly recommend and it is an easy and interesting drive from Puerto Vallarta or Nuevo Vallarta.

366014074.name: Awesome day Trip!
366014074.author: a TripAdvisor user
366014074.reviewBody: Sayulita town and beach is really fun! The town reminds me of Playa Del Carmen before it "grew up". It has a definite off the beaten path and backpacker vibe. There are tons of cool bars and restaurants on winding pedestrian streets ending on the beach. The beach is large and nice with some really good swimming areas as well as rock pools at one side and surfing/ surf schools in an area. You can rent chairs and umbrellas and just spend the day on the beach. We picked up drinks and snacks at a corner store and then spent hours on the beach. While the kids swam and picked up seashells there was great people watching. We had a good lunch at one of the many restaurants next to the beach. Taxis are easy to get and find to get back to your resort.

365899682.name: Quant town with lots of local color
365899682.author: a TripAdvisor user
365899682.reviewBody: When visiting St. Regis, I love visiting Sayulita for the galleries, shops, local color and beach. So great seafood, margaritas and shopping to enjoy. Great beach with lots of surfers.

365846589.name: Lots of "bro" surfers
365846589.author: a TripAdvisor user
365846589.reviewBody: It is a great beach but it can get busy and competitive for waves. There are also lots of stray dogs so look out for beach surprises :)

365805184.name: Don\'t go in the water.
365805184.author: a TripAdvisor user
365805184.reviewBody: The sea at Sayulita beach is very polluted. There are beautiful beaches up and down the coast, however the surf can be prohibitively big for swimming.

365782732.name: Never a dull moment!
365782732.author: a TripAdvisor user
365782732.reviewBody: To be honest, I\'m glad that I didn\'t know exactly how busy this beach was, as it might have caused me to select a different destination. That said, we found that if we went out in the morning hours (between 9:00 and 10:00) and found a comfy spot, we could enjoy the crowd slowly populating around us without having to fight it. Once we settled in, we were mesmerized by the humanity - I struggled to read a book, as there was so much to take in! The beach itself was great (soft sand, inviting waves, warm water, reasonably clean). The vendors, although there were lots of them, were respectful when we said "no". I also have to report that we were there the week leading up to Easter holiday, which must be one of the busiest weeks of the year. Fun spot, we\'ll be back.

365177272.name: Fun surf scene!
365177272.author: a TripAdvisor user
365177272.reviewBody: Loved spending time here, great people watching. Water a bit rough for general swimming - found better swimming at Playa de Los Muertos, a short 10-15 minute walk south of town. Lots of fun little bars and restaurants.

365121072.name: This is the best surfing in this area
365121072.author: a TripAdvisor user
365121072.reviewBody: You can get to most areas from the buses staged out side of the Walmart. It is the equivalent idea of a greyhound terminal except no terminal just bus stops. We paid very little, maybe $2 each to go on the hour trip to Sayulita. If you are interested in street food and surfing this is the place for you. You can rent surf boards, bicycles and even golf carts there. All in all a fun and not too expensive of a day.

364765666.name: Beautiful Spot
364765666.author: a TripAdvisor user
364765666.reviewBody: Sayulita is a great surf area to visit.  Great bay with gentle wave break which is fantastic for beginners.  Lots of neat shops and restaurants in the area.  A must see.  A word of warning if you are taking a cab.  The set rate from my hotel to Sayulita was $335 pesos.  Our return trip to the hotel as $400 pesos.  We questioned many taxi drivers and they all said it costs more to take a taxi from Sayulita.  In other words the cabs gouge you once you are there.  I did have one cab offer to take us back for $300 pesos but when the other cab drivers heard the price she was charging, I thought they were going to lynch her for undercutting them.  In the end she backed down on her price and we ended up being forced to find another cab and we had to pay $400 pesos.  Screw them.  Next time I will rent a car.

364741535.name: Sick is Sayulita -- Stay away!!!  POULLUTED water from the from the river runs right into the ocean!!
364741535.author: a TripAdvisor user
364741535.reviewBody: We love Sayulita and have been vacationing here for years!! Although after this year we are thinking of finding another vacation spot. Sayulita used to be a charming fishing village but it has become too crowded. I believe their infrastructure can\'t handle the crowds which was evidenced by the raw sewage that we saw flowing down the river and into the ocean. Five of the seven people in our group became violently ill for days!!  For all the years that we have been coming to Mexico we have never been sick!!  They really need to fix their infrastructure problems!!! Until then I would stay away from Sayulita!!\n\nhttps://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g445056-d6467604-r339013406-Sayulita_Beach-Sayulita_Pacific_Coast.html#

364706099.name: Beautiful beach
364706099.author: a TripAdvisor user
364706099.reviewBody: We thoroughly enjoyed this beach both the north and south ends.  The north end has fewer visitors (and lots of fishing pelicans) and the south end smaller waves and more amenities.  Go here!

363169463.name: Cute Beach town
363169463.author: a TripAdvisor user
363169463.reviewBody: Sayulita Beach is a cute laid back place to visit. Small town type of feel to it. It caters to surfers, low maintance type of travelers and chill crowd. You will find small Inns,Hostals, Cafes and a varied amount of activities such as Yoga,Massage,Surf & Salsa lessons. Its easily done as a day trip from Puerto Vallarta & nearby beaches. Its well connected with Public transport/Taxis.

363072771.name: Fun beach for kids and adults
363072771.author: a TripAdvisor user
363072771.reviewBody: Fun wave jumping and the temperature and sand are perfect. Can get very busy, $20 usd for a massage as well! Good time watching surfers or take lesson

362829355.name: Lively or quiet
362829355.author: a TripAdvisor user
362829355.reviewBody: You have choices of plenty of areas-closer to town has more and is noisier-further north is quieter, but there is a great small beach bar and massages.

362674538.name: Fun surfing town; liked it better than downtown Puerto Vallarta!
362674538.author: a TripAdvisor user
362674538.reviewBody: Great street market shops and some nice boutique type stores.  Even had some surf shops with familiar brands as in California and west coat stores. Short cab ride from Nuevo Vallarta but the first time I thought we were going into the jungles. Lots of tourist now. Easy to find a cab back at least during day time. We found a great place right on the beach to eat tapas. \n\nI liked it much better than Bucerias.  Great place to people watch as there are locals and tourists.

362613243.name: We cant wait to go again
362613243.author: a TripAdvisor user
362613243.reviewBody: I am a beach fanatic and I loved the whole town but couldn\'t wait to get to the beautiful beach. I was not disappointed, lovely fine sand, lots of walking, great views and seems pretty family friendly.\n\nBe prepared to pay for chairs, but sure are lots of ways to spend the day, basic or waterfront resorts. We will be staying in Sayulitas on our next visit to Nayarit.

362525242.name: Losing its charm
362525242.author: a TripAdvisor user
362525242.reviewBody: The beach and town are very crowded.  It is impossible to find parking unless you arrive very early.  Be Prepared to be solicited non stop by locals pedaling everything from donuts (very good) to jewelry and blankets.\nThe beach is very good for families as the water isn\'t too deep and the waves are soft.  It\'s a good place to learn how to surf or boogie board.\n

362344574.name: Love the North end of the beach.
362344574.author: a TripAdvisor user
362344574.reviewBody: The north end of the beach is quiet and beautiful, particularly in the morning.  We noted that the sand has gotten finer over the years we\'ve been visiting and makes for great beach walking.

362302020.name: Surfers Paradise
362302020.author: a TripAdvisor user
362302020.reviewBody: We caught a taxi from Bucerias to this beautiful town for a day trip and realized that next time we come to the PV area we will be booking at least a few days here. The atmosphere was so relaxed and the winding streets of the town made exploring a lot of fun. Then you have the brilliant beach loaded with surfers. Great little spot if you have no interest in bigger centers or the resort lifestyle.

361924011.name: GREAT Family Friendly Beach
361924011.author: a TripAdvisor user
361924011.reviewBody:
Fun and plesant sandy beach with kid friendly waves and water temperatures close to everything in town.  Lots of useful and affordable beach rentals of chairs, water toys, umbrellas, etc.  Food nearby or hawked by vendors.  Sometimes the vendors are so frequent that "no, gracias" becomes a mantra.  

Stay away from the sketchy water quality rivermouth, even if local kids are playing in it.  Other than surfing outside of it stay at least 50 yards north or south so it dilutes.  Shorepound  (waves breaking in shallow water) was bigger to the north of the river and maybe a little treacherous for small kids or those not used to the ocean.  The beach to the south, closer to shops in town, is shallower and more gentle for little kids.  

Decent surf for those who can and the folks giving lessons looked competent.  

Just a short walk to town for refreshments.

361871333.name: Great beach
361871333.author: a TripAdvisor user
361871333.reviewBody: We visited the town and beach! The whole area has a fantastic vibe.  The people are friendly, there\'s a market like atmosphere but without the hard sell you get in many places like this! It\'s worth the cab ride!  We stopped at a grill called Barracuda and had shrimp tacos (delicious) and margaritas (THE REAL MC COY!) along with bottled water -( for two)  all for less than $20!

361836913.name: Throw Back In Tme!
361836913.author: a TripAdvisor user
361836913.reviewBody: Saw so many surfers when I visited this small surfing community. The beach was crowded with young people as well as families . The beach was clean and the sand felt great under my feet. There are several restaurants that are near or on the beach. Sayulita itself is a lovely town to visit either for a day trip or a prolonged stay. There are several hotels to choose from and price are moderate.Althogh the town is somewhat commercial you still get the feel of a sleepy coastal town.\nWill be returning  there next year for a return visit !

361801074.name: A bit of a dream spot but it we may have chosen the wrong time to come
361801074.author: a TripAdvisor user
361801074.reviewBody:
This is a bustling little beach town with a nice mix of old and new feel. We were there on the Monday after Easter and it was packed. Not necessarily in a bad way but it would have been a bit nicer if we went during a less busy time.

The beach itself is a bit small, I think due to the hurricane damage but had a nice spot to spread out under out rented umbrellas. The water was perfect, a bit warm but still refreshing, there are a fair amount of stones so it is not the type of beach where you can let your guard down as you have to gingerly navigate the water.

We couldn't resist the food vendors on the beach and I think we paid the price stomach wise, call us dumb but we wanted to enjoy what the beach had to offer.

The kids had a blast and we do regret not signing up for the surf lessons.

When we left we all had smiles on our faces and enjoyed the experience which felt unique and memorable.

361670626.name: Fun beach with kids!
361670626.author: a TripAdvisor user
361670626.reviewBody: The main beach is awesome!!! It took us a couple of days to be comfortable with the huge number of people at the beach! Once we got over that it was a wonderful experience. The beach vendors offer everything from Hamocks to chips to grilled shrimp and even whistles! Out kids loved buying all the fun and local goodies while enjoying the waves.

361588212.name: Disappointed in the beach, not the town.
361588212.author: a TripAdvisor user
361588212.reviewBody: Arrived Easter day, stayed 5 days.  Town busy, beach crowded with scattered trash and overflowing garbage cans.  Certain parts of the beach smell like rotting "something" and a sewage scent permeated the air.  In agreement with other reviews, catch the sunset, have a couple of drinks, watch the crowd, put your toes in, but go elsewhere for a full dip.   \nWe hiked over to Playa de las Muertos, much nicer, interesting cemetery on the way or taxi over to the San Pancho beach.

361191935.name: Big Beach Big Surf
361191935.author: a TripAdvisor user
361191935.reviewBody: The beach in Sayulita is wide and lined with eating establishments.  The surf can get pretty high so the thing to do is to grab a table, have some good eats and watch the surfers put on a show.  There were a lot of kids making sand castles and gathering seashells.  It is a lovely place to spend an afternoon.

360775316.name: Beautiful beach and great surf
360775316.author: a TripAdvisor user
360775316.reviewBody: We loved spending time on the beach in Sayulita. The water is very warm and the surf is a lot of fun!

360464233.name: Nice place to catch a sunset
360464233.author: a TripAdvisor user
360464233.reviewBody: Great for catching a sunset or having a drink at one of the many beach bars. Nice seating at El Break and a very lively area to be. Would suggest going further down away from the steam/ river that we named "poo river" due to the amount of grey water and sewage that ran off from the surrounding areas. Watch for the blue flag - which means high content of harmful bacteria in the water. If you want to have a safe swim, take a walk over to Playa De Los Muertos, and a hike to Carricitos, or a short cab ride to San Pancho. Would not recommend swimming in this area for at least 3 days after rain fall. Live stock and waste water treatment plant not too far up the hill from the town. 2 of the 6 people in the group went swimming here and they both got very ill the next day. If you want to have a healthy vacation, the extra hike or cab ride is VERY worth it.

360066447.name: Awesome surf beach
360066447.author: a TripAdvisor user
360066447.reviewBody: Sayulita is beautiful and an excellent surfing beach but in some ways not really safe for kids.   There are surf boards everywhere and no control over when and where they catch a wave so people can easily be hit by a surfer coming in.  It\'s great for surfing and the water and waves are awesome and beautiful but not a good choice for kids just learning or playing in the water.   Definitely worth a trip to Sayulita just for the town and the beach and beauty.  The town is really cool  with lots of awesome shops and restaurants not to mention the beauty,

359806128.name: Nice Beach - Crowds depend on time of year
359806128.author: a TripAdvisor user
359806128.reviewBody: We went during Semana Santa and yes it was busy Fri, Sat, Sunday but by Sunday afternoon the crowds had really cleared out. Sometimes trip advisor makes you panic.\n\nBesides, a short 15 minute hike to the north beach and we had a beach to ourselves for an entire day. No joke. Agree on the water though, it can be a bit choppy.

359799958.name: Discovery Tours Day Trip to Sayulita
359799958.author: a TripAdvisor user
359799958.reviewBody:
I am writing to let you know about one of you employees Marco.  He was the driver of the Van on 3/4/16 from the Marina in Puerto Vallarta to Sayulita for a day trip.  To say we were disappointed is an understatement.  We were led to believe that we would have a guided tour of Sayulita. Instead he dumped us at Don Pedro’s for an hour and a half with absolutely no guidance. He pointed to where the beach was and told us he would be back in 90 minutes.  This left most of us confused and unsure of where we could change to swim , where we should go etc.    When he picked us up, he had left the van in the sun without the A/C on and we nearly passed out from the heat before he got the van cooled down again. Then he took us to another town for lunch. We were told we could swim but the beach was so rocky you could not walk in the water without boots on!  

But my biggest complaint was his driving. He kept driving really fast over bumps in the road,  to the point where my head literally hit the roof of the van! He thought this was funny.  We were furious. 

This ‘trip’ turned out to be nothing more than a long, expensive   miserable and dangerous taxi ride.  We have bought may of your tours in the past and they were always pretty good.   But this one really left us disappointed.   What a waste of a valuable vacation day.

359395689.name: Very beautiful but very busy
359395689.author: a TripAdvisor user
359395689.reviewBody: Were there for spring break and Holy week. The beach was packed. The current is very strong, so great for surfing, OK for swimming and SUP if there is no wind and the water not too choppy. Swimming can be challenging for kids or not great swimmer

359352607.name: Gorgeous Beach!
359352607.author: a TripAdvisor user
359352607.reviewBody: My husband and I travel up and down the west coast of Mexico several times a year and this beach was a real gem.  I was surprised at the natural beauty, the cleanliness of the beach itself and the friendly locals.  We enjoyed a pleasant afternoon on the beach and the view at sunset was breathtaking!

359244698.name: Beautiful, quaint beach and town.
359244698.author: a TripAdvisor user
359244698.reviewBody: Nice beaches and restaurants. Little harbor with fresh fish daily. Market on Sundays with local goods and food.

359200356.name: Great day in Paradise
359200356.author: a TripAdvisor user
359200356.reviewBody: Took the bus with our 14 and 16 years old teens from Centro PVR to Walmart(7.5 pesos/person) but noticed that we left stuff at our condo.  Jumped off bus and grabbed a cab (150 pesos both ways & tipped 30% as great guy) and met a fantastic cab driver Martin Martinez.  He took us to our condo and we retrieved a backpack and off to Walmart. He gave us an impromptu Spanish Lesson.  Great laughs.. Then we took a bus to Sayulita (140 pesos for 4 people).  Got to beach and found Jose Surf Shack and got lessons for our children (900 Pesos for 4 hours of lessons, again tipped well as great teacher) with Josue who was fantastic.  We used beach chairs from a beach restaurant and had a bucket of beer and food.  Hard to get service but food was okay and beer super cold!  Wonderful atmosphere at the beach. A few dogs maybe two or three came by but not what some posts said would be there.  The entire town was very friendly and we met a great waiter at Restaurant Carmelita cold beer and great nachos.  Then back on the bus to PVR and met a few wonderful locals while on the bus.  All in all a spectacular day in Sayulita.  The people of Mexico are so friendly and great ambassadors.  If you have a day or a week make the trip to Sayulita.

358896143.name: BEAUTIFUL
358896143.author: a TripAdvisor user
358896143.reviewBody: first glance at this beautiful place was WOW!! watching the surfers catch waves, the neat vendors goodies, and eating great food was awesome! i love sayulita this place is magic

358864983.name: Nice but crowded
358864983.author: a TripAdvisor user
358864983.reviewBody: Beach is fine, a bit rocky some places. But water was clear and warm with nice possibilities to catch a wave or two.

358605275.name: Surf City
358605275.author: a TripAdvisor user
358605275.reviewBody: I rented a board for 50 pesos an hour!!! The waves were horrible...All week long they were decent and then...Ay!!! This beach is THE BEST!!! The water is so warm and the waves are so gentle. SHHHHHHH...Keep this gem a secret. HA!

358298615.name: Great community!
358298615.author: a TripAdvisor user
358298615.reviewBody: Love this place! If you stay here a few days you begin to fit in. Everyone remembers you and is very friendly!

358041040.name: Gorgeous
358041040.author: a TripAdvisor user
358041040.reviewBody: I felt like I was in the 1960\'s. Many surfers, hippies, crafts people. Beautiful beach. Easy day trip from Puerto Vallarta.

358011553.name: Day trip
358011553.author: a TripAdvisor user
358011553.reviewBody: Took a day trip to Sayulita.  Lovely surf town.  During our visit there was a surfing competition which wa fun to check out for a little bit.  Great restaurants on the beach and a ton of tourist shops to grab gifts or fun items to take home.

357969255.name: Very cool place to visit
357969255.author: a TripAdvisor user
357969255.reviewBody:
Like many others, we spent 4 hours here as a day visit from a resort.  Yes, we too paid too much in cab fare, but our taxi driver promised to take us both directions so we wouldn't have to worry about finding a return taxi.  He was good to his word and also did not ask for payment until we were safely back at our resort.

Sayulita is a very cool little surf town.  The beach is VERY crowded, but has a great energy to it, with drinks and food brought out to your umbrella if you'd like.  We just snagged a table and had a beer while people watching from the edge of the beach.  

There's surfing and other activities, but you'll want to walk the beach and town to just see what it offers.  Bring some pesos for drinks, food, or other trinkets you may want to buy.  There are people hawking 'silver' items, but most are not real silver so buyer beware.  There are also many people offering to sell you 'weed', but just politely tell them no and they won't bother you.

We recommend it as a (more or less) family friendly and interesting place to visit.

357874000.name: A very unique and special destination
357874000.author: a TripAdvisor user
357874000.reviewBody: Sayulita - the destination, is one of our favorite places. We love the town, locals, the food and especially the dogs that wander unleashed (many of whom have owners). If you do not like dogs, this is not the destination for you. We find it to be one of our favorite aspects of Sayulita and we donate to Sayulita Animals because this amazing organization keeps the dogs healthy and matched with families. If you visit Sayulita, you will want to support them, too.

357869153.name: BEACH WALK
357869153.author: a TripAdvisor user
357869153.reviewBody: Nice beach to walk end to end with some restaurants (on the sand) & to watch the surfers.. The town is quite a good size, nice to meander around to shop & eat at the many choices of restaurants . Fun Day out!

357864592.name: A wonderful place to visit
357864592.author: a TripAdvisor user
357864592.reviewBody: A very cute rural town on Mexico\'s west coast.  Known for its long board surfing, and bustling streets filled with restaurants, and village like stores for shopping.  You can literally eat at a different place for every meal for a week.  The town is very friendly and prides itself on courtesy, and love of their guests.  Sayulita Bay offers some of best Sunset views as well.

357698668.name: Ugh- I couldn\'t get out of here fast enough
357698668.author: a TripAdvisor user
357698668.reviewBody:
Spent 4 nights in Punta Mita and concierge at St, Regis recommended s few hours here

After spending an embarrassing amount of $$ to get to Sayulita , I knew , once we got here we made a mistake 

Village is overrun with dogs and the town smells like urine.  There is only souvenir shopping, gray sand beaches, and poor sewers 

Skip it

357693216.name: Wgreat visit to relax and watch the surfers
357693216.author: a TripAdvisor user
357693216.reviewBody: Spent the day here and had a lot of fun.  It\'s been about 20 years since I had been here and my how the city has grown.  Will definitely make a stop back here and it will be in June.

357689814.name: Sayulita Downtown Beach
357689814.author: a TripAdvisor user
357689814.reviewBody: Nice beach located near the downtown Sayulita area. Good surf for body boards. Nearby to coffee and ice cream shops. A bit of a laid back party atmosphere but still relaxing. Dale K

357450573.name: Surfers and pit bulls
357450573.author: a TripAdvisor user
357450573.reviewBody: Loved the surfers.  Hated the pit bulls.  Off leash.  Not sure what is up with that but didn\'t let it ruin the day.  The restaurants on the beach were a little sketchy, in my opinion.  My daughter got a massage in one of the massage tents, which she greatly enjoyed!  More offers for drugs at this spot if you\'re worried about that.  The town was cute with safer looking restaurants and bakeries.  Cute little shops too.

357390832.name: Great Beach
357390832.author: a TripAdvisor user
357390832.reviewBody: Beach is picturesque, waves are mellow and a perfect place to learn to surf.   They have surf lessons and boards for rent in several places along the beach.  Great setup.

357274935.name: Surfing in Sayulita
357274935.author: a TripAdvisor user
357274935.reviewBody:
On March 14 my wife and daughter took their first surf lessons ever at Sayulita Beach with Geovani at Sayulita surf company. I rented a board. My wife made arrangements by email in advance directly with Geovani. He was quick to respond to emails and answered all our questions. He provided directions to meet at his main office/store, which was conveniently located about 50 steps from the bus stop where we arrived/departed (opposite side of the street). (6 Avenida Revolucion) 

We arrived early, but Geovani was quick to load boards and gear and drove us down to the beach 3 minutes away. 

They had a quick land-lesson on the basics and then got right in the water! 

Geovani continued the lesson in the water as my wife and daughter made progress and gained confidence, helping them to understand how to catch waves on our own. They were both able to get up and ride waves to shore. Geovani was patient, encouraging, and positive. He spoke excellent English. 

Sayulita is a perfect spot to learn how to surf; a regular beak, sandy bottom, not too deep. Geovani was a great instructor and he made for an excellent first surf experience. 

Highly recommended!

357157634.name: Great Hippy/Surf Town!
357157634.author: a TripAdvisor user
357157634.reviewBody: Hard to find a parking place if you drive... but a fabulous time/ food/ beach!  Great coffee shop just off the corner of the town square, they don\'t use straws to help keep things clean!

357087909.name: Fun and colorful little town
357087909.author: a TripAdvisor user
357087909.reviewBody: My wife and I recently spent five days near Sayulita. I surfed the break in town one morning. Fun spot. We also returned to do some site seeing and shopping. The town was very busy with tourists and felt quite safe. Would return any time.

356846986.name: Busy town; good beach but very busy.
356846986.author: a TripAdvisor user
356846986.reviewBody: Sayulita is NOT a backpacker town like some people think. It\'s long moved to an extremely busy tourist trap, but the beach is still nice, although it gets extremely busy with tourists and peddlers. Be careful while swimming - waves are treacherous. For a better beach, walk over to Playa de los Muertes.

356801140.name: Great beach for surfing & people watching
356801140.author: a TripAdvisor user
356801140.reviewBody: Sayulita has a great beach although is becoming very touristy for a small town.  You can take surf lessons, lounge, eat at the restaurants on the beach,...

356427077.name: No paradise here
356427077.author: a TripAdvisor user
356427077.reviewBody: This beach must have been gorgeous a few years ago, but sadly in high season there are just too many people for it to be pleasant: crowded, dirty and noisy - and, yes, there is what looks and smells very much like sewage in the little river that runs into the bay.  The north end of the beach is indeed beautiful, and a lovely place to walk, but big surf and rip currents make it too dangerous to swim. Please take this seriously: tragically, a person drowned during our visit.

356260484.name: Crowded, Popular beach
356260484.author: a TripAdvisor user
356260484.reviewBody: Too crowded and a bit too commercial for my taste. But drive down  to the beach at Hacienda san Pancho and you\'ll be happy

356186591.name: Beautiful beach but dirty water
356186591.author: a TripAdvisor user
356186591.reviewBody:
The Sayulita beach is beautiful and full of fun activities - a real active place famous for surfing. The town is nice with good food and lots of shopping. 

Just be aware that the local water can cause some people to get sick. At times, especially if it rains, the local sewage treatment plant is overwhelmed causing raw sewage to be dumped into the ocean. A new treatment plant is being planned. We had the unfortunate experience of surfing and becoming sick within hours. And we found many similar cases when searching websites. 

Visit the town and beach - just stay out of the water.

355906922.name: Visit for the first time !
355906922.author: a TripAdvisor user
355906922.reviewBody:
Beach is very popular to surf and taking surfing classes!
But there is not parking spaces is very hard to find one
The city is not very clean and people were not too friendly
We were try to rent a golf cart but it was hard to find one and mostly you need to stay at one of the hotels in order to rent one. We rent a beach chair and it was $200 for two chairs. We ordered food and it took more than hour to get it and it was expensive and average.

355428510.name: Awesome!
355428510.author: a TripAdvisor user
355428510.reviewBody: This place is a gem and I hope the world leaves it alone.  The restaurants are great, the vibe is laid back, and people are friendly...the surf was good too!

355381086.name: Lack of cleanliness
355381086.author: a TripAdvisor user
355381086.reviewBody: If your idea of side stepping dog feces and trash throughout the beach area and feces on the streets in town then by all means go visit. I would never waste my time going there again. There are much nicer places throughout Mexico. Spent the better part of the day there and couldn\'t wait to leave. Don\'t let the websites fool you with their advertisements. Was there in early March 2016

355116161.name: best sunset beach walk
355116161.author: a TripAdvisor user
355116161.reviewBody: We loved strolling the beach from Amor Boutique Hotel to the other one end of the bay and back.  A short walk at sunset gives you an opportunity to see the sights, mingle with beach vendors, and maybe even see a horse just walking the beach.

355110520.name: Amazing
355110520.author: a TripAdvisor user
355110520.reviewBody: I have been all over the world and I would say this is one of the most charming towns with the best hospitality I\'ve been. Highlight of the trip was going surfing with Risa @ Surf it out she teaches for a beginner to intermediate or just basically a great tour guide to show you all the brakes and the best places to eat on the way back from surfing  she\'s amazing if you\'re with her you will feel like a local.

354841677.name: Some of the best people watching on earth
354841677.author: a TripAdvisor user
354841677.reviewBody: We love it here. Grab a drink and enjoy the world around you. Lower the expectations though. This is not the place you go for tranquility. It\'s a true surf town in Mexico. I truly love it.

354782798.name: Sightseeing trip to Sayulita
354782798.author: a TripAdvisor user
354782798.reviewBody: A nice little town,  probably at the stage Bucyrus was at about 5 years ago. Unfortunately,  with the ease of transportation,  I think that they get overwhelmed with tourist,  in season. Still,  the town remains rustic and original. Naty\'s for tacos @ 13pesos is authentic Mexican. Reuben\'s is good for more traditional North America food. Every place is good for cerveza!!

354766392.name: Day Trip from Puerto Vallarta
354766392.author: a TripAdvisor user
354766392.reviewBody:
This is an amazing town to visit
We were staying downtown so we took a cab to the Walmart by the marina. 100 pesos .
We got on the blue bus that took us on a 50 minute ride to the town Sayulita. 70 pesos per person. The bus was air-conditioned and comfortable
We walked the cobblestone streets . We bought 2 chairs and a table on the beach with umbrella. $20. Total Usd. 
The surfing was off the hook and the people there the locals were very very talented artisans . It just has a vibe to it we explored hotel options and found that's condo was the way to go. We booked a 2 bedroom on the beach for next year . $1000.00 for 7 nights and 120.00 for transfers from airport for 2 pp. 
this place was really unique . 
Can't wait to spend a week there .

354407569.name: Sayulita: a "pueblo magico" no more
354407569.author: a TripAdvisor user
354407569.reviewBody: Unfortunately, this once quaint fishing village and sleepy surf mecca has grown too much too fast. The water treatment system is grossly inadequate to handle the burgeoning population and swarms of visitors, and the consequences are evident in the fetid water pouring straight into the river mouth, polluting the river, the beach, the break, and the air. We were here for a month and were stricken with pretty severe illnesses- of the g.i. and respiratory- for half of our stay. We had already been in Mexico (Oaxaca) for 5 weeks, so our illnesses were a surprise... Until we heard from countless residents and travelers about similar ailments. We also met local surfers who no longer surf or swim at this, their home break, due to the poor water quality. This "pueblo magico" - a title recently bestowed by the Mexican government, is allegedly in danger of losing its status as such due to the poor water quality. If you are looking for a vibrant town with an array of nightlife and food/ drink places and you are happy to swim in your pool, this place might be for you. If, however, you are looking to swim and surf, this is not your best option. I wish the residents of Sayulita the best of luck in organizing and advocating for the apparently inept powers that be to deal with this situation. Suerte!

353967309.name: Sayulita River sewage
353967309.author: a TripAdvisor user
353967309.reviewBody: We have been vacationing every year now for 6 years and we love Sayulita but after this year we are thinking of finding another vacation spot.  Sayulita used to be a charming fishing village but it has become too crowded.  I believe their infrastructure can\'t handle the crowds which was evidenced by the raw sewage that we saw flowing down the river and into the ocean.  Seven of nine people became very ill.  For all the years that we have been coming to Sayulita we were never sick.  I hope they fix their infrastructure problems because we would like to return one day.

353855830.name: Beautiful and Fun
353855830.author: a TripAdvisor user
353855830.reviewBody: Lots of fun sights and eats to be had.  Perfect beach for surf, swimming or just hanging.  We really loved the beach side Restaurant Ponchos

353815700.name: Nice day trip from Bucerias
353815700.author: a TripAdvisor user
353815700.reviewBody: Sit and have a drink and watch the surfers. Not something I would do but there were a lot of people in the water. Take in the town, have some lunch catch the bus back for 18 pesos and it is a fun day.

353434593.name: Disappointing experience although it may have been our fault.
353434593.author: a TripAdvisor user
353434593.reviewBody: We were excited to visit Sayulita Beach after being told it was a beautiful, hip and artistic community.  I\'m sure we took a wrong turn as all we found was a packed (like sardines) beachfront with wall to wall people (ok, folding chair to folding chair).\n\nThe beach is beautiful and ends in a cove like setting.  If ever we return, I think we\'ll try negotiating that route instead of the nerves of steel roadways we travelled on.  It was not a place for timid drivers.

353329859.name: Beautiful and lively Sayulita
353329859.author: a TripAdvisor user
353329859.reviewBody: We took a bus in from Puerto Vallarta for the day, but wish we could spend more time in Sayulita. Wonderfully lively little town was full of festivity with dancing horses, mariachi bands and street vendors on the day we were there. Lots of artisan shops and restaurants on the beach. Beautiful sandy beach suitable for surfing and other water sports.\n\nWolud definitely like to return one day and stay longer.

352861961.name: surfers paradise
352861961.author: a TripAdvisor user
352861961.reviewBody: We took the bus from the Mexico Mega store in Nuevo Vallarta.  It was about 20 pesos each and took about 25 minutes. We arrived on Wednesday and the town was alive with mariachi bands and dancing horses! What a cute little town.  We had the best fish tacos in town and enjoyed a walk along the beach.  The beach isn\'t that long but there\'s lots of surfing going on to watch. There are a couple of restaurants on the beach but they are very busy.\nYes the day we were there they were digging a trench from the river/sewer through the beach to the ocean. It didn\'t smell but it was  flowing into the water where people were swimming. Needless to say we didn\'t swim that day.

352005535.name: It\'s a neat place
352005535.author: a TripAdvisor user
352005535.reviewBody: I first came to Sayulita in Nov 2015. Back now in Feb 2016. Love it here. Plan to buy a casa eventually with a pool. Enjoy the overall atmosphere.

351738673.name: Beautiful natural beach.
351738673.author: a TripAdvisor user
351738673.reviewBody: Small town approx. 1 hr by bus from Puerto Vallarta. Great restaurants, rock n roll bars. Beach is sweeping, small bay. Views are fantastic. This is a surfers town. Hang out, lay out on the beach and just pass the day away. Excellent!!!!!!!!

351718617.name: Main Beach Contamination
351718617.author: a TripAdvisor user
351718617.reviewBody: Yes it is true....The river that flows into the ocean 25 m away from the main beach is obviously contaminated with sewage and other wonders.  My boyfriend surfed one day at Main beach and I chose to just watch.   Within 3-4 hours he was ill with vomiting....   We had consumed the same diet and water etc until this point so the ocean water was the likely culprit. \nWe met other tourists who had similar experiences soon after swimming at the main beach.  We are both healthcare professionals and can tell you with very little doubt, the ocean at main beach is contaminated and the river outflow is the cause.  Choose to swim at Playa de Los Muertos and Playa Carracitos (short walk),  or just further North from the main beach as both are beautiful beaches.\nWe would return but heed the warnings.

351705889.name: Surfing!
351705889.author: a TripAdvisor user
351705889.reviewBody: Perfect beach for my first foray into the surf world. Lots of options for lessons. Some areas of rip tides but just be smart and it\'s fine. Sand was a little dirtier then normal but still a nice beach.

351649547.name: Busy! Entertaining---lots of amenities!
351649547.author: a TripAdvisor user
351649547.reviewBody:
Everything you can imagine or want is on  this beach area,
not unlike a lot of the western coastal Mexican playas---but
what makes this beach area friendly and unique is it's--Flat!
So---a great walking beach area, and you are never far from a beer! Recommended!

351610311.name: Crowded and touristy
351610311.author: a TripAdvisor user
351610311.reviewBody: So this beach is probably perfect for young people, those who like to party, and the surf crowd. I gravitate to the quieter beaches were  I can read and enjoy the peace and quiet. On the plus side, there are a number of good restaurants and fun things to do for the more active types.

351448421.name: Waves are a blast to play in
351448421.author: a TripAdvisor user
351448421.reviewBody: I really like this beach, if you head a little North away from the surfer area it\'s fairly open and spacious. Fun waves to play in, decent enough sand, and very relaxing.\n\nBe aware though, there are many stray dogs, and a horse trail tour passes through the beach as well... so you may come across animal droppings.  Other than that though, I really like the space.  Few restaurants near by too but doesn\'t feel over crowded or anything.

351195771.name: Unique black and gold sand beach!
351195771.author: a TripAdvisor user
351195771.reviewBody: took a taxi in front of walmart in Puerto Vallarta to sayulita cost 35 pescos each way per person.  the ride was about 1 hour. more comfortable than the blue and white city buses. The town is full of shops and streets that roll downhill to the beach.  Ate the street served tamale and cheese baked into a banana leaf for 25 pescos. delicious! the beach is great for smaller kids as the underwater tow is less and you can walk out onto the beach for some ways and hop the waves.  The beach is perfect for picking sea shells and watching surfers! I would want to try and stay here for a few days next visit. free bathrooms to change behind the beach restaurants on the beach.

350960484.name: So crowded!
350960484.author: a TripAdvisor user
350960484.reviewBody: We knew Sayulita when it was a "small fishing village". Well, that is not the case anymore. Sooo much car traffic, so much congestion and so many people.  I guess the next "small" place is North to San Pancho but how long before it becomes crowded like this as well?  Go to Sayulita if you have never been before (preferably by bus) but if you want peace and quiet, keep going...

350952394.name: Tour with Vallarta Adventures
350952394.author: a TripAdvisor user
350952394.reviewBody: WOW! We wish we would have booked this tour earlier in our 10 day vacation as we would have found a way to go back on our own. Beach is full of life, one of my pictures shows a surfer with a large fish; not certain if he had a fish story to tell or a surfer story to tell, one thing is certain he did not set out to go fishing he was rather surprised! Great shopping in the village, fun atmosphere! Our tour was the ATV tour to Sayulita which only allowed us 1.5 hours, we wished we could have spent all day! It\'s a gem, be certain to put it on your agenda. We did not see any of the sanitation problems others mentioned but we\'re very careful and brought our own hand wipes and hand sanitizer. Husband are the "the best homemade key lime ice cream I\'ve ever had" from a beach vendor. This made me very worried, no problems. That was over a week ago. Don\'t let the negative people ruin your trip to this awesome town.

350949617.name: Great town & food but not so much for the crowded beach
350949617.author: a TripAdvisor user
350949617.reviewBody: Food is great in Sayulita, it is also a very safe town night and day. Seen families walking at night, great fun town with music and street food smell. A little expensive when you compare with other Mexican places but cheap when compared with resorts prime spots...\nBeach was too crowded for me and baby waves, apparently great to learn to surf... Good vibe

350706839.name: Best waves to boogie board
350706839.author: a TripAdvisor user
350706839.reviewBody: Very cool beach. Eclectic. Had a blast in the surf! Beach was a bit crowded but awesome culture. Have been twice. Loved it.

350498895.name: Spectacular Beach. Fun and great waves to surf
350498895.author: a TripAdvisor user
350498895.reviewBody: Our friends raved and afternoon there. The beach is full of people families and vendors and full of with life. It is known for its surfing had a great place to learn and there are many sir shops right along the beach. You can rent a couple of chairs and Bralla for about six dollars a day and it\'s well worth it. There are literally dozens of vendors and you can sit all day long and they will bring you food drink and all kinds of local crafts to buy. We had a dozen oysters broth right to our chairs by a local vendor for only one dollar each they were large and the delicious. The restaurants bring you beer and margaritas and there is a constant stream of local vendors try to so you close truly cigars and you make sure you bargain with them. My wife bought a pair of pants for $15 that were originally $35. The beach is amazing as it is full of gold colored sand local high course content and it literally looks like you\'re walking in Gold water. It is very shallow and safe for kids.  when you get about 100 feet there are 5 foot waves where there are surfers boogie boards and great to just body surf. My wife does not usually spend a lot of time in the ocean but she went in three or four times of this always so much fun to draw up a play in. This is one of the better public beaches we\'ve ever been to and looking forward to going back again next year.

350279437.name: Great escape
350279437.author: a TripAdvisor user
350279437.reviewBody:
Just went with the wife for her birthday and had a great time in Sayulita. The beach is in a relaxed surfer town different then most other beaches in Mexico where its more nightlife and fiesta. 

The southern part of the beach is where most of the activitie is and where surfers have a good time but if your more like us that we wanted sun and the occasional dip in the sea the northen part of the beach is for you, there are a lot of less rocks in the sand and you have to worry less about being hit by a surfboard.

there´s restaurants on the edge of the sand all through the beach and I recommend getting a parasol and a rug made out of palm tree (parasol 350-600 pesos depending on negotiation and size, rug 150-250 pesos). The vendors are walking through the beach and most certainly will approach you.

Be wary of the beach sellers, they will constantly try to sell you anything.

350132542.name: Walk  and message
350132542.author: a TripAdvisor user
350132542.reviewBody: The worst.  Too crowded.  Lots of debris.  A very young crowd, or lots of beer drinkers.  If you want nice and serene, this is not the beach for you.  However, a message right off the beach was very nice.

349847308.name: Very beautiful beach
349847308.author: a TripAdvisor user
349847308.reviewBody: This beach was so beautiful and full of things to do and places to eat and drink only steps away.  I will definitely be here again.  Sayulita is a beautiful little town and this beach is a gem.

349815026.name: Feb. 18th, 2016 road trip to Sayulita
349815026.author: a TripAdvisor user
349815026.reviewBody:
We had visited Sayulita  during a vacation in 2010 at RDC. 

Nice little town with a pretty beach where we sat under the umbrella shade at a beach front bar and enjoyed cold adult beverages as the surfers played in the waves.

After vacationing the last few winters in Cozumel with friends we decided to go back to RDC and our friends joined us. We had a list of things we wanted to show them and Sayulita was one of them. Having read the recent threads we were concerned about what others were writing but decided to go anyway, just be extra careful (use of hand sanitizer, watch where we went, what we ate and drank).

So we hopped the bus and arrived in Sayulita after about 20 to 30 mins of a thrilling bus ride. The town was busier, more crowded and dirtier than I remembered. When we got to the beach it was early afternoon, very crowded, with many more umbrellas and chairs than our last visit. We used the banos at a beach bar and sat at a table away from the beach since all those spots were taken. After looking over the menu we ordered a bucket of cerveza, followed later with a second bucket. It didn't take long before we moved ourselves up into the beach chairs under the umbrellas as people moved out. 

We enjoyed watching the swimmers and surfers play in the water as the gentle breeze came ashore, wave after wave. :) Truly a beautiful place to be on a winters day vs the cold and snow back home.

Here it is three full days later and none from the party of five of us has had any ill health effects.

Your Mileage May Vary. :)

349807061.name: Great place to spend the day!
349807061.author: a TripAdvisor user
349807061.reviewBody: We bussed here from PuertoVallarta, took about 50 mins. Totally worth the long bus ride! surfing is CHEAP and the is a beginners area that is great if you want to learn to surf. Lots of neat little surf shops and resaurants along the beach. Watch out for sting-rays in the water and shuffle your feet as you walk out. I would love to stay here next time I visit Mexico!

349802538.name: Nice waves
349802538.author: a TripAdvisor user
349802538.reviewBody: Sayulita is a nice relaxing drive from Puerto Vallarta for a change.  The ocean provides nice waves to learn to surf.  And there are plenty of teachers there.

349752066.name: Nice Beach
349752066.author: a TripAdvisor user
349752066.reviewBody: Nice Beach - but on a busy day you should head for Los Metros just around the corner to the south. You can walk from town or take a taxi

349639932.name: Funky surf town
349639932.author: a TripAdvisor user
349639932.reviewBody: Definitely worth a visit. Bathrooms in some of the places were questionable... That said, it was a really enjoyable visit and would like to try staying there in the future. \n\nWe are staying in Nuevo Vallarta this trip.

349455984.name: Great beach town, can get crowded
349455984.author: a TripAdvisor user
349455984.reviewBody: Sayulita is a fantastic beach town but the main beach area can get crowded. The north side of the beach, across the Sayulita river, has many fewer people and is much more laid back.

349405986.name: Best beach
349405986.author: a TripAdvisor user
349405986.reviewBody: Shhhh. Don\'t tell anyone but this is an awesome beach. Great for walking, surfing, swimming or relaxing.  It\'s quiet. The waves are peaceful. And sadly more people are discovering this quaint little town.

349388647.name: Sewage
349388647.author: a TripAdvisor user
349388647.reviewBody: I was just up to Sayulita with my girlfriend this week.  When we arrived by bus from Puerto Vallarta and walked into town we were really in love with this place.  We have been disappointed with the Puerto Vallarta because we were expecting more of "beach town".  So Sayulita was immediately more to our liking and tastes.  We had pretty much decided this would be our next vacation stay.... Until... We walked down the beach and saw that raw sewage was being pumped into a lagoon that emptied into the ocean.\n\nVery disappointing.   I want to surf and the beach has great access for that but I don\'t like the idea of doing any of that near where sewage is being dumped.

348697166.name: Fun in the sun watching the husbands learn to surf!
348697166.author: a TripAdvisor user
348697166.reviewBody: Loved it -- but had to pay for our beach chairs. The vendors were fun and the beach has a great fun vibe. Surfer schools look like they dominate the beach but don\'t be intimidated by that -- it\'s a family affair.

348650303.name: Beach time in Sayulita
348650303.author: a TripAdvisor user
348650303.reviewBody: The word has gotten out on Sayulita.  This quaint little town has become very busy with lots of people and not so much space.  The beach is now crowded, need to get your spot early.  They need to pick up the trash around town and it would be so much better, the beaches are clean.

348588296.name: Great Waves
348588296.author: a TripAdvisor user
348588296.reviewBody: Lots of surfing, paddle boarding and swimming at this beach with plenty of food and drink available.

348145216.name: Paradise   nice wztching surfers
348145216.author: a TripAdvisor user
348145216.reviewBody: The water is spectacular  waves or calm  merchants on beach just say no they are gone everything from candy donuts cookies  oysters  they deliver to you

348043076.name: Outstanding surf beach for the family, GREAT town
348043076.author: a TripAdvisor user
348043076.reviewBody: Needed way more time here - we took a cab from PV to hang out and surf for 4hrs....  Kids had an absolute blast.  You could just sit and watch the "pro" surfers if you wanted - could do that all day.  \n\nThe board rental dudes were solid with a board for 50 pesos for an hour(ish)..  Got a great bunch of beers and salsa, walked the beach then quickly went through town.  Clearly we should have stayed 3-4 days.  I love food, and there\'s dozens of killer looking unique and reasonably priced spots.  Next time for sure!

347725703.name: Quaint international village
347725703.author: a TripAdvisor user
347725703.reviewBody: I was in Sayulita 7 years ago. It was one hour north of Puerto Vallarta. It was great to be able to park the car, and walk everywhere. It is a small village with dirt roads (at the time), restaurants, some vacation rentals, a small beach with a nice wave break for surfers. I enjoyed the small town vibe, the international crowd of people who live there full time or half time, lots of canadians at the time. I found some nice guest homes to stay in and enjoyed spending time at the beach. My husband could walk down the beach and score grilled fish and fruit all day. At night by the town square by the church people gathered and people from other parts came down with their offerings of food. I love flan so I tried all types of flan made by local women, all delicious. It was at time noisy living downtown but it was Easter vacation so many people from inland areas came down to the beach. The vibe was super friendly and relaxed even when crowded so I can imagine it would be even more lovely at a quieter time. I want to go again. I loved the architecture and all the colors and the Huichol indian art works you could see in galleries but also buy at the beach from the artists themselves. My only complaint about the trip and Mexico in general is that they don\'t have drinkable water, which seems ridiculous for a developing country with so much tourism dollars.. I brushed my teeth with the local water and got sick eventually. So I wish they would focus on this for their own people.. definitely while I know many people who are happy expatriots in Mexico, that factor is bothersome. So don\'t drink the water !

347593802.name: Off to Sayulita for the day
347593802.author: a TripAdvisor user
347593802.reviewBody: The beach is amazing, but expect "touristy  Heavy sales pitches for rental of umbrellas and "touristy" things to buy.  Panhandlers prevalent everywhere, but friendly people and usually satisfied with "no, gracious"

347564561.name: A Fun Day at the Beach
347564561.author: a TripAdvisor user
347564561.reviewBody: We discovered Sayulita and enjoyed it very much. The beach was awesome. We got to watch surfers for hours. We laid back and ate yummy food from the vendors (great macaroons!) had tropical drinks and got to buy some silver  as well. I would think it\'s important to get there early so you could get front row seats.

347389350.name: worth a visit
347389350.author: a TripAdvisor user
347389350.reviewBody: We were staying at a nearby resort Grand Palladium resort and spa - took a cab over to explore the town.  The beach is okay - a lot of small rocks - the beach at the Grand Palladium is far nicer, the views are great. The town is very interesting and was fun to explore. You need to WATCH where you are walking, a lot of surprises, but it\'s a lot of fun too.

347259766.name: Great- but avoid hoildays and long weekends
347259766.author: a TripAdvisor user
347259766.reviewBody: The town is fun, colorful, interesting range of shops, restaurants, accommodation and activities. I found it too busy over New Year\'s but liked it once people left after the weekend. Before that too many people trying to drive on too few streets=chaos. The beach was also much more enjoyable for me once the crowds thinned a bit. Didn\'t think the waves are that good for surfing compared to Hawaii.

347214576.name: Good mostly for surfing
347214576.author: a TripAdvisor user
347214576.reviewBody: Good for surfing. Pretty setting but not a pretty beach. Grey, dirty-looking sand. Sayulita itself has gotten very touristy and has lost a lot of the charm that I think brought people here initially. Food in town overall is just average. Playa de los Muertos (short walk from the main beach in Sayulita) is prettier and less crowded, but not good for surfing. Overall, we were pretty disappointed with Sayulita as a whole and wouldn\'t go back, unless we only wanted to surf. There are much prettier beaches in the region, and likely less touristy "hidden gem" towns as well.

347186221.name: Big Waves, Very Scenic
347186221.author: a TripAdvisor user
347186221.reviewBody: The waves here pretty much prevented us from swimming out into the water very far. But it was great all the same, we put our 6 year old in a life jacket and he body surfed around and played in the sand. Very scenic and clean.

347133931.name: too bad sayulita isn\'t named sonova ...
347133931.author: a TripAdvisor user
347133931.reviewBody:
'cause, if so, the beach would be SONOVA BEACH !  however, it's a nice wide, long (1.2 miles) stretch of sand -- and though i've only been there once (that "once" was seven daze, though) i believe i can comment on it somewhat in depth and accurately.  whoever reads this and has also been there may beg, or differ, or both.  alas ... the south end of S B (or Playa Sayulita) begins abruptly downtown, where the coast-line bends abruptly almost 90 degrees, the coastline rising and rocky.  as one wanders north, the number of people diminishes as you are, of course, leaving the "down town" and getting out in the area of fewer buildings.  perhaps 2/3 the way down the beach you could be by yourself, as you're out and away from "town".   we stayed at Los Gemelas, which is at the half-way point -- that is, on my morning barefoot beach runs, it'd take me the same time to go to one end as the other.
     This has all the ingredients of your "stereo-typical" Mexican playa:  wide expanse of sand (usually about 50 - 75 yards from water's edge to the 'developed' area inland).  Of course this changes with the tide!  vendors selling "the usual" array of handicrafts, junk, soap-bubble wands, hammocks, fruit and drinks and pastries, jewelry, etc., and etc.   We didn't see any boats pulling/towing people up on the parachute/kite things -- and the reason could be that this is also a reknowned SURFING BEACH.  there is a pronounced BREAK perhaps 30 - 70-some yards offshore, which is a challenge for non-surfers to get to, and past.  however, the launches and dive/fish tour motor-boats are all parked at the south ('down-town") end of the beach, and can get in and out by just cutting thru the waves.
     if one likes to run barefoot along the coast, (again, this varies with the tide) i found that about 2/3's of the way you could find a "line" where the sand was firm enough to make your work-out not so hard.  about 1/3 of the beach the sand was soft and i had to just buckle down and suffer (yes, just grind away, slowly but steady) through it.  exhilarating.
    Every day i'd see families on their outing, the kids staying busy and involved with the usual beach fun -- a lot of running into and away from the waves.
    LOTS OF DOGS.  Sayulita is one of those places where the dogs are also citizens of the town.  If you are adverse/allergic/just plain scared of dogs, well, maybe there's a dog-less beach somewhere else.
     for the most part, the sand quality is "normal" -- that is, the areas of pebbles and/or a sharper-grained sand are few -- the norm is not to have to worry what your bare feet are stepping on.
    ONE more thing:  the beach in general is pretty well-maintained in regards BASURA.  That is, very little garbage.  I found one piece of broken glass and (of course) picked it up.  Wish i could say that about all beaches i've been to!

346594125.name: Beware water in south bay!
346594125.author: a TripAdvisor user
346594125.reviewBody:
I'll start by saying that I love Sayulita, this is my second trip here and overall it's great. 
BUT... I unfortunately have to confirm earlier reports of water quality issues in the bay in front of town (south beach). We arrived on the 6th of Feb and after two days of surfing ALL the surfers in our group are down with violent vomiting, etc. The other half of our group who didn't surf, but have shared absolutely every other aspect of the trip ( eat together, casa together, drink together, etc) are totally healthy. And the irony is that the healthy group includes people who have always been the first to catch any stomach bug. 
Is it possible that it's just a coincidence? Of course... But the odds of all of the younger healthier people catching a stomach flu at the same time, but not the non-surfers pretty much defies belief. 
I hate to post a negative comment about such a great place, but people need to be warned.

346161801.name: Beware
346161801.author: a TripAdvisor user
346161801.reviewBody: While the beach at Sayulita is absolutely beautiful and is a favorite among surfers, boogie boarders and paddle boarders I gave it a lower rating for two reasons.  The river (more like a creek in the winter) sometime carries trash and debris into the surf.  And, at times there can be dangerous rip tides north of the river.  My recommendation would be to keep to the south end of the beach, well away from the river\'s mouth.

345848047.name: One beach two faces
345848047.author: a TripAdvisor user
345848047.reviewBody: The beach is separated through a small river. An the one side you can find a righthander beachbreak for surfing, a lot on US tourists, surf schools and locals who want to do business. On the other side you can find more backpackers, surfers on the lefthander break and more laid back atmosphere.  I liked the packpacker area more.

345684735.name: Hippie Atmosphere
345684735.author: a TripAdvisor user
345684735.reviewBody: This town and beach are definitely for the young at heart.  We took the bus from Puerto Vallarta just to check out the vibe.  The beach isn\'t very pretty and is adorned with lots of beach chairs in front of beach front restaurants.  It is kind of a grungy area but having said that we enjoyed our visit.  Lots of shops just off the beach.  We did have an issue finding a restroom as there are no public restrooms but a restaurant offered us their facility.  It\'s a fun experience and if you remember the free loving 60\'s it is reminisent of that time.

345239137.name: Another Vallarta Adventures Tour
345239137.author: a TripAdvisor user
345239137.reviewBody:
This is another excellent tour provided through Vallarta Adventures. It leaves from Marina Vallarta, which is a little further out than the Terminal marina. It departs early in the morning, around 0800. They provide a continental breakfast at the office.
The drive in a well air conditioned van, takes you through Nuevo Vallarta and Bucerias. Then you head into the hills for a 30 minute ride.
Sayulita is an older town and has a real Bohemian vibe. There are vendors on the street selling hand made crafts. There are also several good bars as restaurants. The tour includes a lunch stop at a local taco shop. It is a very busy place that produces some very tasty local dishes.
The beach is undeveloped by todays standards and features several surf shops. You can rent a board and take a quick lesson. The surf can be quite spectacular, depending on the day. There were a lot of surfers out in the water while we were there.
After leaving Sayulita, we drove about 15 minutes to San Pancho(also known as San Fransisco). The beach here is less developed and very spectacular. Surfing is popular here also. There are lots of vendors here too, selling hand made crafts and a real good fresh coconut stand. There are also a couple nice beach bars and restaurants.
One place we visited was a self sustaining recycling center that trains and employs the local people. They offer day care, education, public meeting space and employment. It is truly a remarkable place to visit. The people at the center are proud of what they do and love to share their experiences.
A big thanks to our driver Eric and our tour guide (whos name escapes me), a very nice young fellow with a sense of humour and a knowledge of local history.
We returned to the marina around 3pm. This is a good days outing.

345025652.name: Biggest Bummer of our trip
345025652.author: a TripAdvisor user
345025652.reviewBody:
We spent 2.5 weeks in the Rivieria Nayarit area and drove over to Sayulita to surf.  First there were no waves (we tried 3 different days), but we thought since we drove all the way we might as well enjoy swimming and eating. 

One beachside restaurant wanted me to pay $10 just to sit down, even though I said we wanted to order lunch!!  We go to Cabo 6-8 weeks a year and never have been asked to pay (please order food, yes, but not just rent the chairs before we eat!)

We chose to eat somewhere else.  The food was really good.  There is a guy selling baked goods.  If you see him selling these fruit filled pastries, they are to die for!  We wanted like 5-6, so he took our order and said he'd be back in 1 hour.  He brought FRESH HOT ones!  

The sand had a lot of black silt in it and it stuck to us.  Hard to clean it off before jumping back in to the car.  The beach area was just average.  Lots of shops around it, but kinda a dirty area.

344945703.name: Not the prettiest
344945703.author: a TripAdvisor user
344945703.reviewBody: It\'s fine for a short stay between things but there are so much prettier beaches in the region. Also surf it crowded. It\'s convenient for surfing as you can rent the boards right there, but again, I would go somewhere away from town for less crowds and more clean, pristine conditions.

344806883.name: Great for surfers
344806883.author: a TripAdvisor user
344806883.reviewBody: This is a beautiful beach if you are a surfer paddler ect.  But this is not a swimmers beach. There is a lot of restaraunts on the beach and if yoy have food or drinks, there is a great to lounge.

344404209.name: Great Day Trip!
344404209.author: a TripAdvisor user
344404209.reviewBody: We loved heading out to Sayulita for the day. Caught the bus from Walmart and took us just under an hour to get there for only $30 pesos each. Walked into town and hit a cafe for a morning coffee and snack. Walked down to the beach and rented chairs and palapa for the day which was so nice and comfortable way to be in a and out of the hot sun. We hired a surf instructor an hour and half lesson and then surfed on our own for another hour for only $50. So much fun and such a cool thing to do for the day! Loved the waves, bay, beach and whole relaxed vibe of this cool little town. A must see and do for the adventurer and water sport enthusiast!

344156895.name: lotsa surfing
344156895.author: a TripAdvisor user
344156895.reviewBody: If you are into surfing, modest massage, fresh ceviche, people-watching, this is a great beach.  A bit challenging with rough surf, and not a huge place, it was a fun location for a vacation swim-time.

344155709.name: Awesome Beach at Sayulita
344155709.author: a TripAdvisor user
344155709.reviewBody: The beach at Sayulita is definitely a busy and active place.  The south end is the popular end, the swimming end, where the waves are the mildest.  That\'s where you will find lots of people under umbrellas and on beach chairs.  Much of the beach is big breakers, so most swimming and surfing goes on at the south end, where the centre of town is and where the breakers are smallest.  The undertow can be a problem depending on the day and the tide, especially as you go north.  No one swims at the north end, it seems.  Walking up to the north end of the beach gets you away from the crowd, where there are only a few people sunbathing or walking.  At the north end of the beach, you can find a trail that takes you to the next couple of deserted beaches, if you head north through the jungle for about 20 minutes.

344150902.name: Fun but not pretty
344150902.author: a TripAdvisor user
344150902.reviewBody: If you want to learn to surf or other water sports then this is a great place. If your looking for a beautiful beach then it\'s just average. \n\nDo go if you want to surf, paddle board, or go whale watching. Not the best if want a pretty beach.

344146960.name: A must see ...
344146960.author: a TripAdvisor user
344146960.reviewBody: Gorgeous scenery ... lots of waves for surfers .. great restaurants and quaint little stores to visit ....

343645453.name: Nice beach and friendly staff in beach cafes
343645453.author: a TripAdvisor user
343645453.reviewBody: I came out for a day trip and was pleasantly delighted at all the shops and great places to eat. Plenty of vegan choices too. Everyone was very friendly here.

343445918.name: Hopping hippie town
343445918.author: a TripAdvisor user
343445918.reviewBody: Just spent the day in sayulita and the surrounding area. Great place to shop for mexican souvenirs. Great little places to eat on every corner. Great place to people watch . Surfers galore. The real gem is at san francisco beach. Quieter and spectacular beach.

343432815.name: Nice Beach
343432815.author: a TripAdvisor user
343432815.reviewBody: There\'s something for everyone here from restaurants, surf lessons, boat day tours, rental chairs to lounge in or just a spot to throw down a towel to sun bathe. The south end of the beach is good for swimming or learning to surf. If your an experienced surfer, there\'s a left hand point break just north of the river in front of the camp ground. Not a secret surf spot by any means. Watch not to step on sea urchins that may have washed up on the beach at high tide.

342968356.name: Great Surfing
342968356.author: a TripAdvisor user
342968356.reviewBody: A very nice beach with lots of restaurants and lounge chairs to rent.  Great for watching the surfers.  Lots of families! Arrive before 11:00 to get a good spot on the beach.

342554114.name: Back again
342554114.author: a TripAdvisor user
342554114.reviewBody: This is my third visit, and I am going to be a regular.  It is a long beach with lots of variety.  Watching baby turtles, surfers, pelicans, paddle boarders, fishermen, sunbathers, or just going for a nice hike are a few of the things you can do.  Just off the beach are horseback rides, or you can terrorize people on an ATV.  Lots of things to do, and families are welcome.

342246872.name: Kinda dirty for my taste
342246872.author: a TripAdvisor user
342246872.reviewBody: We liked it just fine. Quite a bit of trash accumulating. We did a beach clean up on the north side. Water where we went had a bit of a strong undercurrent. Again north. Not my favourite around the bay but love this little surf town

342243269.name: Beautiful little town!!
342243269.author: a TripAdvisor user
342243269.reviewBody: If you are staying anywhere near Sayulita make sure you visit! You won\'t be disappointed.  The vendors on the roads are all very friendly and didn\'t find them very pushy. There are beautiful stray dogs roaming the streets with collars with their names on them. We sat on the beach at one of the restaurants, so relaxing and fun we sat there for 3.5 hours!

342177108.name: Right on the Beach!
342177108.author: a TripAdvisor user
342177108.reviewBody: Stayed at the Casa Blanca which is right on the beach. Nice waves, vendors strolling down the beach and all with a cool breeze. Can walk to the heart of Sayulita along the beach with no problems. There also is a small turtle farm on the beach which releases the turtles at times.

342137797.name: Lovely beach
342137797.author: a TripAdvisor user
342137797.reviewBody: The beach is just lovely but a bit rocky. The surfers are quite entertaining to watch. There are quite a few quaint restaurants in the beach area. There are a lot of street vendors in the area. One of them tried to sell me a bottle of vanilla which appeared to be quite dirty for $35.00.
