We did our shopping in the Plaza area downtown as I did not find the individuals in the beach area to be reputable.

341977036.name: Surf, Sun, and Good Times!
341977036.author: a TripAdvisor user
341977036.reviewBody: We went to Sayulita the 2nd week of January and loved it.  It was our 2nd visit, this time we brought friends.  It is much busier than it was 3 years ago, but maybe it had something to do with the time of year.  What I love about Sayulita is that there are no huge All-Inclusives.  Just a lot of little cute hotels and home/condo rentals.  We learned that you can definitely negotiate on price of a rental.  We had an amazing ocean view/front, (right by the ocean) house.  It was 5 bedrooms on 3 levels, amazing.  When we first contacted they asked $500/night, I said no, they said $400, I said $300, we settled on $330 a night.  Considering we were splitting the cost with another couple I thought that was pretty cheap for what we were getting.  The name of our house was Vista Del Mar.  The rental company we used was Avalos Sayulita Rentals, talk to Tamra, she is awesome!  The first night we went out we visited several restaurants just ordering appies and drinks at every place, it was awesome.  I highly recommend Calypso restaurant, it is on the 2nd level overlooking the town square.  A great breakfast and lunch place is Tierra Viva, ask for Armando, awesome guy!  My wife went to Choco Bananas every morning for her coffee, she said it was amazing and bought some beans to grind at home.  1 of the days we rented a golf cart so we could really see the town.  It was expensive $75 American/24 hours, but let\'s just say we got our moneys worth!  We went places golf carts aren\'t supposed to go, haha!  Funny story, that same day we were off on some trail getting aways out of town, my wife thought we were getting a little too far.  Anyways, we got to an entrance with a gate at a dead end, so to turn around I drove through the gate.  We noticed security cameras everywhere, and then the gate started to close with us in it.  My wife almost peed her pants she was so scared!  She thought we got into the compound of some drug lords, haha.  Actually, I did get a little scared when within seconds a truck starts driving our way.  Turns out we were in some private resort and they just let us out, haha!  Story to tell the grandkids one day!  The only thing I didn\'t like was because we were 4 adults we were offered drugs a lot, just said no gracias, and walked away.\nFor those of you who like to bring Vanilla home, you can find it in the markets for 140 pesos for a 1 litre bottle, the same bottle at the airport duty free is 240 pesos.  Taxi from the airport should be around 600 pesos into Sayulita.  The beach was awesome lots of surfers to watch!\nGo and enjoy!

341657967.name: Beautiful Beach
341657967.author: a TripAdvisor user
341657967.reviewBody: We took a taxi to Sayulita Beach which was very reasonable.  The town is filled with artists, hip stores and a beach that you can only dream about.  We ate breakfast at Villa Amor and it was delicious; We sat outside with a beautiful view of the ocean.  Terrific photo opportunities.  The cobblestone streets, the shop owners and the flavor of the town was so energetic.  The only downfall were the vendors selling their wares on the beach.  We just wanted to have a beer on the beach and they were relentless.  They had a hard time taking no for an answer.  \nNext time I go, I will sit at the bar to enjoy the view and not on the beach where they can find me.\nThis was a most enjoyable day.

341583676.name: Perfect Place
341583676.author: a TripAdvisor user
341583676.reviewBody: Sayulita is a perfect little slice of life, a beach town that has as many locals as tourists, but which nevertheless remains charming and pueblo-like. There is good shopping that is less aggressive than in Puerto Vallarta, some amazing food and margaritas around the scare, and swimming and surf that are very nice! While there I get the sense I never wanted to leave.

341325618.name: Beautiful area with lovely sandy beaches
341325618.author: a TripAdvisor user
341325618.reviewBody: Sayulita is a small town 30 miles north of Puerto Vallarta.  Lovely sandy beaches with good surfing and sun bathing.  The surf gets a bit rough here for any real swimming however.  But just north of the main beach area becomes uncrowded and really lovely and secluded, especially bit off season.  Just lovely.  Enjoy.

340936165.name: A fabulous beach in a wonderful location
340936165.author: a TripAdvisor user
340936165.reviewBody: This was our second week long stay at Sayulita, Mexico in the last 7 years. It is still an amazing beach for surfing, swimming or just walking along the water\'s edge.  There are numerous restaurants in the village and many little shops.  And it is almost as much fun walking around the little neighborhoods as it is being on the beach.

340778108.name: Busy, but beautiful!
340778108.author: a TripAdvisor user
340778108.reviewBody: This beach is absolutely gorgeous! Would be a great place for beginner surfers to learn and catch some small but nice waves. It is very busy, but there is lots to do!

340767835.name: Not What It Used To Be.  Dirty Water.
340767835.author: a TripAdvisor user
340767835.reviewBody: The water is dirty with bacteria.  Although Sayulita has been growing pretty rapidly over the last 6 or 7 years, it was night & day compared to our trip last year.  Sayulita has definitely reached its tipping point. The Town couldn\'t keep up with influx of people. The trash, traffic, noise pollution and the smell of over-flowing septic tanks were shocking. 11 out of our 12 people got sick from swimming at the main beach over the New Years holiday as well as many other people in town due to the massive influx of tourists during that time. The only person that didn\'t get sick didn\'t swim at the main beach. We all ate different food and we don\'t drink. I mention that because I know people will be quick to say it\'s from drinking tequila and too much sun or that is from a virus.  This was definitely a bacteria- it\'s cycle was 24 hours. Viruses last 3 to 4 days. According to local business owners, a consultorio, surfers and surf instructors their sewage treatment plant can\'t handle the the amount of people that visit anymore.  I love Sayulita,, I am not reporting this to speak ill of Sayulita. I have been coming here for the last 11 years. I am only mentioning this so people don\'t get sick in the future. I am hoping that the town can admit there is a problem and fix the sewage/ water treatment plant to accommodate all the new tourists sooner rather than later.

340728039.name: Beautiful view but crowded
340728039.author: a TripAdvisor user
340728039.reviewBody: Sayulita beach is great for people watching and critiquing surfers, but it is very crowded.  There is a regular barrage of strolling souvenir hawkers which can be overwhelming.  Nice \'hippie\' community with interesting and picturesque shopping.

340573735.name: Day trip
340573735.author: a TripAdvisor user
340573735.reviewBody: We went for the pay while we were staying in pv for the week. We walked further up the beach north to get away from the vendors after being asked constantly to buy things. Although they were all very nice and polite. Very beautiful view

340339871.name: Lots of changes
340339871.author: a TripAdvisor user
340339871.reviewBody: We had not been here since about 8 years and we were surprised and somewhat disappointed with the increase in traffic and the number of crowded streets.  Now having traveled extensively in Mexico I feel the town is loosing its old appeal ... For me and mature friends anyway.

340149097.name: Beach itself is underwhelming
340149097.author: a TripAdvisor user
340149097.reviewBody: Don\'t be mistaken, the village of Sayulita is well worth visiting however the beach (at least for the week we were there) is not in the same league as most Australian beaches we are used to. The sand is dark and full of stones but worse for my kids and wife, the waves roll in and close out in one big head high dump on the shore. This makes it only swimmable for the brave or experienced. Also the constant dumping of the waves makes the water near the shore an unappealing brown colour. I was the instigator for this destination due to possibilities for surfing good waves and for that it was OK, but I was outnumbered by family members not prepared to even take on the local waters for a dip. So probably a poorly researched choice on my part. The saviour might be.... a half an hour trip to Punta Da Mita and the waters was blue, the sand was white and fine under foot and the waves rolled in more friendly manner. (Surf for board riding was better also). So maybe that is a better option. Possibly it could be season dependent, we were there in January.

340110849.name: beautiful and beware
340110849.author: a TripAdvisor user
340110849.reviewBody: We were here in January. It was quite  crowded but we were still able to find a nice spot. We were approached constantly by vendors, but they were all charming and polite. We were prepared to go in the water until 3 people came outwit jelly fish stings. later the beach was littered with jelly fish and a small child was bitten. No life guards or warnings.

340099318.name: Magical, Beautiful, Loud and Busy Pueblo Magico
340099318.author: a TripAdvisor user
340099318.reviewBody:
Sayulita is beyond colorful, stunningly beautiful, full of music and energy and lots of turistas from all over but mainly Mexico and the U.S.  Not a place to go study Spanish since just about everyone you'll interact with in the shops and restaurants all are completely fluent in English.  Also not a place to go for peace and quiet unless you're staying well out of town, but the energy of the town is something to behold.  The beach is filled with vendors but they're really polite (will return a smile, even with a "no, gracias") and not pushy.  

Tips:  If you want to get away from the crowded beach scene, walk north.  The further up you go, the quieter and less populated the beach becomes.  If you're ambitious, you can walk all the way to San Pancho, the next town north, but you have to trespass for about 100 yards to get from Playa Malpasos to the southern end of the beach of San Pancho.

You can walk via dirt road to Playa Los Muertos which is a very beautiful and less populated beach with an interesting walk through the cemetery.  That sounds creepy and morbid but it really isn't;  it's touching to see all the flowers and candles left for loved ones who've passed.

Go for the long walk to Playa Carricitos which is the most beautiful beach I personally have ever seen, including a load of beaches on all of the Hawaiian islands.  There are cool rock formations to scramble around on, on both ends of the beach.  Looking south you can see all the way to Punta de Mita.  Breath-taking.

339512813.name: Day trip to Sayulita from PV
339512813.author: a TripAdvisor user
339512813.reviewBody: We stayed in Puerto Vallarta for a week and wanted to visit Sayulita for a day. There are public buses that leave from Walmart to Sayulita every half hour and it costs close to nothing. The ride is about one hr long and it was a great cultural experience for our kids. As the bus kept making stops it got really crowded. There were at least ten people riding standing up in the aisle. The ride was bumpy, the bus was crowded but it felt very safe. For our kids it was a new experience to see street vendors come in the bus to sell water, snacks and soda, and in one stop we even got to pick up a guitar player who serenaded us for part of the trip! We arrived to Sayulita and were within walking distance of everything. The town is charming and colorful, and the beach was great to try surfing. We took a public bus on the way back to Puerto Vallarta. They keep running back and forth until 10pm and we heard the last ones get pretty full. We would definitely visit Sayulita  by bus again.

339280715.name: Picturesque but not clean
339280715.author: a TripAdvisor user
339280715.reviewBody: The views of this pretty beach through the Mexican cobble stone streets is beautiful but walk onto the beach & it\'s a different story. The sand is not a clean colour & there is people\'s rubbish scattered along the popular areas & many fishing boats down the south end with rubbish around them. We had read many a story about tourist getting stomach bugs from the sewer run off so decided not to swim there. We walked around to Playa Los Muertos instead.\n\nSuch a pity more isn\'t done to improve the water quality as this is a stunning looking beach right in the heart of town. A visit to the local bars/restaurants along the beach will give you the great views without going swimming.

339235423.name: Highlight of our trip!
339235423.author: a TripAdvisor user
339235423.reviewBody: Sayulita was by far the highlight of this trip for us. The village is a combination of fun and funky. The beach was well kept and we were able to easily rent an umbrella, mat and boogie boards. The waves were ridiculous! Would be a fantastic place to surf!

339192623.name: Cool beach
339192623.author: a TripAdvisor user
339192623.reviewBody: Very cool vibe here! All ages. Lots of surfing to watch or try. Very casual place. Tons of open air restaurants to eat at or bring food down to beach. We came here from the Iberostar hotel and wished we would have spent more time here. Prices of shopping, restaurants and lodging all very good in this area.

339013406.name: Yes, you CAN still get sick as of January 2016!!
339013406.author: a TripAdvisor user
339013406.reviewBody:
Just returned from a week long trip in Sayulita (the rating above is based only on water pollution, the town itself is great). Unfortunately all 6 of us ended up with projectile vomit, the runs and really bad stomach cramps throughout our trip. I chatted with a few of the locals (we didn't believe it was a flu or food poisoning) and many told us that unfortunately the main beach is incredibly polluted. As Sayulita doesn't have very good system, sewage is ending up in the ocean on the main beach. Many locals avoid swimming this beach.

Our initial symptom was feeling very full and not able to digest food....that's when things turned badly quite quickly. 

If you are looking for swimming beaches their are many around to the North and South but if you're looking for a surf vacation you may want to reconsider.

339011803.name: Best of both worlds
339011803.author: a TripAdvisor user
339011803.reviewBody: Enjoyed Sayulita, the town, and the beach.  The traffic and chaotic street scene the weekend after Thanksgiving was crazy hectic at it\'s busiest.  However, once I got situated in my accommodations, all was well.  Early morning I was able to enjoy the north end of the beach without many vacationers in attendance.  However, the guidebooks warn of a strong undertow so not many people ventured into the water there.  The dogs, vendors, boats, surfers, and campers give Sayulita a magical vibe.  If you want pristine, I would suggest you might select another spot for your vacation.

338670947.name: Better in summer
338670947.author: a TripAdvisor user
338670947.reviewBody: It\'s a very beautiful beach, more attractive maybe to the surfer travelers, and a little bit more expensive that another mexican beaches.

338569575.name: The beach is dirty
338569575.author: a TripAdvisor user
338569575.reviewBody: It\'s sad to see how dirty the beach is and I don\'t think it\'s a proper beach to take the kid,s lots of people are smoking joints in the afternoon . It\'s not comfortable this with the kids.

337642840.name: Busy beach!
337642840.author: a TripAdvisor user
337642840.reviewBody: Spent some time here post-Christmas in 2015, it\'s a busy beach over the holidays, but great & super close to town. Was fabulous to go sit at the beach at night to relax and hang out.

337615317.name: Easy Beach
337615317.author: a TripAdvisor user
337615317.reviewBody: Sayulita is about the beach and this beach is one of my favorites . It has food , drinks , vendors and beach chairs for that afternoon Margarita and snack . Sit back and watch the surfers or walk the beach .

337509177.name: Christmas holidays is too crazy
337509177.author: a TripAdvisor user
337509177.reviewBody: The beach is an extremely popular place for surfers and stand up paddlers. There are many places to rent from and take lessons right on the beach. I have been here before in late February and it is so much better than December/ New Years. It\'s a very small beach, so in the high season it\'s literally crammed shoulder to shoulder both on the sand and in the water, while swimmers compete for space while trying not to get hit by flying boards! You can rent sets of 2 beach chairs with a table and umbrella for 300 pesos and most of the beachfront restaurants offer beach service. Of course, there\'s also the multitudes of vendors offering their souvenirs, massages, tattoos, snacks etc. Don\'t even think about driving here or trying to find parking. There are buses which stop just at the entrance to town then you have a 5 minute walk through town to the main beach. The beach closest to the bus stop, known as the North beach is much, much quieter. Compared to Bucerias, Sayulita is considerably smaller but the waves are better for surfing by far. Bucerias waves are called "shore break", as they crest and break very quickly right at the shoreline. The beach in Bucerias is way bigger and longer though to space everyone out - plenty of room there.

337414590.name: Ideal beach for surfers
337414590.author: a TripAdvisor user
337414590.reviewBody: Sayulita is considered as a "Pueblo M\u00e1gico". It\u00b4s a nice place, the center is cute with some little restaurants and some streets have typical handcrafters with huichol influence. Also, you can find some galleries that have colorful paintings.\nAbout the beach, I think is ideal for surfers, because the waves have the necessary characteristics. I tried to swim, but I couldn\'t, I prefer a quiet beach.\nFinally, if you want to sleep or stay in a quiet place, I recommend to walk to the other side of the beach that does not have restaurants, there noone interrupt you.

337406635.name: Best beach for families
337406635.author: a TripAdvisor user
337406635.reviewBody: Great gently waves but still fun for adults! Not terribly busy, safe, soft sand, great views both directions of bluffs! Better than most beaches we have been to in Mexico! Can\'t wait to come back!

337044568.name: Little SMA by the ocean
337044568.author: a TripAdvisor user
337044568.reviewBody: Visited December 14th. Pretty picturesque little town, filled with artsy shops and cute B&Bs run mostly by expats.   Wasn\'t too crowded on the day we visited.   Nice coffee shops and art galleries.   Reminded me of San Miguel d\'Allende...   Too bad no hotels with the ocean view.    Beach  mostly for surfing.   If you want to swim  go to the North...

336738661.name: Very beautiful!
336738661.author: a TripAdvisor user
336738661.reviewBody: We stayed in Sayulita for 6 days and it is great beach for surfing! My husband is a surfer and I\'m not but we always found the place to stay in Sayulita! It is very beautiful village, not far from Puerto Vallarta.

336529612.name: Visit NOT during main season
336529612.author: a TripAdvisor user
336529612.reviewBody: Was here for 4 weeks during Christmas/New Year. The first week, pre-Christmas, was wonderful, as was the last week, post-New Year. But the two weeks inbetween were crazy, mad, full of both US and Mexican tourists. Hardly any space on the beach right in front of the town. Best to go to the beach to the north inbetween Sayulita and San Pancho.

336108492.name: Not worth the trip
336108492.author: a TripAdvisor user
336108492.reviewBody: We were disappointed by our experience in Sayulita. Let me just start by telling you it took us 30 minutes to find a parking spot. That\'s not how you imagine your arrival at some idyllic beach! In the end we still ended up parked in a "yellow" zone and were vulnerable to get our license plate confiscated by local police. We went straight to the beach and rented SUP boards, with visions of SUP Surfing dancing in our heads. Much to our disappointment, the waves were PACKED. You have no hope of catching a wave without taking out like ten small children in the meantime. We ended up desperately paddling to avoid hitting tourists, and didn\'t catch a single wave. I really liked the idea of thsi place, but the reality is over crowded and dirty. The beach at your resort is nicer.

335809727.name: Too crowded, too many vendors
335809727.author: a TripAdvisor user
335809727.reviewBody: Sadly, I remember when there was nothing on this beach, just ten years ago.  Now its a hustle of commerce.  A lot like Puerto Vallarta was ten years ago.  Now Vallarta is quieter than Sayulita.

335766678.name: Crowded
335766678.author: a TripAdvisor user
335766678.reviewBody:
Sayulita is an idilic Mexican town but very busy. The majority are American tourists and the beach is super crowded. 

I took the bus there from Bucerias which was easy - simply walk up to the highway, wait at a bus stop until a bus comes by marked "Sayulita" and flag it down. I didn't pay attention to the exact cost, but it was no more than $15 pesos each way. The trip takes around 30 minutes. 

I found the shops in Sayulita super expensive and the people not very friendly. I was shocked to find that I wasn't even greeted at a majority of the shops I stopped in at. This is very uncharacteristic for Mexico so I'm not sure what the deal is here. 

It was worth going for the day but I don't think I'd want to stay any longer than that.

335754889.name: Fabulous beach for beginner surfers, but beware of CROWDS Dec.15 onwards
335754889.author: a TripAdvisor user
335754889.reviewBody:
Fabulous beginner surfing beach right in town at the foot of Marlin Street with ample places on the beach to rent boards and hire an instructor.   No sharks, no jelly fish, just relentless beach vendors.  It's an ultra fun and safe place for boogey boarding or just playing in the waves on non-windy days.
HOWEVER starting Dec.15, teeming masses arrive each day by bus and car, and you can't find three feet of space for surfing/boogey boarding that isn't busy with other boarders, or that doesn't have a family with small children jumping in the waves right in your path should you succeed in riding a wave.  
Surfers in the know and that have cars no doubt have less crowded surfing beaches they go to. 
There is a lot of fun restaurants and good food in this bohemian town, but during the course of our 2 week stay, 3 of 4 of our group got travellers diarrhea with some vomiting.

335565825.name: Fun beach trip at Sayulita!
335565825.author: a TripAdvisor user
335565825.reviewBody: If at all possible try to book a beach front hotel or vacation house in Sayulita.  We enjoyed endless hours on the beach and also people watching from our balcony at a new boutique hotel, La Esquina. Definitely recommend this hotel for the modern large room, great view of beach, infinity pool and only 4 short blocks to the main plaza!  Perfect vacation!!!

335547572.name: Crowded beach
335547572.author: a TripAdvisor user
335547572.reviewBody: We travel to Mexico often and were surprised by how crowded this beach is. A little like Waikiki in Mexico. Although we went to surf it looked too chaotic with all the people learning to surf and boards everywhere in the water. It is nice that it is so close to the center of town, however. In the night it isn\'t a family-oriented scene.

335422417.name: Sayulita surfing.
335422417.author: a TripAdvisor user
335422417.reviewBody: Beautiful little beach to visit just 30 minutes away from Nuevo Vallarta. We are a family of 4 so we just took a cab. Not expensive at all for a trip this length. Beach is beautiful and town is funky. Great place to go if you want to learn how to surf. Lunch at Don Pedro\'s was excellent.

335135898.name: Christmas in Sayulita
335135898.author: a TripAdvisor user
335135898.reviewBody:
The perfect place for a sunny family holiday. We have just completed a wonderful week in Sayulita...we traveled for Christmas with our adult children, their spouses and our two toddler grandchildren. Sayulita was the perfect choice. It's easy to get there after a flight into Puerto Vallarta. We had arranged a VRBO in Los Delfines complex in the north part of this sweet little town, right on the beach. We arranged transport from the airport ahead of time as a car is really unnecessary. We rented golf carts to get around which were the perfect form of transportation and great entertainment for the toddlers. 

Our transport stopped at MEGA the superstore just north of the airport so we could stock up for the week...it's a great place to get everything and anything.  While you can buy anything you need in Sayulita getting diapers, beverages, and enough food for the first few days worked out well. 

Sayulita is a very family friendly place so eating out with the kids was a breeze and very inexpensive. Kid's menus everywhere always included a yummy fruit smoothie along with the main dish (quesadilla w beans and rice, chicken pieces with papas fritas, bean and cheese burrito). And then there were the tacos...tacos...and more amazing tacos. Eat at the local carts..they are cheap, clean and incredible. We did taco take out on more than one occasion.  

The beach near town gets pretty crowded. We loved put beach at the north end...quiet, fewer waves and a short walk to get paddle boards or a massage. If surfing is your things, you'll need to walk down to the beach closer to town where the waves are best. 

Christmas week was great. Perfect weather, a hint here and there of the holiday, warm water and the wonderful easy going people of Sayulita wh were so welcoming to all those of us who has flocked south to avoid the snow. Be aware that many of the restaurants are close don Christmas Eve evening and Christmas Day. There are still plenty of choices but the beach bars are almost all closed Christmas Day. Stock up and enjoy the day on the beach. Don't worry...oxxo market ( think seven eleven) is still open as are th fish and vegetable market ( get there before noon) if you don't plan ahead. Also, all the ATMs in town were out of cash by noon Christmas Eve. Stock up the day before or really stock up on pesos at one of the banks connected to MEGA before you get to Sayulita. Everyone takes dollars but the exchange rate isn't great. While most bogged restaurants take credit cards the beach bars, carts ( really don't miss these) and smaller restaurants and shops do not. 

Most of all....enjoy!!  You will come away loving this still quaint Mexican beach town that's has every modern convenience.  
 FelizNavidad.

334782919.name: Beautiful beach!
334782919.author: a TripAdvisor user
334782919.reviewBody: The sand is cool, the water is warm!  Lovely place that is not too crowded. We enjoyed a day there on boogie boards and body surfing.  We are headed off today to see the turtle release at sunset and surfing.  Food, beverages, shops, cabanas.

334683637.name: Colorful Mexico beach town
334683637.author: a TripAdvisor user
334683637.reviewBody: Great place for surfing and shopping, nice food all around town.\nSafe place for family fun and relaxing

334630287.name: amazing hidden treasures
334630287.author: a TripAdvisor user
334630287.reviewBody: If you head north along the beach you get to a rocky area... from there you can head into the bush a little ways along a trail and then keep heading north and at one point when you see a trail heading back towards the beach... you get to a super neat rock formation that lends itself to some great exploring!!! off the beaten path and exciting. There were some beach campers. Made me think of doing that next time!

334525601.name: you must experience Sayulita!
334525601.author: a TripAdvisor user
334525601.reviewBody: Every year we visit Sayulita and every year it changes!  It is a busy quaint town that appeals to surfers and tourists.  The bay is small and the sand is almost black with gold flecks.  My boys love it hear for the surfing experience.

334316253.name: Vendor nightmare
334316253.author: a TripAdvisor user
334316253.reviewBody:
I've traveled to over 30 countries, this is by far the worst beach I've ever been to.
It is in transition, from a quiet wonderful small surf town into a up and coming tourist trap.
Due to boat traffic, river run off, and rocks there is only a small area of beach to enjoy.  At this area, you are bothered by vendors of all kinds at least once every two minutes. Sometimes 2-3 times a minute at the busy times of the day. They sell everything from donuts, candy, cotton candy, jewelry, ect.  Relentless.  We went to Puerto Vallarta to escape the vendors it was THAT bad.
My gf and I gave up $300 on a room because we were so annoyed by the place.  At night we had to wear ear plugs from the roosters waking us up at 5 a.m. and unable to take day naps to catch up on sleep because they made so much noise throughout the day.  Additionally, you can't sleep on the beach due to vendors.

We felt trapped.  Puerto Vallarta is very "touristy"  but significantly more laid back and relaxing than Sayulita.  I wouldn't recommend the place to even an enemy.

334313158.name: A little busy
334313158.author: a TripAdvisor user
334313158.reviewBody: A nice beach, walk a little way north for less crowding, or head over the hill through the cemetery to the south to Playa Los Muertos for some seclusion.

334266928.name: Surf haven, youth haunt
334266928.author: a TripAdvisor user
334266928.reviewBody: If you\'re looking for a hip scene, young vibe, great bodies scantily clad, loud music, cool shops -- all on a pretty cove, this could be your paradise.  Prices keep rising, crowds keep growing.  If you prefer a more tranquil scene, head for San Pancho or Lo de Marcos, up the coast a few miles.

334059857.name: Pretty place
334059857.author: a TripAdvisor user
334059857.reviewBody: Waves are gorgeous, overcrowded beach. Nicer town to shop and walk then Punta de Mita. Plenty of vendors and you can get a message on the beach. I am not a surfer but enjoyed watch others surf.

333940744.name: A beautiful beach for surfing and beach-bumming
333940744.author: a TripAdvisor user
333940744.reviewBody: I use the term beach-bumming as one to describe the act of sitting your butt on the beach and enjoying the sun! The beach is absolutely beautiful, amazing sun and great waves. The main attraction is surfing but there is also paddle-boarding, and boogie boarding. You can swim here safely most days unless there is a big swell in, you can ask any local if it is safe to swim and they will let you know but you will usually see lots and lots of people swimming and splashing. Sayulita is a very happy vibe town. Whether you\'re walking around exploring or relaxing on the beautiul sand beach, you will have a great time!

333508168.name: Surfers beach but others can also enjoy
333508168.author: a TripAdvisor user
333508168.reviewBody: This beach is a surfers paradise.  The water is rougher than most beaches but swimmers can also enjoy, especially if you enjoy waves

333412010.name: Absolutely love this town!
333412010.author: a TripAdvisor user
333412010.reviewBody: I love hanging out in Sayulita.  The restaurants are excellent, the entertainment very nice and the view is fantastic.  Great views while you\'re drinking and eating

333183909.name: Disappointing beach
333183909.author: a TripAdvisor user
333183909.reviewBody: Sayulita Beach is actually a pretty dirty beach compared to the beaches of Bandaleras Bay around Old Town Puerto Vallarta and compared to those north of Sayulita in Nayarit. There is a lot of trash that washes on shore (including several pieces of broken glad from bottles that I collected) and there appears to be no local effort to clean the beach. With such a large expat community, I\'m really shocked that no such effort exists (or if it does, that it is so ineffective.) \n\nAlso, during the high tides of Dec 13 and 14, 2015 (near a new moon), the water can\'t ask the way to the businesses; there was no dry sand. Not sure if there was recent south erosion, but the beach would clearly benefit from some kind of erosion control program to restore the volume of sand.

333133809.name: Fun in sun
333133809.author: a TripAdvisor user
333133809.reviewBody: Nice high, heavy surf last few days after some nice cooling rains.  Main beach in town a little crowed for me.

332732904.name: Extremely beautiful beach!
332732904.author: a TripAdvisor user
332732904.reviewBody: Sayulita is truly a paradise. We visited for the first \ntime 20 years ago. We wish we had stayed. Many \ngood changes for the city. So, so many things to do here.

332544877.name: Fabulous view at sunset
332544877.author: a TripAdvisor user
332544877.reviewBody: We walk the fabulous my stretch of beach at least twice a day.  It keeps us coming back year after year.

332344322.name: Wonderful beach, steady surf, great services.
332344322.author: a TripAdvisor user
332344322.reviewBody: Rent a chair or lie on the shade on the beach, surf as little or as much as you want, spend the day. I really enjoyed this beach. the vendors take your first no for an answer,  and are friendly in general. Public bathrooms and running water if you want to rinse off. Thanks Sayulita!

332162542.name: Beautiful Bohemian Chic town. Great for watching the surf
332162542.author: a TripAdvisor user
332162542.reviewBody: We love the vibe of this town and every time we are in the area we are sure to hit up a few hours watching the surf, shopping the eclectic shops and enjoying a nice margarita and fish tacos at one of the local seaside restaurants. Must go if within driving distance of Puerto Vallarta.

332157506.name: Wow! Great beach with lots of activity
332157506.author: a TripAdvisor user
332157506.reviewBody: We arrived by boat and took another boat to shore. Not for the faint of heart; we rode a wave and the boat beached us on the sand. From there, we walked around, had a bite to eat and spent a few hours watching surfers and paddle boarders. Very interesting. There are a lot of vendors but they aren\'t aggressive. There is a kind of hippy style, laid back atmosphere at this beach. Wish I had more than 4 hours to spend there!

331711265.name: Surf spot
331711265.author: a TripAdvisor user
331711265.reviewBody:
The beach is really nice. Lots of vendors selling stuff, they are pretty relentless but not to much of a hassle is you say no. 

Plenty of surf shops, if your a beginner anyone of them will get you standing on a wave. If you have surfed a few times but not a lot pick your shop based on your needs and inspect your board to make sure it's enact and has adequate wax. 

Massages are $25 usd and decent for a beach massage.

331402275.name: Great beach but can be a little wavy for little kids
331402275.author: a TripAdvisor user
331402275.reviewBody: We love the town and the beach. But, it is a bit wavy for little kids (great for surfing) and there are some spots that have some pretty dangerous rocks.

331327075.name: Beautiful beach town
331327075.author: a TripAdvisor user
331327075.reviewBody: This town is a beautiful laid back town that has everything you need in a peaceful beach area. Stores restaurants and activities to keep you busy if you want .Surfing lessons or just watching others ride the waves.

331130898.name: Beautiful Beach
331130898.author: a TripAdvisor user
331130898.reviewBody: Beautiful beach with great climate year-round. Waves are perfect, and water is hot. Surfing lessons are available, and there are spas on the beach. Be weary of those trying to rip off tourists (I.e., expensive jewelry that shouldn\'t be). Also be weary of the ATMs- that have high fees and may have been tampered with. Perfect place to relax. Most everyone can speak english, and it has a Mexican village feel. Enjoy your time here!

330924531.name: Beautiful Beach
330924531.author: a TripAdvisor user
330924531.reviewBody: This beach is good for surfing, boogy boarding, paddling. Swimming is fine if the surf is on the calm side.  There are beach chairs for rent. Lots of restaurants have tables on the beach. You can have a massage as well. This you might need after getting thrown around in the waves!  The vibe is low key. Great for walking or people watching.

330915065.name: Nice excursion from Punta Mita for a taste of local life
330915065.author: a TripAdvisor user
330915065.reviewBody:
We stayed at the St. Regis and while it was oh so lovely, I really felt the need to explore the local area.  Our butler suggested we go to dinner at Don Pedro's in Sayulita and arrive an hour or so before dinner to explore the town.  

Sayulita is a cross between a local beach town and a haven for surfers/hippies.  It reminded me a little of Tamarindo Beach in Costa Rica in that regard.  The town consists of 4-5 streets lined with small shops, art galleries, street vendors, small inns and restaurants.  We spent $50 each way for a taxi (from the St. Regis) and probably spent 3 hours total here.  

If you are staying at a hotel in Punta Mita, I wouldn't imagine you would want to spend a "day" at the beach here.

330860922.name: Love the beach
330860922.author: a TripAdvisor user
330860922.reviewBody: This beach is really nice. The surf is often too rough for swimming but people watching, watching the surfers and walking are all worth it. Don\'t miss the sea turtle release down the beach at sunset. Lots of local wares, food and beer all along the beach. More crowded than in past years but not too crowded. Real Mexico flavor.

330611342.name: Beach review
330611342.author: a TripAdvisor user
330611342.reviewBody: We enjoyed our vacation and found the beach at Sayulita very nice. The beaches where cleaned and raked every night and the beach chairs/loungers comfortable. The beach restaurants and servers (Louis and Charley) were also great.

330595708.name: Lazy days in Summer Sun and Water
330595708.author: a TripAdvisor user
330595708.reviewBody: We loved Sayulita. The Beach, the quant little town, the Friendly Locals ! Yes. The beach gets crowded and busy, on weekends especially, and very busy when it was the National Stand-up PaddleBoarding Competition . . but it was all good as well. The Vibe was so lovely. Sayulita definitely comes alive at night as well. You can hear the music in the bars and restaurants to very late at night. This is more a Town for young people. The Best Place for Stand-up paddle Boarding I\'ve ever been to. We saw Whales jumping twice, dolphins, and sitting in the beach, or at one of the Beach Restaurants watching the Sun Set is Stunning. Bring Your Own Beach Umbrella along . . Get to Know the Locals ! We loved it !

330245562.name: Busy surf beach
330245562.author: a TripAdvisor user
330245562.reviewBody: Nice beach with big waves. Fairly busy place, not so much in the water which is mostly used by surfer. Many chairs along the beach. Nice place to hang out. Many restaurants within walking distance. Great visit when the weather is good. Generally a young crowd.

330240757.name: Wonderful beach
330240757.author: a TripAdvisor user
330240757.reviewBody: We were at the north end and put our chairs under a tree and we\'re able to enjoy time on the ocean  and reading for 5 dsys.  Magnificent beach time.

330226540.name: busy but beautiful!
330226540.author: a TripAdvisor user
330226540.reviewBody: Busy with lots of people, but beautiful spot. The beach is huge, and great for laying out, walking and swimming -- not too wavy either. Lovely location. Lots of surfers!

330043645.name: Touristy, good for novice surfers.
330043645.author: a TripAdvisor user
330043645.reviewBody: Sayulita has become one of those ideal Mexican beach towns that has been discovered by everyone. The beach was crowded, the surf was flat, and the food was expensive.we spent more time by the pool than by the Pacific.

329831488.name: Beautiful Beach town
329831488.author: a TripAdvisor user
329831488.reviewBody: The day I visited it was rainy, but it didn\'t dampen the spirits of the town. Everyone was around, shopping, eating, working, and talking. The town is colorful, artistic, quaint and better suited to walking or as is typical, driving a golf cart or scooter. Lots of surf schools around.

329763014.name: Crowds and vendors
329763014.author: a TripAdvisor user
329763014.reviewBody: We hiked to Sayulita beach from Playa Escondido ( about 45 minutes).  The beach is crowded and chairs umbrellas must be reserved and go several rows back.  The people hawking jewelry, toys, blankets, hats, food, are relentless.  Pretty enough but not relaxing.

329569700.name: Fun
329569700.author: a TripAdvisor user
329569700.reviewBody: This is a fun beach to hang out and people watch. Surfers, paddle boarders, and fun restaurants and bars. Good way to spend an afternoon.

329438054.name: Beautiful and laid back
329438054.author: a TripAdvisor user
329438054.reviewBody: Away from mass tourism, friendly, beautiful beach, simple and cheap accommodation. We stayed with our tent on the beach in a kind of camping that also has bungalows.

329210942.name: Top 3 on our list
329210942.author: a TripAdvisor user
329210942.reviewBody:
Sayulita is a beauty!!! Absolutely adore this quaint town... It had a European feel in the streets, with cobblestones and tiny eateries popped everywhere.. Little hidden gems are always a gorgeous find.. 
The shopping was my heaven!! Colors and tapestries.. The acclaimed surf beach is perfect for children and fun surfing, laying back drinking coronas and Pacifica while watching sunset surfers was paradise!! 
I can't get enough of the service and people, it is excellent! 

Don't pass up Gusto's Italian after many days of tacos... Incredible lasagne and pizza! No to mention stunning staff! 
 
Don't bother coming to this side of Mexico if you aren't coming here!!  Amazing!!

329039843.name: Great water and decent surf break...
329039843.author: a TripAdvisor user
329039843.reviewBody: Sand is nice and the water as well. Lots of surf and paddle boarding. Great spot for beginners and great people watching. Fun younger crowd with plenty of food and drinks nearby.

328633743.name: For surfing or other activities
328633743.author: a TripAdvisor user
328633743.reviewBody: Great place even with kids. You can have a drink when your kids are in the water .easy to access recommend it\ud83d\ude00

328403509.name: I\'m trying to keep this one a secret.
328403509.author: a TripAdvisor user
328403509.reviewBody: Golf carts cobble stone roads, This is isla mujeres and Playa del carmen twenty years ago. Great restaurants real fun people great surfing. This is laid back and fun. get to know a lot of people real quick if your out and about.

328235384.name: Third Visit
328235384.author: a TripAdvisor user
328235384.reviewBody: Such a nice beach with wonderful people.  There are great vendors on the beach, food, drinks and activities.  I\'ve visited 3 times already and still haven\'t seen or done everything I want to yet.

328219913.name: best surfers show ever
328219913.author: a TripAdvisor user
328219913.reviewBody: you can just sit back and enjoy seeing the surfers along the see... it has nice places to eat or have a drink

328021564.name: Busy tourist town with nice beaches
328021564.author: a TripAdvisor user
328021564.reviewBody:
Took two buses from the palladium to visit one morning.
Really nice town lots of restaurants and shopping.
Beach looked great for surfers.
Other smaller beaches you can walk to as well .

327259430.name: Beautiful, Clean and Intense
327259430.author: a TripAdvisor user
327259430.reviewBody: The beach is beautiful and relaxing. The ocean has some serious power behind it and changes as you go up the beach. There a spots for learning surfers and spots for advanced surfers.

327191372.name: A traditional Mexican Village located on one of the most scenic beaches anywhere
327191372.author: a TripAdvisor user
327191372.reviewBody: My wife and I were staying in Punta De Mita area at Royal Suites Palladium\n Lovely spot....all inclusive.  We wanted to explore an outer village so we thought let\'s go to Salulita. ...it was near where Bachelor in Paradise was filmed this year. What a great place to visit. Traditional Mexican streets shops and plaza right out of the movies with all the lights and banners strung across the streets. Cute cute cute. We soon found the beach which was filled with surfing activities and of course the typical vendors one expects in this region. However.... we found all these massage vendors set up with open tents and palapas offering good value massages. If you want to go down to the birthday suit ....here you need to be pretty open minded as privacy is not an option in the tents we found. Level of dress is up to the customer as these talented Mexican ladies didn\'t mind either way. We negotiated for 1.5 hour deep tissue massages. Both our ladies had strong hands and very talented technique. I had a fabulous massage. I have a back problem due to a car accident this year and my massage lady found all my problem spots almost instantly. For a third the price of a resort treatment. Worth the price of our taxi just to get these massages. I will definately return to Salulita and spend far more time here. Fabulous low profile place. We both loved it.

326756922.name: Waves
326756922.author: a TripAdvisor user
326756922.reviewBody: Great beach. The lifeguards are all over the safety of their visitors. There is a varying strength of waves as far as surfing goes ...at times perfect for the beginner and as the day goes on for the advanced.

326722641.name: Relaxing time
326722641.author: a TripAdvisor user
326722641.reviewBody: Very nice place to relax, swim and have good moments with friends. Hihghly recommended If you visit nerby.

326403417.name: Not as wonderful as it used to be
326403417.author: a TripAdvisor user
326403417.reviewBody: I\'ve been going to Sayulita Beach since the early 1990s. It was so wonderful in those days, and still retains a lot of the charm. But now that everyone else has discovered it the prices have gone way up and the crowds are thicker.

325973374.name: Paradise
325973374.author: a TripAdvisor user
325973374.reviewBody: Beautiful beach, If you are not a party person, research ahead. The North end is quiet and secluded, town is loaded with things to do.

323894344.name: Great surfers village
323894344.author: a TripAdvisor user
323894344.reviewBody: A short taxi ride from Iberostar Punta Mita and definitely worth a visit. A sleepy feel during the day with lt\'s of fresh fish restaurants and plenty of local shops.\n \nTry the beer battered shrimp at Pedro\'s right on the beach.

323657251.name: Good for Beginners
323657251.author: a TripAdvisor user
323657251.reviewBody: This is a great place for beginners to learn how to surf. Waves aren\'t too big (at least when I was there in October) and it\'s a fun hang out. Gorgeous beach too!

323252743.name: Day Trip
323252743.author: a TripAdvisor user
323252743.reviewBody: Absolutely love this place, the beach, the surf, the food - Captain Cook\'s on the beach has THE best ceviche!! Will be back for a longer stay...

322792977.name: Get good at saying "No, gracias"
322792977.author: a TripAdvisor user
322792977.reviewBody: So. Many. Vendors.  People walking by on the beach, trying to sell you stuff is incessant.  Sarongs, carvings, ponchos, hats, jewelry - you name it, you can probably buy it from the comfort of your beach chair in Sayulita.   It\'s irritating, but you just get good at saying "no, gracias." And if you want one of the items, don\'t be afraid to barter.  Other than that, there are beach chairs and umbrellas available for hire for a nominal fee, Don Pedro\'s will serve restaurant-quality food at your beach chair, and there are plenty of booths where you can spend money on surf lessons and rental equipment.

322776010.name: Fun beach
322776010.author: a TripAdvisor user
322776010.reviewBody: The main beach at Sayulita was an enjoyable experience...  We rented a surfboard from a shop in town, only about $15 USD for the day, and rented chairs with an umbrella for same price for the day.  The chairs were right next to the beach so we were able to leave valuables there while we played in the water and didn\'t have to worry about any theft.  The waves were nice and chill, was able to teach my GF how to surf, but also had a blast on the larger waves where the locals caught breaks.  As it goes almost anywhere, stay out of the locals path and there\'s plenty of waves to catch.  There are town\'s people up and down the beach selling trinkets, cigars, and blankets, but they leave you be if you\'re polite.  You can find some really great deals on some quality silver jewelry, but beware some sellers directly on the beach.  There\'s also some great taco stands near the beach and stores to buy beer if you like.  Overall we felt everyone was very friendly a d had a great day at the beach.

322658843.name: Beautiful beach at any time of the day!
322658843.author: a TripAdvisor user
322658843.reviewBody: I cannot say enough about this beautiful beach! We must have walked and played in it 100 times! It is very large so it makes for a great walk with someone(s) special to you. Closest to Villa Amor there are a ton of fishing boats that are fun to walk by and see how they operate. There are plenty of vendors, restaurants, bars to stop in and grab a bite to eat or drink in. Along this beach there is also a turtle sanctuary where you can watch and help release baby sea turtles nightly. Its a must see and a great cause!

321958578.name: RELAXATION
321958578.author: a TripAdvisor user
321958578.reviewBody: Great place to enjoy a authentic feel of Mexico! Walk to any activity  like surfing, beach, delicious food and meeting wonderful people!

320992791.name: Art and Sun
320992791.author: a TripAdvisor user
320992791.reviewBody: Coming from Guayabitos another small beach town setting, nice shops and small restaurant\'s to eat.  A lot of nice art vendors small sweet and fun.

320669380.name: Not much open in off season
320669380.author: a TripAdvisor user
320669380.reviewBody:
Nice beach but not as nice as Bandaras Bay near the Iberostar Playa Mita. It will cost you 6o.oo US round trip by taxi from the Iberostar. Do not even entertain taking the bus as you have to go all the way to Bucerias and backtrack to Sayulita for a lovely 3 hour ride each way in oppressive heat. 

High season is November 1st. We were there a week earlier and none of the shops or markets were open yet as they all close for their summer season. That said, there was nothing but pharmacies and endless restaurants open. Restaurants on the beach are super expensive for food and drink. There are a lot of little food vendors but I would be wary of eating from there. In high season it is a busy hippie/surfer town. Everything over priced as you are a captive audience - no competition as is very remote.

I would definitely visit there in high season and on a Sunday when they have really neat markets. Again, don't expect ant price deals.

320649312.name: Great shopping and people watching
320649312.author: a TripAdvisor user
320649312.reviewBody: We popped in for a quick michelada and a little shopping. It\'s a beautiful little town with a very authentic feel. Loved walking the cobblestone streets.

320588160.name: Quite nice golden sand
320588160.author: a TripAdvisor user
320588160.reviewBody: Sayulita beach is quite interesting beach in the coast of Nayarit, Mexico. The sand is pretty dark, with golden reflections, very soft, almost like dust. It gets stick to your body for days. Sayulita is also a popular place for surfing and a good place for relaxation.

318948202.name: Great beach and culture
318948202.author: a TripAdvisor user
318948202.reviewBody: The beach was great!  You can sit under the umbrellas for a small cost (100-150 pesos) and watch the surfers.  They have good food and great drinks. It was relaxing and entertaining combined.  Definitely worth a visit if you are in the area.

318428649.name: Great surf break and good fishing
318428649.author: a TripAdvisor user
318428649.reviewBody: We spend a week here. The surf was great and we had fun switching between surfing and doing stand up. We also went fishing and spearfishing and got lots of fish. For low season we had a good time. If you are going to surf the locals can be a little testy about sharing the main break. I had one local pull me off the wave. We exchanged some choice words but everything worked out in the end. They can just be a little intense.

318385332.name: Busy beach
318385332.author: a TripAdvisor user
318385332.reviewBody: Nicer beach around in Bucerias or Rincon de Gayabitos. It Is \u00e0 surfer Town and the beach gens loud.  Proc\u00e8s are higher here than nearby towns.  Lots of good restaurants in Town.

316969291.name: Cutest Village
316969291.author: a TripAdvisor user
316969291.reviewBody: We were staying in Bucaries, but went for a day to sayulita , beautiful village with a beautiful beach, next time will stay in a hotel in Sayulita loved the village.

316875893.name: Awesome Village with Fishing, Surfing, Snorkleing, Food etc. etc. etc.
316875893.author: a TripAdvisor user
316875893.reviewBody: Sayulita is a small village with impact!  It is authentic Mexican culture of a small fishing village.  It has everything on this beach.  Fishing, many restaurants, water activities from boogey board to surfing or stand up.  You can ride horses, go bird watching, take off to look at whales just a short boat trip from shore!  Too many restaurants in town to add to the beach experience.  It is a secret spot for Gringos!  Which are very welcome here!

316389085.name: Learn to surf or relax with a drink
316389085.author: a TripAdvisor user
316389085.reviewBody: Nice beach if you want a busy beach or want to try a bit of surfing.  Very sandy, nice waves, safe, a lot of beach seating.

315496583.name: A Lovely Beach
315496583.author: a TripAdvisor user
315496583.reviewBody: To clarify, I went in June/July 2014. Sayulita is a lovely little town, very relaxed with a gorgeous beach where you can canoe and body board. The water is warm and the scenery is picturesque. A great place to spend a couple of days soaking up the sun and listening to the waves lapping on the shore.

315228061.name: Sayulita Beach= Relaxing
315228061.author: a TripAdvisor user
315228061.reviewBody: The town of Sayulita and it\'s beach is wonderful. We took a day trip by bus from Puerto Vallarta to visit. It\'s a little over an hour for the trip. Its a easy walking town and there\'s lots of great places on Sayulita Beach to relax at. We chose a place to have some drinks, snacks and do some swimming. It\'s a surf type of town with lots of gringos trying to hang ten on a board wishing they were Jeff Spicoli. We actually saw more Americans here then in Puerto Vallarta. They were fun to watch. We even had messages in a tent on the beach. We had a great time, spent about five hours here before heading back to PV. We\'ll definitely return the next time were in Mexico.

314497619.name: Great besch
314497619.author: a TripAdvisor user
314497619.reviewBody: Beautiful location. The only negative as all the vendors coming up to us wanting us to buy from them. They even did this while we were eating at a restaurant there.

312706162.name: Charming beach!
312706162.author: a TripAdvisor user
312706162.reviewBody: Love Sayulita!  Still a very small town with locals and expats and tourists but not too overly developed yet and no huge hotels.  Hopefully it will stay that way!  The beach is great for people watching and is not crowded.

312541099.name: It\'s been discovered, but it\'s still cool.
312541099.author: a TripAdvisor user
312541099.reviewBody: Fantastic beach, decent paddle boarding, small but regular surf, several good spots for food and drink that include palapas, or you can rent the umbrella and chair for the day... and it\'s all a block from a very cute, hip little town.

311967802.name: Perfect beach for whiling away many hours
311967802.author: a TripAdvisor user
311967802.reviewBody: Great beach, loved the passing food , drink and merchandise sellers. A shame about the stinging  jelly fish on the last day:(

311663830.name: Fun, Fun and more Fun!!
311663830.author: a TripAdvisor user
311663830.reviewBody: A great fun beach to visit even if you don\'t surf just hang out and watch the experts.  Kids will have a wonderful time, rent a boogie board or surf board and you won\'t be able to get them out of the water.\nI am yet to find a good, reliable restaurant on the beach so you could always take your own and just rent the umbrella\'s and lounge chairs for 10 dollars a day.

311407785.name: Great Beach
311407785.author: a TripAdvisor user
311407785.reviewBody: Warm water, good waves, and sparkly sand. We forked over 200 pesos to sit in the chairs that the surf school had set up. it was worth it to have the umbrella and chairs, but a lot of people brought their own umbrellas and towels too. the sunsets were nice, but a little hidden from the shape of the beach. It was nice to watch the surfers in the evening once we were done in the water.

311148568.name: Can sit on the beach all day!
311148568.author: a TripAdvisor user
311148568.reviewBody: Most relaxing beach!  Favorite spot is to the left in front of the large restaurant.  Apologize, unable to recall the two story restaurant.  You can\'t miss it though.  $5.00 a day for chair and umbrella.  Great to order drinks and lunch.  Like this location as it\'s a quieter area.  Prefer to spend $5.00 then drag chairs and sit in the sand with no waiter.

310022226.name: the best place to surf
310022226.author: a TripAdvisor user
310022226.reviewBody: amazing place, the best contact that i have ever with the nature... some many thinks in my mind, nice place, nice pleope

309911082.name: Laid back
309911082.author: a TripAdvisor user
309911082.reviewBody: Great waves laid back , and lots of little mom and pop restaurants, one hour from Vallarta and beautiful scenery!

307951637.name: Day trip from Nuevo Vallarta
307951637.author: a TripAdvisor user
307951637.reviewBody: My friends and I booked a day trip here with a taxi driver. The six of us paid 20 American each for a personal taxi to the beach and a scenic drive along the way. He waited and took us wherever we wanted to go! Sayulita was amazing! It was a destination away from Puerto Vallarta in itself. Its a small town, but its booming with stores and restaurants. It feels more Americanized than rural Mexico and its almost like a beach town that could be along the 101 in California. What makes it have smalltown charm is that it does not have extravagant resorts and clubs, only small hotels. If I go back to that area of Mexico, I would stay here instead of Puerto Vallarta.

306801964.name: Paradise
306801964.author: a TripAdvisor user
306801964.reviewBody: Our house was at the north end of the beach, so that is where we spent the majority of our beach time. The north end is great because it\'s less crowded. The downside is that there is an undertow, so you had to be careful getting out of the water. The south end of the beach, towards downtown, is more crowded, but I believe has less of an undertow. \n\nFloating in the water, gazing at the bay, watching sunsets...we had such a great time at Sayulita Beach. We can\'t wait to return!

306792595.name: Surf lesson
306792595.author: a TripAdvisor user
306792595.reviewBody: The surf lesson was a complete waste of money. The instructor had a really bad attitude and a thick accent so it\'s hard to understand instructions. The beach was over crowded.

306510812.name: sayulita \u2764\ufe0f
306510812.author: a TripAdvisor user
306510812.reviewBody:
everyone minds their own business..
super relaxed
reminds me of austin
love its so colorful and creative

306469897.name: Over crowded and commercialized
306469897.author: a TripAdvisor user
306469897.reviewBody: We hit Sayulita Beach in February of 2015.  We had been there the previous year and wanted to share the place with friends.  Unfortunately the money bug has hit hard.  $200 pesos each to rent a chair, and we were buying drinks.  We had lunch but that was with the restaurant and not the beach chair jombronies.  The streets were crowded and tons of construction made it almost impossible to find a parking spot.  I was very disappointed and will not make the effort to go back.

306030607.name: Enjoy the Beach, But Go For the Total Town Experience
306030607.author: a TripAdvisor user
306030607.reviewBody:
I have been to Sayulita many times over the past 15 years.  The beach was what first took me there, or rather the surfing.  Not to surf, but to "watch" surfers.  
The beach, at the edge of town, is not large or expansive.  There is one area where the surfers congregate and surf.  That's where the waves break, and on either side of that area, are rocks.  
This beach gets "a lot" of use during the peak season.  Sayulita draws an international crowd, and you can hear a number of different languages on a stroll down the beach.
About 8 years ago, a strong storm devastated this beach line, and it has taken years for it to "heal itself".  I was amazed at how much the beach had changed, when I went to Sayulita, a year after that storm.  
There are many beach vendors who carry their wares up and down the beach, back and forth.  As is usually the case, a simple "No, gracias" will "sometimes" send them on their way.  You can "dicker" with the vendors and usually get the asking price down to where it's a real bargain.  And, the food that some of these vendors offer is really good.  
You can rent a space on the beach, with your own little palapa, table and beach chairs.  These are available in several areas along the main stretch of beach.  And, several beachside eating/drinking establishments provide beachside seating while consuming your purchase.  
The beach isn't "beautiful", by some beach standards.  A few of the beachside establishments make an effort to keep their areas litter free, but that's not the case along the entire beach.  
Mexicans love dogs, but unfortunately that has led to an uncontrolled number of them and many are "homeless" and hang out on the beach.  They are always looking for a handout or scraps of food that were dropped or disposed of.  A lot of these dogs are well cared for, but many are not and they are gaunt and sickly looking.  I believe Sayulita has been making an effort to control this situation.  
Sayulita has changed dramatically, from my first visit over 15 years ago.  More and more people have made Sayulita their home, and more and more businesses have opened.  It's still a small fishing town, but it's not the "sleepy little Mexican hideaway" I first visited.  It continues to draw surfers, and there are opportunities for lessons at several locations along the beach.  If you are in Puerto Vallarta, it's only about a.$4, round trip, on the bus to get to/from Sayulita.  It's a great day trip.  .

305781669.name: Sewer discharged to the beach
305781669.author: a TripAdvisor user
305781669.reviewBody: There is a water treatment plant that discharges water right to the river a few meters from the beach, so basically if you swim in the beach you will be swimming in this water.  It is disgusting, government has to do something with this.

304538174.name: Lively beach scene
304538174.author: a TripAdvisor user
304538174.reviewBody: Sayulita beach is a fun and lively scene.  I enjoyed all the surfing action, watching the local Mexican families, and walking the beach.  The beach was crowded and not peaceful for folks that like peace and quiet.  I saw tons of pelicans and a beautiful egret.  Local fisherman were catching sardines with a net at the end of the day. Lots to enjoy visually.

304237969.name: Nothing special for the average tourist
304237969.author: a TripAdvisor user
304237969.reviewBody: If you like beaches, or wanting to learn to surf, this is the area for it. Other than that, nothing really special about it. Its like any regular beach. Nice ocean view here. Vendors ready to sell you things. Oh, you must pay to relax on the beach chairs. I don\'t recall how much they charge, but its hefty. So, be warned.

304205747.name: The action never stops
304205747.author: a TripAdvisor user
304205747.reviewBody: I live here and I have seen the main Sayulita beach change over the years.  It\u00b4s a very busy beach now and never a dull moment, but most people want to enjoy the beach with everyone else and enjoy the food venders that walk by, the surfers catching waves and the general buzz on the beach.  The north end tends to be quieter if you prefer a few less people, but the waves turn over more quickly there so you need to be more conscious when playing in the water.

303768778.name: Surf beach
303768778.author: a TripAdvisor user
303768778.reviewBody: Went with my friends for the first time to learn how to surf, it was ok, my only down side was a bit to rocky where we were doing our lessons, I was a little scare of falling... Paco our instructor was great, we did stand up and it was a fantastic day out. will be back for sure!

303766086.name: If you love surfing you can\u00b4t miss Sayulita
303766086.author: a TripAdvisor user
303766086.reviewBody: Sayulita is an enchanted village near Puerto Vallarta on the Riviera Nayarita, it is mainly known because you can practise surf, if you are near by, you should not miss it. It is very hot during summer, since I don\u00b4t like that much hot I rather go on winter or spring. There are some nice stores around the area.

303408559.name: Beautiful hidden jewel
303408559.author: a TripAdvisor user
303408559.reviewBody: Many people recommend this surf seafood hidden town...highly recommend the surfing, the banana boat and the seafood! The people are extremely friendly!

302646591.name: Sayulita - say whaaaat?
302646591.author: a TripAdvisor user
302646591.reviewBody: Heard Sayulita was worth seeing, so we ventured away from Punta de Mita for a quick day trip.  It\'s a quiet surf/fishing village.  Beaches are picturesque (but they are pretty much everywhere along this coast, right)?  They were relatively empty too (but again, there\'s lots of that to be found).  In all fairness, it\'s probably a great place to learn to surf when there\'s waves - looks like a slow roller kind of break and lots of surf shacks renting boards and offering lessons.  But it was flat.\n\nThere wasn\'t anything not to like - it\'s just there wasn\'t any reason for us to leave Punta de Mita for this.  I liked Rincon de Guayabitos more, since it was different from where we already were (see my review).

301556247.name: Middleground between Vallarta & San Pancho
301556247.author: a TripAdvisor user
301556247.reviewBody:
Sayulita Beach is a great spot for anyone that's not too into the "civilized", over-crowded & tourist-y life of Vallarta, but also not into the super quiet, local-style, non-tourist-y , tranquil life of San Pancho. It's basically, from my point of view, the real MIDDLEGROUND between the two.
You can easily find a bar open at night for a couple of drinks and live music, and you can also go to the beach and relax quietly on the sand.
It has a somewhat large national & international tourist base year-round, so you can count on meeting people from all over the world whenever you visit.
Iv've been there a couple of times, on different seasons and although there's a noticeable decrease in tourists on "low-season" , theres always people around and businesses stay open year-round.
So, no matter when you visit, you'll be guaranteed a good time, good food, good drinks, good company and a lot of nice, traditional places to enjoy and visit.
However, if I'm being honest, I really wasn't a fan of the beach itself...
The water-temp, the view and the sound are all amazing, it's a beach after all!
But, inevitably I compared it with my beloved San Pancho, and the results weren't that flattering for Sayulita...
The water, to my eyes, wasn't as clear and as turquoise as San Pancho's, and when going into the water, there are some rocks that make the walk a bit uncomfortable, and that was a definite turn off. Also, the sand isn't really all that amazing, on the beach it's quite alright. But the one on the shore is a darkish-black muddy color that isn't very appealing.
But I found that the farthest I walked from the "main beach", the clearer the sand got, and the prettier it looked.

So my advice is, if you're looking for a relaxing time enjoying the beach, walk a little longer and find a better spot. If you're looking to meet new people, looking for conversation and people overall, stay on the main beach and you'll love it.

Overall, a really nice experience, loved the shops (a lot of places that have amazing locally produced stuff that wiped me out), the food (there are lots of options for any kind of taste) and the people (both locals and toursits are always friendly and super helpful).

301160346.name: The waves!
301160346.author: a TripAdvisor user
301160346.reviewBody: The waves were nice here! make sure to were sandals as its really hot!. Mule rides. Some nice scenery. 10 min more drive there in San Pancho which is even better and more english speaking people lol where my Canadians at!

301078153.name: Better than San Pancho and Vallarta.
301078153.author: a TripAdvisor user
301078153.reviewBody: Great beach, As you enter the beach. Head over to the right where the beach becomes much quieter. In fact you are on your own. With a little traffic passing you as you sunbathe. Take a bag with you to take your trash home once you leave.

300467506.name: Sayulita life
300467506.author: a TripAdvisor user
300467506.reviewBody: The beach farthest away from town was much better.  The sand was white not yucky black like the one by town.

299963586.name: Fun times
299963586.author: a TripAdvisor user
299963586.reviewBody: Great place to relax.  Old style Mexico with $1.50 beers and $1.50 tacos.  Surf is small but can get big with a northern swell.  People are really nice and friendly.  Town as everything you need including a great night life.  Great for the kids and families too.

299719132.name: We love Sayulita
299719132.author: a TripAdvisor user
299719132.reviewBody: The best thing about this beach (and the town) is the vibe.  Lots of gringos, but also Mexicanos vacationing.  Great interactions with the locals.  The water quality was a little off during our last visit, but hopefully this is a temporary issue.

299670941.name: Fun in the sun
299670941.author: a TripAdvisor user
299670941.reviewBody: Great beach and town. It\'s like the Venice Beach of Mexico. So cute!!! could have stayed a few days just to chill and relax even more

299240112.name: The perfect little hippie paradise
299240112.author: a TripAdvisor user
299240112.reviewBody: A little village for of hippies, relaxed atmosphere, good food, long nights at the beach, sailing, surfing. The perfect vacation if you need to recharge your batteries

297622205.name: Town and beach review
297622205.author: a TripAdvisor user
297622205.reviewBody:
Comparitely the beach in Sayulita is more sand that its counterparts in the area which tend to be more rocky - it is a nice beach and stretches out but it was very crowded the day we went in the area closest to the town.

We primarily went to visit the town and from our resort the journey cost approximately £13 each way - which is nothing for a 20 minute journey. We chose to taxi as I didn't fancy the confusion of changing buses and the risk of going wrong.

The town itself is beautiful and a little change of pace compared to the hotel and other things we did while in the area. What you will notice is the hired security for the town and the number of Canadians and Americans that have bought into the area - felt safe for our whole visit. 

If you are planning on buying things - make sure you shop around. For example, the local beadwork costs 4x as much in Sayulita as it does from when the makers come round to the hotels to showcase their craft.

All in all, a nice little town to visit but not much to do for more than a few hours in our opinion.

297217399.name: A special beach.
297217399.author: a TripAdvisor user
297217399.reviewBody: It\'s a very special place, really. It\'s great for all ages whether you\'re coming with your significant other, family or friends. I tried various restaurants and was impressed that all of them had good food. The sunsets are beautiful and they\'re a bunch of little boutiques. Make sure to remember vendors on the street will usually start at an outrageous price \'cause they know you are foreigners, if you disagree they will you usually bump it down, unless you would like to pay them more.

297184459.name: Beautiful Beach- Change of Pace from the Resort
297184459.author: a TripAdvisor user
297184459.reviewBody:
I was determined to get off the resort and so glad that I did. Sayulita was a great change of pace. The beach is beautiful and has a hippie like vibe. The shops all great for souvenirs, all though not all authentic Mexican- my favorite was the Huichol shop that sells art by the local indians- they cover ceramic pieces with beeswax and then tiny colored beads. The work is exquisite!

Even though I enjoyed Sauylita, our taxi ride from our resort in Nuevo Vallarta was a great adventure as well. Originally,  I had planned to take the bus, however after much discussion, I decided to take a taxi. He waited for my family  for 4 hours while we shopped. Although we paid more than a bus ride it was well worth the cost. 

 On our return, we passed numerous fruit stands,  where we stopped and bought cocadas (coconut candy), mamey fruit, rhambutan (lychee like fruit), yak (jackfruit), and carambola (star fruit). It was great to have a taste of the local goods and interact with the local people. I loved tasting the yummy sweets. The vendors were so friendly and  willing to let us try the local fruits and sweets, even if we didn't decide to buy them. 

This was definitely an authentic experience. The tours will charge you tons of money to go to Sayulita. I suggest you do it on your own. If I had more time, I would have gone to San Sebastian- in the mountains. We will save that for our next adventure.

296157682.name: Just okay
296157682.author: a TripAdvisor user
296157682.reviewBody: We visited in August.  In comparison to other beaches I\'ve been to, it\'s somewhat crowded and can sometimes be lacking sufficient umbrellas to keep everyone shaded, unless you\'re paying for drinks or food.  It has many different surfs lesson tents and can get quite busy in the water.  If you\'re looking for lots of activity and fun, it\'s great.  If you\'re looking for a relaxing place to read a book, not the best option for you.  There are many people trying to sell you necklaces and wood carvings and hammocks and pants and hats, etc.  This gets a bit annoying.  Don\'t get me wrong, it\'s a beautiful beach - the water is churned up and brown so you won\'t be snorkelling or seeing any kind of underwater life here.  The waves are mild and good for body surfing and surfing!  I enjoyed it but wouldn\'t return for the Satulita beach, specifically.

294426096.name: Sayulita Rocks!
294426096.author: a TripAdvisor user
294426096.reviewBody: Beautiful village: artsy, cobblestoned, quaint. Great tequila and restuarant! Good surf and warm water. Lovely trails to walk or run.

294236921.name: Great beach. Great waves. Even better sunsets.
294236921.author: a TripAdvisor user
294236921.reviewBody: We usually headed down to the beach around 8am to walk the dog. Most afternoons we avoided the beach as it was just to hot. In the evening around 830pm you can catch a great sunset.

293075897.name: Cool and Funky surfer dude place
293075897.author: a TripAdvisor user
293075897.reviewBody: Inexpensive drinking and dining and a lovely beach in an attractive bay 13km up the coast from Punta Mita, a day trip would allow time on the beach, souvenir shopping, a few drinks and dinner.

292679236.name: Nice small hipster beach
292679236.author: a TripAdvisor user
292679236.reviewBody: Went there from Puerto Vallarta, took the bus route "compostela" and it costs you around $35 MXN and it takes about 1.5 to get there.The beach is great! Small waves to learn to surf (just ask around the guys at the beach to get a better price, they\'re cheaper than the surf schools in town), bring an Umbrella as there\'s no shade to sit under otherwise you can rent one for 130-150 pesos for the whole day, you can bring lunch and drinks or you can buy snacks and fresh drinks/alcohol in the oxxo at the end of the beach or you can just go to a restaurant the place is not that expensive

292644168.name: great for surf but not for long walks beware of rocks
292644168.author: a TripAdvisor user
292644168.reviewBody: clearly the best surfing beach  but  close to river inflow beware; it  is congested with rocky bottom and if you want a long walk the slope along water\'s edge is challenging.  Great crowds, forget quiet and serene; walk north or go to other beaches in area.

291317634.name: Las Olas
291317634.author: a TripAdvisor user
291317634.reviewBody: Great waves for learning surfing! Always coconuts available (with rum if that what your into), Might not beat the beaches of SE Asia but the town and people included this place is special.

290902527.name: Nice Place
290902527.author: a TripAdvisor user
290902527.reviewBody: Swung into Sayulita for breakfast.\nThey have opened the restaurant just before you go over the bridge into town.\nAwesome menu and the food was excellent.

289807846.name: Great Fun Beach
289807846.author: a TripAdvisor user
289807846.reviewBody: We had a great week visiting this beach daily. It\'s a busy beach, meaning there are lots of people and vendors, so it you are looking for seclusion, it\'s not the place for you. We enjoyed the vendors with all the amazing food. There was one woman who came by with homemade tamales and they were amazing. My tip is to go early and reserve a beach chair at one of the restaurants so you have access to bathrooms and a comfortable place to sit. There is a food and drink minimum but we thought it was worth it. The waves at the beach are super fun. There are smaller waves in close for kid, medium waves out a little further for those of us who like to boogie board, and then the surfer spot with the more serious waves. It can get crowded out there but we were there at Spring Break so it may be less crowded other times. Great family fun beach and walking distance from most houses and hotels in town.

289358715.name: Funcky beach town but fun!
289358715.author: a TripAdvisor user
289358715.reviewBody: We visited in July. A friend drove us up from Puerto Vallarta. We liked this town.  More hippies than in PV. More like a funky New Jersey shore beach town - lots of young people making a go at life by selling jewelry or stuff on the beach. We hung out at one of the restuarants, it was a bit crowded there and I think choosing a spot a little farther away would have been better. Very HOT in July.
