Walking around the streets one just dives into any air conditioned shop for relief!. Lots of fun stores but we were too hot to shop. Great waves. Some items for sale in stores and booths that you don\'t see in PV. For example, striped cotton fabric to be used as bed cover or light towels. All over the place in Sayulitas, nowhere to be found in Puerto Vallarta! Also different jewelry - lots of handmade brass wire things.

288651027.name: Love it
288651027.author: a TripAdvisor user
288651027.reviewBody: The waves, the sand the sun, priceless!\nWe would spend hours just playing in the waves.\nIt is a great family beach.

288271993.name: Great surf/beach in a clean Mexican town!
288271993.author: a TripAdvisor user
288271993.reviewBody:
if you are able to, go check out Sayulita! 
We stayed in downtown PV and we took the city bus (about an hour ride) for only 35 pesos each way. (or about a $60USD cab ride)
you can pay 150-200 pesos and get lounge chairs for the day and get served food and drinks from one of the many restaurants. 
There is also an Oxxo (Mexican 7-11) right on the beach if you want to spend less money and buy cheap beers and eats.
We are defiantly going back to Sayulita!

287771262.name: Better than Vallarta
287771262.author: a TripAdvisor user
287771262.reviewBody: Nice small town.  Beach is nice and great waves.  Beach is clean.  It\'s a nice day trip from Vallarta.  We paid $650.00 pesos from the Now Amber to Sayulita.  We also paid the same to get back.  Soft sand and clear water.  You can rent the beach chairs their for $200.00 pesos all day.  Note you will have to pay for everything.  Even the showers are $5.00 pesos.  Can\'t wait to go back.

286992725.name: Fantastic Beach
286992725.author: a TripAdvisor user
286992725.reviewBody: Sayulita is one of my favorite places to visit. The beach there is exquisite: calm waters, white sand, friendly people.  I highly recommend getting a massage while listening to the sounds of the ocean in the background.

286396442.name: Quaint, but crowded
286396442.author: a TripAdvisor user
286396442.reviewBody: Sayulita Beach is great for people watching, because there are lots of them!  The sand and the water was packed with tourists and locals.  There are several surf schools right on the beach, but the waves are so crowded, we opted out.  We saw lots of surfers crash into each other and people just wading out into the water.  If you could find a less crowded day, it would be a great place to learn to surf, as the waves are optimal.

286091549.name: Beautiful Bustling Beach
286091549.author: a TripAdvisor user
286091549.reviewBody: This is a wonderful beach with lots of beautiful views.  The sand and water have gold sparkles in them which was really cool.  The sand however, is VERY hot, be sure to have something on your feet or be prepared to RUN to the water.  There are a lot of visitors to this beach so I would suggest getting there early to get a good spot if you are planning to stay the day, umbrellas are a necessity. There are peddlers on the beach, but from our experience a simple no thank you worked well.  You have many food choices on the beach if you didn\'t pack food or you could go into Sayulita for other options (we needed more water and walked to a market and got a big bottle of water for $0.50 USD). There are also lots of shops to check out if you\'d like some souvenirs (practice your bartering skills before you go.).  :-)  Just apply 50+ SPF sunscreen, kick back, relax & enjoy!

285512922.name: A GREAT BEACH FOR THE WHOLE FAMILY
285512922.author: a TripAdvisor user
285512922.reviewBody: Beautiful beach, soft white sand is easy on bare feet.  Waves are gentle and good for beginner surfers. My 13 year old grandson took his first lesson here(450 pesos for a 21/2 hour private lesson) He was up and riding the waves in no time.There are several very nice restaurants on the beach, where you can sit under umbrellas, use the bathrooms, and even rinse off with fresh water showers as long as you buy a little lunch or cold drinks.\n  We took a local bus from Bucerias to Sayulita. The trip through winding mountain roads was beautiful and exciting. We spent most of the day on the beach and if not for quite so many vendors on the beach I would give it a 5.

285189441.name: Trip to Sayulita
285189441.author: a TripAdvisor user
285189441.reviewBody: Do not miss this amazing surfing town! Great shopping and you get to see the people of the area instead of just your resort. Well worth it!

285082453.name: Not as nice as people say.
285082453.author: a TripAdvisor user
285082453.reviewBody: We drove here from San Pancho for some surf lessons.  Everyone enjoyed learning how to surf here but outside of that its just a beach.   The beach area was lined up with umbrellas and chairs right next to each other.  There were people constantly coming up to you trying to sell things which I found a bit annoying.   The town itself was ok.  Lots of restaurants and decent shops for souvenirs.   Parking was difficult.  If you go, park to the left just over the bridge.

284401873.name: The beach itself is no real fun.
284401873.author: a TripAdvisor user
284401873.reviewBody: Sayulita can be fun, but outside of some sparse people-watching from restaurant patios, the beach is not worth visiting,  Simply put, it\'s not a great beach, and there are lots of other great ones in Nayarit.  Syaulita is worth an afternoon or evening, but it\'s become very Amercianized.  The streets can also be pretty dirty in a way not found in other Mexican villages.  I really don\'t understand why it isn\'t cleaner or nicer.

284358366.name: Sayulita, Very Cool Little Surfin Beach Town.
284358366.author: a TripAdvisor user
284358366.reviewBody: Typical old surfing beach.  Lined with restaurants.  Very good feel on the bach and the little town of Sayulita.

283715191.name: Hidden Gem in the jungle.
283715191.author: a TripAdvisor user
283715191.reviewBody: I was seriously not expecting much when we drove to Sayulita, the road from Puerto Vallarta to Punta mita was pleasant, we then turned toward Sayulita northbound and about 5 minutes into our drive, our perspective changed. The road is in very good condition and it\'s one of the most beautiful scenic drives you will ever have. There is something special about this beautiful jungle. Once you arrive into the town you realize what special charm exist in this place. There is a mixture of Southern California surfer beach town vibe mixed with mexican village charm and accented with European bohemian style. This is a surfer, artist town with a very laid back feel. Plenty of good food, nice bars and lots of art stores. The beach and the jungle around it are spectacular and very few placed offer this much beauty and serenity along with a sense that this place can turn up the party at night. If you are into more upscale mega resort places, then this may not be the place for you. If you\'re into a real place with a real feel, there is no better place.

283437142.name: Entertaining
283437142.author: a TripAdvisor user
283437142.reviewBody: Food and drinks on the beach makes up for the mucky water.  For 150 pesos for the entire day, you can rent a small table, 2 chairs, and a shady umbrella. Fun to watch the young men play futbol in the surf!  We were gifted with an unusual sight as a spooked horse appeared out of nowhere and frantically galloped up and down the shore!  The vendors can be quite intrusive but it is to be expected.  It IS their country and their means of earning a living.  Enjoyed the day. Just disappointed that the water was not snorkel worthy.

283136159.name: Beautiful Golden Specs in the Sand
283136159.author: a TripAdvisor user
283136159.reviewBody: The beach is beautiful with sparkling golden specks in the water and in the sand. The waves are strong and crash into you hard sometimes, definitely a beach for surfers and experienced swimmers.

281895937.name: Gross. Just gross.
281895937.author: a TripAdvisor user
281895937.reviewBody: Sayulita might be a cute little tourist town with clubs, restaurants, and "charm", but it has a real sewage problem. The sewage dumps into the ocean. The sayulita river stinks so bad holding your breath is the only option. It\'s nasty and pouring into the sea. \n\nThere may be a great surf wave there, but I\'ll never go back. So gross.

281467678.name: Loved it!
281467678.author: a TripAdvisor user
281467678.reviewBody: Sayulita was friendly, many small mom and pop restaurants that were delectable, great shopping, lovely people!

281411002.name: I <3 Sayulita
281411002.author: a TripAdvisor user
281411002.reviewBody: Sayulita is my favorite place in the world. :)  The hippy vibe, the surf vibe, the beautiful local art, the food, the "hang loose" mentality.  Heaven!

281202998.name: Picturesque beach in a charming town
281202998.author: a TripAdvisor user
281202998.reviewBody: A friend took me too Sayulita while I was visiting Puerto Vallarta.  The beach was lovely, surrounded by hills.  Its not too big, so was easy to walk, enjoy the breeze, and climb the rocks.  The surrounding town is charming  Keep an eye out for the iguanas, or as my Mexican friend called them, alligators in the trees...lots of photo ops!

280505788.name: grovy
280505788.author: a TripAdvisor user
280505788.reviewBody: Nice surfer town.  a bit touristy, but still has a groovy hippie yoga surfer vibe.  plenty of street vendors, clothing, trinckets, food and pharmacies.  nice beach.

280500646.name: Beautiful
280500646.author: a TripAdvisor user
280500646.reviewBody: Loved the beach but be careful for jellyfish.  There were quite a few!  Other than that, it was a wonderful!

280464009.name: Sayulita Life
280464009.author: a TripAdvisor user
280464009.reviewBody:
Sayulita is definitely a place worth visiting if you are in the Puerto Vallarta/Punta de Mita area. If you are looking for an authentic experience and would like to immerse yourself in Mexican culture and really experience Mexico, (instead of living on the resort bubble), this is the place to visit. There are some hostels/hotels and not many large resorts in the area. However, there are a ton of rental properties to choose from and in my opinion this is the best way to experience Sayulita. My boyfriend and three of our friends rented a house on the hill, with pool, two bedrooms, three bath, open roof tarrace with ocean view and nice ammenities. Price worked out to be about $130/person/night. However, you can get less lavish and smaller places for much less as well. I recommend checking out the website "Sayulita Life" for condo and house rentals they have a lot of properties to choose from. 

Safety: Compared to many other places I have visited in Latin America, Sayulita is VERY safe. No sketchy vibes, no gangster looking people walking around, just a really friendly and nice place, surfer style. 

Food: There are lots of cool places to eat in Sayulita. If you are looking for McDonalds and Starbucks you will be disappointed, its mostly authentic and local restaurants - no big American chains. That being said, Sayulita is a great place to experience authentic Mexican food - from street food, to casual cafe's and restaurants to fancy places. My personal fav for lunch, happy hour, and casual dinners is "Aloha", located just up from the very end of the beach. This hidden gem has some of the best ceviche and fish tacos I have ever had and the owner is really friendly. Located literally steps from the beach it is an awesome place to eat after catching some waves and meet the local crowd.

Surfing: Best surfing school located at the very end of the beach is Tigre surf school. Awesome guys fun to hang out with. 

Overall, Sayulita and Saylita Beach are awesome, great culture, lots to do, awesome surfing and good times. I prefer it any day to the resort filled Puerta Vallarta and look forward to going back

280162202.name: Party on the left, peaceful on the right
280162202.author: a TripAdvisor user
280162202.reviewBody: Sayulita Beach stretches out a decent half mile.  To the left of the river mouth, bars and restaurants are beach front.  Chairs and umbrellas are lined up closely, you can grab one for 50 pesos, there is also food and beverage service on the beach.  Little kids get surf lessons on a soft, sand bottom beach.  It\'s a gradually sloping beach, an adult would have to swim 100 yards out to be in 5ft of water.  In front of the river mouth are large black rocks. To the right, the waves are a little stronger, but the lack of chair rental, restaurants and bars means one has more room to stretch out and a little more privacy.  The sand is also less fine, which isn\'t comfortable for delicate feet.\n\nThere are several places to rent surf boards, paddle boards, boogie boards  - the beach can get very crowded on the weekends and it can get pretty hairy in the water.  Beginners on boards without instructors can be a liability under those conditions.  For those who don\'t mind walking and do not care for chair rentals or sports equipment rentals, there\'s a another beach far left of the river mouth, past the cemetery.  There\'s food and coconuts for purchase, the water is more calm making it a favorite for locals with small kids, even on weekends, the distance prevents crowds from building up.

280159449.name: Great surf!
280159449.author: a TripAdvisor user
280159449.reviewBody: The surf in Sayulita is good. The wave is mostly a righthander but can also be ridden left when tide is right. Stay of the reef which is on the right side of the tahe off zone. IT IS SHALLOW and filled with lots of Sharp stones and other scary stuff.\nSurfers are friendly and happy to talk with others on the line up.

279670103.name: Fun wave....
279670103.author: a TripAdvisor user
279670103.reviewBody: This is the tourist beach front, plenty of beach chairs for hire with table service, local food vendors sell prawn sticks, fantastic doughnuts, fresh fruit.  You do get harassed by sellers of toys, blankets, sunglasses.....similar to Bali beaches. In December the water was grey, not blue....and dogs are allowed on the beach, enough said. It is a fun wave for kids and beginner surfers or paddle boarders. A chilled out vibe, but still a bit too touristy - we loved San Vincenzo beach and town to get away from the crowds.

279563888.name: A unique and one of the best beaches!
279563888.author: a TripAdvisor user
279563888.reviewBody: I think Sayulita is one of the best beaches in the Puerto Vallarta area.  The waves are grat for surfing, paddle boarding or for body surfing.  I go there each year for water fun.  The town has some interesting shops but the reason I go is the water.

279560972.name: Nice quaint beach!!  Sayulita is a great, safe, little town to visit!!
279560972.author: a TripAdvisor user
279560972.reviewBody: Quiet little beach.  Plenty of excursion opportunities but not too many people hassling you to buy stuff.  Really safe!!

279417259.name: Quaint little surfer hippie town you will LOVE
279417259.author: a TripAdvisor user
279417259.reviewBody:
So I simply love this place and now so do my friends who said and I quote "thank you so much for suggesting we go here as we probably would not have thought to visit on our own and now we want to book a vacation to stay here".

It is approximately 45 minutes North of Puerto Vallarta

You will notice lots of local hippie types in Sayulita. It is hard not to appreciate that atmosphere.

There are lots of fun shops and many nice restaurants to choose from.

The beach is a lovely beach where paddle boarders and beginner surfers spend their days

I like to spend at least a day here each time I stay in PV.

I expect to continue to do so and think you should as well

279140415.name: Playa & Party
279140415.author: a TripAdvisor user
279140415.reviewBody: Enjoy this amazing beach with a bunch of surfers and a lot of places to taste delicious food from Nayarit.

279008622.name: Surf beach
279008622.author: a TripAdvisor user
279008622.reviewBody: it is good for surf beginners, the sand is nice for feet, i dont like when the people rent some shadows and there are some rocks in some specific part of the beach

279005543.name: Beautiful Seaside Town
279005543.author: a TripAdvisor user
279005543.reviewBody: Spent the day and evening at this beautiful seaside town.  Got to witness the incredible sunset, eating tacos among the locals, chilling in the square - people watching and listening to 2 marching bands compete against each other - priceless!

278765640.name: Sayulita\'s beach is a fun Hippie town!!
278765640.author: a TripAdvisor user
278765640.reviewBody: Sayulita beach was described to us as a fun, small little hippie town and that\'s exactly what we found when we got there. About 45 minute taxi ride there but spent about 4 or 5 hours watching surfers and swimmers and they had the cutest little shops too!! Very laid back atmosphere and will go back there next time we go to Mexico...

278728494.name: best beach town from yelapa south to chacala north
278728494.author: a TripAdvisor user
278728494.reviewBody: perfect balance of convenient town needs & small town crowds. Our family explored chacala, rincon de guyabos, la penita, punta raza, san francisco, punta mita, puerto vallarta & yelapa. If you are looking for the best combination of convenience, beach scene & manageable crowds---this is it!

278360411.name: Warm water, soft sand, chairs in abundance
278360411.author: a TripAdvisor user
278360411.reviewBody: Order 300 pesos worth of food and you have chairs from 10am -6pm, what a deal! It costs me more than that just to park in LA. The water is warm, the sand is soft, not a lot of rocks, clear water. Perfect for learning how to surf,

277619153.name: Great place to loose yourself
277619153.author: a TripAdvisor user
277619153.reviewBody: We drove over from Puerto Vallarta to Sayulita it was an easy 45 min drive and well marked roads. We parked the car downtown and walked around to get the lay of the city. A small very cute art town right on the beach with lots of nice little restaurants. It was early and we saw a small coffee shop that was very busy so we sat out side on the sidewalk caf\u00e9 and ordered coffee and Danish, to our surprise they were excellent, fresh brewed and fresh baked. You could see the ocean down the street and hear the crashing waves. \nGreat place to loose yourself.

277391530.name: Seems Perfect, but is it?
277391530.author: a TripAdvisor user
277391530.reviewBody: So upon first glance, the beach is just great and picturesque. The water is full of surfers, swimmers, and paddle boarders.  There are many umbrellas for rent and restaurants that will deliver foold and beverages.  I also really like that there appear to be a lot local families that take advantage of it too, especially on the weekends.  Walking from one end of the cove to the other is also nice.  Although my husband and I have now gone back 3 times, this time the only water we swam in was our pool.  There is river water that runs into the ocaen, which doesn\'t look or smell good. I feel like I should mention this since it kept us from swimming. There are lots of posts about this topic, but  I don\'t know anything factual or definitive.  Not sure we will return until we do know for sure.  I would have given it 4 stars if I knew all was good.

277365989.name: Nice town to go to for a day-trip
277365989.author: a TripAdvisor user
277365989.reviewBody: Nice little town with a good beach. Go farther north to avoid the crowds! The town itself is rather touristy but you can find the old Sayulita if you walk a bit. But that means also that there\'s lot\'s of restaurants and cafes in town. Good for a day-trip.

275983036.name: FUN, SUN and FOOD
275983036.author: a TripAdvisor user
275983036.reviewBody: I\'m hesitant to gush too much about Sayulita as even more tourists might ruin its appeal. A small Mexican beach town with tons of good food, amazing people, great bars, surfing, paddleboarding, etc

275978261.name: The Break Restaurant
275978261.author: a TripAdvisor user
275978261.reviewBody: On the beach with shade under palm trees. Great magaritas  and tapas. Large menu.  At end of street with many higher end tourist shops.

275294245.name: Great Beach
275294245.author: a TripAdvisor user
275294245.reviewBody: Wonderful water temperature and great surf! If you like to play around in the water, this is the beach for you.  Dont forget your sunscreen because the gringos were burning.

274872388.name: Shopping trip
274872388.author: a TripAdvisor user
274872388.reviewBody: loved the town! people were fabulous. Beautiful beach, good for surfing. The shopping was so much fun and it\'s only a 20 minute taxi ride from the resort.

273878084.name: Paradise found!
273878084.author: a TripAdvisor user
273878084.reviewBody: We took the bus out from PV - only 35 pesos each and runs every 20 minutes. \nThe beach is incredible, great sand, consistent waves for body boarding and a nice breeze. \nOnly complaint was the constant pestering by the beach vendors.

273410433.name: Felt like home again!
273410433.author: a TripAdvisor user
273410433.reviewBody: I can\'t get enough of this beautiful place. Every time I am near I have to drop by and it never gets old. It\'s so charming, so quaint, it brings out the hippy in me. If you\'re a surfer, this is paradise. Absolutely love the vibe in this cool corner of the world.

273109405.name: Sayulita Day Trip
273109405.author: a TripAdvisor user
273109405.reviewBody: Great little village through the jungle. I would recommend the bus as its very simple and kinda fun if you\'re with the right group. Must try surfing. Also check out the small beach called "playa de los meurtos" must walk around the beach to the left if facing the ocean and follow a dirt road. Cool secluded beach that isn\'t very far.

272398425.name: Sayulita Beach is a small beach in the middle of a cozy little town.
272398425.author: a TripAdvisor user
272398425.reviewBody: A wonderful small surfer\'s beach with good shopping and great food. The views are remarkable. The water and beach are very friendly.

272398154.name: Surfers paradise in Mexico
272398154.author: a TripAdvisor user
272398154.reviewBody: A melting pot of people, cultures and visiting competing sports men and women for surfering and paddleboarding

271988710.name: Busy but Beautiful
271988710.author: a TripAdvisor user
271988710.reviewBody: We spent a week at the beach. It was a little crowded, but it made for excellent people watching. The only inconvenience was that it was hard to dodge people in the waves when learning how to surf. There is so much to do in terms of shops to see and restaurants to try! Yes, there are stray dogs and street vendors, but I think it adds to the charm of the beach. It\'s rustic, not Cancun.

271663220.name: One of the best beaches I ever visited
271663220.author: a TripAdvisor user
271663220.reviewBody: This was the best holiday I ever had with my friends. We took a bungalow on top of the hill which had a small pool on the edge of the bungalow from where the whole Sayulita beach can be seen clearly. The beach had white sand and a lots of places and canopy\'s to sit under. This beach is a must visit if you are around. Just make sure you dont tan too much :D \n\nYou also have a boat trip from here to a small island in the middle of the sea and you have to jump in to water and swim to go inside the island which hides a small beach inside. This was a life time experience for me.

271566665.name: Smells...
271566665.author: a TripAdvisor user
271566665.reviewBody: Its a really nice beach where you can have a great time, however the main beach is crowded and the smell is almost unbearable, restaurants at the beach should be more interested in cleaning the beach, organizing surfers and swimmers but most importantly to reduce the sewer smell that sometimes cover the whole beach.

270794138.name: Disapointing
270794138.author: a TripAdvisor user
270794138.reviewBody: Well it has some good views around, but the beach stinks, locals are possesive with the surf spot, and there\u00b4s no safe food places to eat anywhere around, if you go, be prepared to fix your own food and it is advisable to have a good medical insurance.\n\navoid a place called el Jakal, 1 block from the beach on the north side if you don\u00b4t want to  get to the hospital in Mexico (Which i dont recommend).

270747657.name: Great little escape from the hubbub of PV
270747657.author: a TripAdvisor user
270747657.reviewBody: This is the place to go to if you want to avoid the hubbub of PV. In fact, if you can stay in Sayulita all the time, then it\'s even better. It\'s nice and quiet. the beach is popular with surfers and tourists who know better and prefer to venture off the beaten path. The beach is not "developed" and it may be lacking the "facilities" but what it\'s lacking in infrastructure it makes up in location and culture. Not to mention the laid-back atmosphere. Enjoy.

270480462.name: Great Beach
270480462.author: a TripAdvisor user
270480462.reviewBody: The beach at Sayulita is really good. Kind of crowded some days however, but still family oriented and lot of fun!

270428595.name: Lovely little town.
270428595.author: a TripAdvisor user
270428595.reviewBody: About an hour out of Puerto Vallarta is this little jewel.  We would have loved to have spent more time there.  The beach was beautiful, the people were friendly and the atmosphere was relaxed!!!  I hope we can spend about a week there next time!

270172146.name: surfing and great town atmosphere
270172146.author: a TripAdvisor user
270172146.reviewBody: Nice beach, just off the town.  Lots of food, shopping and of course the beach.  Well worth a day visit!

270058694.name: Great hidden gem. (Surfer and fishing town)
270058694.author: a TripAdvisor user
270058694.reviewBody:
We were told that when visiting Punta Mita, Mexico to go to Sayulita. This was a very cool town to visit. Highly recommend taking a day trip to the town. It is a hidden gem that most people don't know about. A small little surfer/fishing town. There are plenty of restaurants and a great shopping district. The view of the beach was great. The waves were big, and great for surfing. 

The shopping district was a great place to visit with some great architecture. Being a surfing town, people acted like there wasn't a care in the world, but we felt very safe at all times. 

I would recommend eating at Don Pedros. Corner of the shopping district on the beach. Great food and reasonably priced.  I would definitely go back for a day trip, but don't know if I would stay there.

269727031.name: Morning surf
269727031.author: a TripAdvisor user
269727031.reviewBody: Just went to surf one morning and did not get to stay long but looks like a sleepy fun town to spend a day!

269517295.name: Great walk end to end
269517295.author: a TripAdvisor user
269517295.reviewBody: Perfect morning stroll.  Took us an hour end to end and back. \nMake sure you go back in the evening for the sunset walk.

269511989.name: Neat place to viait
269511989.author: a TripAdvisor user
269511989.reviewBody: Been several times neat little place to visit for the day ! If you want to learn to surf there is many companies here to help you with that

269271559.name: Wonerfull village on the sea.
269271559.author: a TripAdvisor user
269271559.reviewBody: Quaint, beautiful village by the sea. Great beach and surfing. Charter rentals, beach chairs, food and drink service right on the beach. Nice town with lots of shady streets to explore the local shops. The vendors are absolutely non aggressive, and very friendly. We had lunch on the beach, rented surf boards, swam in the clear warm water. The beach lounges for the 2nd row were 100 pesos for 2 chairs and umbrella. A lot of people enjoying this town, the beach was very crowded and few if any Mexican locals around. It reminded us of a typical southern Cal beach in a tourist area. The visit is worth it, you could spend the day and enjoy every minute. We highly recommend this stop, about a hours drive north of Puerto Vallarta by cab for about 500.00 pesos.

268980728.name: Avoid Holly Week
268980728.author: a TripAdvisor user
268980728.reviewBody: Loved the beach but would recommend to avoid Holly Week. (Easter break) The beach becomes full of trash during this week but soon after Holly Week isover the beach receives a good cleaning.  Loved taking long walks in the early morning.....most mornings I would have the whole beach to myself. Lots of surfing and fishing takes place in the area. Waves action can be too hard for really young children.

268972753.name: Great beach...surfers and youngsters!!
268972753.author: a TripAdvisor user
268972753.reviewBody: Follow the beach past the town and to the "end"...you will find a private home and some cliffs and rock outcroppings...swim around them in the ocean and you will discover another very private, long beach that is totally worth the effort...an adventure!!

268971685.name: A nice day out
268971685.author: a TripAdvisor user
268971685.reviewBody: Spent the day there and loved the shops.  Had coffee & cake at a nice little bakery and lunch later on.  Nice beach to sit and watch surfers.\n

268739719.name: I don\u00b4t get the charm - except for two streets
268739719.author: a TripAdvisor user
268739719.reviewBody: I was disappointed in the town. There were dogs all over the place , many covered with mange. There were two streets that I thought were " cute" but that is all. There were some good stores on those streets. A Huichol store sticks out and another that was also filled with mexican crafts- more high end. I visited Sayulita about 15 years ago...and I thought it had potential. Our wedding party got sick eating fish tacos somewhere. I don\'t know the name of the restaurant, cause if I did I would post it too! Sorry, I hate to give a bad review of a Mexican town. But I think that the municipal government needs to get on the drainage issues and water issues.

268174157.name: Put your flip flops on and go!
268174157.author: a TripAdvisor user
268174157.reviewBody: Great small town with at least 25 places to eat. Rent a chair or chase lounge on the beach - 4 for 200 peso\'s and you sit waterside. The restaurant behind you will cater to your needs as far as beer, drinks and food - spend at least 2 hours watching some of the surfing, swimming, walking the beach and just relaxing.  Walk around the town for arties things and food, fast tacos to go, or sit down - you make the choice.

267965216.name: A great day-trip from Puerto Vallarta.
267965216.author: a TripAdvisor user
267965216.reviewBody: During our 2-week stay in PV, my wife wanted to see the "surfing beach", which we learned was @ Sayulita.  We took a regular bus from Walmart to Sayulita, about an hour\'s duration, through towns in between and the foot-hills of the Sierra Madre; 2 tickets one-way $60MX. It\'s about a 10-block walk from where the bus ride ends to the beach, through  a fairly typical Mexican town, but with a sort of a hippie-vibe, due to the beach-lovers and surfers.  I\'m not a beach-lover, but my wife is, and she went in the water, swimming but no surfing lessons or stuff of that kind.  I stayed on a lounger in the shade of our umbrella, rented for $200 MX for the day.  Lots of vendors, lots of people-watching, lots of relaxation for me. When we tired of this, we headed back into town for a good lunch, got on the bus again (they leave about every 15 minutes or so, the last one said to be about 9 PM). Frankly I enjoyed the bus-trip itself, for the scenery and just experiencing how the locals live their lives, the most.  Wife loved the beach scene.  We were both happy at the end of the day!

267814968.name: What You Expect from a Good Beach!
267814968.author: a TripAdvisor user
267814968.reviewBody: Vendors, crowd, waves!  Get there early to reserve a beach chair.  During the tourist season, the go quick.  Warm water.  Waves of varying height.  Great people watching!  The real surfers stay to the south. The tourists learning to surf are right in front of the crowd to the north.  Sand varies from soft powder to rough.  Enough variation to please everyone.

267635605.name: Surfing
267635605.author: a TripAdvisor user
267635605.reviewBody: Best place to learn to surf and hang out at Patricia\'s beach restaurant! The boggy boarding is really good you can catch some long waves and the break is smooth.

267595281.name: Surf and people watching
267595281.author: a TripAdvisor user
267595281.reviewBody: The little town of Sayulita is well known for its surfing and beachfront life. Its still relatively untraveled although it can become crowded in the winter season. The town and beach never disappoint.

267340702.name: Can\'t get much better
267340702.author: a TripAdvisor user
267340702.reviewBody: This beach is kept clean by volunteers, there\'s something for everyone, to a crowded party scene at the main beach to deserted stretches to the north.  Plenty of places to rent beach gear, chairs, and get food.  Shallow areas for kids to play, and a fun surf break.

267177045.name: Crowded and a bit of a mad house
267177045.author: a TripAdvisor user
267177045.reviewBody: I love this place when there are waves and you can surf. I wouldn\'t spend more than a day here unless you love a big party crowd. It has grown so much that I might suggest venturing down the beach a bit.

266662602.name: 6 of 8 got sick!!!
266662602.author: a TripAdvisor user
266662602.reviewBody: We have been going to Sayulita for five years, always the week after Easter.  We had never been sick and it was our favorite spot for a vacation.  This year, 6 of 8 got sick, ranging from 24 hour variety to 5 days and emergency room visit with blood in stool and vomit.  We are sad and will never go back.  A group from our home town was there at same time and 7 of 8 of them were ill.   A boat trip we booked had 15 out of 40 cancel due to illness(we were 2 of 15).  Something is wrong there and I would doubt that it can be explained honestly by the people who depend on tourism.  Since we drank no water(only bottled) and ate only at restaurants that we had eaten at in previous visits, I suspect it is an ocean problem.  There will be those that say they got sick and didn\'t go in ocean and I am sure that is true, but it doesn\'t prove that the ocean is safe.  It seemed that everyone we have spoken to about Sayulita lately has had a "sick" story.  I am grateful that the many friends that did not make the trip with us  were unable to come as I would have felt so guilty to have made them sacrifice a cherished vacation on such a terrible experience.  The little town is darling and the restaurants are delightful.   We loved you Sayulita but we must say Goodbye.

266353237.name: Nice beach
266353237.author: a TripAdvisor user
266353237.reviewBody: I am not sure if it is Pyrite or something else, but it looks like there are gold flecks in the sand. It is very cool. The water is warm. You can go pretty far out before it actually gets deep. It\'s a great place to learn how to paddle board and surf. But parts of the beach get very rocky. Also, it\'s not like the powdery white sand on the Eastern coast.

266258335.name: Amazing Surf Beach.
266258335.author: a TripAdvisor user
266258335.reviewBody:
Lots to do and see!
Vendors, massage, surf, boogie boards, resturants.... etc.

The waves get a little big when the swell in in - great for water fun... however one half of the beach has a rock bottom (not good for beginners).

266241736.name: Rocky beach
266241736.author: a TripAdvisor user
266241736.reviewBody: The beach has good waves but there are a lot of rocks. You gotta hit it early in the morning, otherwise it\'s packed.

266239849.name: Nice Beach, too crowded
266239849.author: a TripAdvisor user
266239849.reviewBody: Do yourself a favor and walk to way the north end of the beach if you\'re not looking to surf and want a peaceful spot to lay in the sun. It\'s rockier there, but much less crowded and no hawker every 30 seconds trying to sell you a trinket.

266090427.name: Spend the day!
266090427.author: a TripAdvisor user
266090427.reviewBody: The beach is expansive.  You can choose to bring all your own seating food and drinks, and there is plenty of private enough room, or you can do what we did which is to rent chairs from attached restaurants and have drink and food runners.  Good swimming, and sunning!

265957639.name: Nice Beach, but Touristy
265957639.author: a TripAdvisor user
265957639.reviewBody: The beach was nice, but having to chase off vendors every two minutes got old.  There are other area beaches that are not as commercial.

265955295.name: Beach
265955295.author: a TripAdvisor user
265955295.reviewBody: We walked to the beach after parking and the overwhelming smell and site of stagnant water at the beach sent us back to our vehicle. The streets were crowded and hard to maneuver for even my husband, a Mexico native. Very disappointing.

265759035.name: Quaint little beach town - off the beaten track
265759035.author: a TripAdvisor user
265759035.reviewBody: A short bus ride from PV is Sayulita Beach. We spent some time in Canada before heading to Mexico and 2 separate people told us to head over the Sayulita as it is a step back in time and not as busy as PV itself.\nThe beach is lovely, with clearer water than the PV beaches, and some quaint little restaurants and shops. Still not overly cheap, but a more "real" Mexican experience. \nIf you do take the buses from PV, make sure that you get one that has Sayulita on the windscreen, as other drivers will say they are going there, then will drop you 1\u00bd miles up the hill.

265657131.name: 13 out of 18 of us got sick!
265657131.author: a TripAdvisor user
265657131.reviewBody: No surprise! Village is cute, but filthy! Garbage everyone on streets, raw sewage dumping into the ocean at the most popular swim and surf beach. Dog poop all over streets and beach. Can\'t trust water, fruit, fish... E-coli like symptoms! Never going back.

265571231.name: Town Beach
265571231.author: a TripAdvisor user
265571231.reviewBody: The main beach had a small river flowing into the ocean and it smelt like sewage. In the surf line up you could smell it and we got out before we got sick.

265554556.name: Sayulita is dirty - swam in the ocean and got totally sick. The music and noise never stopped.
265554556.author: a TripAdvisor user
265554556.reviewBody: This was supposed to be a sleepy little mellow beach town. Ok so we ended up going two of the three weeks that are "busy" we were there the day before Easter and the week after. We could handle the crowds but the noise would not stop and on top of that after swimming we got sick. The water treatment plant doesn\'t work well and basically we got sick from unclean water being dumped back into the ocean. The treatment plant is in the middle of town right on the river that separates north from south. It smelled terrible and we would get wiffs of it while walking through town. The bothersome thing is that the locals know that you can get sick when swimming in the bay but they don\'t tell you that BEFORE you go. One hotel manager at the Kupuri told us oh ya - I had some friends here when people were getting sick from swimming in the bay so they just swam a Los Muertos (another close by beach). There were 4 other people who stayed at our hotel the previous week we were there and the doctor said they had gotten sick from swimming in the bay. I believe this is negligent on the people in charge of running the town. If you look at the roads in town there is a pharmacy every other door - this should tell us alone that this is a town to go to where lots of people get sick. Boo Sayulita! So sad as I was looking forward to going there for about 8 years.

265515503.name: Great
265515503.author: a TripAdvisor user
265515503.reviewBody: It was a pleasant beach ! Better than other beach in Puerto Vallarta that we had done in the week!\nWe rent a surf board and surf a bit, but it\'s nothing compare to Costa Rica\'s wave and beach for Surf! But I love the town and the style of it.! Lots of people, but every one is very nice and it\'s also as secure place :)

264689734.name: Swimmers beware
264689734.author: a TripAdvisor user
264689734.reviewBody: The town of Sayulitas is very cute.  It has a surfer/hippie vibe to it with plenty of little places to eat.  However the river running through town smelled of raw sewage which you could only smell in the proximity of the stream.  But the stream dumped out right next to the popular surfing and swimming beach.  I would hate to think of the fecal coliform count in the swimming area.  We hiked about a mile up the beach before we dared get in the water.

264579985.name: Over-crowded, too much peddling
264579985.author: a TripAdvisor user
264579985.reviewBody: If you want peace \'n quiet \'n relaxation, this is not the beach for you.  If you want gringo tourist action, drugs, and peddlers bugging you every few seconds with over-priced stufffff galore which some consider having fun.......then come contribute to the lunacy.  Vendors have people who don\'t speak spanish buffaloed !  Other than surfers locals go elsewhere.  The water in this bay is amongst the most contaminated in the world, which, of course is never mentioned by those promoting tourism.

263650696.name: Great area
263650696.author: a TripAdvisor user
263650696.reviewBody: Small markets and shops for the Adventurous shopper.  From the glass shops to the clothes shops there is something for everyone in this small Mexican Hideaway

263575599.name: Crazy, but fun
263575599.author: a TripAdvisor user
263575599.reviewBody: We were here during Easter week and town and the beach were crowded. Fun, but busy beach with lots of activity. Felt a little like EVERYONE was there, but it was a safe and fun family adventure. Nice wave break for beginners. It was easy to rent umbrellas, boards and get some ice cream. Fun spot.

263492032.name: Great beach for surfing (beginner) good vibes
263492032.author: a TripAdvisor user
263492032.reviewBody: Went for a daytrip there from Puerto Vallarta and as soon as arrived, felt that we should have chosen this place instead of PV. It had something, really good vibes there. Perfect for surfing lessons, not really for swimming though.

263163570.name: Great beach! Too many people!
263163570.author: a TripAdvisor user
263163570.reviewBody: This is a fantastic beach.  However, it\'s a bit overwhelming!  We arrived at 9:30 to surf and it was PERFECT!! Sandy ocean floor which made our crash landings super soft!  Not many people in the ocean and not many people on the beach. We did have to pay the surf company money to rent 2 chairs.  By 11:30 we were having a hard time surfing without hitting other people trying to surf, boogie board, body surf, or just swim.  It was crazy!  The beach was even crazier!  People were EVERYWHERE!  Venders were EVERYWHERE!  We were constantly saying, "no thank you" to the adults and kids selling things.  We did buy a few things but got tired of getting approached every second.  It was AMAZING for surfing and a fun area to swim in but the amount of people on the beach got to be too much for us!  Arrive early!!!  You can only use the bathrooms if you purchase something from the restaurant.  We purchased and none of us liked our food. I don\'t know the name of the restaurant. sorry!

262459760.name: A beautiful perfect!
262459760.author: a TripAdvisor user
262459760.reviewBody: There is nothing really to dislike about this beach. It has a perfect area for swimming, a perfect area for surfing, perfect surf and when its time to get some sun...well thats also perfect. The sunsets are incredible and the people and small town are too. I love that place and hope to go back again soon.

262347964.name: Walk carefully
262347964.author: a TripAdvisor user
262347964.reviewBody: Dirty, filthy, disgusting.  A drainage ditch i.e. river, flows directly into the ocean from the middle of the beach.  Dogs roam freely everywhere in town and on the beach.  Broken glass and litter everywhere on the beach.  Surfers too close together.  Numerous birds congregate just off shore, further contaminating the water.  If not for the sunsets, why bother going to the beach.

262097426.name: Paddle Board Competition
262097426.author: a TripAdvisor user
262097426.reviewBody: Great beach to have the whole family enjoy, very safe - Sunbrellas provided for a small fee, well worth visiting.

261929661.name: Great Beach and Great Surf
261929661.author: a TripAdvisor user
261929661.reviewBody: This is a great beach to relax on and chill out. The water is crystal clear and the waves are relatively easy so if you wanted to try to learn how to surf this would be the place. You can also rent beach chairs and have cocktails delivered to your chair.

261778796.name: Nice but very crowded
261778796.author: a TripAdvisor user
261778796.reviewBody: Came up from Nueva Vallarta for the day.  The main Sayulita beach was very nice but super crowded, way more than any of the beaches down by NV.  We ended up doing the short hike over to the beach at Los Muertos and it was much nicer - many fewer people, rocks for the kids to play on, only a few vendors, etc.

261773926.name: great surfing beach for beginners
261773926.author: a TripAdvisor user
261773926.reviewBody: It gets crowded here but that makes it fun.  The surf is great for beginners but if you want to surf at the larger outer break be ready to have to fight to ride without a crowd.

261768558.name: A little bit of Paradise
261768558.author: a TripAdvisor user
261768558.reviewBody: We come back to Sayulita Beach every other year. First it was day trips from Nueva Vallarta then a 25 hour visit and this time we stayed for a week. We love this laid back Surfer Beach. Even did some beginners surfing this time. We spend most if the day on the beach, drinking beer, eating mexican food, watching the surfers a little swimming and surfing, walking on the beach and a lot of people watching. It is total relaxation from our busy life at home. This is what we imagine Paradise to be.

261490687.name: Day trip from PV
261490687.author: a TripAdvisor user
261490687.reviewBody:
We had a lovely day at Sayulita!  The town looked interesting and I think it would be nice to stay over night to enjoy the restaurants there.
We rented a surf board from Patricia's rentals and were about use her beach chairs and umbrellas for free.
We caught the bus there from Walmart in PV and it took just over an hour each way.  
Reasonable surf, nice but very busy beach.

261467741.name: Nice waves!
261467741.author: a TripAdvisor user
261467741.reviewBody: Nice place to surf, excellent environment, fun place, warm temperature, people around selling all you need lol

261444726.name: Surfing beach
261444726.author: a TripAdvisor user
261444726.reviewBody: Took bus ride to this sleepy town about 45 miles from Puerto Vallarta.   Take the bus, it is $3.00 instead of $45. by cab.  The town looked like it was stuck in the 60\'s and there were beautiful hotels nestled in the side of the mountains.

261082241.name: Excellent Beach with something for all
261082241.author: a TripAdvisor user
261082241.reviewBody: Both my wife and I were really impressed with Sayulita in general, but the beach was the hilight.  There is shopping, bars and restaurants, surf schools, ice cream shops(gelato) all located next to or on the beach.  And it is not to large, but large enough where there is lots of room to grab a towel and bake all day, surf or swim.  I had 4 teenage girls 15 and 17, who found so much to do they were never bored.  Really awesome beach.  Just a note:  Sayulita is largely a english speaking town, so if you havent travelled much outside your country, this really is a perfect place to begin.  One of the most fun towns Ive been to in my life time.  Something for all.  Great food too.

261034254.name: Relaxed vibe on Sayulita Beach!
261034254.author: a TripAdvisor user
261034254.reviewBody: We stayed at Sayulita trailer park + bungalows...a bit down from the main beach. great sand, some waves, only a handful of vendors, and dog-friendly. Loved it!

260888613.name: BEST BEACH!
260888613.author: a TripAdvisor user
260888613.reviewBody: Even though we stayed in Bucerias (very disappointing beach)we drove daily into Sayulita.  As nice as the beach is, the streets are a nightmare and parking is very limited (restaurants take up parking space with their tables).  We once had the audacity to saunter into town at 11am and there was absolutely no parking so we had to leave (actually drove onto San Pancho which was charming with a nice beach).  Get there by 9am and you will find parking.  We rented chairs/umbrella/table/surf board for 400 pesos each day.  The atmosphere is unique with a steady stream of venders (clothing/silver/food/musicians).  There are plenty bars and restaurants on the beach. On the far south end of the beach one can charter a boat/jet ski.  The waves are not consistent and huge groups of surfers have to wait for the waves to appear, but when they do they are a good size.  One day the water was filled with jelly fish and many surfers got stung, so a good idea would be to pack a bottle of Calomine  lotion in case of emergency.  All in all, our favourite beach by far!

260778161.name: Excellent day trip from Vallarta
260778161.author: a TripAdvisor user
260778161.reviewBody: Fantastic Beach with the best surfing around! Lots of little restaurants with great prices (right on the beach)

260620830.name: Great little town
260620830.author: a TripAdvisor user
260620830.reviewBody: I was travelling by myself and this town is so gorgeous. The beach was amazing with this beautiful moutain around. I was walking in the town and its a safe place to be alone. The people are awesome.

260383451.name: Tripping on Vitamin D
260383451.author: a TripAdvisor user
260383451.reviewBody: By far Sayulita has the best beaches I\'ve ever visited. Hubs did some body surfing and tried out a board. Several times we sat under an umbrella by a bar and drank Pacifico and Corona while we counted our good fortune. I bought cloths and souvenirs from wandering venders and felt more relaxed than I have in years. At La Playa de las Muertes, the waves undulate gently and the salty water kept me afloat under the afternoon sun. I bought mahi-mahi on a stick from a little stand and savored it while sitting among the gravestones at the colorful and joyful cemetery. One day we hiked through the forest and ducked through a cave to find a private beach, where I watched pelicans dive for fish while hubs played in the surf. Everywhere we turned there was a gorgeous view. There\'s plenty of beach to explore, and we put in many miles each day with sand between our toes. Oh, Sayulita, we\'ll be back!

260205598.name: Liked the beach, but other\'s better
260205598.author: a TripAdvisor user
260205598.reviewBody: The main beach was a little bit busy for our taste. We went to Los Muertos and learned that there were lots of other great beaches close by. My girls took a surfing lesson on this beach and had a great time. Perfect small waves.

259475508.name: Nice beach
259475508.author: a TripAdvisor user
259475508.reviewBody: Nice beach but there are better ones if you\'re willing to hike a bit toward Playa Los Muertos or even better by continuing another 20 minutes towards Playa Carricitos.

259421586.name: Great little Mexican town
259421586.author: a TripAdvisor user
259421586.reviewBody: We really liked this town, it has a wonderful Mexican feel with a small square, small church and lots of walkable coble streets. We really enjoyed all the small shops, restaurants and street vendors. There are a number of open restaurants on the beach. This is a surfer\'s town with lots of tourists but very friendly.

259143271.name: Amazing Oasis in Paradise
259143271.author: a TripAdvisor user
259143271.reviewBody: A 45 minute bus ride from Puerto Vallarta Airport, I arrived at an enclave of serenity \nand stunning oasis in Sayulita. The rooms are simple but comfortable and clean. The location is PERFECT...... amazing beach front property with great restaurants nearby (try Pizza Venezia). If you are lucky, you may be able to reserve and stay at Casa Guitron ... good luck !

259133209.name: Much better too choose from
259133209.author: a TripAdvisor user
259133209.reviewBody: Was not a fan of the beach.  The town is amazing but when you get near the beach it was not very attractive.  Vendors have staked out most of the sand and you will constantly be hit up for goods/services as you are trying to enjoy the beach.  South end of the beach is where the boats go out but then can drift further up the beach if they don\'t get out passed the waves and can be dangerous.

258460349.name: Amazing beach with a lot of dog poop
258460349.author: a TripAdvisor user
258460349.reviewBody: I was sad to see such a beautiful beach with dogs pooping all over, it was disgusting!!!! Dogs should not go to this paradise, can\'t the mayor do something about it?. There is a toilette in the beach but the sewer water are just outside the bathroom, it stinks and  it is smelly....

258027601.name: meh
258027601.author: a TripAdvisor user
258027601.reviewBody: Sayulita may have had some sort of funky charm 10 or 15 years ago but now it is just another dusty tourist town and the small crowded beach has little to recommend it.

257904401.name: Enjoyable, Low key.  Families and surfers.
257904401.author: a TripAdvisor user
257904401.reviewBody: Relaxed pace.  Almost vacant on a overcast, cooler day.  Our hotel provided beach chairs, towels and umbrellas.  Family oriented.  Enjoyed watching the surfers and paddle boarders.

257759027.name: surfers can have it
257759027.author: a TripAdvisor user
257759027.reviewBody: The beach in the smallish bay seems protected. I would not enjoy having to sit in the shade and wit for someone to kill and animal or m

257532893.name: Great surfing and beach, watch out for floaters
257532893.author: a TripAdvisor user
257532893.reviewBody:
Four of us recently spent 5 days in Sayulita, three days on the beach and two of those three days in the water for surfing and body-boarding. Overall, the main beach front is very nice, scenic, and all the tropical bliss you could expect... but, contrary to some of the posts we read, there were definitely "floaters" (aka, poop including toilet paper) trickling along a small river as you walk north towards the trailer park area depositing into the bay. One of the days, the water in that river wasn't high enough so nothing made it to the beach. Still, it was enough to give us pause.

We went to Hotel Hafa for drinks (go there for drinks) where we struck up conversation with a local wedding photographer / bartender. He'd been in Sayulita for 6 months and we asked if what we saw in the river by the beach was actually what we thought it was, he said "yes, and you can imagine how bad it gets when it's the rainy season".

Do not let this gross-ness keep you from visiting Sayulita and the beach. When you see it in person, it'll all make sense and you'll understand where to go to avoid it. Beside, Playa de los Muertos and Hidden Beach aren't afflicted from this issue and they are an easy walk from the main beach. 

Have fun, bring suntan lotion and cipro, and definitely go surfing.

257510963.name: Wonderful, clean beach
257510963.author: a TripAdvisor user
257510963.reviewBody: We have been coming to Mexico for 10 years and never ventured to Sayulita. What a wonderful day. The bus ride from PV is about an hour but certainly worth it.

257510075.name: Great Beach
257510075.author: a TripAdvisor user
257510075.reviewBody: Always worth the trip so Sayulita!  Love this beach, watching the surfers, enjoyed some paddle boarding and take a walk thru the cemetery on the far south side to the next beach over, wonderful.

257508533.name: La Penita, San Pancho, Sayulita
257508533.author: a TripAdvisor user
257508533.reviewBody:
Another good day trip $40 US dollars. 
Thank you Hugo for the safe drive down to La Penita Market first and nice stroll through 
the market and a pretty picture of the beach.
Next to San Pancho and a nice tour of a school that recycles everything and give the
kids a chance at an education. 
Next to Sayulita the surfing spot great  restuarants on the beach to watch surfers and 
nice walk through the streets.
Picked up at 9:15 at Walmart and dropped off at the Condo at 5:30 .
Thanks again

257463766.name: Beautiful, fun. and relaxing!
257463766.author: a TripAdvisor user
257463766.reviewBody: This is the main beach that runs along the Pacific in front of the  village of Sayulita. The south end is where all the small, local fishing boats come in. A little farther along is the "surfer" beach, perfect for beginners ( and there are several excellent surf schools right there ) and also Stand-up Paddleboarding.  The water is warm and the waves are fairly gentle. You can rent beach chairs and umbrellas  and watch the action in the water, as well as all the people walking by. Food venders walk by occasionally. This is the busiest area of the beach, in front of Don Pedro\'s restaurant.  As you walk farther north, the crowds thin out, but be aware that the water also gets\' less "gentle".  Once you have crossed the river, there is the possibility of rip tides- so not as great for family swimming. Ask the locals what the current water conditions are.

257369449.name: Surfing beach
257369449.author: a TripAdvisor user
257369449.reviewBody: Clean and nice surfing beach, good for beginers as well, cozy hipster place to chillax and party with friends as well

257303798.name: Great beach!
257303798.author: a TripAdvisor user
257303798.reviewBody: Great beach - surfing is hit or miss but still a fun, chill spot. There are many places to eat along the beach...just make sure to ask if their ice is purified so you don\'t get sick.

257177661.name: You really need to enjoy the beach-y lifestyle, and even then . . . take the bus.
257177661.author: a TripAdvisor user
257177661.reviewBody: It\'s a dusty town.  I positively reviewed both the Sayulita Central hotel, and the Sayulita Cafe, but the town itself I don\'t need to return to. Parking is awful, and even when we found a place, we almost had our car towed.  The towing guy was quick to acknowledge (once he figured out I speak Spanish) we had not violated any ordinance, but apparently we were inconvenient to a business.  By the time we got to our car (parked across the river because there was no parking anywhere near our hotel), the car was on the flatbed, and it took $50 to get him to release it.  Just a shake-down.  As generously as we had tipped every place we actually visited, this left a profoundly sour taste in our mouths.  It holds some charm for folks who love the beachy, sandy communities, but just beware.  You get no credit for being friendly or generous. I am told the bus from Vallarta is convenient and cheap, ao that might be the way to go.  But the ease with which these folks took us for granted made me want to avoid it in the future.  Which we will; we live here two months each year, but won\'t go back to Sayulita.

257087401.name: Sayuita Surf / Sun / Shopping / Sangrhias / Sexy Beach
257087401.author: a TripAdvisor user
257087401.reviewBody: Hoping the Title says it all but if not? Yes great restaurants from high end to carts, great shopping for clothing or souveniers.  Lots of B&B\'s , small hotels, vacation rentals, lots of fun on the beach for young travelers and older travelers, great family beach too, Restaurants rent their lounges on the beach so if you don\'t want to pay $200.00 pesos for an umbrella and two loungers bring your own.  You can buy a good umbrella on the beach for $30.00 ? so I would go that route .  Food and drinks on the beach are good , but you can bring a cooler full of cervazes and food and be just as happy, lots of vendors on the beach but I have to say that the clothing they are selling on the beach is some of the nices in the bay, so if you see something you like ? buy it because it may not be on the next beach.  The clothing stores tend to be pricey so look on the beach before you head into town to buy a new dress or ??? Over all it is a great place to hangout for the day or a week ( if you don\'t mind lots and lots of noise at night)  there is a place called Calypso restaurant it is upstairs from the center of town .. GREAT FOOD good prices too

256901080.name: Gorgeous beach!
256901080.author: a TripAdvisor user
256901080.reviewBody: Awesome beach!!! Very busy but a definite must see when on Mexico! Love the surfers! Great experience! Just be prepared to pay to use bathrooms and showers!

256894820.name: Greatest beach in Mexico
256894820.author: a TripAdvisor user
256894820.reviewBody: We love Sayulita beach! From the bustling South end to the quiet North side! Easy hikes to remote beaches too.  Just watching the surf and the water is so clean and clear!! Great days for paddleboarding too!

256453300.name: Has It All
256453300.author: a TripAdvisor user
256453300.reviewBody: Lots of good sand, waves for surfing, and some eateries on the beach.  It is more crowded than several other beaches we have visited but still a must.

256450806.name: Beautiful but busy!
256450806.author: a TripAdvisor user
256450806.reviewBody: Sayulita beach is gorgeous but very busy due to all the restaurants and bars. It is a great place to eat, surf and socialise but not to chill. If your looking for a quiet swim and chill I\'d reccomend los muertos, it\'s just a 8 min walk from sayulita beach, along the way there is a lovely hotel/resturant called villa amore, have nachos and a cocktail here and soak up the views.

256408880.name: lazy and happy town
256408880.author: a TripAdvisor user
256408880.reviewBody: not crowded and many of the shops are more upscale as they are owned and run by Europeans. Only drink bottled water and make sure the ice being used is bagged ice.\n

256158789.name: Loved this little town and beautiful beach
256158789.author: a TripAdvisor user
256158789.reviewBody: Water is clearer here with a more blue color town is known for surfing and body boarding. Tons of chairs on the beach you can use if buying snacks or drinks from the beach restaurants. Clean unique town very trendy with tons of little shops..mostly run by expats so a little more pricey but beautiful. I highly recommend it.

256085753.name: Anyone else get sick?
256085753.author: a TripAdvisor user
256085753.reviewBody: It seemed like a lot of people were sick around us with "flu" symptoms last week while we were there. Did anyone else experience it?

255993858.name: colorful town
255993858.author: a TripAdvisor user
255993858.reviewBody: surf beach and tons of fun there.\nI don\'t like the idea to see dogs on the beach and doing poop by the sand.

255906550.name: Not impressed
255906550.author: a TripAdvisor user
255906550.reviewBody: Sayulita was, I suppose, just fine, but I was not impressed. We were not totally happy without beach in Vallarta, so schlepped here as w e were told it would be better. Cannot say that it was.

255836183.name: beautiful beach town
255836183.author: a TripAdvisor user
255836183.reviewBody: beautiful, not touristy like Puerto Vallarta. Lovely shops with original artwork, clothing and jewellery. Lovely juice bars, small cafes and lots of surfing lessons!

255692340.name: Pay this place a visit
255692340.author: a TripAdvisor user
255692340.reviewBody: Spent about 5 hours their, very laid back, good bargains and authentic Mexican food. Use pesos for the best values but dollars are OK

255639336.name: Compared to What?
255639336.author: a TripAdvisor user
255639336.reviewBody:
Square peg in a Round hole!!  Compared to the below freezing temps back home, this beach was sublime, but the reality is:
This beach gets crowded.
The north end of the beach is cleaner but has pretty strong surf  - great for the surfers, but not so great for swimming or getting in to cool off.  Be prepared to dive two or three crashes before you get out past the breaking waves - then you have to get back in!!  My husband went in a few times, but I only went in once - unlike other beaches in Hawaii or Costa Rica where we both enjoyed the body surfing and snorkling as well.  (no snorkling here)
The south end of the beach is calmer, but the sand is muddy, the fishing boats fleet here, and so do all the other people who want to aviod the big waves.  
The center portion of the beach is populated!!  Beach chairs and umbrellas front the main beach accesses from the town.  Locals set up their own vending stations.  The OXXO store is a good place to buy your drugs, and I don't mean pharmacia - ( We were approached 4 times in 2 weeks to purchase drugs from a back pack) 
There are a couple of bathrooms facilities along the beach -  some cared for by locals who charge 5 pesos or so for using them.
This beach gets a lot of dogs out for their daily excercise, especially Sunday when everyone brings their dog (s).  It is fun to watch, but saw only one guy in two weeks actually pick up his dog's feces.
Thank fully the tidal surf washes it all away every night, so the beach stays fairly clean.  Also be prepared to not have a moment's rest.  Obviously, there has to be an ecomony for the locals, but the vending up and down the beach gets tiresome after a while.  You can only say - " No gracias " so many times.  One guy actually came right up to me, knelt down and looked under my visor to see if I was awake.  Thankfully, we had a pool, so it ended up not so bad, but I would have not enjoyed this particular holiday without the pool backup.

255596728.name: Something for everyone
255596728.author: a TripAdvisor user
255596728.reviewBody: Fun beach to relax, sunbathe, watch the fishermen,buy from vendors who walk up and down the beach, boogie board or surf.

255568187.name: Average Beach - Lots of Surfers
255568187.author: a TripAdvisor user
255568187.reviewBody: Sayulita is a surfer beach, so you have to be careful if you are out in the water - try for a beach North of the main surfing beach if you are a swimmer or for a more peaceful experience.

255352837.name: Good waves, good people
255352837.author: a TripAdvisor user
255352837.reviewBody: The beach was fairly crowded, but everyone was friendly and having a good time so it was OK. Also went to Los Muertos beach nearby, which is smaller and quieter with gentler surf.

255321996.name: First time back in 7yrs
255321996.author: a TripAdvisor user
255321996.reviewBody: Always loved the beach here,   but the changes were not pleasant, gone is the sleepy little fishing village, now its a tourist destination and lots of restaurants on the beach with chairs and umbrella\'s, you have to pay to sit in the shade except for Captain Hook\'s   \n  The venders are everywhere and approach you even when sitting inside a restaurant.   I know they need to make money but it was very annoying   Shame its not the same, still lovely to watch the surfers and scout for a whale.

254769794.name: You Gotto see this place
254769794.author: a TripAdvisor user
254769794.reviewBody: We went for a drive and ended up here! What a change from PV. Come for the beach and when the sun has set wander the town and try a restaurant. We came back the next day for more.

254734117.name: Surf\'s Up!
254734117.author: a TripAdvisor user
254734117.reviewBody: This beautiful surf beach with surfers in their element and many more learning how to master the craft sits magically in a scenic bay surrounded by hotels, surf shops, restaurants, bars and talented artisans who hand design and produce unique arts and crafts. A cool beach to visit. Go for a day or book into sayulita for a couple of nights. Great culture!

254590097.name: Disappointed...wish I had come 5 years ago
254590097.author: a TripAdvisor user
254590097.reviewBody:
For a long time I've wanted to come to Sayulita. I had heard such wonderful things about the lovely little fishing village.
So this February, we booked two weeks and was I surprised by the crowds of people at the beaches, in town everywhere. 

Luckily we stayed up the hill about 10 minute walk out of town so it was quite a bit quieter but at night the music was so loud we sometimes heard it till 1:30 in the morning. We visited San Pancho to the north which we liked a lot better a much more laid-back scene didn't charge for the chairs on the beach, lovely little restaurants. 

Many people we talked to who were repeats said  Sayulita was much noisier and busier then their previous visits.

254582760.name: It has lost its charm
254582760.author: a TripAdvisor user
254582760.reviewBody: It has been several years since we last visited Sayulita.  If you like crowded beaches and umbrellas so close to each other if you put your arms out you would touch the person next to you , then this is the place for you. We found a couple of loungers that didn\'t look as though they were going to fall apart .  The waiter informed us it was 100 pesos for the use of them plus we couldn\'t eat or drink anything we had of our own, not that we had anything. Lots of people taking surfing lessons .  We did enjoy watching people surfing but we will not be back it was way to busy for us.

254121135.name: To be young again !
254121135.author: a TripAdvisor user
254121135.reviewBody: Ahhh, Sayulita Beach! I usually go once a year so this year I thought I would write a review. We took the buses from Punta Negra to Downtown P.V. to Sayulitas for a day trip since it has been cloudy this week. Since the surf has been high, the opportunity to see surfers in action prompted me to take this trip. Fyi. in 2015 the bus from Mismaloya is 8pesos, the city buses are 7.5p, and the bus from Ave Las Palmas Walmart to Sayulita\'s is 35p. The fare to Sayulitas drops as you get closer I hear.  Anyway, the bus we rode on was more comfortable than the city buses. Cushy seats and music ! :). We went on a Friday so as we walked toward "downtown" Sayulita\'s from where the bus "terminal" is, there was a "farmers/flea" type market going on that morning. Since we had arrived late morning, early lunch time, we had lunch at the RiverCafe and then walked around town where the wives shopped and the guys headed towards the beach to watch the surfing action. The waves didn\'t disappoint and neither did the shopping and surfing. As a baby boomer in my late 60\'s I surfed the east coast beaches until I enlisted and went on the Southeast Asian Tour. Sayulita\'s reminds me of what the surfing life was in the 60\'s in Calif and N.Y., N.J. shore towns. Young people with surf boards and the beach was the focus during the day.\nThe youthful atmosphere includes the colorful buildings, the young surfer carving the waves, and now the paddle boarders joining in with the occasional bogey boarder. It was fun watching the surfers while our wives visited every shop or bought from the beach vendors that smelled the "open to buy" vibe our wives emitted. You can rent a chair, you can rent a surf, paddle or bogey board. My only compliant is that they charge by the day not hour ! So it is 200p or nothing. Like any beach town there is an occasional riff raft working the beach but it is not the Mexican vendors. A young youth tried to sell me a box of cigars he "found" . Our wives got some great deals on the beach vs the shops on necklaces. My wife got a great deal on a purse in a shop vs a vendor so as you can see, the shopping is everywhere. The surf school youth were very helpful and you can take in a surfing lesson if you wish. I recommend bringing a mat, towel and beach chair to enjoy the beach. The beach is public but not the chairs !  I also recommend bottle water and stay away from where the river flows into the ocean if it has recently rained (dirtier water). Like the title says: "To be young again"  because if I was in my teens-30\'s, I would relive an "Endless Summer" experience here, alternating with downtown P.V. living. OH one last thing you have to eat a CHOCO BANANA ! You know the concept is good when imitators pop up. A local legend that has grown into a casual restaurant but you can still order from the take out booth, sit on the improved local plaza ringed with restaurants. If you are look)ing for a beach front restaurant, the most elegant is (Don Pablo\'s? or Don Pancho\'s?) which has a bar and tables inside and outside on the left side of the beach as you look at it. Enjoy the day or Stay regardless it is a different vibe than other parts of Puerto Vallarta/ Navarit Area.

253993728.name: Quint town
253993728.author: a TripAdvisor user
253993728.reviewBody: we took a taxi from our hotel to this town.  It has lots of souvenir shops and restaurants.  We felt safe walking around here for the couple of hours we were there.  There were lots of good waves for surfing if that is what you are looking for.  It was very humid there.  Take pesos if you want to buy things as that is all they will accept.  Enjoyed the afternoon there.\n\n

253417515.name: Beautiful, long beach to walk and enjoy watching the surfers
253417515.author: a TripAdvisor user
253417515.reviewBody: The beach is soft and cool on which to walk and you can log a lot of steps while enjoying a gorgeous view!

252996702.name: This was the fifth visit to Sayulita. I was always concerned with my son\'s safety. And mine was always assumed. not this
252996702.author: a TripAdvisor user
252996702.reviewBody: I was assaulted. I was kidnapped. The police did not help. They charged me with theft of some strange man\'s cell phone. They arrested me. They assaulted me. They stole from me. In the end I paid $5000 pesos and left with a black eye and bloody lip. Never going back! Been going here for 5 years and never once feared for my life. Everything has changed. Do not walk alone. Ever!

252973699.name: Good option for surf and SUP
252973699.author: a TripAdvisor user
252973699.reviewBody: The Beach of Sayulita is very good for surf and SUP, sunsets could be amazing too and the best time of the day to enjoy it is early in the morning. On my opinion there are too much stones and there are also too many dogs with nobody looking after them are what they do, I love dogs but don\'t like a beach as a dog\'s toilet. If you really want to enjoy the Beach go to some other close to Sayulita like "Los Muertos", "Careycitos", "Patzcuarito", "Punta Monterrey" or even "San Pancho", among many others.

252965679.name: Crowded but fun
252965679.author: a TripAdvisor user
252965679.reviewBody: Nice sandy surf with TONS of action - vendors, restaurants and people - crowded beginner surf location, but fun.

252836231.name: Excellent place to escape from everything
252836231.author: a TripAdvisor user
252836231.reviewBody: If you are that kind of a tourist that enjoys a beach with great sunsets, then Sayulita is the best place in Jalisco. It\u00b4s way calmer than Puerto Vallarta and conviniently close. Although it is true that you see many American and European tourists, you get a more chill vibe from the locals who dont seek to harass you to sell you anything. You\u00b4ll friend beautiful stores to buy original souvenirs, a great French bakery very close to the beach (I dont remember exactly where but since the city centes is small you will be able to find it easily) and the tianguis there sell the best aguas in Mexico (try the agua with cucumber and lemon - so refereshing!!)

252730152.name: such a fun place!
252730152.author: a TripAdvisor user
252730152.reviewBody: locals are very friendly and they come around and sell little suvineers on the beach. Sit infront of Captain Cooks and theyll serve you all day. We stay for 1 week but even taking a day trip is enough. There\'s so much to do, horseback ridiing for 250-300 pesos, so much food, shopping, fishing (choose jose), fourwheeling, and so much more. Surfing is very popular for this village. If you need luxary, this isnt for you. Sayulita is overall clean but its dirt roads and locals. Going to Sayulita is my families favorite part of our vacation.

252529880.name: Quaint, friendly
252529880.author: a TripAdvisor user
252529880.reviewBody: Loved it and would go back in a heartbeat no high rise hotels. Super cheap and easy to shop very safe to walk alone

252497419.name: This beach glitters like fine jewelry.
252497419.author: a TripAdvisor user
252497419.reviewBody: Beautiful beach that reminds us of Puerto Vallarta 40 years ago. The sand has minute particles of pyrite(fools gold) so it shines like something from Tiffany\'s windows. This metal also adds to reflections of walkers and people...ideal for painters or artists of any persuasion. The ocean stays\nshallow for a long way making this an ideal beach for young surfers to learn. Go ... you won\'t be disappointed.

252439417.name: Great surfing Beach
252439417.author: a TripAdvisor user
252439417.reviewBody: Not a place to swim, especially for the inexperienced..swimmer..\nGreat afternoon...\nLots of places to eat on the beach..as little pricier than small towns in the area..but great for people watching & shopping..

252314709.name: Fabulous beach and town
252314709.author: a TripAdvisor user
252314709.reviewBody: Can hardly wait to get back here !  The people, the beach, the food . . Impossible to choose a favorite thing about this place.   Very laid back and relaxed atmosphere.   Several local eateries bringing in fresh fish cooking to order.  Beyond wonderful !

252268109.name: Nice atmosphere
252268109.author: a TripAdvisor user
252268109.reviewBody: We were just there for a few hours and it seemed like a very, laid back type of place.  They were just getting ready for a festival, which we didn\'t stay for.  There was one shop we went into, where the artist was working on a picture.  There were many, very nice painting in there.

252094669.name: In love with this town
252094669.author: a TripAdvisor user
252094669.reviewBody: I actually am going to move here to live in Sayulita, perfect little art/culture town that leads to a gorgeous, huge beach. Had a beer in a cool little beach side bar and it just made the day complete.

252023586.name: Avoid this non-Mexican city
252023586.author: a TripAdvisor user
252023586.reviewBody: Just got back from PVR Jan 31 2015. I have been to Mexico 10 or 11 times. I was told to go to this small, cool, surfing village. What I found was a rather large town full of overpriced restaurants, yoga studios, jewelry shops, golf carts zipping around, real estate shops and bank machines....easily the most pretentious place I have been to in Mexico. The beach is dirty, the water is dirty, and we saw a number of dead fish washed up on shore.....maybe due to the raw sewage pumped into the bay? We saw more beach vendors in 2 hours here than 5 days in PVR. Went to a restaurant to use bathroom and noted the special of the day....35 USD for shrimp or 22 USD for beef stroganoff ! Could not leave this place soon enough. Beaches south of PVR are so much nicer.

251726199.name: Small picturesque village !!!
251726199.author: a TripAdvisor user
251726199.reviewBody: This small village is very picturesque, about an hour from Puerto Vallarta, you have to take the highway to Punta de Mita, actually you chnage to a different state Tepic. To enjoy this place you must walk around  there\'s a lot of option to eat a lot, the beach is very close just one block to the main street.
