There\'s a lot of things to see like art gallery, souvenirs speacilly one dedicated to the dead but fun like mexicans only can do that, and try the ice creams. Enjoy it is unique

251672867.name: Best Beach in PV Area
251672867.author: a TripAdvisor user
251672867.reviewBody: While we didn\'t try all the beaches in the area - we did feel that this was the best one that we tried. The best waves and the best sight-seeing around

251657138.name: Prepare for the pedlars
251657138.author: a TripAdvisor user
251657138.reviewBody: You have to take the attitude that the pedlars are just trying to make a living.  But, it does get a little wearisome saying "no thank you" to the same pedlars over and over throughout the day.  Also, see if your rental provides an umbrella and chairs - otherwise, you must pay to use the ones already provided by the various businesses.

251645343.name: Surfer vibe, lots to look at
251645343.author: a TripAdvisor user
251645343.reviewBody: We spent a couple of beautiful days under a sun umbrella on the beach at Sayulita, just down from the main town.  It isn\'t a serene, deserted beach, no.  It is a beach of constant visual entertainment.  Beautiful scenery, with diving birds and verdant hillside on it\'s southern edge.  All ages of people, from the very beautiful young people, to the very beautiful local families, to the varied vendors, to the retired Canadians and Americans playing with their grandchildren in the surf.\nThe water is warm, and the waves at the southern end were manageable, but one has to keep an eye on them.  Of course, sunset is the best time.  Lovely memory.

251529445.name: Pretty setting v. Tourist trap
251529445.author: a TripAdvisor user
251529445.reviewBody: This old fishing village is set on a beautiful beach.  The drive through the jungle from Punta de Mita was quite pretty.  We hired a driver and would recommend it highly.  Not easy driving.  Roads are not well - lit after dark and shoulders are narrow.  Lots of kitschy shops and pushy vendors hawking their wares.  No lack of restaurants and taco stands.  We ate at Don Pedro\'s and had a great meal.  See my restaurant review.  It had a funky bohemian feel and was populated with a mixture of older tourists, families and the surfer crowd.    There were a few artisanal shops, but were few and far between.

251518683.name: Very pretty but getting super crowded.
251518683.author: a TripAdvisor user
251518683.reviewBody: I love the warm water and the feel of the sand. The surf break is fun (if the locals aren\'t rude and run you off) and the view is beautiful.\nThe street vendors have fun quality goodies to buy but they will steal from you every chance they get with the exchange rate. Bring pesos.

251362135.name: Love it!
251362135.author: a TripAdvisor user
251362135.reviewBody: Great, quaint surfing ( small waves) village away from PV. If you need a break from the commercial, big hotel aspects of PV, this is a place worth visiting!

251342689.name: yep
251342689.author: a TripAdvisor user
251342689.reviewBody: it\'s a beach. It\'s fantastic.Great surf learning spot. Next time I may rent a board. Lots of families, cafes, etc.

251333601.name: Quaint town
251333601.author: a TripAdvisor user
251333601.reviewBody: Loved this small town - no big chains, very local in small stores, locally made items.  Good taco\'s and drinks.  Great to watch surfers and to learn to surf.  We will be back to stay next time.

251179089.name: Not the best beach out there
251179089.author: a TripAdvisor user
251179089.reviewBody: Visited the town of Sayulita during our anniversary trip to Mexico last November. We really enjoyed the town but the beach was nothing to write home about. First impression was the fishy smell. The beach was mostly vendors and was really busy. I recommend taking a quick walk to Playa los Muertos, there are a few vendors there but the beach was only occupied with two families.

251027313.name: Amazing Day
251027313.author: a TripAdvisor user
251027313.reviewBody:
We were staying in Neuvo and decided to take ourselves over to Sayulita by bus.
If you are staying in the hotel zone in NV you can catch one of the little local taxi/buses that go to the smaller Walmart on the main highway. Pay when you get out 8pesos. Wait at the same bus stop for the green Compostela Bus. This bus will take you all the way to Sayulita (takes about hour and a bit). The bus seats were rickety the bus was packed and it was great fun. Lovely trip over. Bus drops you to the 'Bus Station' - this is also same place you get the bus back. Lots of seats and covered area to wait (and loads better than our stops in the UK!).
Easy nice walk down to the beach, just follow everyone else. Once over the river all the side roads lead down to the beach.
We stopped in Chocobanas for some brekkie then spent the day on the beach.
When we went, the beach was spotless. quite crowded in the main surfing areas but with a lovely chilled vibe. We walked the length go the beach, with a stop off at the Miramar beach bar (which is right next to the nesting turtles) and the sea just got greener and bluer.
Sit and watch the world and the Candyman go by. There are clean loos at the side of the Beach OxXO for a small fee (i think it was about 5pesos)
On the way back, just ask the driver to put you off at the small Walmart for Neuvo Vallarta (if you are staying in PV it goes back all the way into town) and just wait at the side of the road (seems daunting at first but its great fun) for a NV bus back.
A great day put away from the resorts etc. Would definitely go again and would love to stay up in that area.

251002468.name: Unique Beach
251002468.author: a TripAdvisor user
251002468.reviewBody: We stayed at Iberostar Playa Mita and when we told some of the help, that worked there, they called it a "Hippy Beach".  And this was so close to the truth.  Sayulita is a Surfer Beach.  Good waves and was fun watching all the people trying to catch a good wave.  There is also a camp site on the beach where people put up pop up tents and spend days.  The beach is a nice walking beach and we enjoyed watching all the activities going on.\n\nThe small town of Sayulita has some good restaurants which set their tables up in the streets, so it is not a good idea to bring a car into town as you will have a hard time trying to find a place to part.  We took a taxi and were glad we did.  They also have little shops which are fun.  We went during the day, but I would bet the place gets rock\'n later on in the evening.

250977015.name: Get up stand up surf place on beach - be aware of consequences
250977015.author: a TripAdvisor user
250977015.reviewBody: Please be aware of this company if you want to rent a surf board.  Our daughter paid for an hour rental and after 10 minutes her board broke.  They made a scene, brought the Mexican police to have us pay for their worn board.  We had to pay $100USD. It was an awful way to run a business.  \n\nWe loved the artsy beach town and had so much fun exploring. It was so disappointing to be taken advantage of by these people running the shack.

250808647.name: Just what we were looking for
250808647.author: a TripAdvisor user
250808647.reviewBody: Great body surfing and a very nice beach to rest upon. We didn\'t want to leave. Caught some waves that took our breath away.

250636843.name: Surfing & Beachtime
250636843.author: a TripAdvisor user
250636843.reviewBody:
We just got back from Nuevo Vallarta a week ago. We made sure to make a day trip to Sayulita to go surfing and sprawl on the beach.

The surfing here is good, there are a lot of people in the water waiting for a wave at any given point (about 20-25 people, legit because it seems to be a surfing destination). There is quite a large section of the water that is very very rocky, so make sure you have a first aid kit and talk to the guys at the surf shack there. They make sure to let you know where to go, even if you don't rent a board. They were great guys.

The beach is just gorgeous, and quiet. It's a public beach, where you'll mostly find seasoned hippies and snowbirds. The small bars and restaurants along the beach are quaint and quiet.

**If you are renting a car to go here, park for free along Calle Delfines. It's direct access to the beach, and a bit south down the beach is where you will find the surf shack.

If you get hungry, hop just up Calle Delfines to Medusa for perfect Margaritas, Coconut Shrimp, Tacos, and cheese loaded Nachos.

250513388.name: Sayulita Beach
250513388.author: a TripAdvisor user
250513388.reviewBody: Nice day to spend at the beach and exploring the town..also has area set up with table, chairs and umbrellas.. and can watch the surfers and paddle boarders.. fun!

250170594.name: Still a perfect spot
250170594.author: a TripAdvisor user
250170594.reviewBody: safe,restaurants galore,friendly people,we went nowhere that made us uncomfortable .But by your grocerys in PVR as some of the items we needed were a bit overpriced.

250011498.name: Great beach...clean and not crowded.
250011498.author: a TripAdvisor user
250011498.reviewBody:
The north end of the beach is very quiet and not many vendors to bother you.  South end is a completely different story.

The sand goes from soft and fine to quite pebbly and difficult on your bare feet.  

When we were there, the waves were significant and you wouldn't want to go in too far unless you are comfortable with waves breaking on you and a strong undertow.  Still, surfers and paddle-boarders were very active and fun to watch.

The beaches are very clean and the water is warm enough to spend time in.  There were a lot of tents set on the beach along with some fires, but for the most part, there wasn't a lot of activity on the beach except for families.

Most of the beach vendors spend time at the south end where there are more people to hassle.  But, we didn't have any problem with them.  A quick shake of your head and a polite 'No, gracias' was all it takes to send them on their way.

249881221.name: Surfing Festival Weekend
249881221.author: a TripAdvisor user
249881221.reviewBody: Sayulita is a great town if you are young and energetic and love the vibe of music, tattoo\'s and hippies.  Lots of wonderful, healthy food choices, but you have to like to be around a lot of people and not mind a little bit of loud music.  Great if you like to surf and like the surf scene.

249738819.name: Good Beach
249738819.author: a TripAdvisor user
249738819.reviewBody: Good beach. Touristy but not as over crowded as other beach towns with concentrated number of tourists. Places to eat & shop are not too far from this area- the town center is behind the beach. If you\'re looking for something less touristy, walk either opposite directions and you\'ll find more remote beaches.

249632355.name: Disgustingly dirty
249632355.author: a TripAdvisor user
249632355.reviewBody: Full of dog poop, really dirty, could be nice if people cleaned up after themselves and their dogs, also there are a lot of wild dogs running around crapping everywhere, watch where you sit!

249197214.name: Mexican Surfing Town
249197214.author: a TripAdvisor user
249197214.reviewBody: yep, exactly what it says! Cheap hotels in town, its small and old school mexico! we will be staying there next time we go to PV for a week. Its a half hour drive, maybe 45 min from town. busses all day or rent a car. or ATV! :)

249048062.name: Souvenir shopping
249048062.author: a TripAdvisor user
249048062.reviewBody: Was a very cute town with nice beach but very busy over Christmas.  \nSpent some time shopping here.  Bit to crowded for us but teenagers liked the vibe

248336235.name: Slice of heaven in 2009
248336235.author: a TripAdvisor user
248336235.reviewBody: I am sad to read reviews of what this beach has become.  I was traveling with girlfriends in 2009 and we happened upon this little town and had an amazing day wandering around, eating and buying some of the most fantastic jewelry I\'ve found in Mexico.  We spent the evening hanging out with some people at the beach, made some new friends and watched the most beautiful sunset.  I hope it finds itself again.......

248330881.name: Hmmm
248330881.author: a TripAdvisor user
248330881.reviewBody: I was pretty, but the north beach is the best so far as cleanliness but you cant swim there? Hmm, I also wish there were leash laws on the beach, not know here the next doggie land mine could be isnt the most charming thought, but leashes seem to be a foreign concept here

248106313.name: Overrated. Dirty, invested by hippies, not worth it.
248106313.author: a TripAdvisor user
248106313.reviewBody: Disappointed by the visit. I expected a paradise type beach but it was a dirty hippie invested beach, people camping all over the place and not on campgrounds, doing their business on the beach. Very dirty place, not worth the visit.

247795465.name: Pollution made us run away
247795465.author: a TripAdvisor user
247795465.reviewBody: Firstable, when I got to see the beach I didn\'t like it. It\'s not that is terrible. But after seeing other beached you get more picky even more when you hear a lot of a place and your expectations are high.\nI didn\'t like the color of the sea, the tons of people that there were (it is one of the busiest I\'ve been too), and the worst thing is that we walked a few steps away from where we were and we found that to the beach was joining a polluted sewage river, that definitely made me not going into the sea. Not cool!

247691877.name: "Charming town"
247691877.author: a TripAdvisor user
247691877.reviewBody: Sayulita was a very charming little beach town.  We arrived by bus from Puerto Vallarta.  It was really inexpensive this way plus parking is really tough in Sayulita.  We really enjoyed walking the cobblestone roads throughout the town. Lots of interesting folks out here...definitely on the artsy side.  The beach was really crowded and you are constantly being hounded to buy something from the beach vendors but it\'s like that in Puerto Vallarta as well.   Massages on the beach were only $30 for an hour which I did partake in but my lady was not the best. It was still decent for $30.  I wish we could have spent more time here and experience some of the restaurants.  WE did find a great place that made shrimp tacos right in front of you.  It was just a tiny little place where you sit outside..Can\'t remember the name though.

247495121.name: Sewage beach
247495121.author: a TripAdvisor user
247495121.reviewBody: The steep beach is polluted with the run-off of a sewage- spilling river. The excellent surfable waves are a menace for inexperienced surfers who do not realize the danger of the underlying supersharp coral reef formations just feet below the surface.

247458094.name: Unique
247458094.author: a TripAdvisor user
247458094.reviewBody: We toured the town of Sayulita.  Had lunch at a very unique restaurant.  Food was great.  Can\'t remember the name of the restaurant.  Shopping was great!  Streets are very narrow.  Glad we had a couple of great cab drivers.  Beach was very busy.

247446490.name: Great Beach Town
247446490.author: a TripAdvisor user
247446490.reviewBody: Sayulita is a fantastic little beach/surf town, very much reminded me of a more summery Tofino!\n\nThe beach is great for lounging around, I\'ve only been during shoulder seasons so it was still nice and hot but not too crowded. Be aware that this is a SURF town, so the water isn\'t the best for swimming, but there are tons of surf lessons available right from the beach if you\'re itching to get in the water!

247155592.name: Although it can be very nice - DON\'T take a car!
247155592.author: a TripAdvisor user
247155592.reviewBody: We went to enjoy the Sayulita Farmers Market and were overwhelmed by the lack of parking.  It got worse as we tried to go to one of our favorite restaurants on the other side of the bridge and found there were not places to park.  The town is trying to do thing well and in fact doing a good job promoting its\' businesses.  You can\'t enjoy anything if you have to go  to a "Bumper Car" event where the end result is too often NO PARKING!\n\nYOU BETTER PLAN AHEAD IF YOU WANT TO GO TO SAYULITA!

247077687.name: Lovely, but it\'s been discovered by many many tourists
247077687.author: a TripAdvisor user
247077687.reviewBody: This is a lovely beach. But it was quite crowded (during the week between Christmas and New Year). It was as crowded (or more so) than the Jersey Shore during July 4th weekend. Still, it was quite fun and enjoyable.

246741068.name: Beautiful bay and long beach
246741068.author: a TripAdvisor user
246741068.reviewBody: Beautiful bay and long beach... Great place for young kids to learn to surf. We were there on December 31 so it was really crowded. The kids had fun as the waves are gentle and rolling. Lots of choices to eat and the local shops were nice.

246627765.name: Massage on the beach
246627765.author: a TripAdvisor user
246627765.reviewBody: Great deal on massages for my wife, twenty-five dollars for a hour . Taco\'s and Margarita\'s while watching the sunset at Olas Blanca\'s

246509872.name: relaxation at its finest!
246509872.author: a TripAdvisor user
246509872.reviewBody: find an umbrella and park yourself down for a great day! 4th year in sayulita and will be back next year.  spent a week in a nice 3 bedroom apt downtown and walked to the beautiful beach every morning for a walk on an almost empty beach!  the beach comes to life around 10-11 am and then is just heaven on earth.  from the vendors hawking local goods...fresh potato chips, fresh fruit, fresh coconut macaroons! to the short 50 yd walk to the best mahi mahi fish tacos on the planet!  if you don\'t like this place well you won\'t like anywhere.

246351506.name: Very busy
246351506.author: a TripAdvisor user
246351506.reviewBody: If you are expecting a serene and clean beach go elsewhere. This place is interesting but not really relaxing. It\'s more of a social event than an escape.

246061917.name: Surf Paradise
246061917.author: a TripAdvisor user
246061917.reviewBody: Great for beginners and advanced riders.  Lots of board rentals and teachers, if need be.  Chill and relaxed.. lots of peddlers though.. but that is to be expected in a tourism zone.  Warm water and lots of positive energy on this beach!

246060773.name: The great equalizer
246060773.author: a TripAdvisor user
246060773.reviewBody:
Sayulita Beach is the epicenter for the community and visitors. 
Very egalitarian, including dogs that revel in the opportunity to take a leisurely poop in the sand.
The surf is seductive,  but very powerful. I've surfed elsewhere,  but was just unable to get through the relentless sets. Yet, I watched 10 year olds ripping up the "double overheads".
Swarmed by the usual trinket vendors in their white clothes. In a nod to Sayulita's quirkiness,  there was a djembe drum group playing and dancing on the sand. This is a wonderful destination, and easy access on the local ATM bus lines.

246060179.name: Great Beach
246060179.author: a TripAdvisor user
246060179.reviewBody: We were there with a group of 12 (4 teens), sat in front of Don Pedro\'s restaurant, kids had surf lessons, great waves, lot of people watching, etc.  Everyone enjoyed it, looking forward to returning.

245850635.name: Great place to spend a day
245850635.author: a TripAdvisor user
245850635.reviewBody: We visited here twice. Once you hit the town by road you need to travel down dirt roads to get to the beach. It\'s a bit misleading because once you hit the town beach there is a plethora of restaurants, and other places to eat etc. The beach is great and good for surfing. You can hire boards there cheaply too. Recommended

245625515.name: a great hidden treasure
245625515.author: a TripAdvisor user
245625515.reviewBody: catch a bus from PV for a short ride over the mountains to Sayulita, a small village full of "happy" Surfers.

245625218.name: Love it
245625218.author: a TripAdvisor user
245625218.reviewBody:
Put my 9 year old in surf lessons and she had a blast while I got to do a bit of surfing on my own. 
Great boogie boarding for the kids as well. 
Pay for the chairs and umbrella for the day and chill out. Great place for all ages.
A bit of a walk (10 mins) from the bus drop off but not hard.

245554423.name: Beautiful beach w/ surf that won\'t hurt you
245554423.author: a TripAdvisor user
245554423.reviewBody: Great beach scene. Good waves for board or body surfing and about a mile of good walking.Unfortunately they let Oxxo build a store right on the beach c/w bright neon lights and loud music. What were they thinking?

245529607.name: Stay There
245529607.author: a TripAdvisor user
245529607.reviewBody: Great and friendly surf town off the beaten path. I know its not a secret any longer but it\'s still a very cool place to spend time.

245362898.name: Well, sorry to say, I was terribly disappointed....
245362898.author: a TripAdvisor user
245362898.reviewBody:
I'd read the reviews and was really looking forward to finding a home away from home in Sayulita, that some called a surfer's paradise, as we were living in Puerto Vallarta for two months and wanted something different.  Well, different it was.  

While in PV we are in an upscale area less populated with tourists, and we were hoping to find a beach more or less populated  with Mexicans where we could get good Mexican cuisine with fresh fish, a reasonably quiet/not crowded beach... were we might find a place to stay for a few days.  A life-long friend from Argentina accompanied us and shared our enthusiasm, looking forward to a long weekend in Sayulita.   

Well, we arrived at about 10:00 in the morning, and already things were so bustling with tourists that it was difficult to find parking.  That done, we decided to peruse the many, many shops on the streets.  WE WERE SO DISAPPOINTED!  

The shops were almost exclusively tourist traps ... filled with poor quality souvenirs, nearly all made in China, India, or Indonesia.  Worse, their prices were over the top.  Moreover, most of the people running the shops, staffing the "coffee houses", and now at the beach were those that seemed to have migrated from Santa Monica, CA area beaches -- dirty ne'er-do-wells ... living on the land (did I day "scam"?).Strike one.

As for dining, , well you may as well have gone to a low end "resort" in the states, dirty, crowded, and unappealing.  Strike two.

So, we decided NOT to look for a long weekend in Sayulita, but inasmuch as we were prepared to spend some time at the beach we trudged on down to the beach.  Again, not what we expected.  It was crowded, but not with not your usual beach-goers.  In fact, I doubt that many of the local, but not Mexican residents, frequented the water.  STRIKE THREE.  

Needless to say, we were gone by noon.

245268450.name: EEEEK!!!
245268450.author: a TripAdvisor user
245268450.reviewBody: Everything\'s relative but: we are middle aged, middle class travelers, stayed in Punta de Mita and took a trip to Sayulita, partly because it was fairly close and partly because of the great T.A reviews. Were any of the reviewers sober while they were at Sayulita beach?? \nThe beach itself was filthy - cigarette butts, cans/bottles/wrappers/food strewn all around. It was very crowded and noisy. There was a never ending surge of vendors in your face, and very persistent vendors at that. The streets leading to the beach are lined with vendor tables with the exact same wares found everywhere in Mexico, and again the vendors were very intrusive. You literally can\'t move a foot without someone pushing something in your face.\nI understand what\'s behind that - crushing poverty abounds in this part of Mexico and people do what they need to do to get by, but it doesn\'t make for a pleasant vacation experience.

245041160.name: Something for everyone
245041160.author: a TripAdvisor user
245041160.reviewBody: Amid the warm waters, you can find something for everyone. Lessons on all water sports abound and they\'re not messing around. I\'ve seen a few people graduate and they could hold their own in SCA now! Really family and dog friendly. Just amazing.\n\nFeel free to contact me if you need more detail. Just try it out. You can\'t loose:)

245040898.name: Surf it Out Risa Machuca
245040898.author: a TripAdvisor user
245040898.reviewBody: Surf lessons with Risa Machuca were the best in the area. She is an excellent teacher, very patient and will take you out only when it is safe. She is very knowledgable of the area, speaks perfect spanish and english and will take you to the best breaks in the area. Risa is so passionate about surfing and will give the extra time and encouragement to improve your surfing. She also has tonnes of local knowledge of where to stay, where to eat and how to make the most of your time in Sayulita.

244995644.name: Beautiful beach
244995644.author: a TripAdvisor user
244995644.reviewBody: Beautiful beach to just sit and relax or the perfect setting to learn to surf.  Massages on the beach were awesome too.

244687729.name: Excellent Surfing
244687729.author: a TripAdvisor user
244687729.reviewBody: This is a small town situated in a cove to the north of Nueva Vallarta that has not been modernized yet.  It\'s kind of like a hippy town and a bit run down.  It is known for the excellent surfing and, at least on the day of our visit, the waves were quite big and there were a lot of surfers out there.  There are restaurants and bars on the beach and we enjoyed a good margarita and chips and salsa.  There are so many locals trying to sell their wares that it is a pain and we didn\'t see anything worth even looking at.  There are a few shops but we didn\'t see anything that appealed.  We did smell pot in the air!  We didn\'t take a tour here or stay here but got a taxi and spent a few hours before returning to Nueva Vallarta.

244617392.name: great getway for a day
244617392.author: a TripAdvisor user
244617392.reviewBody: Travelled here from Nuevo...great little town, nice sandy beach. \nFood/drinks a little pricey for Mexico, but still cheap compared to Can/USA\nA great 1 day diversion from the big hotels in PV

244540577.name: Nice beach
244540577.author: a TripAdvisor user
244540577.reviewBody: It is a great beach....nice and long. great surf. Just don\'t expect nice soft fine grain sand beach.

244527010.name: Mellow vibe overcomes the crowd
244527010.author: a TripAdvisor user
244527010.reviewBody: The beach is crowded.  The surf is crowded.  Fairly clean.  Vendors work but are not pushy.\n\nThe mellow vibe on the sand and in the water makes it all worthwhile.

244405087.name: This is where we wished we stayed
244405087.author: a TripAdvisor user
244405087.reviewBody: We stayed in PTO never having been to Mexico before.  We took the bus up to Sayulita and loved it.  It is not cosmopolitan.  It is a cool, hippie, surfing and boggie boarding area with a true beach to walk and lay on as well as some coves.  The only negative is that there are the typical venders that NEVER leave you alone for more than 3 minutes and you can flush toilet paper.  However, if you are looking for an adventure and love the outdoors stay here and only visit PTO one day.

244335366.name: beautiful
244335366.author: a TripAdvisor user
244335366.reviewBody:
Small town buzzing with character, perfect for families.

Lots of places to eat, drink cocktails and unwind 

Big beach to laze on all day with small local markets down the streets, great for gift shopping

244078266.name: surfing fun in the sun!!!
244078266.author: a TripAdvisor user
244078266.reviewBody: great day on the beach learning to surf, drinking beer and eating excellent seafood   we arrived at about noon and stayed until dusk.,

243908179.name: Sayulita Thanksgiving
243908179.author: a TripAdvisor user
243908179.reviewBody: Lovely setting, nice folks in town, laid back attitude, some really nice arts and crafts, good beach!

243764192.name: Beautiful and breathtaking
243764192.author: a TripAdvisor user
243764192.reviewBody: best best i have been to. Super clean, clear water and NICE people. You can order drinks and food on the beach and there is no pressure - although a ton on vendors. Great spot to watch the surfers too

243632823.name: Next time we will stay here
243632823.author: a TripAdvisor user
243632823.reviewBody: This town blows PV away. Smaller, cooler, better looking people, cheaper, better surf. If you stay in PV you should make the day trip. Only 45 min to north.

243507726.name: Gorgeous, watch your head and feet
243507726.author: a TripAdvisor user
243507726.reviewBody:
It's beautiful, great for boogie boarding, etc.

I would have appreciated a section reserved for swimmers and boogie-boarders, as the surfers were both sides and many times all over leaving no corridor to people conscious of their heads being exposed to the finned surfboards.

Also, at low tide, there is a rock or piece of cement or somethig right in the middle of the water (facing a green colored buiding) on which I scratched my foot, and I was wondering if anything could be done about it by the owners' association or the municipality.

One last thing, you will soon discover that the north beach is less crowded; that's because it is steeper there and the waves hit harder and are more difficult to deal with for most people.

Mind you, this is still a great beach, like wow.

243135345.name: Great beach
243135345.author: a TripAdvisor user
243135345.reviewBody: I have been surfing a few times already at Sayulita.  The water is beautiful and the waves are great if you are a beginner.  There is a spot for more experienced surfers though.  I would recommend getting there before the lunch crowd though

242999524.name: Cool Hippy Goodness
242999524.author: a TripAdvisor user
242999524.reviewBody: This is a funky surfing town with lots of good places to eat and artsy things to buy. if you want a more authentic Mexican vacay with a gorgeous beach, stay here or or visit this little place for a day trip!

242823028.name: Beautiful Beach
242823028.author: a TripAdvisor user
242823028.reviewBody: We loved this beach. You can walk for hours if you want from one town to the next. It is clean and the water was warm when we were there. There is lots to do if you like surfing, paddle boarding or swimming. Of course there are lots of places to stop and have a drink and all have amazing views. My favorite was the massage I had in a tent right on the beach.

242510906.name: Bus trip to Sayulita
242510906.author: a TripAdvisor user
242510906.reviewBody: True Mexican village, raggedy roads, multi-coloured buildings full of architectural or cultural flavour. Many places to eat. We recommend Don Pedros, right on the edge of the beach and watch the birds fly in perfect formation, then turn simultaneously into a 90\' dive into the water - hitting it and splashing at the exact same moment. Quite a lot of Galleries offering local textiles, pottery, jewelry, art. Wasn\'t impressed with the Wall art. Everything else in the galleries was of high standard and thus reflected in the price. Many, many places of Accommodation, but they are not gaudy and in your face. One really has to look for them. Super fresh produce on the sidewalks. Found wonderful big round, weighty Passionfruit that had just the right aroma coming from them. Cut 2 in half and each shared our half right on the main street, slurping the pulp our with our tongues. Bit messy, but delicious. I bought a wonderful silver ring from a young jeweller, who has his own store. He melts silver dollars, so the quality of silver is higher than the 95. The ring is set with Mexican Fire Opals. I have had so many comments on it within a week of coming home. I recommend spending a few days in Sayulita to truly take time to explore. There are many villas and homes that would suit large groups, which would cut down costs. We took a Taxi back that day. We did arrive safely at our Resort after 3/4 hr of crazy 40k over the speed limit, tail gating, passing 3 cars on a double solid line with oncoming traffic; our driver blasting his horn so the oncoming traffic went for the side. all the time he strummed with his right hand to the beat of "Grease" songs - the main one being "Staying Alive". Couldn\'t help but squeal with laughter in between being scared......... Cost 600P. The bus is 35P each....

241881272.name: Beautiful
241881272.author: a TripAdvisor user
241881272.reviewBody: Great beach chill environment. Clean with lots of things to do. Eat, surf, drink. Highly recommend surfing you can\'t go wrong with any of the surf school.

241575085.name: Glorious
241575085.author: a TripAdvisor user
241575085.reviewBody: Do not go to Sayulita. Trying to keep this place a secret for just my family and friends! What an easy, approachable place Sayulita is without being a whitewashed resort. I may feel different when I visit during high season, but so far this has been my favorite vacation destination ever!

241485369.name: Awesome Beach
241485369.author: a TripAdvisor user
241485369.reviewBody: Loved it there! Great environment, some really cool little shops.  It is a little surfer town with great people.  Food was awesome, beach was great, and I totally recommend surfing lessons!

241463277.name: El Playa Dulce
241463277.author: a TripAdvisor user
241463277.reviewBody: What\'s to not like; clean, warm water, accommodating restaurants and bars bringing drinks and food to your chair. Delightful beach dogs wander about never actually begging and happy to accept a pet and a scratch should you be missing your own pooch.

241303041.name: Nice beach
241303041.author: a TripAdvisor user
241303041.reviewBody: We were at this beach during June - it was sooo hot!! he beach has a nice feel to it although when we were there, there was a lot of debris around from storms but That\'s just that time of year so can\'t be helped. Had an amazing massage on the beach at one of the massage tent places. It was so good I came back a few more times in the week.

241141357.name: A day at the beach
241141357.author: a TripAdvisor user
241141357.reviewBody: My husband and I decided to take a road trip while staying in PV.  We were told that Sayulita was the place to go.  After navigating through the rustic streets of the town we found the beach to be very relaxing.  After a paddleboard lesson, we enjoyed watching the more experienced paddleboarders and surfers riding the waves.  The only drawback is that to stay on any of the chairs under the palapas there is a daily fee.

240930627.name: Ticking time bomb
240930627.author: a TripAdvisor user
240930627.reviewBody: Call me crazy, but this place is in the middle of a transition right now. With some guidance it will flow in the right direction, BUT..... Its on the edge of growing up into a non ethical direction. There are many many locala not quite teens yet, and many that are young adults. Lots of festivals in the city center. Many good places to eat.(stay away from little shrimp) beautiful beach to walk.....

240877062.name: Nice
240877062.author: a TripAdvisor user
240877062.reviewBody: We were traveling with an almost 4 year old. I would not recommend the part of the beach right where the village is as it is by far not as nice as walking beyond the river up north, literally 5 -10 mins walk on the beach heading north. There you will find far fewer people on the beach, it is very clean and better to play where the waves break as there are hardly any surfers there. The waves can be a bit too strong sometimes to go in with 4 year old but one can still play with the kids a bit further up the beach. Every day at around 6pm the "campamento tortuguero" releases newborn turtles into the sea. One day it is 50 and others it can be hundreds ( one day it was 820). This is great for anyone but especially for the kids as they are allowed to hold and release them. Also very educational. It is a beautiful walk on the beach towards the north. Very clean. The only reason why I don\'t give the beach an excellent review is because of the section right where the core of the village is as this one deserves rather a 3 star. The section north of it deserves 5stars.

240010198.name: Go north for a quieter stretch of beach
240010198.author: a TripAdvisor user
240010198.reviewBody: The beach in the front of the town centre is quite busy so if you like it a bit quieter walk north. We were there mid October and our Hotelito was about 10 mins walk from the town square and the beach here was virtually deserted.

240005921.name: Beach O.K. but water was turbulent.
240005921.author: a TripAdvisor user
240005921.reviewBody: I couldn\'t say I was crazy about the beach cause of the choppy waters. It surprised me since beaches in Puertio Vallarta were so much calmer and not too far away.

239852422.name: Beautiful spot
239852422.author: a TripAdvisor user
239852422.reviewBody: Beautiful, clean ,sandy beach, safe swimming, Surf board rentals, lots of available food and refreshments close by.

239286859.name: Beautiful Beach
239286859.author: a TripAdvisor user
239286859.reviewBody: The beach was gorgeous.  The water was warm and views were amazing.   Will definitely be returning in the near future for a much longer stay than the four days of our original stay.

239063900.name: Chilling in Sayulita
239063900.author: a TripAdvisor user
239063900.reviewBody: Great beach , low key and not to crowded. Surf was nice for body surfing, paddle boarding and surfing.

238762526.name: Gorgeous Beaches
238762526.author: a TripAdvisor user
238762526.reviewBody: I love Sayulita.  I\'been there twice and love the small town.  It\'s festive and fun and not\ncommercial.  The people seem always happy.  It has a laid back and bohemian feeling and\nthe food especially the fish tacos are amazing.

238653347.name: Sayulita Beaches
238653347.author: a TripAdvisor user
238653347.reviewBody: Liked watching the surfers and having food and drinks served to me on the beach, but did not like being inundated with locals selling their wares.

238647043.name: Great beach!
238647043.author: a TripAdvisor user
238647043.reviewBody: Excellent beach with close proximity to the water and beach chairs, was perfect for our family outing and sitting with 10 friends.....

238452260.name: Eat, drink and make it what you want!
238452260.author: a TripAdvisor user
238452260.reviewBody: Better beach than in PV and a small town atmosphere with plenty to see and do. People watching is always entertaining and the locals are very friendly.

237937409.name: Renewed, fell in love with life again! We HIGHLY recommend this!
237937409.author: a TripAdvisor user
237937409.reviewBody: A colourful, free spirited loving place, we stayed at a couple different places near the square in the Center of  town.....convenient, and the best food everywhere we ate.....we enjoyed taking creative pics along the beautiful beach....walked and saw incredible homes and all had unique beautiful doors!

237897928.name: Good day trip
237897928.author: a TripAdvisor user
237897928.reviewBody: We spent a day here, it is an interesting place to see. Go surfing that is what it is known for! Beware you have to pay 100 pesos for a chair per day and there are no towels, so come prepared.

237660669.name: Great SUP and SURF spot!
237660669.author: a TripAdvisor user
237660669.reviewBody: We love this area and enjoy the quirky, bohemian feel to the town and the beach.  The surf is really nice for beginners and a super area for families.   The beach is a bit grey and we wish that more could be aware of the garbage and waste in the area, it certainly is better than it was when we supported the area 9 years ago.  The beach vendors are relentless, but I guess there is something to be said for shopping and eating right from your beach chair.  You seem to be able to negotiate better chair rental rates in each area of the beach, and many of the restaurants offer free chairs and umbrellas with your consumption of their food.  Great fun on the surf and SUP area!

237475660.name: Beautiful - easy surfing
237475660.author: a TripAdvisor user
237475660.reviewBody: Beach chairs and umbrellas can be rented by the day. We paid 200 pesos. Surf boards are also easy to rent. The surf, when we visited, was easy for the not-expert surfers in our group. We also saw many people taking surfing lessons. There are many vendors that are going up and down the beach. It\'s an easy walk from the hotels and villas. Very laid back.

237197158.name: A must see in nayarit
237197158.author: a TripAdvisor user
237197158.reviewBody: Beach is obvious for the surf crowed but the atmosphere is awesome, good people, shops, good food cant go wrong to get away from the regular beach crowds, will come back to sayulita next time :-)

237094997.name: beautiful beach
237094997.author: a TripAdvisor user
237094997.reviewBody: This beach was great the only downside was the bus getting there and the annoying vendors trying to sell something every 30 seconds. Very beautiful place though, and great surfing.

236782291.name: Hidden Gem
236782291.author: a TripAdvisor user
236782291.reviewBody: Amazing views, artisan shopping, five star food, and the beach is spectacular. Not very crowded, a real hidden gem!

236749206.name: Nice beach
236749206.author: a TripAdvisor user
236749206.reviewBody: Heavily touristed, but close to many restaurants and cafes. There are certainly prettier beaches nearby, but the location is convenient for those who don\'t have cars.

236573926.name: Great beach with good surfing!!
236573926.author: a TripAdvisor user
236573926.reviewBody: We enjoyed ourselves on the beach watching surfers enjoying the waves all day. It is a cool beach for people watching and enjoying cold beers with great food. Find yourself a nice lounger in front of the restaurant of your choice and enjoy the day relaxing!!

236234587.name: A day at the beach
236234587.author: a TripAdvisor user
236234587.reviewBody: We had an enjoyable day at the beach.  We rented chairs and umbrellas so that we didn\'t have to sit on the sand.  We received bar service with the chairs and the service was good.   The beach is typical for the pacific side of Mexico.  Somewhat rocky.  There was surfing in the cove and you can rent boards.  The beach vendors are persistent but that\'s part of a Mexican beach experience.

236027579.name: Don\'t miss Sayulita
236027579.author: a TripAdvisor user
236027579.reviewBody: This laid back town reminded me of Saint Paul-de Vance, it is a small artsy town with a beautiful beach, also don\'t miss Litibu, a hidden gem beach not far from Sayulita.

235920726.name: Cute beach town!
235920726.author: a TripAdvisor user
235920726.reviewBody: Spent a day up in Sayulita, loved the beach experience and the very cute and colorful shop-lined streets.  Taking this trip was one of the highlights of our overall Puerta Vallarata vacation experience.

235916722.name: Love, love this place!
235916722.author: a TripAdvisor user
235916722.reviewBody: A definite must for any traveler to this area. You\'ll love the laid back atmosphere, reminiscent of southern cal in the 80\'s. Surfing schools, clay massages, street music and some of the best seafood anywhere. Served right on the sandy beach.

235743198.name: GORGEOUS!
235743198.author: a TripAdvisor user
235743198.reviewBody:
If you're a surfer, you'll love it- if you're not and just love to play in the waves then this is your playground!
Sand is gorgeous, be careful of some rocks in the water, but they're minimal. 
The vendors on the beach can make you a bit insane, but keep your eyes peeled for the lady selling coconut macaroons! She is AMAZING! 300 pesos a pop but worth it!

Chair vendors could use to lower their pricing a bit, but in the end you'll give in because with no shade you'll die out there.

235106487.name: Great surf beach and town
235106487.author: a TripAdvisor user
235106487.reviewBody: Fun little day trip with lots to do in this funky little town. Great food options along the beach and fab stores.

234015051.name: Sayulita is AWESOME!
234015051.author: a TripAdvisor user
234015051.reviewBody:
My fourth tip was the best. I'm writing this review after 10 days in Sayulita and I still have one week to go.  

Beach-10 out of 10
Vendors on beach 10 out of 10
Waves 8 out of 10 Saturdays are too busy with noobs for surfing
Surfboards rentals10 out of 10
Go to Sayulita. You will love it and on a budget it's still fantastic.

233654064.name: Sayulita Beach
233654064.author: a TripAdvisor user
233654064.reviewBody: Many good restaurants and bars to visit right on the ocean with beautiful views. Half way between working community and vacation destination.

231460893.name: Paradise
231460893.author: a TripAdvisor user
231460893.reviewBody: Golden water, the warmest I have ever felt! The sunset is an experience. Problem: It\'s far from Puerto Vallarta and the buses are not that good and take a long time to get there.

230856136.name: Great little beach!
230856136.author: a TripAdvisor user
230856136.reviewBody: Love this beach for just sitting back and enjoying life. Love to watch the surfers. So very slow-placed. Had a great view sitting at Captain Cook\'s, sipping beers,  and watching the world go by.\nOnly down side was that there were a number of vendors at the beach, who were quite aggressive. I think that was because it was the slow season.

230741821.name: One of my Top 10 spots in the world!
230741821.author: a TripAdvisor user
230741821.reviewBody:
I would could live there. Sayulita is one of those towns I have always threatened to move to. It is one of those hidden gems that has everything you’d ever want. Great food, great beaches, great people, great vibe, and of course, great surf! 

I’ve been there twice and each time, I don’t want to leave. There are many ex-pats from Canada and from the US living there – so you hear just as much English as you do Spanish just walking down the streets or on the beach. There are plenty of places to stay for cheap and the drinks on the beach are cheap and cold. Sayulita is known for its daily surf…it’s a place many come to learn to surf. There are people from all over the world who visit this quaint little town. It’s only 30 minutes from Puerto Vallarta and very safe. 

Please do yourself the favor or leaving the hotel or resort and taking at least a day trip to visit this town, just don't forget your swimsuit. And don't worry, you can rent surf boards and boogie boards there. There's a cool little place called Lunazul Surf School which can provide it all, even surf lessons! 

Trust me, you won’t regret it!

230707966.name: Quiana little surf town
230707966.author: a TripAdvisor user
230707966.reviewBody: Great beach with lots of waves for playing in. We like Don Pandros restaurant on the beach. Lots of people trying to sell you stuff no needs to shop

230346720.name: entertaining Beach!
230346720.author: a TripAdvisor user
230346720.reviewBody: Sayulita has a vast beach, where everyone feels like  a local. Great local vendors. Great views! Great atmosphere. I enjoyed watching the surfers - wish I could have talked my friends into surf school - its so much easier than you think!

228214660.name: Great get away!
228214660.author: a TripAdvisor user
228214660.reviewBody: For starters this very much like a "pueblito" so no fancy stuff around.\nKind of hippy-ish little town, plenty of "gringo" friends, with ATMs in US dollars, and Spanish classes. Check prices; not because it looks cheap means it\'s all cheap. You can find locals selling you smoking pipes, and... already "loaded". The beach is fantastic: golden soft sand with great waves, surfing classes and boards for rent. Food is really good, all fresh seafood (you don\'t go to the beach to have lasagna, right?). You will have a great get away.

227563410.name: Great beach and surf break (with swell)
227563410.author: a TripAdvisor user
227563410.reviewBody: Great beach and surf break (with swell) beach. For surfing, super fun \'right\' and \'left\' breaks where there is swell.

227185766.name: Unique place to have fun! Good for surfers.
227185766.author: a TripAdvisor user
227185766.reviewBody: Sayulita has a special flavor for young people, artists and\nartist like... just plain fun place!\nBeach is great and so are the little restaurant around the promenade. Shopping is a bit...expensive considering we are in Mexico. Just skip it  and have a lunch at Don Pedro!

226467675.name: Huntington Beach meets the Nayarit Coast
226467675.author: a TripAdvisor user
226467675.reviewBody: If you don\'t want to worry about a car, Sayulita\'s where it\'s at...you can rent a board, grab some grub and rent an umbrella all at the same beach.  The main peak is crowded but plenty of room to SUP around...if you don\'t mind having vendors coming after you, there\'s still plenty of beauty to be found here but it\'s far from the sleepy fishing town it was supposed to be in the 60\'s and 70\'s.  If you\'re looking for that, head north...there are other beaches ready for you to explore...!

226181590.name: Makes you feel young again!
226181590.author: a TripAdvisor user
226181590.reviewBody: Hippy surfers beach with all that entails. Lovely beach. Interesting range of visitors. Good shops and eating places. Town had a real old Mexico feel to it as well.

224721187.name: NICE spot - worth the trip
224721187.author: a TripAdvisor user
224721187.reviewBody: Lot\'s of sand and little places to eat or have a drink.  Cobblestone streets and little shops.  Very nice slice of the sweet life!

222531136.name: There are better places
222531136.author: a TripAdvisor user
222531136.reviewBody: I went to sayulita for the beach but was very disappointed. I was expecting to find clean beaches with clear shallow water but the place is just good for surfers. A few  km south there are much better places with clean beaches and not as crowded as sayulita. I expected it to be a mexican town but it feels like an american town replete with american tourists. Everything looks fake, no authenticity left.

222408145.name: Our new favorite place
222408145.author: a TripAdvisor user
222408145.reviewBody: Great little restaurants in town, small market of goods, smooth sand beach, perfect waves for playing, warm water, 3 great bars to sit under an umbrella and order buckets of beer while playing on the beach.  LOVED IT.  Took public bus from PV-way cheaper than taxi

221880960.name: Beautiful, uncrowded beach
221880960.author: a TripAdvisor user
221880960.reviewBody: The first day getting into the water was a painful experience as there were a lot of rocks.  The next day, however, all the rocks were gone and it was a pleasant experience.

221381866.name: Beach of Gold!!
221381866.author: a TripAdvisor user
221381866.reviewBody: What a beautiful secluded, bohemian place Sayulita Beach is. What a hidden gem! My family and I, wife and 7 & 9 year old daughters took a day trip to Sayulita. The sand looks like it has gold flakes in it. My daughters and I were entranced with it for hours and has us dreaming of what it would be like if it was real. After a fun day walking the beach, playing in the water, we had great meal at a local restaurant. Now that meal we had was the best freshest seafood we have ever had. Shrimp and Mahi-Mahi. Delish!! Service is a bit slow, but you need to remember it is a surfer/beach place and it is a slower pace compared to the big city. Which was goo, and we enjoyed talking and people watching while we waited.

220873518.name: Great beach to learn to surf
220873518.author: a TripAdvisor user
220873518.reviewBody: We went to this beach recently and the atmosphere was cool. Lots of local people and surfers go here. Ok beach a bit dirty but went the waves are up, great surfing!  Rentals of boards are ok 200 pesos for the day and 50 per hour.  To rent beach chair and umbrella is 150 for the day. Lots of places to eat and shop.

219608433.name: beach chillin\'
219608433.author: a TripAdvisor user
219608433.reviewBody: rent a shade tent, and get full service on the beach, food drinks, massages, etc.  summer waves are great for kids and adults wanting to learn to surf, its slow and small beach break and small reef break keep a few waves forming up for some fun

219512012.name: Great Surfers Beach
219512012.author: a TripAdvisor user
219512012.reviewBody: You will meet some really cool people on this beach. I met such a wide aray of people and of course the greenery is pretty good too. I did some surfing, drinking and chilling on this beach. Totally recommend Sayulita!

217067145.name: Chillaxing in Sayulita
217067145.author: a TripAdvisor user
217067145.reviewBody: Buy some beers and get a chair, umbrella from any of the restaurants and just relax.  Beautiful little surfing village and a great place to soak in the sun.  In my two visits to Sayulita, there has never been big waves, but I think it would be a great place to learn how to surf.  Water is warm and the beach is beautiful, good enough for me!

216923145.name: Very nice when is not crowded, early at the morning
216923145.author: a TripAdvisor user
216923145.reviewBody: Is a nice beach, i love the golden sparkles in the sand, is kinda crowded and seems to be little polluted, there is a few trash cans, nice waves to surf, pet and kid friendly.

216830709.name: Great beach, love the dogs
216830709.author: a TripAdvisor user
216830709.reviewBody: I didn\'t get a chance to surf (limited time) but did manage to go for a swim - the beach itself is nicer than Riviera Nayarit, where we were staying, and the water was nicer.  Great little town, had some guac at Choco Banana, and played with the many dogs - Sayulita has a great program whereby the stray dogs are "adopted" and cared for by locals and travelers.  Wish we could have spent more time there, and would definitely go back - worth the trip from Nayarit or PV.

216668850.name: Feel in love with Sayulita
216668850.author: a TripAdvisor user
216668850.reviewBody: Sayulita is amazing! Such a lovely little place. The beach is beautiful and there are great little shops to check out too.  Everyone we met there were super friendly and gracious.  I can\'t wait to go back.

216077863.name: Beach worth of a movie set
216077863.author: a TripAdvisor user
216077863.reviewBody: We spent 2 weeks in PV and went to Sayulita for the day. It\'s 50 minutes by taxi and well worth the trip. Beautiful, flat sandy beach, awesome views and a beach town vibe like Oceanside, CA mixed with Mexican pueblo charm. Go see it, you won\'t be sorry.

214002685.name: Magical place
214002685.author: a TripAdvisor user
214002685.reviewBody: We got to Sayulita by chance, nobody told us about this place.It is the nicest beach in Puerto vallarta, worth the road. A place for surf , stand up paddle and much more. Very romantic, full of beautiful stores and simple people.Liked very much our delicious breakfast at Banana something restaurant on the main square.

213353981.name: Fun
213353981.author: a TripAdvisor user
213353981.reviewBody: Sayulita is worth the drive north. Fun little town with tons of shopping and great little restaurants.

213054508.name: Paradise
213054508.author: a TripAdvisor user
213054508.reviewBody: The beach is beautiful, the water is clear and warm.   We enjoy the friendly and polite beach vendors.  Be sure to take local advice about where it is and is not safe to swim.

212348215.name: Great beach/surf town
212348215.author: a TripAdvisor user
212348215.reviewBody: This was a short day trip, but the shops were interesting and the beach was beautiful. I don\'t surf, but if I did I would want to be here. It was authentic in its appeal and didn\'t feel crowded or touristy, yet walking down the streets we passed people from several countries.

211919320.name: I Love this Beach!
211919320.author: a TripAdvisor user
211919320.reviewBody: This is one of the greatest beaches I have ever been to. Watching all the surfers was a lot of fun. I even tried to surf but apparantly not my sport. This is a beach that you can meet some really cool people like we did, some will be long time friends. Recommeded

211489056.name: Very nice beach
211489056.author: a TripAdvisor user
211489056.reviewBody: We came here for a day trip,  wish we could have stayed longer, beach was nice, we will be back to walk around town and check out the shops and restaurants.

210933541.name: Quaint seaside town
210933541.author: a TripAdvisor user
210933541.reviewBody: We took a cab from our resort to see this nice little town. It had lots of nice shops and boutiques, right on a beautiful beach. We spent 6 hours there just wandering ,looking in the various shops, and swimming on the sandy beach. A great afternoon on a very hot day.

210670163.name: Fishing village or surf school?
210670163.author: a TripAdvisor user
210670163.reviewBody: What a chill little town!  Took the bus from PV - $35pesos each gets you there in about an hour and a half.  Walk a few hundred yards over the bridge and you\'re in town!  What a funky, fun place - sun, sand and surf! We\'ll be going back.

209894539.name: Great little surfing village!
209894539.author: a TripAdvisor user
209894539.reviewBody: We spent the day here while vacationing in Nuevo Vallarta. It was nice getaway! There are ample small bars on the beach with umbrellas. you are literally steps from the ocean. It was cool to watch the surfers and body boarders. Not a busy place and the vibe is very relaxed. Great place to visit that is only 1-hour from the resort areas.

209827186.name: Surfer beach
209827186.author: a TripAdvisor user
209827186.reviewBody:
Good fun surfing, loads of places to sit, alot of places to eat, some nicer than others, don't get too sucked into the beach front bars, some are not good value or good food. 
Annoying vendors, but guess that's part of the experience :) 
Alot of people on the beach, making it hard to surf sometimes. 
You are allowed to eat and drink on the beach, alot cheaper than eating out all the time. Nice walks along the beach.

208535694.name: Rural surfing village, worth the drive.
208535694.author: a TripAdvisor user
208535694.reviewBody: This is about a 40 min car ride from Nuevo Vallarta, good scenery along the way, although traffic can move slowly on the two lane road.  Small charming town with a hippy/surfer atmosphere, lots of beach restaurants to enjoy watching the surfers.  We enjoyed some beers and fish tacos at Captain Cooks restaurant on the beach.  Good little adventure if you want a change from lounging around a resort.

208379632.name: Great Snorkeling and a BIG Hot Sun
208379632.author: a TripAdvisor user
208379632.reviewBody: Other than a lot of vendors and the risk of some serious sunburns, this is an ideal beach. jet-skiing, surfing, snorkeling, swimming, restaurants, massage, fruit stands, fishing, spear-fishing, paddle-boarding.... There is no shortage of something to do here. Love it!

208099632.name: Really nice beach
208099632.author: a TripAdvisor user
208099632.reviewBody: Great beach for surfing, because of the season a little bit crowded but still very enjoyable. Restaurants and stores closed to the beach are great

207256428.name: True surfing village
207256428.author: a TripAdvisor user
207256428.reviewBody: Great day at beach! Very authentic surf beach... Lots of vendors but they didnt harass you. Great restaurants along beach and in town. Very friendly people.

206044760.name: awesome little beach
206044760.author: a TripAdvisor user
206044760.reviewBody: great surf town with nice locals and good swimming/surfing/boggie boarding. a little off the beaten path - good looking people & lots of americans.

205973287.name: Energetic, Young Tourist
205973287.author: a TripAdvisor user
205973287.reviewBody: This is the place I should have come for "Spring Break." Not to worry that my Spring Break was spent on South Padre Island in the cold dreary weather. This place made up for all my disapointments. I discovered that galleries art not art, but boutiques. I found art in plenty though in little out of the way shops.

205805506.name: Awesome beach!
205805506.author: a TripAdvisor user
205805506.reviewBody: They have lots of people selling stuff on the beach which can be annoying but in this case was fun - candy, donuts, foot massages, even lasagna!

205247093.name: Que Bueno!
205247093.author: a TripAdvisor user
205247093.reviewBody:
Great vibe, friendly locals, tons of restaurants bars, surf lessons, board rentals and people-watching... Warm water compared to California's beaches we feel safe here day and night.  All-in-all, an excellent beach town and totally fun beach!

The surf is perfect for beginners with a proper little break once you've gotten the basics down and plenty of places to get rentals, lessons and other sandy-bottom shore breaks to catch your first waves and learn the basics.

Also noteworthy, this is a very SUP (Stand Up Paddleboard) friendly area, which can be hard to find.

Everywhere you look, people are smiling, laughing, having a good time... Locals and visitors alike.  

This place can get CRAZY busy which we had the pleasure of experiencing during Semana Santa (Holy Week which is just before Easter).  Thousands of local families having the time of their lives here... It was absolutely a fantastic cultural experience.  I bet New Year's and Christmas time is about that busy, too.

Right now in May, "Tranquilo" is about the most appropriate word for this place... Fantastic time of year here as everyone prepares for the rainy season that starts in the next month or so.

204831752.name: Nice beach to watch the surfers
204831752.author: a TripAdvisor user
204831752.reviewBody: Beautiful place to watch the surfers, large beach with lots of pubs to stop at for a beer. Lots of vendors on the beach. Nice little shops & boutiques to stop & shop at in the downtown area. We took the city bus from Bucerias so the drive was a nice jungle type view, not too long of a drive. Glad we checked out Sayulita.

203393193.name: A small bay to remember with vivid recall
203393193.author: a TripAdvisor user
203393193.reviewBody: lots of surfers, loads of sun, laughter, and good times\nwe want to go back ASAP.\nCool town as well, loads of boutique hotels

203126738.name: Love Sayulita
203126738.author: a TripAdvisor user
203126738.reviewBody:
Beautiful place, fun, friendly, really good food and arts. Please tourist people support the local. You actually gonna find really good food and reasonably prices. It's sad too see all this "cool chic" restaurants and stores with those exaggerate prices. All this place full of people who promote good vibes and be one with the world they seem to be greedy. Well other than that help to keep the charm of thus town and keep clean and simple and help the local, please. Big highway construction is on the way so which means a lot if jungle and life around to be exterminate (like Jaguar and mountain lion) sad!!! 
Overall great place to spend a fun and relaxin vacation. 
Ayuden al comercio local y a la región, sean limpios y responsables. Es un bello pueblito con una playa hermosa, por fa mantenganlo así o mejor. Pasensela "Chido" pero responsables con el lugar por favor eso demuestra educación y es más "Chido"
En general muy buena opcio para pasar unas vacaciones agusto y divertido.

202876009.name: The surffers place to be.
202876009.author: a TripAdvisor user
202876009.reviewBody: The beach is great. Lots of young crowd. Many surf shops and small boutiques.We were sitting on the beach, watching the crowed. A bunch of Mexican musician were playing Mexican and English music next to us and having some beer. What can be better than this.\nMany small restaurants and take out food in town. Its a must if you visit Puerto Vallarta.\nSan Pedro on the beach is a great restaurant for sea food.

201743319.name: WIsh I was there right now!
201743319.author: a TripAdvisor user
201743319.reviewBody:
We enjoyed a full day in Sayulita and loved the beach.  Lots of nice soft sand, tried surfing and enjoyed lunch at Captain Pablos who has lots of chairs and palapas right on the beach.  

Unfor there are lots of vendors and the beach is quite crowded as others have mentioned.  Nothing that would keep me from returning however.  

All the streets of Sayulita end up at the beach.  We did a lot of walking around during the day, visiting little shops and just browsing. It was a wonderful combination day of beach and shops!

201718101.name: Surf beach
201718101.author: a TripAdvisor user
201718101.reviewBody: My wife and I took a day trip to Sayulita beach while on our yearly vacation to Puerto Vallarta.  It is a long bus ride from the bus terminal at the park.  One bus to SAMs and then another bus to Sayulita.  You then walk over the bridge and turn to the beach.  A very nice beach and nice sand.  The waves were not very big the day we were there so we did not do any surfing.  Jeff S.

201602128.name: Service and Handicrafts
201602128.author: a TripAdvisor user
201602128.reviewBody: We liked everything about the beach ... with the exception of one restaurant that played music WAAAAY TOOOO loud!

200999922.name: Relaxed beach with great surf
200999922.author: a TripAdvisor user
200999922.reviewBody: We enjoyed renting Stand-up Paddle Boards from Captain Pablos and spending a couple of hours paddle boarding in the surf. Afterwards, we sat in the beach chairs - pleasantly tired - in front of Captain Pablo\'s restaurant and drank cold beer and ate great coconut shrimp and guacamole. Very fun day!

200963323.name: Nice long beach
200963323.author: a TripAdvisor user
200963323.reviewBody: Very crowded, near city center, but can walk for few miles down beach and escape crowds. Good shopping if you need to get souvenirs. Nice selection of indigenous art.

200376015.name: Great beach
200376015.author: a TripAdvisor user
200376015.reviewBody: Moved to south end and had the beach to ourselves. Pleanty of eateries and bars along the north end.

195566599.name: Busy place
195566599.author: a TripAdvisor user
195566599.reviewBody: We went by private taxi to Sayulita beach on Sunday and it was really crowded. Ate at a great cantina on the beach.
